Summary: This spicy noodle cures my cold, upset stomach, and headache every time!
Text: I love this noodle and have it once or twice a week. The amazing thing is that when I don't feel well because of a cold, a hot bowl of this noodle will cure my upset stomach, headache, and running nose! This may not work for you, but you should definitely try it.

That's pretty much what these ramen noodles has, spiciness. I love spicy noodles like the next guy but even after using only half the packet, it still leaves your mouth hot and spicy. And can barely appreciate the quality of taste these noodles are suppose to bring.

It's like when you order the most spiciest buffalo wild wings. You cannot taste the meat but just how hot they are. The same can be said about these supposedly top brand ramen noodles.
The taste is great! especially when you cook it with some vegetable and egg.I like it very much, though it's more expensive than the other noodles
This is the best instant noodle I have tried.  Very spicy!  Yes, I like it very spicy.  You can always dilute it with more water to reduce the strength and make it less salty too.

I don't see how anyone could say anything bad about these noodles. These are the number one Nong Shim noodles! Great to add an egg, some green onion and every once in a while a good handful of firm tofu. I enjoy eating these with a nice hot cup of Bigelow Earl Grey Green Tea, 20-Count Boxes (Pack of 6) and an episode of classic Doctor Who. :)

These are very good noodles - better than the ones you find at the supermarket.

The flavor is very real and these are pretty spicy.. not crazy hot but just right.

OK OK it's not Momofuku but for a quick 5 minute lunch on the job.. it'll work!

mj

Very spicy packaged ramen. Good for someone who wants easy ramen but wants something better than 25 cent beef ramen from the store. Best to use only half a packet unless you feel like burning your tongue.
Delicious, awesome spicey noodle has there own flavor. If you like spicey ramen noodle, this is the one your looking for. I am re-ordering.
Always good.  I do not have a better choose in America. This is the best I can buy in the US.
It's quick to cook and pretty dang tasty. I think there's way too much sodium in the seasoning, but it's easy enough to not add it all.

Summary: nong shim shin noodle is my Favorite instant noodle
Text: the deliver is on time. And the noodle's are great. But the pack is quite large so I probably will finish it in a few months.

Love this soup!  Boil water, add a spice packet, a seasoning packet, and then the noodles. Four minutes later you have spicy ramyun soup.  It probably is a tad spicy for the "average" palate but if you love spicy, give this a try.  When I have a stuffy nose, I even add a couple splashes of hot sauce or sriracha and it clears me right up.
bought 2 package for the family and it's almost gone. the noodle is good even though it's so spicy to me

Shin Ramyun (since it's Korean) is an awesome:
- Late night snack dry
- Home cold remedy
- Depressed-mood solution

It's easy to make and it's straightforward. However, NOT for the person with acid-reflux, which I have unfortunately obtained recently. :( Eating shin gives an extremely bad heartburn afterwards.

However, if you don't suffer from GERD, gastritis, ulcer, heartburn, etcetera, eat to your heart's content!
You get what you pay for, forget those .10 ramen from walmart, these are authentic spicy noodles. Makes me sweat and cry but so delicious

I received Nongshim shin ramen through subscribing. It was great deal because I paid less money than offline stores and it was more delicious than any other ramens. Additionally subscribing is very convenient and time efficient way. So I strongly recommend to you.

Summary: Nice quick noodle, a bit spicy
Text:
Good for a quick meal such as breakfast, a bit spicy,
half sources pack is good enough to cook

These are excellent inexpensive noodles but they are quite salty for someone who rarely adds salt to food, even when cooking, as I do! They are more expensive than grocery store Ramen and taste a good deal better but seem to have about the same destructive amounts of salt- 2020 mg or about 80% daily salt intake/bag which claims to be 2 servings but I assume that most adults would consume the lot unless using this as only part of a meal rather than a quick comfort food. Other reviews alerted me to this and following their recommendation, I only used 1/2 the soup base package. I added some dehydrated green onions and dried oinions when preparing on the stovetop and added a fresh egg, covering it with the noodles after removing from the heat. This had excellent flavor and with half of the salt, I did not feel like my blood pressure would be so imperiled as I had used the whole soup packet. I like and regularly consume very spicy food (I frequently consume 4-5 jalapenos with a meal) but as prepared it was quite delicious and spicy enough.
There are other brands of noodles that I frequently buy from Amazon Annie Chun's Korean Sweet Chili Noodle Bowl, 8.4-Ounce Units (Pack of 6) that I relish but the salt is still high and the price is somewhat higher. I will alternate varieties in the future. I only eat Asian Noodles no more than once a week since I do have some sodium issues.
I am on disability and do not get out often from my house in the country so I have tried many of the long shelf life foods that Amazon sells. They sell many dehydrated vegetables in medium sized quantities that make them easy to have on hand and still be way cheaper than grocery store prices. I even found some non refrigerated tofu Mori-Nu Tofu, Lite, Silken, Firm, 12.3-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12) that I have received but not yet tried. The customer reviews claim that it is excellent quality and it is actually cheaper than the fresh brand offered in the local grocery. I expect to add some to my next bowl of noodles and the soups that I frequently make from scratch.

Summary: Delicious and spicy, good quality ramen
Text: I love this compared to the ones I used to eat, like Nissin and Maruchan.  You can really tell the difference.

These are perhaps the best instant noodles available; hot & spicy, and substantive, it'll satiate any craving for a snack, anytime. The product was shipped in good condition from Amazon (USPS). Convenient!
One box of Shin Noodle costs around $15 in Asian store near my house. The same box sometimes sells for $11 during sale. $20 for this box is way overpriced. Check your local Asian markets.
Man this stuff is spicy and tastes great!!!  I like spicy stuff and this is probably the best I have had out of package.

One of my favorite brands of ramen.  To make it a little better for you most people dont use the entire seasoning packet to cut back on the sodium.  Noodles are substantially better than ramuchan and top ramen, but you must add other items such as onions, maybe some meet and an egg to truly make this a satisfying meal.

I stated on the batch this week and it goes well with everything I have tried to put in it.  It taste great with hot dogs, Vienna sausages, eggs, spam, various veggies, and slices of old pizza.  I thought I would only eat half of it, but it tasted so good, I just gulped it all down.  The spice is really intense, I might just save a few packages and put it in my other bland foods.

Summary: Satisfied by delivery time, quality, and taste!
Text: Fast shipping, always service and a really great taste! What more could one ask for!!!
I've tried many noodle varieties over the years and these are by far the best. A little spicy, but very flavorful. Try them with some scrambled egg and chopped green onions for a tasty breakfast.

Excellent product! Definitely higher quality than what I found in the local stores. My first time making them in the microwave they turned out perfect and the taste was very good. I am very happy with this purchase so I got them on subscribe. You can flavor these noodles with your favorite beef or chicken or vegetable base. It only takes a small amount of base.

I really love this soup so much I have it on automatic order refill. I will be getting a box every three months! Nice and spicy and great flavor. I like to throw a few pieces of leftover chicken or pork in the bowl and it is delicious. Move over Ramen Noodles, there is a new kid on the block and he is big!...If you don't like hot chillies don't buy this one it really does have a bite to it!!

This is the most delicious ramen.  When purchased in bulk, it's not too much more expensive than the terrible ramen you more commonly see at the grocery store.  If you throw an egg or two in while it's cooking, you've got yourself a masterpiece.
Delisheous. Easy to make in the microwave. The spicey picante is a little hotter than chile powder. I say check it out, you'll love it.
this bad boy can get pretty spicy! if you cook a bag you can definitely smell the spicyness, but that's what i bought it for :) definitely found a good deal on this thanks to Amazon!

This deal was on the Lightning Deal for $[...] and now i fell in love with this Ramen! Im mexican so the only instant soup is that you find in the grocery store, and let me tell you that thing is crap compare to this.

These noodles remind me of home! I'm originally from California where it's fairly easy to find all types of Asian food, but now that I live in Wisconsin, I'm realizing that those days are over. So I was pretty psyched when these noodles popped up on the Amazon goldbox deal a week ago. They are really spicy and go great with napa cabbage, bean sprouts, and any other veggies you want. I tried them with egg earlier tonight after reading one of the other reviews on amazon, and it was amazing! Highly recommended for people who love spicy food, but also recommended for those (like me) who don't... just add half the seasoning packet!

This Ramen is the best Ramen in the world.  It is very spicy and has great flavor.  It is so much better than the $.10 Ramen you find in your avg. grocery store.  Authentic Korean ramen.  Add some egg to it, and you'll be in Ramen Heaven.  So so good.

Summary: Best Spicy Ramyun on the Market
Text: As a Korean native I've had many different kinds of ramyun because it is a big part of our culture.  Shin ramyun is by far THE BEST spicy ramyun on the market and most Koreans I know agrees with me.  If you're not good with spicy food then I would not recommend this ramyun because you will be sweating like pig!  If you love spicy food and if you love ramyun then this your best bet.  Won't regret it!

Summary: Filling noodles and flexible (no pun intended)
Text: These noodles are quite spicy and a big bowl of food.  They are, however, a very flexible base for simple meals.  You can control the spiciness (and sodium level) by how much of the seasoning packet you put in and you can add cooked meats and other vegetables to the soup to make variety.  I've found that poaching an egg or two in the soup is very tasty, as well.  Far superior quality of noodle to most grocery store brands.

Recently (6 hrs prior to this writing), this company got busted selling instant noodles with first degree carcinogenic ingredients.  They refused recall of the products for some reason.  Ask your Korean friends about this and they will tell you what exactly happened.  I could not find any newspaper in English on this subject, but it is one of the biggest news in South Korea at this moment (Oct.24th 2012)
A delicious night snack at an awesome price! You will not regret getting these noodles! Be aware though, they can be very spicy if you use the whole package of spicy stuff.
Perfect Noodles every time, just enough spicy.  Vegetables are just the right amount and cooks up plump and nice in minutes.
Very tasty, especially for a spicy food lover like me. Subscribe & Save makes it economic. However, these are fried noodles so a lot of calories.

They're not for the faint of heart. I get so bored with most foods that claim to be spicy hot, but Shin Ramyun delivers. And it's not just hot, it's got great taste. I've been buying them by the 20-pack for years and loving every bite.
Dont hesitate, get these and put them in your mouth. well cook them then get those noodles in your mouth.

This is best selling and most popular ramyun in Korea. It has been copied by many Chinese companies.
This is really hot and spicy...not for everyone.
Comparing with cheap ramyun brand is just non sense....
I don't enjoy ramyun as much as others but this is the one I eat!

I gotta say it is less spicier than Korean-made Shin, and somewhat blend.

However, Shin is the best among I have tried.
I haven't tried Mama's but, the distinct spicy taste of shin cannot be replaced for me.
I always add raw egg into 1 min of boiling, and drop chopping green onions after the cooking is over.
AWESOME, expecially if you like spicy things!! Only thing is that the commissary here on base sells them $0.10 cheaper
Excellent buy if purchase is over $25 to qualify for free shipping. Still okay otherwise but not nearly as good.
flavor could be better, I do like the vegetable packet though.  In future, would just by the generic twelve packs of soup at the local grocery store for under 2 dollars though

This Ramen is definitely one of the best. I don't eat the American 10 cent ramen, the quality of noodle is so different and the spices are great. I also eat mine with an egg dropped in. It only get 2 stars b/c this is a rip-off on Amazon. I can buy this 20pack for $20 at my local Asian grocery store.

Summary: also we can get this on website 1800-shop.com
Text: i bought some of this because it is not easy to find at my local store. i really miss the tasty. also i found another website which contain more chinese and korean grocery. [...]

I am from Vietnam and I have eaten nearly 40 noodle brands and hundreds type of Pho in Vietnam and this noodle is nothing extraordinary.If you think this thing tastes like heaven then go to Vietnam and taste our "Pho", then you will laugh of how silly you were when regard this thing as tasty,

These are good, but the noodles are not much different than cheap Maruchen Ramen. The spice however is very different than Maruchen. The spice is so hot that my nose runs and I have snot soup instead. They are good overpriced noodles, I would not buy these again.
This is not so good. However it tests well. Hope everyone does not to buy it. I will never take care of this product.

Summary: Check out the ingredients before eating this stuff
Text:
MSG, Palm Oil, and a ton of other things you shouldn't put into your body.
Yes, they may be delicious - and cheap - but at what cost to your health?

This is just and FYI for you guys, you ca buy this exact same box, of these exact same noodles at a korean market for around 16$'s. You can get them for .80-.99$'s (most placed will still cut you a bulk deal for around 18$ a box) from any grocery store with an Asian section (I'm sure they're 5$'s a piece in California, NY or "wherever" so chill out ninnies). Don't get ripped off for these if you've got any of the aforementioned within easy access.

Summary: What a ripe off - GIVE ME A BREAK
Text: Sorry but I had these noodles and they are no better then the 10 - 20 cent version.  THE ONLY difference is the spices - oh wait I can buy the same spice for one dollar a jar from McCormic.  Anyway the food is fine - but at over one dollar a pouch - it is FAR from worth it.  Go to Walmart of the local grocery store and buy the ones for one tenth the price.

i haven't get my item...i buy this item 2/17/2011
but this item haven't ship to me
what's the problem?
i hope to get it.

Hate the taste. No fineness of taste.
Not only this brand, but most of S. Korean food contains too much salt and red pepper, which increase the risk of stomach cancer.
It is known that very small amount of red-pepper can protect stomach, but too much damages stomach so much.

Summary: Ramen made in the USA = bad ramen
Text: I can't believe this product has such high review. The noodles taste like rubber and it is NOT spicy at all. Please just go to your local oriental store and look for ramen made from japan or korea. Those noodles actually have a nice texture and the spices they use are actually spicy.

I was just about to buy this, until I saw in the ingredients that it contains MSG. At least this product description tells you (the others don't). If you are like me, that means you'll get a nasty headache after eating this. How about offering MSG-free noodles like I can get locally?

Summary: Beware, not the same as the one from the Korean Market
Text:
Just receive the noodle and try one. The package looks similar but not the same as the one that I got from the Korean market. I just finish the box of Shin noodle that I bought from Korean town so I know the differences right away. I thought I got a good deal and save a trip to Korean town. Guess not, I am wrong. I am going to the Korean town this weekend to get the real stuff. A little disappointed, I really want my authentic spicy red Korean Shin instant noodle tonight...

This Shin noodle is made in the USA and it is a American version of the very popular Korean instant noodle. This American version is only one-third as spicy and the noodle get soft and mushy very fast like the regular instant noodle. The dry vegetable package does not go soft even after 10 minutes. To use the dry vegs in the future, need to soak it for at least 30 minutes so the dry mushroom will get soft. The spice package is orange color, the real Korean Shin noodle is bright red in color and the noodle will not get mushy after 10 minutes. I think it is something to do with the red pepper that the Korean use and not the picante in this USA version. It is spicy but taste totally different than the Korean kind of red pepper which make it so special.

Really want to return it but since I got it with the lightning deal discount, I will eat it like regular instant noodle to save the hazzle. So beware if anyone reading this is Korean or have tried the real Korean Shin instant noodle. This is not the real thing, do not order this and do not pay full price for this American version of the Shin noodle. Before I was skeptical when reading some of the reviews with only 1 star, now I know they are right.

Summary: I'm sold on the taste but not all the hype.
Text:
I ordered these noodles after reading stellar reviews. Some folks in the reviews almost acted as if these noodles were sent from God. I've eaten Ramen Noodles for quite some time and have found them to be a super inexpensive meal at .10 a package and sometimes cheaper. I also like other readers mentioned don't always use the entire seasoning packet because of the high sodium content. I found these noodles to have even higher sodium content. Which I guess isn't too bad if you don't plan on eating the soup.
These noodles to me tasted just about the same as Ramen Noodles except the noodles were a tid bit larger in size. If we are reviewing just the flavor packet, I would say it was pretty good. Especially for those who like spice like myself. I am use to eating super spicy foods and have a high tolerance to spice. So they were right on par with what I am use to as far as the heat goes. But I can see someone who doesn't eat spicy foods to find the seasoning super hot and spicy for them. I like the idea of the dehydrated veggies that are enclosed to accompany the seasoning. I am giving these noodles 3 stars because they are just overpriced Ramen in my opinion. Plus the sodium content in the noodles is just unacceptable. They surely can come up with lower sodium options. And lastly I give it 3 stars because of the price. I would not expect to pay more than .50 cents a package for these noodles in a retail store. I would definitely buy these again but not in bulk.

I love ramen type soups. I've tried many over the years. This Gourmet Spicy Picante is ok. The noodles are your regular, fried ramen...a tad thicker then common grocery store noodles. One trick I use is after cooking the noodles, I rinse with water well...it takes that starchy flavor away that I don't care for and makes a fresher tasting soup. The heat of this is strong, use a quarter packet to start, you can always build up. Not much more flavor going on except the heat of the chili.

I do love the Hoo Roo Rook noodles; they aren't fried and the noodles are round to fit your saucepan. They aren't in the same heat category as these noodles, but they are nice for a more 'tender' palate that likes things not-so-spicy.

*NEWSFLASH* Okay, I'm coming to the end of this box of Spicy Picante and realized that I would sort of miss having my mouth burning while eating soup this winter...so on that note, I just may buy this noodle again -- it's a heat that kind of grows on you. I did order the spicy seafood flavor and will see how that one goes. All in all, this is an acquired hotness that takes getting used to if you're not used to heat (like me).

I purchased several different Korean Noodle Soups but I prefer this "Bag" version of this soup over the "Big Bowl" version. The product is a great soup with much flavor, a nice spicy hot taste and lots of noodles. I modify the soup a little by adding some cut-up pieces of 3 or 4 green onions and some cut-up pieces of roasted chicken breast "after" making the soup to make it higher in protein. I usually have this and other Korean soups every day for a great "power lunch". Love this soup, fast and easy to make in a pot or by pre-heating the water in a microwave and then pouring it over the dry soup in a bowl.

Summary: Add a little spice to your life
Text: This product is a must-try!  We've had every brand of ramen out there, but Nong Shim makes the best.  And the spicy picante is so quick and easy, filling, and flavorful, it doesn't last long at our house.  The auto-delivery is a big help. If the whole spice packet is too much for you, try adding just a third or half to your batch.  Finally, the 20 pack price blows away any supermarket price you'll find anywhere.

Although admittedly not very healthy, having tons of sodium and MSG, it is delicious, quick to prepare and cheap. Just throw a bit of everything in the pot when you make it. You can boil dumplings with it. You can throw in any type of meat with it. You can add in beaten eggs for a different soup texture, or just crack an egg right into the soup before or after cooking depending on how cooked you want your egg to be. Add milk to the soup if you want a more milky flavour. Add a few slices of cheese on top after it's prepared and enjoy the melted cheesy deliciousness. You can also add literally any type of vegetable you can think of. If you're not feeling like having noodles with that soup base you can use the noodles with your own broth or make fried noodles. Then you can save the soup base for seasoning any future dishes you make.

These noodles make for some really flexible meals when you're tight on time or ingredients. I wouldn't be alive without them!

i usually use 2 bags and 1 of the spice packets and drop an egg in it.

good stuff

Just be sure and try 1 packet before plunking down $19 for the whole crate of 20.  Bought a pack at the store today and could not get past the 2nd bite.  The heat is intense, but the flavor is flat.  It's probably better once you dress it up with a poached egg or some veggies, but it wasn't the flavorful kind of spicy I was looking for.
I have been a long time consumer of this but from now on, I will think twice about eating it after I found mold in the item when openning one pack.

Summary: Almost feel like I got the wrong product
Text:
After seeing these hyped up over and over again as the "best" ramyun noodles, I had to try them. Verdict after two boxes? They're OK.

Every review on here is how flavorful and SPICY these are. Well, they do taste pretty good. Do they taste that much better than the 10 cent ramyun at the local grocery store? To my taste, they don't. I will concede they are slightly better and certainly more filling.

As far as spicy.. I'm so confused on this. Every review says to use half a packet as these will burn your mouth off. So needless to say, I was expecting HEAT! These aren't spicy at all. To give you a frame of reference, I'm usually sweating after eating "hot" wings at Applebees. If you've ever gone to Buffalo Wild Wings, I have a difficult time eating the "Asian Zing" wings. I can't tolerate heat very well. However, I have a pretty mild burn going on in my mouth after eating a bowl with full spice, and it's not unpleasant enough to warrant a drink.

So, all in all, not bad noodles. Don't think I'd ever pay $20 for them again, though.

Hand these out at Halloween instead of candy for an instant reaction!

The kids who raise their eyebrows are probably paranoid about their sodium intake and shouldn't be allowed to trick-or-treat anyway!

This ramen is so good. I also bought the Neoguri- also a good choice if you like seafood. I would highly recommend this. It microwaves well, I use pyrex. I'm deployed on a ship and it was sent out here pretty quick (relatively speaking ok? lol) and none of the ramen was damaged during VERTREP. It is spicy! Definitely seriously spicy. I cook it with minimal water so it stays that way. I love it. Will buy again. It's pretty much the highlight of my day.

A very consistent, tasty choice when one does not want to cook. I gave four stars only because I had imported Korean soup before that was even tastier.
The Amazon delivery (through Prime membership) was free and earlier than promised.
Recommended.
Excellent noodle quality and very tasty. Way better than American ramen. Highly recommended for anyone that likes spicy foods and wants some better quality ramen.

i practically lived off these stuff during my college years.

they're one of the best instant noodles i've ever had.

i will buy from again and again when they're on sale :)

This is the best ramen that I've had and it's the kind my family has been eating for years. It is definitely more spicy than other types of ramen out there but it is so good and you can always add less seasoning if you don't want to have it as spicy. It's really quick and easy to prepare and it's perfect for college students because you can eat it on its own or add more ingredients (like eggs) that you want to dress it up.

This has awesome  flavor ... nutritional value in itself is little to none .. BUT .. a great base and low in cals ... you can add this to other soups or add vegies ... or on it's own ... great product ... very happy and i will order it again
Absolutely in great condition, and a good price.  i love ramyun, and this was a good way to stock up at a low cost.

This Korean-style ramen is one of my favorites. As an individual whom doesn't often eat spicy foods, the spiciness of the seasoning in the ramen is very near upper tolerance level and nothing goes better with it than a cold beer. The texture is a bit chewier than the generic American ramen but that's what ramen should taste like.

Summary: The best go-to meal for anything!
Text:
This is the best hangover cure you can buy.

That being said, I've been eating this ramyun ever since I was little. It is great just the way the package tells you to eat it. Sometimes, I'll just make it by pouring hot water over it, and the noodles are still a little crispy that way. You can also make this really fancy. Stir in a can of tuna (flavored or not!), some vegetables, leftover meat of any kind...you can make this into a really great and filling meal! I just wouldn't recommend adding rotisserie chicken (that was the saltiest thing I think I've ever eaten...).

I love this stuff and I don't think I'll ever stop eating it. The price on Amazon is alright -- if you have an Asian market nearby, it is cheaper there. Some Walmarts will also sell the individual packs for about $1 each, so Amazon doesn't really save you any money, but it does provide convenience if you have Prime.

I was introduced to this ramen 15 years ago while overseas in the ROK. Its a spicy Korean ramen comparable to some of its Thai counterparts but has to be one of the tastiest ramen noodles I've ever had. The quality of Nongshim is superb and I would recommend this product to anyone. Add an egg to this noodle soup while its cooking and you got an awesome meal.

Good spicy ramen,and when purchased through Amazon, pretty cheap. In NYC you can't really find these in bulk at these prices (under a dollar per soup with Subscribe & Save) unless you go bargain hunting at the Asian markets. I still have most of this case left, so I'd imagine one case is good for 6 months, if you're a relatively light eater of freeze-dried ramen.

You can add all sorts of things to hearten this ramen up: eggs, spinach, tofu, kimchi, bean sprouts. This ramen IS salty (and moderately spicy), so you can add extra cooking water and dump it out after serving, or half the seasoning packet.

I began looking at Amazon's offerings of ramen noodles because I was tired of Top Ramen and the few limited brand varieties most stores carry. I settled on Nong Shim Shin Noodle Ramyun Gourmet Spicy Picante because of the high ratings. I don't mind spicy foods, but sometimes I find that when food is overly spicy it overpowers any appreciation for the flavor. This is my experience with Nong Shim noodles. My dh, who enjoys ramen noodles says these noodles have a slimy texture and I did have to agree with him the next time I tried to "get in" to them. However, I'm still curious about Nong Shim's other ramen noodle offerings so I may purchase one of their non picante flavors.

1. Add an egg while your noodle is being cooked. The timing decides whether the yolk will be soft or hard. To preserve the original spicy flavor, the egg should be hard-boiled in the soup. But some prefers to blend the soft yolk to the soup for a milder taste. There are a lot of people who blend the whole egg to the soup during cooking, this makes it a wholly different kind. Note, as more egg blends into the soup, you are more inclined to finish the whole soup, which is not too great for your health (too much sodium).
2. Add a slice of cheddar cheese on top of the prepared Ramyun in a bowl.
3. Do both 1 & 2.

I gave 4 stars because Shin Noodle is too spicy for me.
Very filling but not too oily, like other instant noodles out there. The noodles are just chewy enough and the right size for the hot, spicy soup. A fantastic quick meal for a chilling winter night.

I could not wait to get this noodles in the mail and right when they arrived, I whipped up a bowl and could not have been more satisfied. I love spicy foods and not only does this satisfy my craving, but it's also full of flavor. The possibilities are endless when it comes to adding ingredients to this ramyun, but even if there is nothing added, it is still very good. I really like the packet of freeze dried vegetables that come with it. I have half a box left and I already know that I will be ordering more if I can't find something similiar in the grocery stores in my area.

To address the sodium issue - yes, there is about half your days worth of sodium in one flavoring packet, BUT you most likely won't be able to handle the heat of one whole packet so you won't be consuming the full amount of contained sodium and if you do use the entire packet, just watch your sodium intake the rest of the day and double your water intake (you will probably do that anyway to cool your mouth from the heat, but it's a good burn :)). These aren't incredibly healthy. My boyfriend and I usually split one because there is a lot of noodles per package and it is so filling. You do not want to eat this for several days in a row, but a lot of things are okay in moderation. I whole heartedly believe that one package of these noodles is a heck of a lot healthier than anything offered at a fast food chain.

Great on a really cold day and if you're really congested.
The spiciness of the ramen really clears my sinuses when I have a cold.

I wouldn't recommend this for those who only like mild-medium spiciness.
This is a very spicy ramen, and will really make your lips tingle and tongue burn.

If you can handle it spicy, this is the best ramen.

Summary: tasty, but loaded with sodium and better prices locally
Text:
This is probably the #1 Ramen in Korea which I also enjoy, but you should be aware of the nutrition facts.

The nutrition table on the bag is for 1/2 a serving, which equates to 1/2 a bag. The cooking instruction is for full bag, so it's fair to note the nutrition contents for the whole bag as below:

Calories: 560
Calories from fat: 160

Total Fat: 18g, 28% of daily value
Saturated Fat: 9g, 46% of daily value
Sodium: 2080mg, 86% of daily value

While the sodium content is on the higher end of foods, you have some control over this by adjusting the amount of power soup base. Once I learned the nutritional facts, I use the full bag of noodles with half packet of the soup base. The other method would be to cook the whole bag as usual, but immediately throw away 1/2 the soup to avoid the temptation of eating the whole thing.

Lastly, my secret to best ramen is no secret to Koreans - after the noodle is dropped in boiling water for 1 minute, drop an egg and sliced spring onions and cook for 1 more minute. Then, pour into a bowl by 3rd minute. You'll know you did this correctly when the noodle in the bowl is "almost" 100% cooked where the noodle have come apart, but still somewhat undercooked. If you cook more than 4 minutes as instructed on the bag, then the noodles will get bloated and taste nasty by the time it makes it to the table.

Enjoy!

Summary: Too expensive and too much fat/oil !!!
Text:
1) I would recommend to purchase this product at the nearest any Korean markets where you can buy it around $18 or less.
2) As far as this product itself concerned, it contains too much fat/oil compared to Samyang Ramen, which might upset your stomach.

Summary: Hands down the Best Spicy Ramen
Text: These are, by far, the best Ramen Noodles I've ever had the pleasure of eating.  I practically lived on this stuff when I was in college.  A packet is included containing the spices which allows you to control the level of heat in the dish by adding more or less of the contents to the noodles.  One important note, the spices provide a tasty spicy hot, not a hot-just-to-be-hot flavor.

As far as packaged ramen goes, this stuff is about as good as it gets. I haven't found any other ramen that I like as much as this.

Most ramen I eat as drained noodles sprinkled with the seasoning packet, but this one is much better as a soup. The seasoning is far too spicy to eat these noodles dry, but the seasoning packet is perfect for seasoning soup. Other types of ramen don't make the kind of flavorful soup that this one makes, but there is enough flavor in one packet of this stuff to flavor a LOT of water!

A word of warning... this soup is VERY spicy. I regularly eat hot wings, spicy potato chips, and I put extra hot sauce in spicy chili. I like spicy food. But this stuff is pretty harsh. If you're very sensitive to spicy foods, I would avoid this one. If you're mildly sensitive to spicy foods, just use a little extra water in the soup. I wouldn't say this stuff is over-the-top spicy, but it has a pretty strong kick.

I think the thing I like most about this type of ramen is how flavorful the noodles themselves are, even when they are made as a soup. When I make ramen as a soup with other types, the noodles are almost flavorless. But these noodles really soak up the flavoring very well.

The one complaint I have is that I don't care for the vegetables that come in the vegetable packet. Fortunately, they are separate, so I just don't put them in. I find that they don't get soft enough, and I don't like the texture or flavor of the vegetables.

Summary: Way better than the typical store ramen
Text: I bought these in preparation for long nights during finals week with the thought that they may be more interesting than the typical chicken ramen noodles. I like spicy food too, so this seemed like an interesting trial for me, although a bit of a gamble when ordering a whole case. These noodles are fantastic, they have so much more flavor than typical ramen, and in many ways are much better tasting than the typical meals i eat. They a slightly-moderately spicy, so i can still give a pack to a friend who isn't into spicy food and expect they will still enjoy it. Ton's of flavor, a bit more volume, and no MSG like normal ramen noodles. Highly recommended.

The big problem with most instant noodles is that the thin noodles get soggy and mushy when sitting in a bowl of soup, then loose quickly their flavor. These thicker noodles avoid that problem and are tasty until you finish the whole bowl. Yes, the soup is spicey, but you don't have to use the whole spice packet if you are a wimp. Just be careful if you are on a diet, since one package if 500 calories (the "per serving" label is for less than half a package).

4 stars instead of 5 because instant noodles have so much fat and salt. Regular dried noodles are much healthier, if don't mind waiting a few more minutes for them to cook.

I first got these because I was looking for something hot, something yummy, you know... a quick snack or a fast meal for when I was in a hurry. I had fond memories of rice and noodle concoctions from my student days and I was drawn to these because of the many excellent reviews. Indeed, after reading some, I fully expected my toes to tingle after eating these! :)

At first I really liked them, and yes, they are truly spicy. I like spicy. The spicier the better. Besides, the reviewers are right- you can just put in as much of the spice packet as you want. After a few of them, though, it occurred to me that the spicy wasn't like any Thai or Cambodian food I've had, or even straight up hot chilies like habaneros; the spice struck me as more chemical-induced. Was it the MSG? The other salts? Whatever it is, it doesn't settle well with these taste buds.

The more I ate, the less good they seemed to me. After a while, I noticed that they always left kind of a gummy, coated feeling to the inside of my mouth. Then I looked at the ingredients.... Maybe it is all the MSG, or maybe the beef tallow, or maybe all the sodium variants that I can't even pronounce. Whatever it is, these are losing their appeal with every serving. Now, I'm not a health foodie and despite the fact that one package doses you with 88% of daily value of sodium and 40% daily value of fat, I'm not holding that against it. (to be fair, the previous amounts assume that you use the entire spice packet and each package counts as 2 servings) It really comes down to that gummy feeling left in my mouth after eating a package, even using 1/3 of the spice packet. I just can't get past that.

The noodles seem like any other ramen noodles, and they are yummy. It's also nice that they have a decent size packet of dehydrated veggies inside, separate from the spices.

Taste is totally about preference, and I don't think this is a bad product just because it didn't work for me. Also, I think they are priced right, especially if bought through subscribe and save. I've got to go with my experience on the rating, though. Though I won't be getting these again, I wouldn't steer people away. I would suggest, though, first looking at the ingredients list to see if you are cool with what's in it, and also get a few to try before committing to a bulk buy.

Summary: Great consistency, less flavor than expected
Text: I enjoyed these noodles, the noodles themselves were thick, per the other reviews, which was very nice. I didn't find them too spicy, but I do enjoy spicy foods. I added some pre-cooked ham and an egg near the end of the cooking process which added a really nice texture and flavor. I would give 5 stars, but based on the other reviews I expected a little more flavor with the spiciness, but nonetheless, I will probably buy these again.

This product was good as are most instant asian noodles....be careful about using the full package of flavoring as it is very hot....the dried condiments are ok....I prefer to eat this package with some chicken broth added....then wait about ten or fifteen minutes until the noodles get rehydrated....a relativewly low calorie lunch.

I generally like my food spicy, but these noodles are just too hot for me.  So much so that it takes away from the taste.  Unless you really, really, really like spicy hot food food, these may be too much for you.

I like this grocery.

It is too spicy and famous noodle in Korea.

I'm not Korean but I can eat it.

Customer service is so good because it is so speedy

Summary: Instant noodle with best taste and texture -- see Recall Info
Text:
I just researched about the korean noodle recall because I love this Shin Ramyun noodle -- the best taste and texture instant noodle I have ever tasted. It is the Neoguri Seafood & Mild Noodles and Neoguri Seafood and Spicy Noodles that are problematic, not this Shin Ramyun type by the same company Nongshim, read this article:[...]
ADVICE: Because of high sodium in instant noodles, put only partial seasoning package and also try not to drink the soup!

As a general statement I do not like Ramen Noodles; however, this is one of my favorite quick and easy meal.
I can't find them in the grocery stores any more so I buy these cases on Amazon. It's a great price!

I can't speak to the these noodles being genuinely Korean. I can only speak to my personal experience with them. I find them absolutely delicious! They are my favorite quick meal after a hard days work where I don't want to spend a great deal of time cooking and I even enjoy them as a comfort food when feeling a little down.

The quality of noodle is definitely greater than your typical Maruchan ramen you find in the grocery store. That being said, this is no gourmet meal. If you're looking for something quick and cheap that doesn't taste like garbage, you found it. Those who don't like spicy food should not purchase them, however. They do have a kick, but nothing extreme.

If you want to reduce your dishes, try steaming the noodles by boiling water on the stove. Put the dry noodles and dry flavoring in another bowl with a lid. Pour boiling water on top of the noodles and close the lid. Instant noodles in about 10 min.

And one warning: always rinse your bowl out when you're done. Never ever leave it sit out for more than a day. You'll only do it once before you figure out why. (Stinky!)
The noodles are awesome. Package came quickly and expected.  Maybe it's just me, but the noodles aren't as spicy as I remembered them back from my college days.
if you like spicy you'll love this way better than the kind you get at the grocery store!it is so warm and delicious! buy it

Very cheap price and very good instant noodle quality and taste!!
Even compared to the Korean domestic market price, the price differential isn't too big.
There is a slight taste variation compared to the real shin ramen made in Korea, but the difference is very minute.
Overall, very satisfied but beware to not eat too much instant food!
The item delivered on time. The ramen is definitely much more delicious than the famous nissan cup noodle. The spiciness of korean ramen is what I miss most after coming to the states

I had tried these when I brought them from my local asian store and fell in love with them. So I thought why not just buy a whole box. I love how spicy these are and tastes a lot better than the other ones that is sold at the grocery store.
as an asian I loveeee spicy food and we eat instant noodles a lot,my husband introduced this to me and im falling love instantly!
So delicious!!!Spicy noodle. I love the taste a lot. It's really difficult to find Shin noodle in US supermarket except California.

Summary: OK, but not nearly as good as the Nong Shim Neoguri Spicy Seafood noodles!
Text: Just ordered these by accident (I usually get the Nong Shim Neoguri Spicy Seafood), and they are OK. Seem to be missing the depth and complexity of the Nong Shim Neoguri Spicy Seafood noodles and are just a bit spicy & perhaps a bit citrus-y. Not sure why these sell better than the seafood noodles. I usually add a few shrimp to my noodle bowls during the last minute or two of cooking, with this noodle bowl they just taste like shrimp in a salty broth. In the Nong Shim Neoguri Spicy Seafood noodle bowl the shrimp meld perfectly!

I don't know if this is the BEST ramen in the world, but it's pretty damn good.  This flavor is very spicy.  Nothing to be afraid of, but it is indeed very spicy.  It doesn't burn your tongue, but it will give your lips a good tingle.  The spice of it has caused me some digestive discomfort, but only occasionally.  The dried vegetables are a nice touch that you don't get with the grocery store ramen, I just wish there were more than a tiny little packet.  This is a good product, I just don't know if it's worth the money.

They are great noodles. I was hoping for the Korean version of the noodles, but these are the US version. These were cheaper than the ones from the grocery store. With the amazon prime, they came in two days.

When I lived in Korea, this brand of ramyun was my favorite so I was happy to see that it's for sale in the US, too. In my opinion, this is the best cheap(er) choice when buying this kind of food. I agree with other posters that poaching an egg with the noodles makes the experience infinitely better.
One word of advice: They are pretty spicy so if you don't like that, maybe look for another product from the same manufacturer (Nong Shim).
Very tasty, great noodles. They are a little spicy, so I only use about half a packet of the seasoning.
I enjoy these noodles over most other noodles. It's spicy enough to make my nose run, which I like, and the noodles have a nice texture to them.
Great ramen.  Delicious with an egg.  Don't overcook it and it's even better.  Amazon ships promptly as long as it's in stock.

Definitely better than the cheap ramen you find at the grocery store. A dollar a packet really isn't that steep, and you realize this when you try them. First off, the packets are noticeably larger than other ramens, with quite a bit more noodles. Then there's the fact that it comes with a spice packet that seems larger and more filled than competing ramens. It also comes with a dried vegetable packet, a very nice touch. Make sure to read the instructions, they're a little different then other ramens (you just place everything in at once and cook). The taste is phenomenal, nice and spicy (especially if you add the whole packet) with firm noodles that are more chewy that "normal" ramen. A very nice Asian spicy flavor. If you are not one with hot/spicy foods, consider using half a packet of seasoning. Definitely a must try, and I will be ordering more in the future!

Maruchan ramen can't not compare to asian made ramen.

The quality of the seasoning stock and dried ramen noodles beats maruchan ramen by a mile.

Sometimes its cheaper to buy it on amazon than going to cub foods/asian grocery stores.

My iPad has been in Netflix mode since Korean Drama was added to my que. Watching "Boys Over Flowers" inspired me to buy some ramen noodles. Since I live close to the Korean Market I stopped in for some Shin Ramen.

Just finished a bowl made exactly as directed. Results: Delicious! Behind the heat the noodles definitely have flavor. About 3 bites in I had to add some water to the broth. I was on fire! But I am not a heat person.

Next time I will Dr. it up with some salmon, shrimp and green onion....it's great with ramen!

I usually make two of these at a time, using both vegetable packets and one-and-a-half seasoning packets. I also break three or four eggs into the pot and stir it well. The sodium's pretty high, sure, but the resulting meal is spicy, delicious, and full of protein.
I subscribed the Nong Shim Shin noodle Gourmet Spicy and Kimchi flavor, and I LOVE them!! Recommend the product to anyone who wants a fast and also delicious meal.

Nice flavor and very economical. At first I have them every day for 2 weeks and got tired of them.

Now I just have them once or twice a week and they are enjoyable.

It's not bad, the quality of the noodles is excellent, the packet comes with a good amount of flavor powder so you can pick how hot you wanna make the noodles. The full packet is pretty spicy, half the packet is better for my taste. It's a good product.

Two negatives for me were:
- Not my kinda flavor, maybe you'll like it, I thought it was a little bland, spicy but bland, I want to try their other flavors later though cause the quality of the product was excellent.
- Really high in sodium.

Summary: You like heat? This is for you!
Text: This is a very high quality ramen.  However, unless you like it extraordinarily hot, you will want to start with only a bit of the powder and increase the amount from there. THIS IS FIRE!

Summary: Two Tastes - Salt and Red Pepper - yet I like it. Add an egg and it really improves. Unfortunately it is far from healthy
Text:
Don't under estimate the appeal of salt and cayenne (red) pepper for many "soup lovers" and reviewers. That includes me.

However, this is nothing more than a watery Noodle Soup with lots of Red Pepper and a tremendous amount of salt. Add an egg and it tastes much better. Chop up some scallion and it further improves.

There is nothing terribly impressive about this soup YET I like It. This dry soup mix consists of a large packet of noodles (essentially tasteless yet ladened with 500 calories of saturated fats) and two much smaller packets. One of these small packets contains less than a tablespoon of chopped dried vegetables and the other is a "spice" packet consisting largely of salt, msg and red (cayenne) pepper.

Add some water and you have 2 1/2 cups of soup.

Impressions: Beyond the watery base (there are no thickeners), my first impression was that of salt followed ---- after a few more spoonfuls -- of the emerging heat of cayenne pepper. As is typical with cayenne pepper, the heat builds up on the palate over time. Some might call this soup "medium hot" but for many I'd imagine they would call it "very hot". However, it easy to adjust the heat level - just add less of the salt/spice packet.

But the only real tastes here are those of salt and cayenne pepper. The noodles are essentially tasteless and the vegetable packet is so small that it can add nothing more than visual appeal. However, I'll say it again, don't under estimate the appeal of salt and cayenne pepper!

This soup can be greatly improved by cracking an egg into the mix and stirring it in during the last minute of boiling. The egg not only adds a much needed third taste but also thickens the soup considerably. I was quite surprised how much an egg improved this soup. Make no mistake - adding an egg really changes the character of the soup.

At the [...] I paid - with shipping - for a case of 20 -- this soup was a good value.

I'd give this soup 3 or 4 stars with an egg but I'm a bit biased toward anything "hot". Maybe 3 stars with an egg is most appropriate and 1 or 2 stars is more accurate for this soup without an egg?

HEALTH WATCH: One packet of this soup provides almost 90% of an individual's daily allowance of salt!!!!! That is a stunning amount of SALT. Plus this soup has 40% of the daily allowance of SATURATED fats (thanks to the palm oil used to fry the noodles). With almost 500 calories, you'll be adding a few inches to your waist line if you eat it regularly. It is shame the company choose palm oil to fry its noodles in (presumably to save a few cents) and added so much salt. It makes this soup needlessly unhealthy. It is, in fact, a poster child for all that is wrong with processed foods. I have to add the ingredient list is truly frightening with a long list of chemicals - far more than is typical - even in processed foods. This is probably not a soup anyone should serve more than once a month. View this soup as equivalent to a bag of potato chips, no more or less healthy.

Another HEADS UP - some of the reviews on Amazon strike me as a bit suspect: There are a number of 5 star reviews generated by One Time ONLY Amazon reviewers. Once these "reviewers" have promoted this company's product - they never publish another review. I've seen this same pattern, time after time, for all the other soups made by this particular company.

Finally, everyone should keep in mind how hard it is to believe that any dried soup with a tiny "flavor packet" could ever rate 4 or 5 stars among people that have a serious love of soup. Consider too, the simple fact that very few of the soup's ingredients are even readily identifiable as a "food".

My thanks to the previous reviewers who suggested adding an egg. It made a world of difference

THIS SAME SOUP IS SOLD in CASE LOTS OF: 20 PACKAGES, 30 PACKAGES or 40 PACKAGES. ALL OF WHICH ARE LISTED SEPARATELY ON AMAZON. The prices differ on a package by package basis too. Generally the 30 pack, which ships for free, is the better value.

Summary: bought it just to see if it was any better than regular ramen
Text:
It is. I'm a white dude from TN so i'm not the hugest ramen authority though.

I just got this in the mail, ripped it open and threw one in some water:

- Spicy as hellllllll. I used half of the packet and it was still pretty hot, but tasty nonetheless.
- Each packet comes with a little pack of dehydrated vegetables to mix in. I was skeptical of them, but it added to the ramen nicely and tasted good.
- I added in an egg. Eggs make all ramen better. This ramen was no different.

Yep, its a bag of noodles.

Summary: Not bad, will compare to Korean Shin
Text:
Giving 5 stars so more people will read, actually rate it @ 4 stars.

From what I can tell, American made Ramen is worse in general

For unknown reasons, even though I cook with the same pot I would in Korea, perhaps it is the stovetop instead of the gas stove I would use in Korea, the ramen is harder to cook to the right degree, probably meaning that the noodles were prepared differently in the factories.

As for the spiciness factor, anybody who eats regular asian / indian hot foods should be able to taste the flavor behind the spice. In my opinion, everybody here complaining about the whole spice packet being too much must have grown up on hotdogs and hamburgers, or equally not-spicy foods.

A tip when cooking the noodles is to cool them in air while the noodles are boiling. Repeat until you see noodles become firmer, perhaps about 5 fork/chopstickfulls for the whole bowl (alot of noodles per utensil-full) and you can taste the difference.

As always, eggs, garlic, ground red pepper, sri rancha(?) sauce or other condiments are good.

In Korea the standard for cooked ramen would include 1egg, green onions, sometimes onions, and sometimes small dumplings.

Red meats are okay to put in, but are less cost-to-taste effective when compared to hams or dumplings.

Summary: great raman if you dont put as much water in it
Text:
I was expecting spicy noodles and I was originally disappointed. You buy a pack of Maruchan chicken noodles and you get chicken flavored noodles. A pack of Shin noodles sits in a screaming hot spicy broth (soup?) that runs off when you pull out a bite. The noodles you get on the end of your fork are left mostly flavorless after the broth runs off. This then leaves you with a bowl of screaming hot spicy broth, not a format that I enjoy.

BUT - I have found that if you don't follow their "soup" directions and instead add just enough water to hydrate the noodles you get quite a different experience, the noodles retain all the flavor and there is no broth. I just ate one of these for breakfast and I am thinking about seconds, these are really quite good in this form.

I'm increasing my star rating from 3 to 4 and considering renewing my previously cancelled subscription.

This is one of the new foods that we are eating to help us lose wieght.  We are  into  spicy foods so I find these noodles to have plenty of flavor. I will experiment with the amount of the spice packet I include when cooking and see if I can come up with a happy balance These noodles are truly delicious but they are very spicy!

These noodles are truly delicious but they are really spicy! I am no stranger to spicy food but I find these noodles a bit too much for me. I will experiment with the amount of the spice packet I include when cooking and see if I can come up with a happy "medium".

These noodles are great if you like spicy food.
They are seriously good and worth the slightly higher price than inferior ramen. Tip: subscribe and you get 15% off. If you don't want more in a few months it is really easy to cancel.

This is a great ramen. It contains a vegtable packet along with the soup/seasoning mix.  It is on the spicy side however in my opinion it is not over the top spicy.  Has just enough heat to be noticable and if you drink the broth you will get the full effect of the heat. These packets also make a slightly larger portion than your standard Top Ramen and Maruchan ramens. I nomrally make this with egg whites from two eggs. If you like ramen, you would not be disappointed with this product.

I've tried 20 to 30 different products - these are the best available. They are a bit salty, and spicy, but that's not always a bad thing and sometimes really hits the mark. They are easy to make, have good instructions on the package, and are of excellent quality. I think they are definitely worth the price, which is higher than many similar products, and can easily be doctored up a level with the addition of some onion, chive, or egg.

Also, and not a small matter, they are made in USA, which I think means less concerns about food safety and labeling accuracy.

Upside - taste, quality

Downside - prepackaged ramen is generally not the healthiest thing you can eat, and this product is no exception - it has 44% of the daily allowance of sodium, and 8 grams of fat, mostly palm oil. All things in moderation!

After reading the rave reviews about these noodles for months & months.. I finally took a leap of faith and ordered me up a box... and I was not disappointed! Now, I love noodles of all kind, even the cheap ramen, but these noodles are fantastic! Definitely a more hearty texture to the noodles and the spice has got some serious kick! For those who don't like spicy, I would recommend starting with maybe 1/2 of the pack of seasoning & working your way up, but for me, the whole packet is perfect! I've been adding fresh veggies, an egg or two & some shrimp to these noodles & it makes enough for two people easily! I'm sold & will definitely continue to buy these noodles! Worth the extra $$ :)

These are absolutely amazing. The spice pack has extremely thick flavor, and the bag packs a fairly decent amount of noodles. Bit spicy for some but perfect for me. I have sampled up to 30+ different kind of bagged noodles in the past 4 years of college and these hands down top the chart. Although slightly more expensive compared to other TOP, Maruchan ramens. It is however worth the price. I'd definitely recommend these to all those want to try something slightly heavier taste.

I like the Nong Shim Shin ramen better than the much-less-expensive grocery store ramen because Nong Shim is hot-spicy instead of just salty. You can add veggies/meat/egg/shrimp as extras and the result will still be spicy. This makes it a good sink for your least favorite veggies or leftovers.

The product has a reasonable calorie to fat ratio but is not particularly low-calorie itself.

Sometimes I pour out most of the water and eat the noodles and seasoning as a snack in lieu of potato chips or crackers.

Summary: Love the taste.  Not crazy about the ingredients
Text: I love the taste of this product.  Great texture and a good kick.  But, I am not crazy about the ingredients.  Wish there were some natural options.

Summary: Not as good as the Korean Shin
Text:
This is an incredible product, and to the few reviewers who felt the noodles weren't as good as they remember them: as far as I can tell, there are two versions of Shin. Like other reviews on here mention, I got these noodles at my local asian market and they were awesome - thick, springy noodles that put regular ramen to shame.

I then saw Shin at my "regular" grocery store, and picked some up - big difference. The noodles were thinner and had no "bite" to them, nothing like the ones that turned me on to this brand. I opened up one of the packs I got from the Asian market to make sure, and they're definitely different noodles.

So, maybe the ones I got at my regular store came from a bad batch etc., but it seems more likely that there's an "American" and "Korean" version, with the ones sold in American stores using a noodle that's more like what Americans are used to.

In any case, see for yourself: the product is hot, spicy and incredibly flavorful. A great buy regardless of the noodle. But if, like the rest of us, you fall in love with these noodles and find yourself craving them, head down to your local Asian market to try the Shin they sell there. It's a bit better, but both are head-and-shoulders better than the 10-cent ramen bricks most of us know as ramen.

Summary: Good, if you like salty and spicy.
Text:
These are easy to make in the microwave---good for a quick snack.

Flavor-wise, they're kinda a one-trick-pony; if you like spicy hot, salty food, you'll probably like them.

I've bought these a few times for my husband to take to work and he LOVES them. When he runs out, he always wants more. They're very spicy, though, so if you don't like hot hots you're better off going with something else. We love spicy, so it's perfect for us.

Summary: Just the way I like it!
Text: I've always like spicy food & after living in Korea for a couple of years, I was delighted to find this Ramyun which is head & shoulders above any other 'ramen' that I've found in a grocery store. The noodles are more substantial, the flavor packet has a lot of flavor & the dried 'veggies' packet rounds it all off to make one of the best available. I was doubly delighted that Amazon made it so easy to order & even sweetened the deal by putting it on sale. Very satisfied!
Melba toast is so delicious with butter and jam. Or with sour cream and jam. With any type of butter and/or jam really.

I had some honey glazed pecans in a salad in a resturant and wanted to try to duplicate, so I ordered these, well they have not made it into the salad yet. My whole family has been eating them just a a great snack. These are fabulous, can't say enough about them. The shipping is a bit much at $10.00 and takes a few days longer than the normal Amazon shipping does.
These are some of the best glazed pecans I've had!  Almost too good, I keep reordering!  Company is also efficient about mailing.

These Priester's glazed pecans were absolutely great! I broke down the large 1-pound bags into smaller ones so I could give them to my clients for a Christmas gift. They were a big hit! I'll remember this for next year's gifts!

I've gotten this oatmeal and the pre-sweatened one by nature valley. I prefer this one. If you want sugar (or better yet a natural alternative) you can always add it, but at least you're controlling what goes into your body. This gets done super fast and its great with all sorts of fruit. It's smooth too. Just perfect in the morning and an even better alternative to starbucks or any other pre-made one. Those always have a ton of weird ingredients that you can't even read. Most of the time simple is better when it comes to this kind of foods.
I am so pleased that Amazon.com has this product.  My local grocery store stopped stocking it on their shelves.  It is a great healthy product, especially the low sodium and calorie content.

This product was sent as a gift and was greatly received.
I recommend using Amazon's Grocery products. I will definitely
be using this facility again.

Summary: You don't get what you order.
Text: I ordered these for my ten year old nephew's birthday. They sent  birthday cake pops and dipped strawberries. Didn't even replace them with a character cake pop and never contacted me about the switch. My nephew was looking so forward to the robots. Very disappointing.
I love licorice and this stuff is GOOD!  The hard candy shell is just as good as the chewy licorice inside!  Fast shipping, another amazing Amazon partner!  Thanks!

These are pretty good.  The pears (and strawberries) are made in China and transported here but do not suffer the "damage" the strawberries incur.  Too bad they can't ship the strawberries the same way as the pears.

I like this product because there's only one ingredient--Pears! And they're also soft.  I don't like really crunchy foods and biting into a "real" pear isn't something that I do.  This way I get the benefit of eating a pear.  And it tastes good too.
Love the product. Ordered on automatic refill. Easy to change quantities and delivery dates. Big savings and great selection better than anything found in stores
These things are pricey, but they are a super yummy, healthy snack. We've tried several brands and this one is hands-down our favorite.
The liquorice taste is not prevelant on the pallet with this tea. I bought it because I was trying to capture the Aveda liquorice peppermint tea but this is not even close!

Summary: No tricks - only treats with Green Mountain Pumpkin Spice
Text: Green Mountain Pumpkin Spice is as good as any flavored coffee you'll get at your favorite coffee house.  It's rich and flavorful, and makes the kitchen smell great when it's brewing.  Try some with your favorite hazelnut creamer; it's like having a yummy pumpkin muffin!  Get some Green Mountain Pumpkin Spice - you won't be disappointed.

I loved this coffee soon as I opened the bag. Mainly it tastes as good as it smells. I've been a pumpkin spice lover for years but GREEN MOUNTAIN's is the best I've had yet. It feels slightly heavy in the mouth and even heavier with creamers. EXCELLENT kick back cup! I'd give it 5 stars but that's reserved for GREEN MOUNTAINS Blueberry coffee. Order a few bags and AMAZON pays the shipping.  PEACE

My large dog is a very picky eater but when I mix just 1/3 of a can of Canidae Grain Free Formula with his dry food he eats all of it, every time.  He thinks it is delicious. By using 1/3 of the can and refrigerating the remaining, the case lasts over a month.  Can't beat that.

At first I tried this because of the price and free shipping. I had never heard of it before.  My 11 dogs love this so I say it is great! The tiny ones (toy poodles) get the almost straight food. The others get this mixed with their Bil-Jac. I am impressed with the ingredients. Not full of corn! Another thing I noticed... Every time I have fed my dogs any brand of straight canned dog food, with the exception of Science Diet, they had diarrhea. Not with this one. Not even one of them had it. That's a good thing. I ordered two more cases and will continue. The price is reasonable too and free shipping with Amazon Prime or free shipping with purchase over 25.00.The only fault I could find, in my opinion, is that the product has lamb.  I won't eat lamb and have never before bought any dog food with lamb or veal in it. I do not like the way the animals are treated and lambs are sweet, baby cuddly things. It makes me sad.  Unfortunately, this company uses lamb in most everything for some reason.  I have never seen this before in a dog food  product. They might have one or two items with lamb, but not most all. They do have the chicken and rice without lamb. Regardless, at this time , I plan on ordering this dog food monthly for my dogs as they love it so much and other than lamb, I am impressed with the ingredients.

Carrageenan is an additive used to thicken foods. In Feb. 2000 issue of Cancer Letters, a cancer research journal; Carrageenan was injected into the vicinity of a growing tumor.  The carrageenan caused the tumor to grow faster.  I do not want to give my dog a cancer accelerator.  I also check food labels as well.  Some of the other flavors do not have carrageenan listed in the ingredients.

My dogs don't have any problems with grains, but they love this formula.  I buy it because, minus the grains, the consistency makes it very easy to mix with dry food.  I've tried other Canidae canned formulas, and my dogs don't care for them.  This formula is always a big hit.

Summary: Far and away my pup's fave!
Text: Have tried several kinds of Canidae canned, and the dog likes them all. However, this is by FAR her favorite. There does seem to be some goop that seperates from the food and goes to the top of the can. I just scoop it off and she chows down.
Good product - you can actually see the peas and potatos in it. My dog has had no issues on this food and he has severe allergies,
My dogs loved the other Canidae dog food but for some reason both my dogs are allergic to something in this food.

Summary: Suspecting change in formula, but still good product
Text:
I've been purchasing this product, as well as the grain free salmon for a few years now by the case. I have 6 special-needs' rescued Greyhounds and although they all require a different 'diet' because of their problems, I keep this on hand in these two grain free 'flavors' as an occasional 'add in' to the fresh-food diets I prepare for them on a daily basis. I have relied on this to get me through their 'picky-eater' times, their 'on-medications-that-taste/smell-funny-and-I-don't-wanna-eat-Mom" times, their upset tummy times, their 'post-surgery-feeling-icky" times as well as when I don't plan right or run out of something. This grain free product comes in very handy and I like that it is pretty close to 'natural' ingredients. Frankly, there is another brand I would prefer but I simply cannot afford it.

I've been more than happy with this product because it is grain free. I cook fresh, whole grains for my 'kids' in their daily diets so to find grain free canned food to keep on hand for 'in a pinch', I like this. ok, so I loved it until the last 6 cases I had delivered. For years, this canned product was almost solid in the can. I needed a spoon to dig it out and I loved the way I had to actually mash it into the rest of their food. The last 6 cases (both flavors: 3 of the salmon and 3 of the ALS) seem to have a change in the recipe. I open the can and can literally POUR it into their bowls. There might be one larger blob of 'food', but for the most part, it is like a healthy soup. I purposely do not purchase the other Canidae canned foods that contain broth because I can make them all kinds of much healthier 'broth' on my own. I don't know if these last 6 cases are this way because they sat in a warehouse for a long time and the food actually broke down or what. To those in the 'know' that may sound dumb but I have no idea why this product would change so drastically and I have to admit I'm disappointed greatly. While this is something I can afford, my disappointment is now to the level where I'm back to considering the more expensive product I wanted all along. I'll just buy less of it, less frequently. Too bad. I really liked this one for quite a while, as did my 'kids'.

Summary: Perfect for a picky German Shepherd
Text: I have a German Shepherd who will not eat anything, but I just watched her eat two bowls of food after mixing in the 5 1/2 ounce can of Canidae. I'm so happy I bought this! I've been purchasing the extremely expensive Newman's organic/ Wellness formula wet foods, and even those she hasn't liked. Hopefully she'll continue to like the Canidae and put some meat on her skinny self. Plus, this brand is cheaper while still containing quality ingredients!

Summary: Not edible according to my dogs
Text: I have fed other Canidae canned foods, this one my dogs and my daughters dog, whom I gave the food to, turn their noses up to. I have tried mixing it into their other food, they refuse to eat it.  I will stick w/Wellness Core, costs a bit more, but they love it. First no grain canned food that you may as well throw away.

I grew up on Mrs. Grass in Northern Ohio. I love this soup.Mrs. Grass Chicken Soup Mix with Extra Noodles, 6.2-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)I have been in Arkansas for 30 years. They don't sell it here. Until i discovered it on Amazon.com I had to do without or bring it back after a visit to Ohio. Not any more! Thank you Amazon
Hey, it's packaged soup, that can't be found in Tulsa, but we like it so we order it, it's good

This soup has been a pantry staple for over 20 years. Now I can no longer find it on the shelves of local stores. I was very pleased to find it available on line and I found the on-line shopping experience to be without fault. I have shared the soup with family members and will be buying again.

I grew up on Mrs. Grass soup, it was the only thing my grandmother could give me when I was sick, since I've always been a vegetarian. I've noticed that not a lot of grocery chains carry the product, now I can buy on Amazon, i'm so thankfull, it's the only thing I swear buy when I'm sick.

Summary: I searched high and low until I found Mrs. Grass noodle soup...
Text:
I've used Mrs. Grass noodle soup all my life, my mother used it too. I moved to Suffolk, VA last year and couldn't find it anywhere; store clerks looked at me strangely when I asked for and described it. A friend suggested I look it up in Amazon and there it was, I quickly ordered it.

Mrs. Grass soup mix comes in a set - two packages glued together for a total of 8 cups of soup. However, I've learned to "stretch" and enhance it by using six cups of water instead of four and adding two tsp. of chicken bullion. I also add a 1/3rd of a cup of dehydrated vegetable flakes and extra noodles as well as left-over cubed chicken and suddenly, I have a nutritious, delicious homemade soup that lasts for several meals. It's far better than any of the other packaged soups out there, partly because of the little gold ball of chicken fat. I'm delighted to be able to purchase it. Amazon is the place to shop.

Lifetime consumer of Lipton's noodle and Extra noodle soup. Couldn't find in store but saw this one and tried it! I had never heard of Mrs. Grass before. To my delight, it was delicious and the noodles are bigger and better! It tastes more home-made than the Lipton's.  Ordered a case from Amazon, and am so happy to find something this good that can be made in 5 minutes.

This product brings back great memories of my mom fixing this for me at lunch, except she bought the regular one with the normal amount of noodles. It's the best tasting dry soup mix, bar none, and that "golden egg" in every box apparently makes a difference, compared to other dry soup mixes I tried.
I was so excited to find Mrs. Grass soup on Amazon. I haven't been able to buy it since leaving Minnesota. I even got my co-works hooked on it.

As a child I grew up on this and since moving south have not been able to find it.  Also the fact that many stores now carry their own brand makes it even harder.  The soup is still the same as I remember.  When my daughter found out I ordered she was right over to claim a box for herself...takes me back to when times were better and simpler.

I was surprised to find it online. I use this mix for a few things and it is always a nice meal add on. I use it with rice, more noodles or even as a add on for a a chicken casarole. I am expecting my first shipment on the 18th of january. It is nice to stock up like this.

Back in Indiana we always had Mrs. Grass noodle soup in the pantry. My father loved it, and passed that on to us kids. As a child, I thought the parsley was the "grass." Ha-ha. I have lived in Utah for the last 29 years, and for the first 20 years, I went without because they don't sell it here. Then I found it on-line. I also send it to my parents in Florida because they don't sell it there, either. I raised my grandchildren on it, and they always ask for it when they come over. Thank goodness for technology, because I would have gladly flown to Chicago once a year just to bring a case of it back with me. :)

Whether someone in my family is actually sick, or just feeling a little blue, they always request Mrs. Grass' Chicken Soup.  None of the stores in my area carry it, so I buy it by the case from Amazon, and the price is very reasonable.  Easy to make, fabulous flavor, tons of noodles, and the leftovers keep just fine.  Good for whatever ails you.  Accept no substitute!
My go-to soup when I'm not feeling well.  What more can I say.  It's a great snack when I'm well.  I have always had some in my home and now can get it delivered.

Summary: Kids and Their Friends LOVE This Soup
Text: I don't know why Mrs. Grass soup isn't advertised.  The truth is, my kids as well as their friends love this soup and even request it when at my home.  They asked for it when they were small, and my daughter said her college friends love it at U of Dallas as well.  I'm buying more now because all four of my kids are coming home for the weekend.  It just has a nice, yummy taste.  Filling without major calories which is nice too.  Better than Lipton and Knorr by far.  They should advertise it!!!

What a snob the first reviewer is!  Onions, by their nature, "smell to high heaven;" anyway, interpreted literally, that  would mean that their fragrance is divine.  They are sealed in a container for freshness; of course, we all know that they aren't "canned," which would mean the container had been cooked in a vat of water.  In taste, there can be no dispute.  I love them.  There is no substitute for this crispy treat, and French's are better than imitators'.  They are wonderful on baked potatoes.  Mmm...

Even Cooks Illustrated couldn't recommend a substitute for these classic fried onions when recently updating and fresh-i-fy-ing the famous green bean casserole dish these onions are most often used for.
I agree.  I'm not sure why people write reviews without even trying the product.  I love using these on mashed potatoes and my bean casserole.  They are wonderful!
I'm sorry but there is no way that something that smells to high heaven and is fried and then canned is "gourmet" food or even "food"

Summary: Nice tea, a bit too pricey
Text: This is a very good Dragon Well, but a little overpriced. I'd say that Rishi's Jade Cloud tea is of similar quality for less money, although of course Dragon Well has a certain prestige and a unique flavor you won't get in other green teas.

Summary: It from Anhui not Zhejiang west lake
Text: Tea tastes fine but it is  not from Zhejiang west lake area. From the description I thought it comes from Zhejiang west lake; best dragon well tea from this place. Could you please verify for me?  I do not know how to contact the seller and hence, post here.

Summary: Nutricity is the VERY WORST EVER place to order from
Text: Nutricity is the very worst ever place to order.  I ordered almond butter thinking it came in a glass bottle and when I received it it was packages in plastic.  I returned them and they send me an email saying they did not receive returns.  When I tried to get in touch with them with their 800 number a recording said they only handle returns via email.  I will never ever order from them.  I highly recommend that nobody ever orders from them.  When I ordered I never read that you couldn't return an item.
