"Our Wild Organic Olive Oil come from the point where Spain's largest river, the Ebro, flows into
Catalonia from Aragón. A number of artificial lakes were created during the last century to generate
electricity. Here on these arid slopes some 600 metres high, near the village of Riba Roja d'Ebre, grow
numerous stubby Arbequina olive trees, small and contorted and often very old.

The unique advantage of this altitude is that there is no incidence of the infamous white fly Dacus Olei,
which presents such a big challenge to organic olive farmers at lower altitudes. This means that Can Solivera
can grow E.U. certified olives here without the use of pesticides.

Once harvested, our Wild Organic Olive Oil is pressed in one of the last remaining traditional stone mills in
Spain. The olives are ground by 3 huge granite wheels and then pressed in a pile of some 65 round straw mats.
The oil is then decanted from the "alpechín" by gravity in large masonry cisterns."

Armed with this and other information I could gather, I went back to the shoppe, bought a 17oz.
bottle of this amazing stuff along with some fresh French bread, and made a beeline for home.

All I can say is this, the Gods of Olympus must surely have a bottle of this on their dining
table. Its that good. Its light but earthy, medium bodied but full flavored and very fruity.
Its great for just dipping, or in salads or for finishing. And this price is very very reasonable.

I've always been a fan of the Spanish Olive Oils, and now I'm even more attached. Thanks to the
wonderful people at Solivera(dot)com for all the great background information, and for this amazing
gift to the culinary world. 5 Pits
Pedicure dog food is a decently good dog food. Our dogs love the meat and econally priced at twenty-four can package!!! Will buy again!!!!!!

Stanley may not be the best source for food reviews, since he generally eats anything he can fit into his mouth and seems to enjoy it, but the fact is, he is very fussy about dog food. I've tried the high priced stuff, Royal Kanin, Iams, even Paul Newman's offering which smells better than the stuff I feed myself. He eats it, of course, but not joyfully, not with that Cocker Spaniel enthusism. Plainly put, when Stanley eats something he loves, he sends up a spray and every fiber of his doggy being exudes joy. Yeah, I know, so do I, thanks for bringing it up in front of strangers. We're talking about the dog, so beat it.

Anyway, until now, only people food...but specially prepared for Stanley (vet approved menu: chicken or beef, baked boiled or broiled, fat removed, diced and mooshed together with selected fresh vegetables)...elicited this kind of enthusiasm. I am not averse to cooking for my dog, but it would be nice to be able to open up a can every so often instead. Particularly when there is only one piece of chicken left and I want it. A friend told me that his finicky dog loved Purina, to the exclusion of all other canned offerings, so I tried it. Country Stew, Lamb and Rice and this "Gravy with Beef" which sounds unappetizing, but smells fine, are his favorites. He still prefers a nice piece of beef and has absolute and undisputed dibs on the white meat from every chicken, but this rates a ten on his tail-wagging unbridled joy of eating scale.

I should point out that Stanley also eats bugs when he can get them, so while the word "choosy" might describe his eating habits, so does disgusting. But no matter, he's the best Good Boy ever and deserves the best...whether it's people food, dog food or the occasional crawly thing.

Summary: Purchased Pedigree Cuts in Gravy with Chicken Food for Dogs
Text: Have purchaed through Subscribe and Save through Amazon.com the Pedigree Choice Cuts in Gravy with Chicken Food for Dogs, 13.2 Ounce Cans (Pack of 24) and our dog prefers this flavor over repeatedly and I will always give it 5 Stars!  This flavor has  Chicken in cube bite size with gravy that is just yummy.  Our dog wags his tail the second he sees the can and so enjoys his meal which means the bowl is clean when done! Our pets know when they are being served the best. High recommendation.

Summary: Our dogs love it but finding low price and 12 oz cans is tough
Text:
When Amazon LLC was selling large cans it was affordable via super saving shipping. You expect a price reduction when buying large size cans. One quarter of these cans was only partially filled with chunks, having an inch of fluid before touching the meat product. I shake each of these large cans before opening one. We prefer the smaller cans of this product, but local chains do not carry it in either size, and Amazon only offers it in large. Our dogs love the pedigree brand pouches and cans, especially the beef and liver. Although, they use corn product (one reviewer noted) and my veterinarian espouses "...it's mostly water," our dogs vote is positive. We treat our pets and give this to them because they like it...not for their health.

After finding the substantial price increase this morning, I found the small cans at PetCo. Perhaps, Amazon will get a small can supplier for the "beef and liver" chunks in the future.
This is the best food i've ever used for my dogs!! Pedigree is easy to digest an the flavor must be good they can't wait to eat !!!!!

Just when i got my shipment i tried it out on my pit but he only ate portion of it and he never ate it after that. So i also tried it on my rottweiler and she does not like it also. The only way they would eat it is if i add some caned meat with it then they would, but that shouldn't be the case. so i don't recommend.

Summary: Pedigree Dog Food, why I give if 5 Stars
Text: I have a four year old dog who loves Pedigree Canned Dog food.  We have been using it the last six months.  I have purchased some of the most expensive canned dog foods at a local pet store and he will not eat the stuff.  If I have a bag of high quality kibbles and mix it in with the Pedigree, he will not eat his food.  We tried Wellness, Blue Buffalo, Eagle Pack, Holistic Select, Innova, Merrick, and Natural Balance.  I don't know what is in these higher quality cans of dog food he does not like.  Maybe too many vegetables??  He will even hide and pout if I put that stuff in front of him.  One time I left the food out for 15 min., put it away, and tried the next day.  He just would not eat the food.  He just loves the smell and taste of Pedigree, and he will even eat Alpo on occasion, but he will not eat the expensive dog foods, which I am more than willing to purchase for him.  I talked to two vets about this.  They tell me dogs go by odor.  The worse something smells the more they like it.  This is why many dogs will roll in dead things out of doors.  We do try to balance out his diets with apples, carrots, etc., if he will eat them, plus the dog gets a vitamin with minerals each day.  Of course he will eat cooked meat if I give it to him, and often we will give this to him with some rice or whole wheat pasta mixed in.  If someone can tell me how to get him to eat the better canned or kibble dog food that so many folks think dogs should be on, then I would like to know this.  Also, the reason we started using Pedigree is because we have some friends (and their relatives) who have had many dogs over the years and feed them Pedigree.  These dogs have lived to a ripe old age.  The biggest thing that got them down was arthritis, but the Pedigree never killed them.  So, this dog food may not be high quality, which I agree when compared to Blue Buffalo, etc., but it does not seem to affect their life span.  I am sure there will be folks who will tell me differently, but for those folks I know personally, they have not found any problems with this food for their dogs.  Amen.

Summary: Delivered to the door right on schedule
Text: What a great way to get heavy items like dog food from an affordable and dependable source. I usually by my dog food in a discount box store rather than my local grocery store. That means another trip and more than once, I've run out. With gas prices what they are the convenience and one less trip is well worth looking into having stock items delivered this way.
The product is what I needed for my dog. Works out fine receiving it one a month for the dogs. It is also great to order an extra shipment when needed.

Summary: MY PUG WONT EAT ANYTHING ELSE
Text: My 9 1/2 year old pug seems to have developed a senesitive stomach as he got older and lost some teeth.. So I had to put him on some soft food that would not upset his tummy.. I bought these for him and Thought he was gonna eat right thru the bowl the 1st time I put it out for him.. Needless to say he absoutly loves his food! and it seems to agree with his tummy.

My two dogs turn their noses up at this flavor dog food.
Even Mikey who eats anything when fed with the other dog won't touch it.
I don't understand why as the texture of the food looked fine and I hadn't noticed any usual smell to it.
There was some left over steak that I cut up into little bits and put in with the food and they managed to get the pieces out and leave the food.
Needless to say I am trying something else to feed them.
Other than the dogs not touching the food, it was delivered super fast and cans were all in tack.
What can I say.  Its dog food and the dog cobbles it up. It is easy to order and the super saving shipping is great.

NEVER buy Pedigree. I made a huge mistake trying this. It has the nutritional value of a cardboard box. It's full of corn and by-products. Your dog deserves better than this. If I could give Pedigree a -0, I would. My dog's coat is softer and shinier and she's much more energetic on another brand. There's dog food info all over the NET. Please, steer clear of the ugly Pedigree.
Very goodIgood taste and good for my skin and heaithCI have it every morning and night with waterCand make it for a mask before I go to bedCit's pretty good

I bought the Casina Rossa Mushroom-Truffle Spread withe the intention to use it as a "spread" unfortunately it didn't work out that way. This seasoning is hard to find but worth it.  We use it to season ground beef like sausage since we don't eat pork.  You can't tell the difference.  Great taste!

I was thrilled to be able to find this seasoning through Amazon, I had looked in every grocery store around my area for it and was unable to find it. My dad always used it and he got me hooked on it. It is really good in meatloaf.

This is great stuff! I used it with the Bob's Red Mill TVP (Textured Vegetable Protein), 10-Ounce Bags (Pack of 4) to make fake veg sausage and it was as good as the Morningstar sausage which is pricey. Give it a try!

We use Morton Seasoning when we make our own sausage. I love this product and was very happy when I found it on Amazon. My family doesn't like the flavor of any other sausage including Bob Evans or Jimmy Dean! Great product

Summary: My Favorite Roux - Pricey, but makes a LOT of gumbo
Text:
I have used this Roux for YEARS. So long, that I can't imagine making Gumbo without it. Amazon's price is pretty pricey. Right now it is $9.99 + $4.99 shipping. I get this when I am back in Louisiana and stuff it in my suitcase to bring back. I only pay about $6 a jar.

I have tried the other variations of this Roux though....the light roux isn't dark enough to really lend it's nutty flavor. Stick to the dark.

I have lived in south Louisiana for the past thirty years and am currently working in northeast Pennsylvania. And though I can make my own roux I have reached the stage where I have no problem with faster shortcuts. But the price on this product is well out of line. I expect everyone to make some money but a 1000% price markup is a little much. Try Zatarain's New Orleans Style Gumbo Base. It is available from Amazon and almost as good.

LOL I bought two jars of this stuff, and I cant tell you if its any good because
it was like cement. I thought this might be a good shortcut, but the ingredients
were literally frozen solid in the jar, I'm still laughing at my feeble attempts
to extricate this "roux" from its glass housing.

This price is hilarious, its oil and flour fer chrisakes. Learn how to make your
own roux, its easy, and not as daunting a task as it may seem. This stuff... I'm
surprised they're still in business. 1 Lonely Crawdad

My Isis loves salmon so I always buy food that contains salmon as the ingredient. When I visited PetSmart and saw Nature's Recipe I gave it try, it has salmon as the main ingredient and it had no meat-by-products or fillers - very important to watch!
She loves it!! before she would only eat at night and during the day she would eat more Whiskas Temptations snacks which all the cats seem to be highly addicted to, but ever since she tried Nature's Recipe with Salmon, she eats it during the day and night - i make sure to watch her weight but the bowl is empty the next day!! and she's eats less snacks during the day - even better!! I just purchased a second bag today and the lady at the store - only found at Pet Stores - told me that this is a very popular brand among cat owners especially the salmon recipe - true I noticed the shelves were almost empty. I'll continue to purchase this one for her. The price is reasonable too and at the store they always have a special offer going on! Check it Out!! They also have Nature's Recipe for Dogs :D

I just happened to order this coffee when my usual brand was out of stock and I'm glad I did.  It's a full-bodied roast and the flavors are great.  The cinnamon is not overpowering and goes well with the hazelnut.  I will be sure to order more.
I have looked for this type of bread for along time because I was brought up on it when I was a child but now I have diebetes and it is a good bread for that problem
I received the Sesame Snaps on time and was very pleased with the product.  This was my first time ordering this product and it is a great sesame seed/honey snack.

I prefer the normal Skippy Natural over the honey flavor, having tried both. The honey flavor has a strange, kind of more plastic-y consistency, and sugar comes before honey on the ingredients list. It tastes okay, but I don't think the extra sweetness adds anything.

Summary: the only peanut butter i'll ever eat
Text: So good...not too thick, not too peanut-y...the honey infusion makes this peanut butter perfect...i don't even eat jelly or jam when i make sandwiches with this. buy skippy's natural peanut butter with honey. it will change your life.

We love this peanut butter! It has no hydrogenated oil, which makes me feel good about it as a choice for my family. The taste is superb, so much so that we've subscribed to have it shipped to us regularly! The kids say it's their favorite.
I am fond of peanut butter & honey together. I really like this stuff. I eat it 2-3 mornings a week on my toast. I will continue to get this. I get it at my local stores though.

Summary: Best. Peanut Butter. Ever. ...though it's $3/jar in store....
Text:
LOVE this!
Sooooo good! Nice sweet taste, creamy texture. Only kind we buy. Perfect for sandwiches, celery, apples, or right off the spoon!
WAYYYYYY over priced on here though! It's $2 and change at wal-mart and $3 at food lion.
SUPER DELICIOUS!

Kids love the taste, easy to spread, no separated oil. It has a 'roasted' taste to it, the Honey is subtle and really adds to the flavor. Kind of like a gourmet peanut butter but at an everyday price.
Not only do you get this delivered to your door but it tastes great without the very difficult job of mixing usually associated with natural peanutbutter!!!!!

I few years ago I tried the current 'commercial' peanut butters out there: Peter Pan, Skippy and Jiff. After tasting each, I felt that Skippy tasted the best overall. When I was looking for some Skippy PB to get my fiancé one day, all they had was natural (it was all on sale at the grocery store). I picked it up and hoped for the best. This PB tastes SO good it's ridiculous. The honey flavor is subtle but appreciated. And you truly DON'T have to stir it. So it's healthy and tastes great.
this is the best peanut butter you will have ever tasted!!!  i didnt know what i was missing and clearly...i was missing something. i have told so many people about this.  i ordered in bulk!
This is delicious.  Not even close to as sweet as Peter Pan's version.  Plus, Peter Pan's got nothing on Skippy!

Hadn't had the chance to try Skippy natural with honey since my local stores don't carry it, so when I saw the six pack deal on Amazon I couldn't pass it up!

Now I won't buy any other brand or any other kind, this stuff is DELICIOUS!!

I think the name is a bit misleading. Sugar is listed as an ingredient before honey. Maybe they should have called it Peanut Butter with lots of sugar and some honey.

It is also considerably sweeter than the plain natural - 5 Grams of sugar per 2 tbsp for this vs. 2 for the Natural.

Natural peanut butter (pb) is good because it has no hydrogenated oils in it(trans fat)regular pb can list trans fat as 0 bc it has .5 g of it..which the FDA calls 0.

anyway, Skippy is a pretty tasty pb for what it is...a grocery store pb. It has a nice rich taste an a nice hint of honey(which is nice but too weak for my likings) It is not my favorite though.
My favorite would be a product called naturally more. Naturally more is another natural peanut butter, except it has better ingredients and better taste.

hope my review was helpful ;)

link to my favorite product
Naturally More Peanut Butter Natural, 16-Ounce
Skippy Natural Peanut Butter with honey is a hit with the kids. It's easy to use and everyone in our home likes the great sweet taste.

Summary: Great Deal at a Great Price
Text: I ordered this peanut butter pack for a holiday food drive that we were having at my church. This pack included 6 large size jars of peanut butter. The price was perfect. If I had purchased these jars individually at the grocery store, I would have been paying about $5 to $6 a jar.

This caught my eye at target the other day. I am a big fan of peanut butter and eat quite a bit of it to fit my fat macronutrients. The honey aspect just screamed at me I have to try it. There is about 10 extra calories (in at 200 for 2 tablespoons) from my other PB. It is definitely worth it. Price point is very reasonable considering the PB prices lately. With the honey it is a tad bit sweeter than regular PB and it's a bit thin in comparison. Almost flows like a thick honey.  Very delicious and would and most likely will get again.

Very delicious. Very creamy with a taste of honey. I know it has palm oil and I'd prefer it didn't, but it's still better than a lot of the other brands out there. I usually hate peanut butter plain but I can eat this out of the jar!

For a long time my wife and I looked for a peanut butter we could agree on that tasted good and was w/o the hydrogenated oils, etc., and was easy to spread across bread. This peanut butter is the answer. It tastes great and doesn't separate or require refrigeration. After trying one jar, we bought a pack here.
My family just loves Fred Meyer Creamy Peanut Butter with Honey.  While shopping on Amazon I found this Skippy brand with Honey and decided to give it a try.  We're not disappointed.  It's very good!

OMG I love this Honey Peant Butter.  I can not say enough about it.  I eat it right out of the jar with a spoon. It is also great on English muffins, especially crispy, warm ones.  I will definitely be reordering this when I run out of the 6 jars I currently have.
We only eat the natural peanut butter, and I am soooo happy that they now make it with honey!!! It is so good!!!

ProfileName: Richard C. Drew "Anaal Nathra/Uthe vas Bethod...
Text: This stuff is simply delicious - tastes  like Butterfinger candy. Yea, it's higher in saturated fat and calories than regular peanut butter, but man is it good!

ProfileName: D. VALENCIA "So Whats It All About?"
Text: They hardly have this at the local market but this is DELICIOUS! Its very creamy for sandwiches, with celery or by itself. Happy customer here.
We are very much enjoying the Skippy Natural Peanut Butter with honey!!  I think this is the first peanut butter I have had with honey and we like it very much. Thank you.
This peanut butter was a great deal!  And how could peanut butter be anything but yummy?  The fact that it had honey in it was a plus!

This Peanut Butter tastes amazing! You get the PB & honey
all in one! And what a great deal. You can't go wrong with
the Skippy name. The texture is so smooth too. I would purchase
this again for sure.

Summary: Creamy, light tasting with a hint of honey
Text: My husband and I like to spread peanut butter on any and everything - so finding this was wonderful.  We purchased both the natural and honey varieties in the 6 pack.  Yes, the natural does feature less sugar, but we both find the taste of the honey is a sweet addition to our PB&J's, on carrots or celery or with apples.  We find the regular natural is best when making peanut butter cookies!
We love this peanut butter! Haven't tried it in cooking yet but will take advice to use less sugar when I do. It was not too sweet for my likes and has a very creamy texture. I LIKE IT
This is a great peanut butter and at a great price, so much cheaper than the grocery store AND it was delivered, can't beat that!
I am a pretty big fan of peanut butter, and this is the best peanut butter i have ever had anywhere.  I have tried a lot of different kinds before and none compares to this.

i tried this and peter pan honey styles..but peter pan had that hydrogenated oil stuff..
this is an excellent taste for sure/not hydrogenated per label...
we love this peanut butter..the taste test is excellent
got it on subscribe and save with an extra coupon
it's 5 stars

This is by far the best peanut butter (natural or not) that I've ever had. The addition of honey makes it incredibly yummy. I have to stop myself from eating it right out of the jar. I love that it's natural; no hydrogenated oils or preservatives or any other weird ingredients. Unlike a lot of natural peanut butters, you don't have to stir this one every time you use it or keep it refrigerated because of the addition of palm oil, which is a healthy fat. Other peanut butters (ones with hydrogenated oils) taste rancid compared to this. Will definitely be purchasing again and again.

I ordered these because they were the cheapest 'natural' peanut butter offered. It tastes great if you like sweet peanut butter -or dont want to add anything else to a sandwich -but we dont taste the 'honey' -just 'sweet' peanut butter. What I didnt notice is that it not only uses honey for a sweetener but sugar as well. And since sugar comes before the honey on the ingredients list, that usually means there is more sugar than honey. Add to this the fact that 90% of all sugar is now genetically modified and the label does not say it isnt...
We like the taste of this so if taste and the absense of hydrogenated oils is your only concern, this is a good choice. If you are trying to stay truly natural and non-gmo, this is not a good option.

At the tune of this heavenly

At the tune of this heavenly delight also consuming half to a whole jar a day my joints especially my knees never felt stronger. The honey is the final touch of perfection to an already awesome product. With great sadness and complete regret I dropped my subscription because I am no longer a growing kid.
On the ingredient list, and you can tell. Not a bad mouthfeel, and certainly superior to some of their other 'Natural' attempt, but nothing spectacular.

Summary: They sent me the regular Natural Peanutbutter
Text: They sent me the wrong ones and I thought I had made the error since it was on the packing slip that way.  But now they are asking me to review this one, so I guess it was an error.

ProfileName: N. Ferguson "Two, Daisy, Hannah, and Kitten"
Summary: human quality ingredients, unique manufacturing process-- my goldens enjoy it
Text:
My two goldens approve of this product. Blue Buffalo uses top of the line ingredients, human food grade-- there's a chicken version and a fish version. No yucky meat "by-products", meat and meat meals are the top ingredients, no indigestible corn or wheat, a wide variety of wholesome and varied vegetable ingredients and several probiotics to promote healthy digestion and absorption of nutrients. On top of that, this is a very palatable food.

Blue Buffalo also uses a unique process to manufacture "lifebits" which are added to the basic "kibble" food. These smaller, darker pieces are cold formed in order to better maintain nutrients. I don't believe any other company incorporates this kind of element into dog food.

I respect what they are doing, and I've changed to Blue Buffalo food for my cat, too.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Here's the nutritional information:

-One cup contains 462.8 calories
-NO animal by-products
-NO artificial preservatives, colors, or flavors
-NO corn, wheat, or soy AND gluten-free (great to know after last years' pet food scandals and deaths with other brands, in which added glutens were contaminated with melamine)
-Crude protein 25% minimum
-Crude fat 14% minimum
-Omega 3 fatty acids 0.25% min
-Omega 6 fatty acides 3.5% min
-Glucosamine 400 mg/kg max
-Major ngredients, in order:
Deboned chicken, chicken meal, whole ground brown rice (very digestible grain source vs. the usual corn), whole ground barley, oatmeal, rye, whole potatoes, tomato pomace (natural source of lycopene), chicken fat (preserved wtih natural mixed tocopherols), natural chicken flavor, whole carrots, whole sweet potatoes, blueberries, cranberries, flaxseed, barley grass, dried parsley, alfalfa meal, kelp meal, taurine, l-carnitine, l-lysine, glucosamine hydrochloride, yucca schidigera extract, green tea extract, turmeric, garllic, sunflower oil (natural source of Omega 6 fatty acids), oil of rosemary, the whole bunch of expected vitamins and minerals, and several probiotics (lactobacillus acidolphilus, bacillus subtilis, bifidobacgterium longum, enterococcus faecium).

I hope this helps you evaluate whether or not this food would be a good match for your best pal.

I received a sample of this dry dog food from the company and I have to admit - it is a very good product.  My dogs all loved it eespecially the little "bits" of additional antionidants and nutrients.  All my dogs practically fought over who would get the most!!!!!  Never before have I had a dog food that my dogs liked so much.  And the list of ingredients - wow!!!  I rate this product very high and so do my dogs!!!

...but of course, "Jacob" the exuberant, 16-month old Weimaraner rescue has a VERY broad definition of "edible":-)

Full disclosure: everything we place in his dish fills him with delight.

We purchased this brand based on the recommendations of the local breed club and a local dog specialty shop. Although our dog is a pet, and neither a show nor field dog, it was clear that owners with major investments in their show and field animals had high regard for this food.

While I haven't sampled it, the manufacturer's emphasis on "human-grade" primary ingredients appeals to us. In the workplace, we often talk about "eating our own dog food" in evaluating services and products delivered to customers, and this is also true for the food we choose for out pets.

An additional note about this food. Without getting too graphic, cleaning up after your dog might present a slightly different experience. We've noted a slightly softer consistency overall. Just be prepared for a change in what your dog leaves behind...

I was told from a friend of mine, how great blue buffalo dog food was. I kept telling her I would try it, but never did. The problem was, I would always have a full bag of dog food when she would remind me. I didn't want to waste the dog food I had just bought. Anyway, one day I was ordering off Amazon and said, "what the heck, I'll give it a try." I ordered it, it arrived and my dogs LOVE IT!!! I am never going back! the other (no names) dog food would literately go right through them..YUCK! They weren't getting the proper nutrition and they were not as energetic. Thank you and I am going to keep purchasing BLUE BUFFALO!!!!

These are great straight from the can and I found my favorite condiment to go with these Octopus is catchup of all things.

Reese Spanish Octopus have a LOT of Olive oil you will need to drain (not extra virgin) and you will need to be very cautious when opening these cans because they are a little difficult to open (I open mine over the sink).

Great value and a tasty and convenient treat with a very long shelf-life.

Never had octopus before...but I love most other seafood-in-a-tin ( sardines, oysters, etc )
Before buying 100 cans, I bought one at a local store for $2.49
Tasty !

Bought the 100 cans when they were on sale for $71
Wish I would of bought 300 cans.

I eat one a day, right out of the can.

My girlfriend cant even stay at the table when I eat them...so definitely try them out before buying online.

Summary: Ahh..Cupella Morning Blend is great coffee!
Text:
Excellent flavor. Wonderful fragrance. One of the best coffees
I've ever had! So glad it's available on Amazon.com!! I can't imagine
anyone who tries it will be disappointed.

I've tried a couple of different dark chocolate and cherry bars and this is the only one that has delicious chewy dried cherry pieces right in the chocolate.  And they are large enough pieces to really taste the cherry (not tiny bits or just cherry flavoring like you get in other bars).  This has become my favorite chocolate fix (although Godiva Key Lime truffle is a close second)...

This organic chocolate is so dark and delicious without a trace of bitterness.  The added dimension of the dried cherries is terrific.  And, as an added bonus, I know I'm supporting a business which is doing its' best to make our planet a better place, both environmentally and socially through the Fair Trade certification.  Thanks Green & Black!!

Of all of the Green and Black flavours, Cherry Chocolate is probably my favorite.  Green and Black's Dark Chocolate is superb, and here it is mixed with large pieces of dried sour cherries.  Perfect with tea, particularly after an opulent dinner that needs to be capped off by something tart.

Summary: great if it didn't almost break my tooth
Text: I almost broke my tooth on this bar and have been having major tooth pain for months since.  I bit into something very hard and crumbled, which I'm assuming was a broken cherry pit...and at this point I hope it was cause that would be gross not knowing what I bit into.  They mentioned that you may encounter them on their website...but nowhere on the package. Be warned so you don't need dental work after buying an expensive chocolate bar!

I've got to be honest, I don't care at all about free trade. I do care deeply about taste and this stuff takes two things I love and somehow screws them both up beyond recognition. what an awful disappointment. I don't think "tart" is a fair description, mouth puckeringly sour and acidic (not in a good cooking way, more like a stomach acid way) would be a more accurate description of the flavors. I don't taste any chocolate and not really any cherry (even tart) it's more just a chemical reaction with no flavor. it's actually similar to their chocolate chili bars - I love both of those things too and love the combination but rather than getting chili flavor and heat you somehow only get the unpleasant heat and no flavor.

Finally I found a food that doesn't give my 1 year old Giant Schnauzer diarrhea. I have a 7 year old mini schnauzer who is very picky and has bad teeth, but always enjoyed Blue Buffalo, but poor Conrad had upset tummy every few days. So I switched him to Diamond brand, same deal. We tried probiotics, pumpkin, rice but nothing worked. A friend has the most beautiful boxer and told me about Ultramix so I decided to give it a whirl. Both dogs gobble it up! In fact I think I will have to get a "slow down" feeder for Conrad. His stool hasn't been loose since which makes us both happy! :) yay! Yes, it is a bit pricey but I love my dogs and care for them as I do my 5 children so I want their diet to be the best it can be. I do super saver shipping and have it auto shipped each month which also saves a few bucks. Very pleased!!Castor & Pollux Natural Ultramix Large Breed Adult Dog FoodCastor And Pollux Natural Ultramix Adult Dry Dog Food

Thanks to Amazon, I received the second bottle of this drink mix to replace the first one that was tasted funny to me. The second one was exactly the same, nothing resembled to the "almond" flavor I used to.  I had to throw both of them away.

Summary: I love it in my tea!
Text: I add a heaping teaspoon of Badam Drink Mix to a large mug of black tea, then add half & half and a little sugar. Yes, Badam mix has sugar, but I was going to add sugar to my tea anyway, so I just add less. Makes a yummy tea, morning or later!

Summary: Not healthy, lot of sugar and no trace of saffron!
Text: We bought this as our 2 year old son was didn't like to drink milk. We saw the ad on on tv and decided to buy this. When we opened the package it was merely sugar mixed with traces of badam (almonds) and cardamom. However there was no trace of saffron! Even one strand of saffron makes the milk yellow and emits nice fragrance. Apparently MTR  is indulging in deceptive advertising. This is not healthy for kids as it is full of sugar. I have written to the company, but so far no reply.

Rarely can I say that a GF product tastes better than the gluten version.  Thse cookies do, though.  Melt in your mouth delicious, and just the right amount of lemon.  I am confident tht if you gave these to gluten eaters, they would not be able to tell the difference.

Although at first I wasn't sure about the texture of the wafers, I found these lemony wafers to be really addicting. The lemon filling flavoring is delicious and much better than the chocolate version of the same wafer. i would definitely buy this again!
We really like these. The lemon flavor is heavenly. The cookies are crisp and light... VERY VERY good.

When I first ate one I thought Wow... that is lemony and not sure if I liked it but by the end of "just trying one more" I was addicted. I have to hide them from my non-gluten free husband. He likes them better than the vanilla or lemon ones I used to buy for him in the grocery store that are not gluten free. I am trying to get a local store to carry them.

Summary: The best gluten-free cookies I have ever had
Text: I feel like have tried every gluten-free baked good out there. Since I am allergic to dairy, eggs, soy, and bananas as well this product is a lifesaver for when I need a cookie. They taste really , really good and don't make me sick.  I love these things I pray they never stop making them.
These are actually superior to any similar vanilla cookies I've had - they are absurdly addictive, so watch out for that...
These cookie and the chocolate version are the best gluten free substitutes for Oreo cookies on the market. Filling very creamy and cookie is nice and light.
My two little boys love these.  I can't tell them apart from the real gluten version.

Summary: Vanilla wafers -- beware they can melt in shipment!!!
Text: These tasty chocolate coated wafers are a great way to get a chocolate fix without too many calories. Be warned however that if the weather is sunny and in the 70's or higher, you're likely to be disappointed when you open the box because the chocolate melts. You'll have three solid blocks instead of 18 wafers, even if you used next day delivery. Best to order this product when cloudy weather is forecast, and high temps will be in the 60's or less -- apparently those brown UPS trucks get pretty warm in the sun!

These are so good.  I love them as a quality , gluten free sweet treat.  My kids , who are also gluten free, just think they are great cookies. They have a great lemon taste.  I dont know of any afater taste or any particular potato smell.  They are just real good cookies in a gluten free world!

The lemon flavored wafers ARE really good, but the STRAWBERRY are BEST!
I'm going to ask Amazon.com to get them on the subscribe & save program.
J.

These wafers are awesome, if you like the ones you buy normally in a local grocery store or use to buy you will love these, but be careful, very addictive, just like the others.yummy Great product that is free of gluten.
my kids were thrilled to have this kind of treat gluten free and tasty.  It has become a favorite in our family.3

Summary: Gluten free, but NOT taste free
Text: I got these for my daughter who has celiac.  I usually can tolerate the gluten free foods, but rarely do I find something that I would choose to eat.  These go beyond that.  They are so good.  Now, I LOVE sugar wafers and so I was skeptical.  But, you'll not be disappointed.  The biggest problem was stopping myself from eating them and saving them for my daughter.

These wafers remind me of those regular chocolate, vanilla, and strawberry wafers I was addicted to as a child...now if Glutino could only make those flavors gluten-free!  Yummy!!  Lemon flavored is a great start!
These wafer cookies are every bit as good as the ones I used to eat that are wheat-based.  They are light and airy and just plain good!

These are the best gluten-free cookies that I have ever tasted.  They are as good as the regular wafer cookies (or better!).  The only problem is that in shipment (during the summer months) the chocolate all sticks to the paper and the container that the cookies are in.  If they could be put on ice packs for shipment, they would get to the customer in much better shape.
I never thought I'd bother to review a cookie, but . . .  These are terrific, indistinguishable from 'real' cookies.  We go through a lot of these.
These remind me so much of a KitKat, which I can't have anymore due to a gluten intolerence.  I literally have to hide these from my daughter so I know I'll get some!!

I bought these cookies because I love lemon, I'm always looking for something that tastes good and is gluten-free. These cookies had everything up until the after taste - they had this funky fake lemon taste that wasn't there at the beginning. I was disappointed in the box and never bought another.
Chocolate Chip has a nasty smell and taste. I would never buy this flavor again. But the oreo ones are very good.
These are wonderful.  I had low expectations for some reason, but wow, very good.  I'm thinking I might make them into a crust for a cheesecake for Thanksgiving ... yum.
Delicious "oreos".  A little less sweet than regular oreos, but I think thats a good thing.  Overall, very excited, even my non-gluten-free friends enjoy these oreo-ish cookies.

My daughter has a wheat/gluten allergy so we have purchased a large number of gluten free cookies for her, trying to find something to serve as a substitute to real cookies.  Of all the brands and types of cookies, these are her favorite.  I have tried one as well and as far as prepackaged, store bought cookies are concerned, these are great.  The cookie is made up of alternating layers of waffers and chocolate creme and the whole cookie has been dipped in chocolate.  If you like chocolate I think you are going to love these cookies.

Summary: To make good even better - keep them in the freezer!
Text:
These are very good, but in the very warm weather the filling can go soft.
So I keep mine in the freezer. Try and keep them sealed to avoid moisture -
all I do is fold the silver packet over - and they are really good. There
is not enough to them to taste cold - but they are crisper. I only keep
the packet I have open in the freezer. See what you think.

Before becoming a Celiac and switching to a gluten free diet, I used to love Trader Joe's Vanilla Joe Joe's. I found these on sale at the Grocery Outlet the other day and decided to give these a try. These were so much better than the Trader Joe's Vanilla Joe Joe's and significantly better than Vanilla Oreo's. Even my gluten eating friends said they were addicting. They are great dipped in hot chocolate, milk or tea but are even better on their own. Will definitely buy again.
I bought these locally.  The price was high and I don't like the licorice taste!  I couldn't even finish the box...  I prefer the Schar brand vanilla wafers.

I've purchased most of the gluten free cookies available on Amazon and in local stores. These are best of the bunch. If you like wafer cookies -- they're good whether you can eat gluten or not (I grew up eating cookies with wheat and these compete with any "normal" wafer cookie (I wouldn't go as far as I would with Blue Diamond's Nut-Thin crackers, which I would say are better than regular crackers -- but they are at least as good as most cookies -- if you serve them to friends they won't wince (or even know they are eating gluten free) when they bite into them). The other Glutino flavors aren't bad either but the chocolate is the best -- I find chocolate tends to help mask the glutin free flour taste in most cookies.

I would recommend some caution in shipping them during the summer as you are more likely to recieve a cookie block rather than individual wafers (although the cookie block was pretty tasty too). Also, an added bonus for anyone shipping to APO or DPO, they will ship to these addresses(again a caution about the heat, especially if you are shipping to Afghanistan during the summer).

Summary: Might just be better than Oreos!
Text: Love these cookies!  I finally found one that tastes just as good as Oreos.  I think I can handle being on this gluten-free diet now as long as there are decent tasting cookies like these around!  I don't feel nearly so deprived.  Just made my day!

We have been on Gluten Free for a few months now, and when you first start, many things are hit or miss. I don't usually like vanilla "Oreo" type cookies anyway, and worried that my boys (6 and 4 years old) would never go for them... BUT- they are so sweet, flakey, and delicious that our whole family (my husband included) couldn't get enough of them.
BUY THESE COOKIES, for real.
Crispy, light, but overloaded with sugar.Sweeter then any GF product I have tried!!!  The price is one the high side, but Amazon has a good deal.

CHOCOLATE. When going GF 10 years ago, I was bummed cause there was suck a lack of store bought goodies. I once had an addiction to Keebler Fudge Shop, Fudge Sticks. I was hesitant at first to but these cause of the price, but they are worth it if you have the craving. I like them frozen/refrigerated the best. I gave them to a GF co-worker and she really liked them too. The only problem I have is once I open one box, I have trouble not finishing the whole thing. oops. I've also tried the vanilla ones, but they are not that good. Buy these!!!
These vanilla creme cookies taste great! Some gluten free items lack taste and texture, but you'd never know these cookies are gluten free and they are a favorite of ours.

Summary: Best gluten-free vanilla cream filled cookie ever!
Text: I have been on a gluten-free diet for nearly ten years,and these Glutino Vanilla Creme Dream Cookies are by far the best I have ever tasted!  Try them for yourself and if you like vanilla filled cookies,you won't be disappointed.

Ok I am a chocolate snob. If things have chocolate in them they have to taste really good. and these do. I bought a box and the local grocer today, there are about 16 wafers in a box and now there are just 2 left.

I'm surprised! These are awesome! They are just like the organic ones I used to buy for my kids before we stopped eating gluten. They're crunch and tasty. They are quite sweet though. Not something you could eat a lot of in one sitting. I'm done at 2. Maybe that's a good thing though. :)

I love these!  They have the same flavor as Oreos, with a very similar texture.  As with most gluten-free things, they are a tad grainy, but this is easily overlooked!!!  Definitely something to keep on hand (and in hand).
These wafer have a very bright lemony filling and dont taste like they are gluten free cookies. I have to keep them away from my kids!

There are very few "good" gluten free cookies out there. These are quite good, nice and chocolaty, but not too sweet.
Ps. don't forget the milk...

These dark chocolate covered wafers are wonderful. I don't even realize they are gluten free. With a rich dark chocolate covering and good tasting crunchy wafers they are the same as regular wheat wafers but without the problems for my condition.
These wafers are delicious.  My daughter has celiac so I buy them for her, but I love them too!
Best cookie ever - if there are Glutino Lemon  Wafers on my kitchen shelf, I can sleep well at night... best dessert .... fabulous fix for the sweet tooth. Top notch cookie that deserves top praise.

Summary: These cookies are to die for.
Text: Since going gluten free, what I have missed the most is a good cookie.  The gluten free breads and cookies on the market are not very good.  When I found these, I thought I had died and gone to heaven.  Can't live without them.

These are good, rich cookies, but I would not buy them from amazon again because they were so poorly packed that half of them were falling apart or already crumbs. I'll go back to buying them locally.

I keep these on auto-ship and hope I don't run out! But once a box gets opened here...they disappear at once. Crisp, light, so flavorful....and gluten-free! Whole family is hooked on the entire brand..but this flavor cookie is the MUST have. Especially refreshing refrigerated on a hot summer day.
These are delicious and such a treat if you are on a gluten-free diet.  I could eat the entire box at one sitting!
The cookies are okay in taste. They are a little too sweet for me. They also came completely crushed which didn"t help the texture.

I've been gluten free for about 10 years now and love my cookies!  I generally order Schar products and love their vanilla sandwich creams which really are as good as or better than gluten cookies.  With Glutino I feel it's hit and miss.  Their crackers are generally delicious and I love their pretzels but these cookies tasted like styrofoam and the icing was super sweet.  Not my favorite product from Glutino.  If you didn't care for these, you might try the Schar vanilla cremes.  They're amazing!

Summary: Very close to Nabisco Sugar Wafers taste
Text: The wafer part tastes very close to Nabisco sugar wafers but it's so much lighter. The light, crispy wafer combined with the strawberry flavor is not too sweet, like most GF products are, it's just right. We love them.
DELICIOUS. In summer heat they get soggy rather quickly, but freshly opened they are amazing.
these little cookies taste fantastic! not too sweet, just right....chocolate melts easily, so we will be ordering these in the cooler months only

I love these! After discovering a familial gluten intolerance, premade items that are gluten free have been difficult to obtain. Therefore, I now order these by the case each month. Light, refreshing, sweet and no grainy aftertaste. Yahoo! I don't have to break my dient now and I might not starve to death! I am so weary of lettuce....
a great gluten free product wityh a real taste of lemon. This is not a washed out flavor but a excellent mix of sweet and tart in a light crunchy wafer cookie.
I got these not expecting much but they were realy good. For gluten free they were great. I am so glad i found these. There great for when your craving something sweet.

ProfileName: Marc S. Gibian "Enjoying the outdoor world"
Summary: gluten-free and corn-free cookies that truly satisfy
Text: These are cookies that give a satisfying crunch, taste great, yet still are both gluten-free and corn-free. Finally, something to satisfy my sweet tooth while also providing some of the hard to find gluten-free crunch.

Having tried a couple of other brands of gluten-free sandwich cookies, these are the best of the bunch.  They're crunchy and true to the texture of the other "real" cookies that aren't gluten-free.  Some might think that the filling makes them a bit too sweet, but for me that just means I've satisfied my sweet tooth sooner!  The chocolate version from Glutino is just as good and has a true "chocolatey" taste - something that isn't there with the other gluten-free brands out there.
These chocolate wafers are delicious.  It's hard to find gluten free products that taste great, but these hit the mark.  They are a staple in my pantry.

This product is very tasty but if you are also lactose intolerant, better forgo the pleasure.  Milk is not listed on the allergy advisory (May contain traces of...) but the ingredients section lists whole milk powder as a component of the chocolate coating.  Otherwise, it's a great product.
These wafers melt in your month!  I buy by the carton.  we all love them.  Highly recommended.

Summary: Wow! Just like the real stuff!
Text: These are absolutely wonderful, great tasting cookies. People who are not celiacs can't tell the difference. You'll like them, too!

It's really hard to believe that these cookies are gluten-free.  They are like those really yummy cream-filled vanilla wafer cookies from childhood, only these have a heavy chocolate coating. Extremely good and if you're gluten sensitive, they are oh so good for you ! Indulge yourself.
It isn't easy to find really delicious cookies that are gluten-free, dairy-free, nut-free, and don't contain chocolate. These lemon wafers are all that -- truly yummy.

Summary: Excellent- but do yourself a favor and try them from the fridge!
Text: I loved these cookies when I first tried them, but found that in the humidity they will get soggy and gross if left open for too long.  Easily fixed with a Ziploc, but one time I tossed them in the fridge to keep them extra fresh.  That was when I fell IN love with these cookies.  When cold the creamy layers really hold up against the crunchy wafer and make a wonderful combination.  They are truly addicting.  Also, because we keep our entire house allergen free for my boys, these cookies are some that I can confidently serve when entertaining gluten-eating friends.  They often ask where they can get their own!

I recently had to go gluten free.  I have disliked so many products, because I can't get used to the tastes of some of the flours.  I would NEVER had guessed these were gluten free.  They are delicious!  I really have to use self control so that I don't eat them all in one day. If only I could find a gluten free bread that tastes good.
The cookies are the best GF packaged cookies.  The only complaint I have about them is they seem to disappear!

These are excellent. Expensive, but so good. You'd never know they were gluten-free. I don't know what the person was talking about them smelling like potatoes. They really do taste like a Kit Kat. So good!
These are my favorite gluten-free cookies, and I have tried a lot of brands. What more can I say?!

I have a three-year-old celiac who knows more about GF cookies than most adults, and these are his favorite cookies.  I like them too.  They really taste just like regular wafer cookies.  Totally worth the cost.

With 3 Celiacs in the family, the entire house is gluten free. Friends and family can't believe when I tell them that these cookies are gluten free. Another note, the cookies are packaged well, so they arrive INTACT, not in pieces, like other cookies out there.

Well, my kid who isn't gluten free likes them, and my kid who is won't touch them.  I cook and bake most of what we eat, so desserts are very homemade and natural in their flavor.  These are really, really artificial-lemon flavored....they remind me of my dish soap every time I try one.  I really don't like the flavor, but the texture is nice.  I'm a little dizzied that I have so many boxes of something I don't care for... it was worth a try, though.
My hubby and daughter LOVE these cookies. They are kinda spendy though. I did not enjoy them as much as I like gluten containing cookies!!!!

My son is 6 and he has celiac.  He loves sweets, however when he took a bite of this wafers he was done with it.  He said that it just was not good.  I tasted it and had to agree with him.  The only thing I could taste was the extreme sweetness and the fat sticking to the roof of my mouth.

Summary: Very good.  Also, they smell like potatoes.
Text:
I really shouldn't complain: the world would be a sadder place without these. They are like gluten-free Kitkats, which is wonderful.

However, they also smell like potatoes. The chocolate covers the potato taste and smell, for the most part, but, it's still a little bit like eating chocolate-covered crispy potatoes.

However, as you are probably aware, there are variations in what people can taste and smell. Personally, I can tell what vodka was made from--potatoes, wheat, whatever--even though it's so finely distilled that there shouldn't be any way to distinguish that. If you're not super-sensitive to tastes and smells, you probably won't notice the potato at all, in which case, these would be fabulous.

Summary: It's good junk food.  They also smell like potatoes.
Text:
First, let me say that I love this company. They have somehow managed, with very difficult flours, to make normal junk food. (These kinds of cookies are sold in American supermarkets in packages that are three times the size.)

The packaging is pretty; the cookies are crispy, light, and very appealing in your hand. They are an exact duplicate of the wheat version. However, once you get them up to your nose, you can smell the potato flour they are made from.

Pull them away from your nose, and you have a very pretty cookie. Bring them back in to your nose, and it's a surreally icky potatoey experience. Cookies like this shouldn't smell like potato vodka.

They do have a chocolate-covered version of this that you can't really smell, because the flour is covered. It's such a sugar rush that you may not care what it tastes like, particularly because it has an excellent chocolate-sugar-bomb wafer cookie texture.

Just hold your nose.

My son and I who are both Celiacs loved Glutino wafers in both chocolate and dark chocolate varieties. We were on our 3rd box when I opened one of the bars and went to bite into it. It was the equivalent to biting into some sort of spongy rock. I immediately spit out what chocolate had fallen into my mouth while biting it. The bar itself seemed extremely stale to me. I went ahead and opened the remaining 3 bars in the box and the rest were normal. I also noted on the package that the product is made in Israel then processed in Canada, then sent to USA to be bought. It seems to me like one of the bars I had floated around a facility for quite some time before it was actually packaged and sent. Or worse who knows. I'm glad it was me and not my 3 year old son who bit into it.

I tried contacting Glutino about what happened. I tried calling several times as well as sent messages via the internet. But no response. It went from being suspicious to down right scary, what are they hiding and if this is how they treat their costumers- how do they treat their food?

Please be forewarned. Going gluten free isn't easy and Glutino is a big brand on the celiac's grocery list but since our incident we avoid Glutino at all costs.
I love my Sweet Raspberry coffee in the morning.  Just sweet enough so don't need to add anything.  Just brew & go.  This purchase is my winter stock since it is a summer coffee.

I absolutely love this coffee. It gives the taste and aroma of raspberry without being overpowering and without the sugary taste of syrups.  My day is not the same without a cup of this coffee in the morning.  Because this is just a seasonal item, be sure to stock up for those months when it is not readily available.
My dog loves it. It is a great high quality dog food product. It goes a long way. My dog's vet said excellent choice. Highly recommended. My shipment had about a 1 1/2 year freshness date on the bag.

Summary: Great to keep in the pantry!
Text: I was very happy to find this product on Amazon. As living in a small Midwest town, I don't have access to a health food grocer like Whole Foods Market unless I drive 1 hour each way. Only mushroom I can buy locally is regular mushroom, but now I can keep this in my pantry for whenever I need to use it in a recipe. I just made a Pasta with one of the packs and that was great! Just enough for 4 people, and the mushrooms are ready to use after soaking them in hot water for 30 minutes. The left over liquid can be used to make a recipe like cream of mushroom soup or something as it has great extract from them. Considering they are organic, price is good for me. I also bought Shiitake and Matsutake too.
you can buy this at Trader Joes for $1.00 a bottle; this joker is asking $2.50 per bottle.

I am not a water drinker at all! I am a bonafide coffee and soda addict. I have never liked the taste, or lack there of, of water. As a child I did enjoy Naya but that was discontinued. I have always had for force myself to drink water. That was until I came across Smart Water! There is something about the tatse that makes it feel like you are not drinking plain water. I even use it in my coffee machine and when I make tea.

The only down side, is the cost. But this proves that old saying "You Get What You Pay For" is true and you can usually find it on sale at a grocery store.

I personally feel much better drinking more water, and would not have done so without Smart Water.

Summary: Smart Water is one of the best-tasting brands out there
Text:
Smart Water is my favorite brand of bottled water. I enjoy its taste better compared to other bottled waters. It just taste smoother to me. I'm not sure whether it's because it's distilled, but I like it. It's almost comparable (although not quite) to Fiji water (which is expensive). The price for Smart Water here cost a bit more, compare to other outlets.

Ingredients: Vapor Distilled Water, calcium chloride and magnesium chloride, potassium bicarbonate (electrolyte sources*) *electrolytes added for taste

Although slightly more expensive, I'd say this water is certainly worth the extra cost. I've been looking for a supplement water without flavoring for quite some time, and I've found the perfect specimen in the Glaceau Smart Water. As a highly active individual, there was a noticeable change in my energy level with the addition of the water to my routine (as compared to regular water). For a fairly inactive individual, I'm unsure as to how significant the difference may be, but at the very least, this product is refreshing and nourishing. Now, if only it had vitamins in it in addition to the electrolytes...

This product is no better than any other bottled water brands name or simple tap water. First of all, Glaceau is distilled MUNICIPAL water. Second of all, buying this product for the sole reason that it is  distilled water isn't very advantageous to your health or is a waste of money. Distilled water does more harm than good. Drinking distilled water for a long period will remove necessary electrolytes from your body such as sodium, potassium, chloride, and several trace elements that are absolutely necessary for your health. These deficiencies can cause irregular heartbeat and high blood pressure. So what if it contains electrolytes. The average person is not doing very strenuous activities that requires them to drinks with added electrolytes because he/she is profusely sweating out electrolytes  onto skin. Water has naturally occurring electrolytes. Also, fruits and vegetable are good sources of electrolytes.
Some of the chocolate pieces had a crystalization on the sides or bottoms.  YOu can eat around that, but still dissapointing a bit.

I was very worried how this would arrive, whether the chocolate would be broken or all over the place.  This box includes a few trays that serve as crates for the mini bottles. The crates are slid into the box as if it were a shelf.  It was like the equivalent of an egg in an egg carton.  When I opened it, the bottom tray had its chocolates fallen out. The other trays had their chocolate secured. Needless to say I freaked out a little bit and inspected all of the bottles.  The chocolate is thick and did not break...for any of them! The presentation of each bottle is very cute and not cheap looking at all.  The packaging came in a 1st class, prefect fit, package.

Received item relatively quickly with good packaging. One thing stood out, on the back of the package by the barcode it reads "Costco".  The seller has put "his own" barcode with scotch tape.  This strikes me as odd, I guess this item was purchased at Costco and is being resold my the seller .... Weird and odd, just be honest.

when i opened up the shipping container, i saw that the box of chocolates had been opened, and the bottom row was all messed up. all the chocolates were accounted for, but i dont like to buy food that has been opened. i suspect these may be counterfeit but i really dont know.........

so I purchased this box for my fiance' and I, but make sure you know which ones you're getting.

I was trying to get the Jack Daniels ones specifically but this box doesn't come with them anymore.

Other than that, they are tasty and fun for parties or decorations.

This is a combination of Milk Chocolate Bottles filled with some of the finer Spirits and Liquors.  For those who are addicted to chocolate as I am and like fine booze, these are great.  My wife loves them.  However, if you are an alcoholic you should stay far away from these due to the alcohol in them.  Seriously.
I received these super late! And when I opened them, they chocolates were all smashed and dry. I was really disappointed.
These were very good. Could differentiate the taste from one another. The chocolate flavor was very good and the variety just can't be beat.

We gave these to my husband's family members for Christmas. They were a big hit! It is good quality chocolate and a nice variety of liquors. I ordered them for my husband for Valentines Day as he only got to try three during the Christmas gathering and raved about them. My mother in law is still commenting on how fun it is to share with her friends..there's plenty here..enough to share!

Summary: If you like certain flavored liquors and "dark" chocolate...
Text:
Anthon Berg Chocolate Liquor Bottles 64CT Box is good for those who like certain flavored liquor and DARK chocolate. I prefer milk chocolate over dark. But still enjoyed these treats. There is real liquid filled liquor inside which is very runny so do not bite in half unless you plan to wear some of the liquor.

The following are the 8 "spirits/liquors" included in package:
1) Malibu Caribbean Rum with Coconut
2) Remy Martin Fine Champagne Conac V*S*O*P
3) Danzka Cranberyraz Vodka of Denmark
4) Spirito Italiano Galliano Vanilla
5) Grand Marnier (Triple Orange)
6) Borghetti Di Vero Caffe' Espresso
7) Sauza Tequila Gold
8) Cutty Sark Scots Whisky

I had hoped for Kahlua as I once had with Anthon Berg Chocolate Liquor before. But there was no list to go by this time, nor did I realize it was dark chocolate.

But like it or not, the taste grows on you.
The Anthony Berg Chocolates were delicious! They arrived soon after I ordered, and just in time to give as present toppers, and Grown-up Stocking Stuffers. I will definately order them again. :)
My father-in-law is very happy with his Christmas gift. Will be purchasing again next year too. Package also came to me, much faster than I had expected, and package was in untouched shape! :)
This is the best jasmine tea in a bag that I've ever had.  The flavor lasts through a second cup too!  It also taste good with milk and sugar.
delicious tea, a good deal. literally every silk packet has two tea leaves and a flower bud!

I know this is a gross title for a review, but it's true. You can tell a lot about the quality of dog food and its ingredients by the consistency and quantity of dog poop.  I've tried a lot of high-end dog foods before finally settling on Innova EVO. The ingredients and the nutritional composition were exactly what I was looking for, and my Bichon Frise and Havanese absolutely love this food.  And I can tell they're absorbing the nutrients from this food because their poops are smaller, firm (but not hard), and regular.

Okay, let me be one to say my "kids" love this food. I have three longcoat Chihuahuas who are very finicky. One would eat something I got and the others wouldn't and, this has been going on for a couple of years now. My oldest, a male was the worst and even he eats it. This is the first food I've gotten that they all like and eat regularly which, cuts back on my preparing wet foods for them. I am so happy with the product and will continue to buy this brand of foods. I've done lots of research and this has most of what I'm looking for, no by-products, grains, and chemicals I've never heard of or would want to eat myself, much less feed to my loved ones. The cost in comparison to the store brands is a bit more BUT, I save in not having to make larger qty meals from fresh, organic foods myself and...they are worth it. I can already see a change in their coats and stamina over about 4-6weeks. Happy Customer.

Summary: My dog likes it, so do I.
Text: My dog took to it very well.  Given the ingredients, it appears to be an extremely high quality food, far superior to any other brand I've tried. A no grain diet seems to be appropriate for dogs, in my opinion.
My rescued Chihuahua had been through 4 differnet kinds of dog food before we tried Innova EVO. He absolutely loves it.

Summary: My dog is crazy for Evo!
Text: My vet recommended Evo. I ordered it even though it seemed it bit pricey. It came quickly. My dog loves it. From the moment it came out of the box, he went nuts just smelling the bag. Honestly -- I am not exaggerating one bit. He used to walk away bored when I put his dish down with the previous brand he ate, come back later, and then eat it. Well no more -- he's like a different dog at mealtime. Happy and satisfied. Enough said!

My Maltese loves the small bite kibble and flavor. This food has very high protein levels. Make sure your pet is in good overall condition, as this food could raise liver enzymes because of the high protein content.

Summary: Protein content too high... gave my dog acute renal failure.  RIP Ollie
Text:
About 3 months ago I researched all the different foods and finally decided to purchase EVO because I thought it was what was best for my dog. He is 3 1/2 and healthy (or at least he WAS until recently). He has routine physicals including bloodwork for kidney problems so I didn't worry when I read that this food can cause problems with underlying kidney disease. One day he began having diarrhea and refused to eat... I thought, no big deal dogs get tummy upsets once in awhile, right? But he didnt get better. His Belly and hind legs started to swell so much that the skin looked like it would tear... multiple labs and fecals showed kidney disease of unknown cause. He has had ultrasounds, multiple blood and urine cultures, a plasma transfusion and is now on multiple medications. His BUN/CREAT has shot up and he now refuses to eat ANYTHING. His entire diet consists of water, pills and whatever vitamin paste I can force him to take. My heart is breaking for him... I can't do anything and feel helpless. If it goes on much longer without improving I will face the horrible decision of humane euthanization. I feel that it was caused 100% from the high protein diet. We can find NO other cause and he has no underlying kidney disease. Please choose a different food and save the pain that my dog and I are going through right now.
UPDATE>>> Not long after I made this review Ollie lost his battle to acute renal failure at the young age of 3. No other underlying condition was found and my vet feels that the extremely high protein content in EVO is what shut his kidneys down. RIP Ollie... :-(

Summary: Bypass recall worries........This is a quality product.
Text: My Australian Cattle Dog loves the dry and loves the canned.  This is a quality dog food with natural ingredients.  I'm not trusting supermarket dog foods anymore.  Innova is pricier than most, but well worth it.

I can honestly say that I have done my research on high quality foods for my cat and dog. Evo has the highest meat content in any dog food I've seen. My dog loves the small bites. It is very high in protein, so I do not recommend this to people who have little dogs unless they are very active. I have a 8mo old Belgian Malinois and her breed needs good quality food as she is a working dog. She did have diarreah in the beginning, but I think its because I switched it from red meat to chicken too fast. So, if you are planning to switch to Evo, just make sure you take at least 10 days to fully switch it to Evo. I am serious, I never wait that long, but with this high of protein, you really need to transition this food slowly. Otherwise, your dog will have a rumbling tummy and possibly poopy accidents in your house.

The wet food is amazing too. It contains quality ingredients and even smells decent. I wish more people would buy better quality food for their pets. Its such a shame to see dogs eating Kibbles and Bits or Pedigree or basically anything you buy from Walmart or Target. All those contain are fillers and by-products.

This is one of the best dog food's I have gotten yet.
My dog likes it and it is good for him.My Vet. said it is good brand also. Cost a little more,but if I eat the best why shouldn't my dog???
I have a very picky dog. I have spent lots of money on dog food and have found none that he likes. This seemed to come the closest to any food he will even try.

My "hard to please" eater has finally decided to eat her dog food and to stop begging at the table since I started giving her the new Evo small bite dog food. Plus it is rated as one of the top commercial dog foods.

I found this dog food after reading the reviews a[...].

This earned their top category - 6 stars, for Premium Dry Food. We have a very picky Pomeranian and she loves it
After years of searching for the food my dogs would like I finally found the kind of dry food I don't have to mix with real beef or chicken to make it tasted. They love it.

ProfileName: Dawndy12 "Barely Surviving The Loss of My Dau...
Text:
Procter & Gamble - A Probing Look at Corporate Ethics

Iams and Eukanuba Dog Foods
In 1999, P&G purchased the Iams Company, which included the Eukanuba dog food brand, for $2.3 billion.

Prior to the buyout, Iams was a respectable family owned and operated dog and cat food company. Iams and, Eukanuba in particular, were a cut above other mass market dog food brands, and were only available through specialty pet stores and veterinary clinics. (Note, one can't compare their original foods with the quality of our present products, as premium all natural dog food, as we know it today, did not exist in the 1990s).

Shortly after the acquisition, P&G expanded both Iams and Eukanuba to the mass market, making it widely available in supermarkets and retail stores such as Costco, K-Mart and Walmart, across the globe.

Within months of the takeover, it became very apparent that changes had been made to the formulation of the foods. There were numerous accounts of dogs and cats suddenly developing various health issues and dog food allergies -- from diarrhea to intense itching, brittle and poor quality coats, skin rashes, hot spots, and even blown coats.

The packaging remained unchanged, and no notification was given to retailers, pet owners or vets. (Note: Pet food companies are not required to list ingredient changes on dog food labels for 6 months -- a legal loophole for P&G).

After much publicity and a huge public backlash, P&G admitted to switching ingredients from rice to barley, but denied making any other formula changes. They went as far as adding a PR page to their website in an attempt to dispel what they referred to as "rumors", and insisted they were continuing to use the same quality ingredients as before!

In April 2000, P&G implemented another strategy in an attempt to further reassure the public of their "emphatic commitment to maintaining the premium quality of Iams and Eukanuba dog and cat foods" - and that - "any product changes that occured were designed to enhance the product". They convened an independent seven-member panel, known as the Iams Quality Review Board, consisting of veterinarians, breeders, research nutritionists and pet specialty store owners. The members met at the Company's Ohio plant to observe and review the manufacturing process and analyze and compare ingredients lists against product samples obtained over the past twelve months

I got the product yesterday.  The bag looked like it was opened and glued back together.  I was very hesitant to open it but my dog is running out of food...  It is just insane to believe that the original EVO packaging is so bad.  It wasn't air-sealed and the top fold looks messy.  Again, it looks like some one roll it and glue it together. (like how we would seal it at home!!)  This is the first time I got such a bad quality dog food product.  VERY disappointed.  And I do demand an explanation if the seller cares about their business!!  I will not recommend this to anyone.

ProfileName: ChibiNeko "Sooo many books, so little time!"
Summary: Not exactly what I'd expected, but still tasty
Text:
Needing a healthy snack to take to work with me one day, I picked these up. As most of the packaging was in Japanese, I just automatically assumed that these were wasabi peas because they looked just like wasabi peas usually look. I didn't really give the ingredients more than a slight glance, as I was in a hurry.

If you were wondering, these are not wasabi peas. They are, however, still very tasty & crunchy. They are lightly salted, having only 100 mg of sodium in each serving. (There are 4 servings in the bag.)

The bag doesn't look huge, but it packs quite a big amount for the size it is & it really was good. If you want a nice Japanese snack that isn't spicy, has low sodium & tastes nice, you'll like this stuff. If you're looking for something spicy, you might want to pass over this product.
Very good pasta. Orzo is hard to find in this area and this is a great way to get it.

ProfileName: Michael L. Love "free is a verb"
Text:
I have been searching for pasta the meets the exacting criteria of whole grain and low sodium, and this delicious penne qualifies for my highest recommendation. Carbohydrates can be a problem with most pasta, due to the processed white grain product that used to make them, but this pasta is made from whole wheat, a far more wholesome option. Because of this fact, it has a deep and rich flavor, which I have never found in any other kind of pasta, and unhampered by unhealthful added sodium salt.

I bought 5 bags, and filled a gallon jar, which left two bags to spare. With my nose in the jar, is smells _exactly_ like whole wheat, and you can see the bran in the noodles. When it is cooked, it looks like regular pasta. Due to the fact that it is unseparated semolina, the cooked noodles are a little brittle, but it tastes much better than the regular stuff. Don't worry, this is the real deal. This pasta is dream pasta! Congratulations to an insightful manufacturer.

Regards,
proclus
[...]
It is the closest thing I have found to what I used to buy in Denmark. The price is quite reasonable. I will certainly order again.

Summary: Great tasting (vegan) cookies...not just for kids!
Text: These cookies are just delicious...PERIOD.  They just so happen to be organic. And they just so happen to be vegan. And I don't have any kids...these cookies are for ME!!! I cook vegan food and was looking for some cookies for banana pudding. Haven't gotten around to making the pudding yet and the cookies are almost gone! Thank goodness for subscribe and save!

I know these are meant for little kids, but I'm an adult and I seriously love these cookies. They're crunchy but not -too- crunchy, and they're not crunchy in a really dry way if that even makes sense. They're sweet but not -too- sweet. They're just fantastic!

Note this is not a rating for the item. If I wasn't mad as h*ll, I would have thought this was some kind of bad joke.  The seller (diapers.com) advertized the item as a pack of six. I ordered two packs and the seller sent just two boxes (which i could have purchased in a grocery store for a lot less).  The product description was probably an error, unless it was an intentional misrepresentation.  Please do your DD before you order.

I try to limit processed sugary foods in our diet, however these are my favorite treat to give my son.  They are fairly low in sugar and he likes to ask the letters on them.  These are the only food item I have purchased in the baby isle at the grocery store... I think they are fresher from Amazon... and cheaper too!
My little one really loves these crackers!  They are lightweight, delicious, and the perfect size for little hands.  My preschooler also loves looking at the letters imprinted on them.
My daughter loves them.  I think I eat them more than she does though, especially since this was a pack of 6 boxes :)

My son loves these cookies & I love that we can learn letters during snack time.  He really gets into looking through the box for a certain letter, asking about things that start with that letter etc.  Some whole grain would be nice that is the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars.
My son loves these cookies and they go perfect with applesauce for a snack. I use Amazon's subscribe and save (it's awesome) to get the best price.

We LOVE these cookies!  We take them for snacks at my son's preschool, and they love them because it's makes for a fun letters exercise.  They taste great, and make me feel better about offering cookies after a meal, since they are made with wheat flour.  A great choice for your little snacker!
My kids love these cookies.  They love the taste and the fact that it has letters on them!
And they are good for you. Even Mum likse to eat them ;) Pity they are now discontinued by Amazon!
This is by far one of my daughters favorite snacks!  I've tried them and they are actually pretty good.  They are healthier than other options so I allow her to have them in moderation.
This is a tasty,satisfying and healthful snack.I love these as a fast snack. They taste great and are super healthy!
My children love these cookies.  I love that they are organic and I can trust the ingredients.  I got a killer deal on them and have already gone through half of my stock. :)

These have raisins and oats and wholesome ingredients, not sugar (cane juice), for a subtlety of sweetness. It's hard to describe, but they are just delicious. (I can't help but help my toddler eat them). So much better than sugary cookies from the snack aisle.
I bought these at the supermarket for my son but I love them more than he does at the moment. I just ordered the 6 pack. So much more cheaper on amazon than the grocery store.

Summary: Did not really take a liking to them
Text: We bought the pack of 6 almost six months ago for our baby boy and we had to give most of them away; he (surprisingly) did not really take a liking to them. It was rather unfortunate.
