I discovered coconut M&M's in a prepackaged trailmix and have not been able to find them in the grocery stores.  I found on Amazon.  Well, M&M's may not melt in your hands, but they do melt in your mailbox when it's 96 degrees outside! I refrigerated them and I'm eating them in chunks now.  Still very good!

My dog loves bully sticks, so I decided to try this brand. He loved this one as well, however, he's an inside dog and the smell from these bully sticks is awfully strong and pungent. I don't want to let him chew on it outside, as the stick will definitely get dirty after he's chewed on it for awhile. In fairness, I'll let him finish this pack of sticks and see if I can adjust to the smell. Other than that, he seems to love this product as well and you can't beat the price. I've paid $7.49 for just one from Petco, but it was a different brand and didn't stink.
If you can get past the smell, then I'd recommend this product.

Item arrived today, unbelieveably fast delivery! Was very impressed with packaging. Each bully stick is indivdually wrapped with product info on tag. When I ordered them, the description did not specify what country they were made in so I was concerned because I absolutely refuse to feed my dogs anything made in China. The price however was so awesone, I decided to give them a try. Was very pleased to find they are made in Brazil. My dogs were going crazy for them before I could even get the wrapping off. As far as one reviewer stating the odor was strong, that is another reason I DID order them because the dogs LIKE the smelley things better where they will not touch products I have purchased in the past that were odor free. To me, the odor was not an issue. It was no stronger then the ones I have seeked out in local retail stores by sniffing each one before purchasing with the hopes my dogs would chew on them. I am enrolled in autoship and as long as the quality continues I will continue to purchase this product on a preselected schedule.

2/17/2011 Update: Just received my autoship delivery today. Dogs love them just as much now as when we first ordered. Actually have doubled my autoship order because my mom's Weimer loves them too! Still highly recommend.

My 3 month old Blue Heeler loves these!

But when I was looking at the ingredients I found out it is made of Bull Testicles. The kind of smell horrible as well but as long as the dog loves it right? These keep her entertained for at least 15 minutes, which is a long time for her!

Love them, hate the smell haha.

Summary: Dogs Like Them But Misleading Picture:  Only 5 Pieces per Purchase
Text:
The description of this product reads "Ferrera Farms 12-Inch Regular Bully Stick, Cigar Banded, 5-Count", followed by another picture insert that reads "5 Pack". All this is accompanied by a picture of a box full of bully sticks. Call me stupid, but I read the description(s), looked at the picture and thought that I would be getting 5x5 (25 pieces) for my purchase, which seemed like a great deal. Unfortunately, when the product arrived there were only 5 pieces in total.

On the upside, my 3 dogs did really seem to enjoy the sticks. Unfortunately, they went through their respective bully sticks in about 15 minutes each. This works out to a cost of 40 cents/minute. Not such a great deal!

My American Bulldog puppy absolutely loved these bully sticks!  They are individually wrapped & very high quality.  One or two of the sticks did have a very strong smell but my dog seemed even more attracted to them since they smelled so strong.  The odor didn't really bother me like it did some of the other reviewers.  I was thrilled that my dog had something constructive to chew on & I will definitely buy these again!

Love, love these Bully Sticks. They have an oder about them, but both my dogs love them.  Its amazing how clean their teeth are after they use these sticks. One a week does the trick. We have a 13 pound Pom and a 4 pound chihuahua. Thank you for this product. Being natural makes me feel good about buying this product. Thank you again.

I just received them today and my little weimaraner pup just LOVES the one she has now.  Yes.....they do smell, but I am glad they do.  I really would be skeptical purchasing an "odor free" bull penis, after all.  My dog seems to really love the aroma.  I don't always sit next to her during a chew-fest though ! Great item, nicely wrapped in individual packages and quick shipping.

Summary: Dogs Love them, but not in my living room....
Text:
Let me start by saying, our dogs LOVE these! The sticks were in their Christmas stockings, and even our older dog, who doesn't like to chew on anything (even food), LOVES these!!! It kept our 4 month old puppy busy for hours Christmas morning while the kids were able to peacefully open their gifts! That said, they smell. The sticks have been in our house for 3 days now, and although it doesn't bother me too much, the rest of the family has decided these sticks will stay in the basement, where the dogs play when we are not home. They are no longer allowed in our living room.

The price is great, the sticks look like they'll last our 14 & 20 pound dogs a week or two each, and the dogs surely do love them.

I like the price, the packaging, and the product. I hate the smell! I dont hate the smell to not buy again though, because if you give your dog bully's, then you have to deal with the stink of them. (these dont stink any worse than others i have tried)

Summary: Tossing chili powder into vegetable soup doesn't make it chili.
Text:
I work at home, don't want to take the time to cook and don't care if my lunch leaves me glowing in the dark.

That side, I still want something tasty and satisfying for lunch.

I tried this new Progresso flavor and, overall, I am disappointed. Progresso soups are among my favorites, especially when I eat later in the day.

Usually Progresso soups are very good. Their chicken noodle is a perennial favorite of mine.

Three Bean Chili with Beef misses on a couple of points.

As a vegetable soup, it is fine. Lots of beans correctly cooked. The meat is plentiful and consists of tender little chunks. The broth, however, is thinner than I would like, but not every Progresso soup can be a stew in a can, no matter how much I wish otherwise.

What really comes up short in this one is the attempt to turn a good vegetable soup into chili. All Progresso did was dump a lot - too much, in fact - chili powder into the kettle.

No thanks, though if your tolerance and liking for chili powder is higher than mine, you might like it.

Jerry

I really enjoy this soup/meal, it's hardy, low calorie and filling. I add a few drops of Tobasco to heat things up and nothing else. It is the type of food that tricks you into thinking you are eating something bad but really, you're not. Can't ask for more than that. Also, pay attention to the fact that one can is two servings. 280 calories per can, still not to shabby!

Summary: If you doctor it up it's okay...
Text: As people have pointed out, this is really more soup than it is chili. I've always considered Chili to be more like stew. Essentially, thick. This is very much watery. You can compensate for this by adding a bit of corn starch before you heat it up however. But... at the end of the day, you should not have to doctor up ready-to-eat soup to make it more like you like. Flavorwise, it has a rather strong chili flavor. To me, this is a good thing. I love chili. However, if you're not too much into it, this will be a bad product for you. This soup is nice if you want a fiber boost, but it's not really as satisfying as real chili.

I paid about $20.00 for this Item (a case of 12/18oz cans), and I'm not dissapointed. If you know Progresso Soups, (it's not Campbells) it's more natural tasting, like you made it from scratch. This tastes like a beaf and bean soup more than Chile; but it's very good and satasfying.  You'ld pay about three times as much in a grocery store, easy.
Kidney beans, mystery meat and chili powder in too much water. Really, what kind of meat is this, i can't place the texture.

Summary: Progresso Must Have Cornered the Market on Chili Powder...
Text:
Progresso has always made some of my favorite soups. Their numerous choices have provided a needed variety in my often soup-centric meals. Some of their soups have a light broth, some are thicker, and some verge on being very stew-like. However, lately I've noticed a marked tendency toward watering down their previously thicker soups such as Lentil and Beef Pot Roast. Their Three-Bean Chili with Beef was created in this vein and the tomato-flavored broth is thin and watery. In order to compensate, Progresso seems to have decided to overuse chili powder in any soup which has been tagged as Mexican or Southwestern in origin. Thus, the sole flavor one was able to taste in this particular soup was chili powder.

On the positive side, the beans are plentiful and well-cooked. The beef was not fatty or grittle-laden, although it was not plentiful in the can I cooked. There were a number of small tomato pieces and a bit of what appeared to be jalapeno peppers. It would have been wonderful if these flavors had been melded into a more balanced tasting soup.

It is because of Progresso's current overuse of chili powder - perhaps to mask the inadequacies in their newer soups - that I have rated this soup as a three-star product.

I've gotten to be afraid to buy sunflower seeds in stores; so often they are rancid, and people don't even seem to know the difference. These are fresh and sweet, reasonably priced, and arrived so quickly I couldn't even think what this package would be. Excellent vendor, I will use again.Sunflower Seeds - 5 Lb Bag / Box Each
Arrived well, easy to make, very flavorful.  If a little more kick is needed just add hot chili peppers or Tabasco. Very nice on chilly days.... recommend other Leonard Mountain brands too.

My wife and I love this stuff. Dice some chicken breast and toss it in for an easy meal, or it makes a great starter base for adding some masa and various veggies. (I like thick soups.)

My only negative (if you can call it that) is that the flavors are very good but somewhat subtle. I usually spice it up a bit with some hot cause.
I have started using this as a base for enchiladas (just add tortillas and chicken) and the kids and I love it. As a soup, well, we made it into a dip because it is a little thick for my taste.

first of all, you must accept this product for what it is. It is not fresh. It contains dried vegetables which have to be reconstituted.as you eat the product, you are aware that it is reconstituted product, similar, I suspect, to things like the MRE or camping rations.

Once you have come to terms what the product is, the taste is pretty good and it is a fairly good value for the money. It takes about 25 to 30 minutes to prepare, and the package in the extremely small print of the directions suggests adults writing the product with chicken or canned tomatoes or other things of a customer's choice. I think some chicken would be appropriate, although I don't see that adding canned tomatoes would improve things very much.

Again I emphasize, recognize what you are eating. This is not an enchilada plate. This is dried product that must be reconstituted. But it doesn't taste bad.

$73 for a tin of Earl Grey, even if it's Ahmad (my favorite)? I buy excellent loose Ahmad tea for around $8.00, so pray tell me what justifies this price? (And I've smelled - not drunk - rare Chinese tea that was going for $1000/100 grams). I await enlightenment.
I received my order promptly and it was just as described.  Will definitely order again.

I bought a set on amazon. One pen worked (barely) and the other didn't work at all. They sent me a replacement that works a little better. I've found that storing them upside down definitely helps. First few uses gave a very fine writing but after a few uses, the tip kind of softens and I've been getting much thicker writing, with little or no pressure at all. Still the best food markers I've used as of yet.

After buying similar food markers from local stores to decorate cake pops (wasted $$ - I ended up piping black frosting to decorate), I was wary buying these. Since my initial purchase, I have since bought the multi-color set twice and these even more times than that! They really work!

These markers decorate batches of cake pops without stopping. The other ones ... I could maybe finish two individual pops before the markers clogged up. I use three different brands of candy melts and have never had problems with any. A homeschool co-op class borrowed a set to decorate marshmallow Lego pops for a special treat, and they worked well for me after 15, 5-8 year olds used them (and not carefully - like any kid colors). Well worth the money!

when i thought of making the "stargazer lily/tiger lily flower", i looked for a good black food decorating pen to make the dots on the petals.

these Americolor Black Food Writer marker set was a very good choice, easy to use,good price and easy to see . highly recommended if anyone

wants to make this beautiful flower .
I've tried the other famous brands but only works up to the 3rd cakepops. I try the Americolor, it's the best that I ever used. It still works for 3-batch of the cakepops.

These are the first food markers that I have purchased, but they work exactly like you would expect. The tip was defined enough for me to easily write numbers and provide a nice deep black color. I was using it to make tick marks on a fondant tape measure for a sewing themed cake. While this was the simplest component of the cake it easily provided for the biggest "wow" factor with people. I would highly recommend these to people getting stated in cake/cookie decorating as it opens up lots of new possibilities.
I love, love, love these. I got them as a gift years ago. I find them as an invaluable tool when I decorate cakes with fondant and custom cookies.
These markers did exactly what I expected them to do.  They work greatly better than the food markers that I bought from Michael's craft store.
I was writing on candy and it tended to run out every so often. I kept having to switch pens.

Summary: Awesome mustard with a cheesy taste
Text:
I am a big fan of Stonewall products and this one is one of my favorites. They start with a very mild herb flavored Dijon, which is great on it's own, but when small chunks of real blue cheese are added it takes it to a whole new level.

On of the first things that I put in on was a Kobe beef hamburger along with crisp dill pickle slices and bit of freshly snipped tarragon. Wow! I would be willing to pay $15 for a burger this good at a restaurant. The next thing that I put in on was a natural casing Polish sausage and it was wonderful. I have now used in on lamb chops, roasted chicken, sliced tomatoes and more. I tried making my own but for some reason it just wasn't as good. Once the jar is opened it lasts for months in the fridge. This has become a staple in my kitchen.

product arrived timely.  Price was a little high.  Do not know quality since this was a gift to someone else.

Summary: No substitute for a healthy diet, but the kids love it
Text: We all know by now that eating a balanced diet leads to a over all better quality of living. Will this product be the end all fix for tricking your kids to get the proper amount of veggies a day. No way, but that doesn't make it a bad product, just not a miracle in a pouch. Each pouch is one combined serving of fruit and vegetable. That doesn't mean one serving of veggies and than one fruit but only one serving made up of both. The taste isn't bad at all. My kids inhale them as soon as I ration out their daily allowance. I noticed the amount of sugar in these and only allow one a day. My kids would love to drink these all day long if allowed. They pass the kid taste test approval. I subtracted the 5th star and only give a 4 because of the amount of sugar to volume, and that the juice is not 100% juice. I would love to see a Super-V drink with 100% juice and not the 66% it currently has. The Berry is the best tasting one in my opinion, but since we also buy apple, and fruit punch Super-V I notice they all go just as fast when offered to the kids.

We do love our coffee. Generally, we buy Alterra Cafe Voltaire, but the price is getting pretty high. And, with funds more limited than they used to be, I thought we'd try Coffee Bean Direct. We'd save $20 on the same amount of beans.

The first time I ground this blend and put it in the coffee maker, the aroma of the fresh beans did it for me. I knew I had a hit. And, the coffee has been just the way we like it. Not too bitter, not too dark, but still robust and rich. We add a touch of chicory sometimes to the top of the grounds, and ... yummmm.

We'll buy this again, and likely try one or two of the other varieties.

Summary: We are on auto-ship for a reason..
Text:
My husband makes lattes for the two of us each and every morning. We have a VERY fancy, expensive espresso machine which we got for free by using points from our credit card. (Points are SO worth it..)
The sound of the milk frothing and the beans grinding keeps me sane every time I have to get out of bed way too early. We have run the gamete of bean exploration, and have settled on this medium roast because it is just right for both of us. Not too dark, very smooth, good crema, consistent espresso expressed cup after cup. ..And, the price is very reasonable. Highly recommended.

Like I said, I'm not a coffee connoisseur but I do enjoy a good latte with friends and family. Starbucks recently raised the price of their coffee and I decided that my Delonghi espresso machine could use other brands of coffee just fine, thank you. After looking around and reading reviews, I found nothing negative worth noting about CBD. The beans smelled wonderful when I opened up the bag and the results are every bit as satisfying as Starbucks for a bit more than half the price. Since I go through more than a pound a month, I just grind what I need for the next couple of days.

So far nobody has noticed the difference which tells me I made the right choice.
A pleasant espresso bean and a good price for a great value. I will buy again.

I like "Vernor's", and drink it all the time. It is old fashioned drink from Michigan, since 1866, and the labeling was known for its lovely green and gold colors and the gnome character. If you look at the can it is actually called ginger soda instead of ale and is different than typical ginger ale in taste. Vernors has a strong vanilla presence, is smoother and more moist, and sweeter than a ginger ale. It is closer to a cream soda than ginger ale, very good. A ginger ale is more dry, higher in carbonation, and has a spicier bite to it. Vernors has 39 grams sugar per can, versus 33 grams per can for Schweppes Ginger Ale. Neither has caffeine.

The recipe has changed a bit over the years mostly in the choice of sweeteners. They use the same high fructose corn syrup that the cost-cutting mega soda companies use, rather than the cane sugar they used to use. The down side to that is that the corn syrup syrup drowns out some of the flavors. Many microbrews are using cane sugar again, although it costs more, to get a better taste. Vernor's is still aged in oak barrels for 3 years, no doubt accounting for the smoothness. All in all a great soda for anytime. The soda is also known, like other ginger drinks, for its use as a home remedy for an upset stomach.
Vernor's is a regional soda, and there are many areas of the country you can't find it in. That is why it sells here. They may be selling it in glass bottles again soon, at least there is a page that says so the day I am writing this comment. Search at Amazon for ASIN: B001JK2SEG to see what I mean. Vernors has quite a history, and there are two books at Amazon about the soda. The first is Vernor's Ginger Ale (Images of America: Michigan) ISBN-10: 0738551856. The second book is "The Vernor's Story: From Gnomes to Now" ISBN-10: 0472066978 a book about the company's marketing green and gold packaging with the famous gnome, and Vernor's fans.

I have 2 female ragdoll cats. They both have that peculiar habit some cats have of not wanting to eat the crumbs they leave after nibbling on larger pieces of cat food. And they don't leave them on their tray, but on the floor and nearby rug. Grrrr. So I went searching for an adult food with tiny pieces. This one fits the bill! They love it! They have healthier coats after only 2 months! They are much more playful (if you can call a ragdoll playful)! It's cheaper on Amazon than at most pet stores, and ships free with Amazon Prime! Nuff said!!!

My 9 year old now indoor cat has a bit of a weight problem since he no longer goes outside. We have tried a number of the "weight management" foods, but he was still not losing weight (actually gaining), even when only feeding 3/4 cup. I tried dropping him to 1/2 a cup a day and he was starving all the time. I caught him trying to eat a cough drop that was on the night stand! I switched him to this a month ago and he loves it. It is considerably lower in calories/cup than a lot of the "weight management" foods, so I found I could give him a reasonable quantity (3/4 cup) and save a bunch of calories. This seems to be the recipe for success! He transitioned over to it without any hesitation, i never even mixed it with the previous food, he just ate this right up. Coat looks amazing, he is playful and happy... so am I.

My cat is a senior cat and she eats just about everything we have given her.  We got her at the humane society and her previous owners fed her fleet farm food.  We figured we would feed her something a little better for her and decided to try the blue buffalo.  We mixed it with what the humane society gave her to ease her into it, but after every meal there would be the blue buffalo chunks left over.  She strategically ate around them and spit some out of the dish.  I am not sure why she doesnt like it, maybe the chunks are too hard because there are some half eaten pieces. Whatever it is not working.  I dont really blame the product because like people, cats have their preferences and blue buffalo did not cut it.  My only suggestion is do not buy the big bag to first try it out.
I have a cat who is allegic to several commonly found products in most cat food.  This food is great for all of my cats, especially this problem feeder.

I bought this food due to the high quality food content, but the pellets were so hard my 16 year old cat would not touch them.  I gave the food to a friend with younger cats, thinking strong teeth would be better suited to this item--but they had no interest in the food either.  They actually removed it from the bowl and ate only their regular food, which was mixed in to make the transfer to a new food easier. I finally ended up putting it outside for the neighborhood feral cat.  He ate it.  But then, I suspect he is starving.  (I live in a very rural area where no shelters exist or I would make an effort to help him; as it is, I just feed him.) Maybe another of the Blue Buffalo products would work, but I opted for Purina One Beyond for my cat which is available at my local stores, costs considerably less, also contains nutritious food and was an instant hit here with my old kitty.  My cat does have a sensitive stomach, and the Purina caused no stomach distress.  I cannot attest to the Blue Buffalo on that count as she would not eat it at all.

Summary: It gave me my childhood friend back
Text:
I have a 14 year old cat and we were feeding her Iams, Purina... one of those big name cat food brands. However, when we moved to a new location we came across this brand and I instantly fell in love. All you really need to do it read the ingredients in the back. Practically, everything that you would see a cat eat in the wild is in the food. There is real meat and fish in there, blueberries, cranberries and vegetables as well. I noticed a HUGE change in my cat. She used to be real lethargic, always laying around sleeping, taking a few practice jumps before jumping up on the couch. Not to mention she had very bad dandruff. She's a tortoise shell and you could clearly see the dandruff without being right on top of her. Once I switched to Blue Buffalo, she got a little pep in her step. Now I find her running around the house like a bat out of hell and neither of my other two cats know what the heck is going on. Her coat is also nice, shiny and dandruff free. I never knew how much of a difference the change in food could be for her. Now she jumps up on the couch and bed (which is higher up) with ease and is even initiating play with my other two cats. I hate to sound mushy but considering that changing food was the only thing we did different with her, Blue Buffalo gave me my childhood friend back.

It may be more expensive than your average cat food but it is well worth it in the end. I do mix longevity with Blue Buffalo Wilderness Grain Free Dry Cat Food, Chicken Recipe, 12-Pound Bag and have had no problem with her not eating it. All three of my cats gobble up the food in their bowls as if they were rottweilers.

*I recently had to switch to a low protein diet due to my eldest developing kidney disease. Within a month of switching foods she reverted back to having horrible dandruff. Aside from switching away from Blue Buffalo nothing in her diet/environment has changed. So this food really does help with dandruff.

It's been a long struggle for us to find cat food that our three cats both like and is good for them. This is it in terms of dry food. They liked it immediately and continue to like it. This food is available to our cats all the time and they seem to eat it mostly at night. All of our cats have lost weight on it and seem to like it well enough that we can give it to them as treats at times. We also give them canned food and make sure their water is always fresh so that they get enough moisture; dry food doesn't seem to provide adequate moisture for cats.

My one objection is that chicken fat is one of the ingredients of this food; one of our cats has a serious allergy to chicken, which is why we were searching for so long for a cat food. However, he would not any of the other foods we found without any chicken. I will need to check with my veterinarian to see if this is going to cause problems in the long-run.

Summary: Perfect drink on a warm day!
Text: I was very skeptical about buying this as I have never been a fan of any tea. I decided to give this a shot as I was looking for some new k-cups for my maker and for a new drink as I was getting tired for my packets of flavor added to water. After reading several review I made the purchase. I am very glad that I did! I make this over ice but have learned by trial and error to find the perfect combination of a 16 oz double walled cut filled to the brim with ice. From there I make it on the middle setting. Some people say you can use the pod twice for tea but I only like to use it once and I like the full flavor.  This is a great drink with a good amount of flavor and taste even if you ate not a tea drinker, it is not too sweet either which I like as well.

Summary: Hands Down the Best Bold Coffee T-Disc Available
Text:
I drink strong black coffee. After sampling all the bold brew T-Discs available, and prior to the release of Starbuck's Africa Kitamu, I was a faithful user of their Verona discs. That all changed with my first sip of the Africa Kitamu coffee. The strength is decidedly bold but not bitter. The best description may be that it is very smooth. It is absolutely delicious, and Africa is now my first choice and new favorite.

The coffee is also a wise choice for those who like a lighter brew. Simply use the manual override procedure on the Tassimo coffee maker to add extra water to taste. In the process, an even larger cup of coffee is created.

With each new release, Starbucks's has added significant quality to the T-Disc line and is quickly making my Tassimo indispensable.

Summary: My NEW first cup of the day
Text: I was skeptical when I ordered this the very first time. I like a bold coffee for my first cup of the day and my old favorite, Verona, was terrific. I just hoped I would like the Kitamu enough that I wouldn't have to throw it away. I was hooked from the first sip. The Kitamu is much bolder than the Verona and has a great aroma, and the flavor of the roast really comes through. If you favor breakfast blends and other mild coffees, pass on this one. If you're a fan of Verona and have not tried the Kitamu, give it a spin. You might find a new first cup, too.

This is one of my favorite coffees.  I love my Bosch Tassimo single-serve coffee maker, especially when I make Starbucks coffees.  The Starbucks Africa Kitamu Coffee is a bold, smooth coffee, great with a big dose of half-and-half.  As good as what you'd get at Starbucks.  Love it.

This coffee is fantastic, no doubt. The reason the price is now sky high is that Starbucks has discontinued its T-disc line and is moving over to Keurig. The new sellers have hoarded the discontinued T-discs and are ransoming it off.  If anyone knows an equivalent to this amazing Starbucks coffee, please post here on Amazon so we can continue to get great coffee for the Tassimo machines. Maxwell House isn't doing it for me, frankly.

This is the absolute finest coffee that Tassimo has to offer!  If I had known that the relationship between Tassimo and Starbucks was coming to an end, I would not have purchased their coffee maker.  This coffee offers an intricate depth of dark roasted coffee with none of the bitterness.

Ordered this in place of Cafe Verona-  O.K. but disappointed can't get any Starbucks T-discs anymore especially Cafe Verona. Really unhappy with Tassimo for not contracting with Starbucks anymore. Now only have inferior products to use for my Tassimo coffee machine! --

The Africa Kitamu bold coffee is delicious.  I don't usually drink black coffee, but after I brewed the Kitamu and took a sip, I only added a little sugar.  The coffee has a wonderful floral aroma and taste, and it's smooth without any bitterness.  Verona used to be my favorite bold coffee, but Kitamu quickly replaced it.  It's a coffee that's great in the morning with breakfast or after dinner with dessert. I could drink it all day long.  It's really that good.  Anyone who enjoys Starbucks bold coffee will more than likely be extremely pleased with Kitamu.  Definitely worth a try.

I agree with Allen's comments below. This coffee is excellent but the price has been more than doubled by this new seller. Amazon used to offer it for $21 which is what you can get it for in any store like "Bed, Bath and Beyond" etc.

I have purchased this item 2 or 3 times from Amazon, and the quality of the coffee is very good. The price I normally paid was about $21 . Now its being sold by this new seller "Deals on Call" for $53.95 !!! and for the exact same product.

I would advise anyone thinking of purchasing this product to wait until Amazon has it again, or buy it somewhere else. This price is completely out of touch with reality, and is obviously trying to take advantage of unsuspecting buyers.

Normally I make coffee with a Capresso coffee maker and use the Tassimo for fun coffee drinks only. But this one is my choice when I need to make a quick cup for the road in the mornings and don't want to make a bigger batch in the Capresso.
Flavorful and adequate strength without bitterness. Pity we won't have it much longer with the Starbucks deal expired. But I will stock up so I can enjoy it for a few more months,

I like this Africa Kitamu Coffee even better then the Verona. It is nice and bold and not too bitter. Give it a try I don't think you will be disappointed. My second favorite now is Verona it use to be my first.
This went from $21 to $56?  What gives?  I'd give this a great review as it is a wonderful brew, but this new price is ridiculous.

My Tassimo has turned me into a coffee drinker for the first time in my life, mostly just because of the convenience in making once cup at a time. Starbucks Africa Kitamu has turned me into a coffee drinker for the taste!! WOW!! I have always been of the opinion that coffee is coffee and snickered at the mocha soy double latte no caf low fat grande type of people. =0) I was a bit nervous to order a 'bold' blend but thought 'what the heck?!' and went for it. I don't know coffee words but there is no after-taste and I don't find myself with a sour belly immediately after my cup is finished. Kudos to Starbucks...you've made me a convert!

Kitamu is an excellent bold blend, not for the moderate palate. After I went through SIX Keurig-engined single-cuppers (4 Keurig, 2 Cuisinart), I was kind of bummed about going to the Tassimo--until I found the Starbucks (who has wisely shunned the mechanically flawed Keurig engine). The Kitamu is ideal for an extra-shot Americano drinker.
This is the best coffee I have ever had at home. It really is heaven in a cup. I am not a morning person but knowing this is in my kitchen I will be jumping out of bed now. Nice smooth bold taste.
This coffee is one of the free packages I ordered when I registered my Tassimo coffee maker. It is delicious! I was enjoying Starbucks cafe verona but this has a richer flavor - robust but smooth.
Can't find this blend anywhere local...extremely flavorful!  I really enjoyed it!  The item was received promptly and in great condition!  Will be ordering more soon!

Summary: Kitamu is currently the best tasting T-disk on the market
Text:
If you like stronger coffee, you need to try this - the best T-disk I've sampled (and I've tried a very wide variety). It is also one of the more expensive choices. For those like me who count pennies, the best Amazon deal is usually sold in 2 packs of 12 = 24 T-disks, thus about 90 cents per cup, with free shipping. A slight bit cheaper even with tax if you can find it on the shelves at BB&B, especially with one of their coupons.

Closest I've had to a cup purchased from a Starbucks counter. Of course, I have to miss out on an engaging conversation with the neon haired, body pierced counterperson, but can't have it all.

If you want a really great tasting bargain strong cup of coffee, and if it becomes available again, try Seattle's Best Henry's Blend (c'mon SB, bring it back!!). Better bargain than Starbucks, and better than many of their selections (I still prefer the Kitamu, but variety is the spice).

Summary: I'm more of a coffee gourmand than gourmet...
Text:
but I know I like this coffee! I like strong coffees (I normally buy Peets--YUM, or some Caffe Kimbo my husband likes). I don't usually go to Starbucks for anything other than a green tea frappaccino for a treat--I don't get coffee there habitually.

I also don't personally have the Tassimo machine but one of my co-workers has the machine and likes to brew up coffee for the rest of us once in awhile. The other ones she has made were good but I do prefer a really strong cup, so I bought this coffee to try out (I bought her some of her favorite stuff too--carmel machi-something or other...more like a dessert to me).

This is nice, strong and tasty. The only commercial stuff we have in the building I work is Seattle's Best (ugh) and then stuff in vending machines...this is WAY better needless to say. I may have to get one of these machines now that I found a coffee I enjoy.

In any case, for those with the machine (or a co-worker like mine) and who like a nice strong, tasty cup of coffee, this is great.

Recommended!!

JTG
Love this coffee.  I like a bold rich coffee without acidity and this is it.  Smells heavenly in the brewbot!
If you are anything like me and like your coffee strong then this Tassimo blend is for you. I do not remember ever seeing this blend in the Starbucks shops. It is tasty. But definitely a bold.

Summary: Probably the best T-disc out there
Text: This is good, smooth, strong coffee.  If you like it bold, your going to like this one.  Not one of those cheap tasting truck stop brews.

Bold, but not bitter...can easily use the "hold for more" option if you dont like your coffee as strong. This is one of the only cups of a bolder coffee I can drink without cream/sugar in it. It's THAT good. Kudos to Starbucks and Tassimo.

I am a lover of Starbucks Sumatra Bold Coffee.  I bought my Tassimo a few weeks ago because of the affiliation with Starbucks.  I bought the Cafe Verona as that was what was sold at BB&B.  I thought the flavor was bold and bitter especially compared with my Sumatra.  I ordered the African Kitamu from Amazon and I am in love!  It has an amazing bold flavor with no after taste and can replace my Sumatra.  I bought 10 packs from Amazon.  This is my favorite bold coffee.  Please beg Starbucks to keep this in stock.

Summary: Very bold flavor with citrus undertone
Text: Very bold flavor with citrus undertones, this is a great coffee if you like a strong and flavorful cup. It ships in a box with 2 bags, so essentially it's 6 of the small boxes, so the price is pretty good.

Summary: No Need to Wait In Line at Starbucks, Anymore!
Text:
April 30th, 2011 -
I'm pissed at Amazon ... as a few days ago, I took the time to write multiple, extended Reviews on Starbuck's Coffee Products, but, they were all Rejected by Amazon, because they had a 'link' to my previous review on the Tassimo Bosch Coffeemaker (RED), 4500 Series.
My Newest (unpublished) Reviews were focused on the 'Holy Trinity' of combining certain Starbucks Coffee's + Tassimo Creamer + the Tassimo Bosch Coffeemaker, as they are all integrated as one ... since you can not speak about one, without mentioning the other two side kicks.
And I'm NOT going to re-post my long/extended reviews, just keep it short & sweet this time!

The Starbucks Cappuccino Primo, Latte Primo, Breakfast Blend & Africa Kitamu - are Absolutely Superior to any other product lines, that I have used in the past 4 months.
The amazing integration of Tassimo Coffeemakers, with Starbucks T-disc technology is the "Key", with the way the hot water (@ perfect temperature) is pushed thru the coffee so well, thereby, `extracting' the perfect coffee solution, AND, by mixing that with their Fantastic Milk T-Discs, it makes it an Absolute Dynamic Duo! This is as close as to what you will get your local Starbuck's ... while in the comfort of your PJ's!

5-Stars!

Rec'd package 4days earlier than expected. Nice, easy to open. excellent- use before date on package and price compared to other around MN area/hard to find in my area. Brewed up a cup and had good flavor to it and would recommend if interested in bold flavor coffee. tracking of package was easy to use and free shipping on three items.  definitely would tell friend about this. price is $22 for two packages not bad price don't pay any higher(not worth it)
Starbucks Africa Kitamu Coffee (Bold), 12-Count T-Discs for Tassimo Coffeemakers (Pack of 2) [Amazon Frustration-Free Packaging]

Summary: Good coffee at a bad price!
Text: As noted above, Bed Bath and Beyond's price for this same product is $10.99 making the price here ridiculously high. Khol's also sells Star Bucks t-discs for about $10-$11. ....thought you should know.
Many online retailers have this so much cheaper!  The 12pack is only $10.99 on Bed Bath and Beyond's site!  Why are they so expensive here? It makes no sense!

Summary: As Stringer Bell would say, it's a 40 degree day
Text:
The best way to describe this coffee is to use a line from the Wire - it's a 40 degree day. If you're not familiar with the series or the saying, it means that there's nothing distinctive one way or another with this coffee. No, it's not bad, but it's not memorable either. Makes just a plain, rather bland cup o' joe.

I wanted to try this brand since there aren't any Biggby's shops around me. I've heard they serve a decent cup, but their beans (at least this particular blend) are just so-so.

There was no roasted-by date on the package so I may be dealing with some stale beans.

I found them to be much more palatable when mixed with some Italian roast beans I recently bought which were a bit too intense. The Biggby's helped cut the strength and make it more enjoyable. Just alone, however, the Biggby's lacks sufficient body to stand up and be noticed. It's just the coffee equivalent of a 40 degree day.

I used to love Twizzler's licorice. Then I tried this soft liquorice from Australia. Wow, what a difference. The flavor is amazingly zestful. The liquorice is soft and chewy (unlike Twizzler's, which sometimes you have to pull apart to eat). Looking back, I can hardly believe how I lived without these in my life. I know these things have sugar and might not be great for my health, but what the heck - it's worth the price!

I love this licorice. It's soft, but not too soft. The flavor is actually tastes like real fruit! Not that raspy artificial flavoring that tastes like chemicals.

Very good stuff indeed. I would say these are like potato chips, you can't eat just...5? Hehehe.

Summary: Good, Healthy, Vegan-Friendly and lacks 'inert ingredients'.
Text:
I don't even like licorice-not until I happened to stumble upon this in my local gourment grocery store in September, 2009. I originally bought this because it was the perfect snack according to the information label for my hypoglycemia (low blood sugar) attacks that I sometimes have while stuck in traffic. Each piece is 10 grams of carbohydrates so 3 pieces is all I need to get the sugars back to where they need to be. It is extremely portable as it is not perishable and will not melt in the summer heat of your car. The packaging is plastic lined on the inside to prevent it from going stale while on the shelf.

The texture is not quite like any previous licorice that I've tasted. It is not tough and does not crumble when chewed. It is more like a very soft taffy but not as sticky. It truly is a great product and if you like fresh fruit, eating healthy, and non-fat snacks then you will love this.

Summary: It's bitter. And lemon. And I love it.
Text:
I love this lemony tonic both on its own and with gin. The cost is high, but it's a worthwhile splurge for me. It's definitely for those who like bitter notes, and it's less cloyingly sweetened than some of your standard tonic waters. I tried adding a dash of bitters to a Bitter Lemon G&T, and it was too much - I take that to mean that Fever Tree's recipe is just right. A fresh mint or basil leaf doesn't hurt, though.

I like their tonic also, but the lemon is really something special. I even asked for it for Christmas :)
Fever tree Bitter Lemon--the name says it all--is a winner.  It puts real zing in a gin and tonic above and beyond what ordinary tonic can do!
Since I haven't been able to find a recipe I like, tried Johnny'a and it is awesome!  A little pricey but worth it

Summary: Addicting, and hard to find in the US
Text: I grew up with these chocolate bars and fell in love with them. They melt in my mouth. Of course all reviews on food are biased due to taste buds. I haven't gotten the package yet. I'm merely reviewing the food itself, not the seller. I will review the seller on his page after it arrives. I only wish it was amazon prime eligible for 2 days shipping. I cannot wait. These are worth twice their weight in gold.
This is excellent Muesli.  I eat it pretty much six days a week for about a half year now.  The best Mueseli I've found so far in the US (though imported from Germany, where I grew up).

Summary: SNAPPLE-BEST STUFF ON EARTH-NOT SO... HONEST TEA IS ***
Text:
I HAVE BEEN LOOKING FOR AN ALTERNATIVE TO SODA & JUICE FOR A LONG TIME, SOMETHING THAT IS NATURAL WITHOUT HIGH FRUCTOSE SYRUP, NOT TOO SWEET WITH A GOOD, NATURAL TASTE. THIS DRINK
IS JUST THAT.
IT'S STILL A TEA AND NOT EVERYONE LIKES TEA OF ANY KIND BUT THIS PRODUCT IS REALLY GREAT.
IT IS ORGANIC WHICH IS VERY HEALTHY AND A BIT MORE EXPENSIVE (AS ARE MANY HIGHER QUALITY
PRODUCTS) BUT IT'S YOUR BODY AND THE MORE HEALTHY & NATURAL PRODUCTS YOU LEARN TO USE THE
BETTER OFF YOU WILL BE.
HIGHLY RECOMMENED *****

Could not wait til this product hit the shelves. Imagine my surprise when it tasted like muddy water. I couldn't believe it. The whole case went back to Kroger. Maybe I got a bad batch, but I'll stick with Snapple.

I read some of the health benefits from this tea and decided to try it. Using 1 tea bag in a MrCoffe making 12 cups-this stuff was sooooo bitter. I put in 2 tea spoons of honey in a 1/2 cup of tea-still very bitter. The aftertaste lasted for days and so did the slightly quezy feeling. If it did me any good I haven't a clue what it was.

Summary: Klein's Dried Cherries are the best!
Text: Wow, did we luck out.  I tried the Klein's cherries hoping they would be good and they are DELICIOUS.  So flavorful and NO SUGAR!!  Just cherries.  Love them....

I put these in my steel cut oatmeal, make a week's batch and I'm ready for the week. Of course, I have to hide the containers or someone else snacks on them! Very convenient packaging, great taste, and reasonably priced. I highly recommend them.
These would be great if they did not contain sulfur dioxode which, among other health concerns,  inhibits vitamin B1. Sticking with Eden's Organic Dried Cherries which are pricier but healthier.

I have found the "hard-to-find/next-to-impossible-to-find" dried cherries (NO SUGAR added)!
I am fully satisfied with this purchase and have just returned to Amazon to make my second purchase of Klein's Dried Cherries.

Do not like to leave reviews. Look at the stars to see my review.
So Amazon.com get over your inane rules!
What can I say they are delicious, good for you and convenient to eat while on the go or whatever. I love Klein's dried cherries.
I first had dried cherries in a salad while in Michigan. This addition to a salad certainly kicks it up a notch or two and Klein's is the best!

I ordered these to keep in my purse for a quick energy burst (I have both FMS and low blood sugar). They work for both. They keep me from being held hostage to meal schedules, especially when I travel, and allow me more flexibility and energy between meals. I highly recommend these. They are tasty and don't have added sugar.
So yummy!  They're worth the expense, though that does make them a special treat rather than a daily thing.
These are wonderful! Very tasty. Not overly sweet but by no means sour. Eaten straight and added to items for cooking. They are absolutely fabulous.

I have bought other unsweetened dried cherries over the years, and though good, they were always a little too tart to eat on their own.  These are so flavorful it's unbelievable, and not too tart.  Kids love them.  Adults too.
Well, they are dried, so they can't be fresh, but they don't have the dried bland taste that many dried fruits have. I love these, and it's the one sure way to get my kids to eat better snacks.

As with the Americolor red, red, super black works exceptionally well. Finally I can get real black for my icings and fondant without the bitter chemical taste.  Americolor gel paste colors are the only one I'd use.

Summary: Beautiful tomatoes ruined by excess of salt
Text: Hunt's has made the most beautiful, ripe, red tomatoes ever put in a can.  They then pour an entire box of salt in the can and seal it.  What a pity.  GIVE US LOW or NO SALT HUNT'S TOMATOES.

My dog loves this treat and I like it better than the Pedigree Dentastix. I'm comparing the two products to each other because they look so similar in color, size, shape. But my dog will tell you that the texture is definitely different. The Zoe appears tougher and chewier. It last minutes longer than the Dentastix per serving. My dog will sit and take his time to chew through the Zoe chew stix, which I like. Compared to the Pedigree stuff I get from my local Target which seems to disappear in his mouth and he's begging again after just a few seconds. The manufacturer's feeding directions says to feed two sticks a day. The calorie count is 90 per stick. I can't recommend that to your pet. I'm going to give this as a once a week treat, alternating with other stuff since my cocker is prone to getting fat. Unlike Dentastix, this does not indicate any dental health benefits. Still, this is made of quinoa and is gluten free, in case you care about that stuff. Cute packaging and is conveniently resealable. I would buy again and recommend to others.

UPDATE: I have bought this again since my dog loves it so much. The second package I got, I actually decided to count houw many sticks came in one bag. There are only 6 if you get the large size like I do. 6 stick for $6. They tell you to give one or two sticks a day. Nevermind the calories (90 per stick)... but one bag might not even last you a week if you follow manufacturer's directions. Kind of pricey at $1 per stick. Greenies on Amazon (regular size) are less expensive. Anyway, I still think that this is a great product and I would still buy it... but believe me, I will be buying less often and only give it to my dogs on special ocassions!

Summary: Unfortunately caused an allergy to my poochie
Text: This treat did not have good reaction with my Jack Russell terrier mix, he ate it fine and even enjoyed it, but then he suddenly became quite hyper and nervous like he was having caffeine shakes.  I definitely will not be feeding this to him again.  It is too bad also since this looked to be a great treat, I looked at the ingredient list and did some research on all the ingredients and the only one that can cause an allergy is carrageenan, which is the vegetarian equivalent of casein, used as filler.  It is a natural ingredient derived from seaweed, but is said to cause digestive problems.  Most doggie treats do not contain carrageenan so this is the only ingredient that may have caused a reaction in my dog.  I am giving the treat two stars for the effort and intention, but there really should have been more research regarding the fillers.

Summary: Variety is the spice of life
Text:
I have 2 dogs and while I don't give a lot of treats, I like to have a variety of items on hand to put in the everlasting ball, Kong etc., to keep them interested on days when the weather is not conducive to getting out. My thought with these sticks was that if I cut a little off one end, it would be a perfect fit for the everlasting ball. It turns out, they are hard as a rock! I tried a couple of different knives and even my meat cleaver, but none of them made any headway in cutting off the 2" I needed to remove. Then I picked it up and tried to break it with my hands, and it snapped in two right on the line I had been trying to cut (perhaps I scored it a little). Anyway, it turns out that is the secret to these things - breaking instead of cutting.

I am not in the least concerned about the caloric value of them so that was not figured into my perception of the treats in any way. One of my dogs is slender - the other downright skinny (has a high metabolism and is offered plenty to eat but never finishes a meal). The older, slender dog got the 2" bit I cut off and the younger skinny dog got the remainder of the stick in her everlasting ball. May not be fair but she had to work harder to get it so it all comes out in the wash.

The older dog practically took my hand off to get to the treat quickly. Once she had it, she ran off and put it back on the floor so she could take her time with it. I will say that the little 2" stick lasted her much longer than I would have expected so I rate them high for that reason. The chewing action is good for their teeth/jaws and is far preferable to a treat they gobble down without tasting.

The younger dog went racing after her everlasting ball and stayed busy for a long time trying to get it out. I wasn't around when she finally succeeded to know how long it took her to eat it but am glad it kept her interested for awhile.

The packaging is cute and the bag is resealable. I believe they are kind of pricey and for that reason I might not order them again. Otherwise I am completely satisfied.

Normally, I spell out the ingredients off of the package when I do these reviews; but I'm learning that people do not mark that as helpful.  So, if you are curious about the ingredients...please read the description!  And, I obviously have not ate one of these dog treats personally!  But I can tell you this much--my dog loves these treats.  In fact, I have never seen her run so fast to get a treat.  If I leave the package out on the counter...she hangs around and sits until I give her one.  She actually will mind perfectly if she knows these treats are out.  It's kind of funny, really!  I honestly have to hide them...because other wise she will keep sniffing under the pantry door.  The product itself smells like a dog treat, and it's a good sized treat for my dog.  (She is a 78 pound boxer)  So for smaller dogs you could probably break it in half and make the bag last longer.  My dog has eaten the sticks on the carpet...and I have not noticed any stains, so I don't think there is a lot of coloring to them.  I clean up after her anyway because that is my preference...but I don't get the brown color like other treats.  Anyway, because of my dogs response to them...I am getting them again.  They'll make a great stocking stuffer!!
Gave them to my beagles, who are both pretty picky, and they both ate them up. Nice that they are low calorie since my dogs are kind of tubby.

My 5-year-old Australian shepherd, Pete, has put on a lot of weight in the last 18 months, so I was curious to see how he would take to a low calorie treat.
I placed a regular size Milk Bone, a small Beggin' Strip, and a Zoe treat stick side-by-side on the carpet and invited Pete to help himself.
Being wary like most Aussies, he cautiously sniffed each offering, then took the Milk Bone. When he was finished with the Milk Bone, he picked the Beggin' Strip. Finally, when there was only one choice left, he took the Zoe treat stick.
I did this test with him four times to see if he would develop a taste for the Zoe treat sticks, but the results were always the same.
From a health and caloric point of view, the Zoe treat sticks may be the better choice, but Pete's interested in them only if nothing else is available.
I suppose that's true of people and diet food too.
At any rate, Pete gives 'em 2 stars.

Zoe Lifestyle Treats for Dogs are a healthy alternative to the typical high-calorie dog snacks which you find in stores today. The product is gluten-free and is a good source of soluble fiber. These treats are as hard as a rock which would probably be troublesome for older dogs with poor teeth. I tested these treats on a 2-year-old lab and a 9-year-old golden retriever. Keep in mind...they will eat just about anything. Both dogs threw the sticks on the ground and proceeded to sniff them.  I am not sure, but I think the cinnamon spice flavor threw them off a bit.  After rolling the sticks around on the ground, I am happy to report that they ate them. The next day, I offered them another treat and they didn't seem too excited. Overall, if you are into healthy dog food, these snacks are sensible treats. Personally, I wouldn't buy them again due to the price and the firmness of the product. I would be concerned that my dog would break a tooth.

Summary: Great item, disappointing price & shipping service from Amazon
Text: Love these treats for my puppy and my veterinarian was pleased with this product since the pup is slightly overweight and made in the USA, unfortunately they are quite pricey.  But when I started on the automatic monthly shipments from Amazon at the reduced price, Amazon cancelled the automatic shipments before the first shipment, for whatever reason, so now I have to buy them at the full higher price.  I guess someone wanted MORE MONEY so I will have to either buy them less frequently or find somewhere else to get them at a better price or look for something else.  How sad for my puppy, she really, really enjoys these treats.

I was looking for something healthy as a treat to my puppy. My 10 week old puppy loves these things. whenever I go near them she gets wound up. They also give her a boost of energy for another hour. I like to cut them in half and stick them in a kong toy and let her spend 10 - 30 minutes working on getting the stick out.

At any rate, puppy likes these, so they are a win in my mind.

I'm reordering because my Corgi really enjoys these Quinoa protein sticks. I give them as a special treat. They
don't last long, but he really likes the flavor

My dog has a very sensitive stomach. I've found very few treats that she can eat without throwing them up. I thought I would try Zoe treats since they had all natural ingredients and I have very few choices so far my dog likes. Well - So far so good, she loves the treats and no problems with her stomach. Because of her sensitive stomach and size I give her ½ of a stick at a time and she likes then so well she begs for more. It's nice to find a healthy treat that my dog likes. I have purchased them again!
My Shih Tzus & Pekinese loved them  - I even signed up for "subscribe & save" so I can automatically get them sent to me monthly.

My black lab loves these and she never likes dog treats.  Finally found something that can keep her occupied for more than a few seconds.  It takes her about 5 minutes to chomp through one of these but she really enjoys them so I keep buying them.

Summary: Sammy loves Zoe Low Calorie Treat Sticks
Text: My black Lab Sammy loves the Zoe Low Calorie Treat Sticks I bought at Amazon.  Because they have only 28 calories each, he can enjoy a few every day.  The treats are also good for his teeth as they keep down the tartar.

I have 3 dogs so its not easy finding a treat that all 3 can have and now this one fits the bill!  The two aussie shepherds get a full piece but the min-pin/chihuahua mix gets it cut in half.  They love them and always look forward to this special treat.
My two Portuguese Water Dogs are loving this treat.  They need a low cal option and there aren't that many in the stores.  These are just what they need and love.

Summary: Great treat for the older, overweight dog
Text: One of our neighborhood dogs is a love, but as he's gotten older, he's gained weight. We've always kept treats on hand for his visits, but his owner naturally wants to limit extra calories. With these treats, we can honor her wishes and give our neighbor a special snack when he drops by for a visit. He enjoys them, his owner is happy -- it's all good.

I find it hard to review something I don't experience myself, but I'll try my best here.

I gt these treats to see what my dog would think of them. My dog liked the treat. He also had some fun chewing the treat, so it was good for chewing and as food.
I can also state that the treats did not affect his health either positively or negatively. His stool was also consistent pre-treat and post-treat. In other words, the treats are safe to give to your dog.

Our dog does not suffer from any allergies so that was not a factor for us.  He did enjoy these sticks quite a bit and that is a huge factor for us.  I like that they are calorie controlled.  Even so, I break the sticks in half so they will last longer.  If your pet does suffer from allergies, this is an excellent choice when you combine the health aspect with the enjoyment aspect.

Summary: My dog loved them, and tolerated them!
Text: I have a dog that has a history of poor tolerance to several dog foods and treats. My dog LOVED these snack sticks and he did not have any digestive issues with them whatsoever. For these reasons I would certainly consider purchasing them again. My 21 lb Cockapoo was able to eat a full stick in well under 5 minutes, they are not a long lasting chew snack.

I tried out these treat sticks for my dog and she quite liked them.  They are somewhat chewer and take longer to get through that similar chew sticks so they keep the little beast occupied a bit longer.  And if the packaging can be believed, they are healthier than other chew sticks too. I will likely buy her some more of these.

My dog (who is on a diet) loved these and I didn't feel so guilty giving him a treat.  They are good for large dogs as they are a healthy size, must be tasty as he gobbled them right up (and he's picky) and they are low calorie...what more could you want.

These are the kind of dog treats that take the dog a few minutes to chew up.  They break into safe pieces so they won't get lodged in the throat or further down, but they still take a few minutes to eat as they are kind of hard.  I thought they smelled sort of medicinal, but my dog seemed to like them a lot.

These treat sticks are larger than I thought they would be.  I ended up cutting them down for my miniature dachshund (easy to do, you only have to notch into them a bit with a large knife and then bend in half).  She seemed to like them a lot, but I wish they'd taken more time for her to chew down.  She was able to eat one pretty quickly.  That would be my only negative, in that I like a treat this size to take a while for my dog to chew it down.

Summary: A great dog treat for special diet or sensitive needs
Text: I saved these treat sticks for my German Shepherd who had been licking her paws a lot to the point of bleeding.  When I told the vet about it she suggested a wheat free diet. These treats went right along with that new diet since they are gluten-free, wheat-free, corn-free, and soy-free.  They are also good for the dogs teeth.  She liked them and enthusiastically ate them all. The vet was right..... along with diet changes, to include these low calorie treats, my German Sheppard quit her over-licking problem.  They are somewhat solid, but chewy for the dog and it's evident the dog enjoyed the taste.  I will continue to use these treats for my Shepherd and will purchase the medium sized treat sticks for my smaller English Setter.
My two dogs really enjoyed these treats and downed them in no time at all, In fact I wish they had been harder to chew, and lasted longer for the price they were

If I didn't know this was a dog treat I might have mistaken for a piece of plastic from one of my kids many toys. It's very solid, therefore it keeps my dog busy for awhile, which is great. She loves them. Best part for me though was the scent. It's got a lovely scent of warm spice.

Because it doesn't smell bad, nor crumble, it's ideal for popping in my pocket when I'm on my way out w the dog.

I have a dog that is a Jack Russell Terrier that will eat anything and her weight shows it... So it really isn't saying much that she likes these treats. On the plus side, they are low-calorie and it takes her longer to eat one of the Zoe sticks than it does to eat one of her nightly Dentastix (the two products look very similar) but I suppose the Zoe sticks are denser and a bit tougher to chew through and so last longer.  If they are low-calorie and she'll eat it, I consider it a good product!

Summary: 3 out of 4 dogs found this treat acceptable
Text:
One out of one owner-and-buyer-of-dog-treats thought they were not worth the cost.

A few additional thoughts:

I cannot see an "item count" on the package. In the picture, the treats look like skinny pencils. In fact, each treat is the size of four skinny pencils, with eight in the bag.

"Cinnamon spice" is a people-flavor. "Rancid road kill" is a dog flavor. "rancid road kill" does not sell well. That said, buy treats for your dogs, if that's who will be eating them, not yourself.

My larger dogs (70#, excellent teeth, and 30#, bad teeth) inhaled these chews, taking just a little longer than they would take to eat fresh meat. For this price, chews have to last a bit longer.

I do not understand how the chews could be considered "hard" if used straight from the package. YMMV. My Chihuahua took two days to eat his. He left a mess. The bigger dogs didn't.

My larger, 55# and underweight, young girl dog would not touch these chews on two different days. She is one of the last dogs on the planet who needs either low fat or low calorie treats, so perhaps she was using good doggie judgement in not wasting chewing-effort-calories on a treat that may have a negative caloric payoff.

These strips were an instant hit with our pit bull chico.  In fact whenever anyone approached him when he was chewing he would growl, very unusual behavior for him.  The strips themselves are denser and chewier than others we've had.  There is no artifical coloring to them so no carpet staining.  The low cal aspect was also a plus for us.  Definately will be buying again!

The smell isn't pretty as with most dog treats. But my dogs knew as soon as they heard this bag what they were getting.  The treat is hard for them to chew on for a little bit. Not like a rawhide that last for days, but enough to keep them busy for a while.  Since there's an odd number in the package I had to attempt to break one in half. It was difficult but I did it to split between the two dogs. They loved it.

My dogs love chewy treats and these seemed like a good possible option to combine a safe and healthy treat with the opportunity to chew. On the positive side, there was no excess packaging, the treats arelow calorie, gluten free and safe/healthy for your dog if given in the recommended amounts and even for dogs on strict diets. There's a nice cinnamon smell that's appealing to humans. Both my dogs appeared to enjoy this treat and were eager for a second once they ate the first, so in addition to the positive aspects for a cautious owner, it was also popular with the intended audience.

However, I'd also caveat this with a few other issues. First, the package says a medium dog could get 2 sticks per day. There are six sticks in a bag and the cost is $6 - that's fairly pricey given that my dogs (admittedly expert, hardy chewers) ate their sticks in less than 5 minutes. While the cinnamon scent is appealing to humans, one of my dogs didn't seem excited about it at first. She did decide to eat it after a couple minutes (she initially put it down and backed away), but only because the other dog expressed interest. Once she ate the first one, she seemed more than willing to take another, but there was an initial hesitation. I'd expected something that might take longer to chew through. I'm the first to admit my dogs are super-chewers, so if your dog doesn't have jaws of steel, you might get more out of this treat, but it took between 2 -4 minutes (depending on which of the dogs) to eat the strips.

Overall, if you don't mind the price, it's not a bad treat.

It can be difficult writing reviews of pet food/treats for obvious reasons and most everyone can read the nutritional information in the item description area, so I will just say that our large build 12 lb Yorkie LOVED these treats! There are a lot of times where she will tire of biscuits and seem reluctant to take them, but that was not the case with these things. When she heard either one of us messing with the packaging, she would be right there to make her presence known and show us her "puppy dog" eyes. As you bend down to hand one to her, she would jump up on her hind legs and excitedly grab it from you and run off to consume it.

On a practical level, these things seem to be a bit pricey (as healthy foods tend to be) at about a dollar per... If you believe that your pet could benefit from these for a short period of time, then go ahead and try them. However, if your pet already seems to be in good shape, stick with what you are doing and don't over do it.

This will not cost the product any stars, as all necessary information is provided for you to review before your purchase and the fact that our Yorkie likes them. In the future, I would buy them again to throw in a bit of variety, but not as an everyday option.

I have a 9lb dachshund and I didn't notice the size on these when I ordered them and they are recommended for dogs 30lbs and over.  They are large sticks that most adult dogs would eat in a few bites, but this one lasted about 30 minutes for my dog.  She loved them, begged for them and when the package was empty, knocked the trash can down to get at the wrapper which she licked clean.  These are all organic and smell wonderfully almost like cinnamon.  With a smaller dog, they do make a bit of a mess since she has to chew it slowly so put something under your pet before letting them go at it.  I think they even helps clean her teeth a bit which is a real bonus.  I am now looking for a smaller size to order for her.

Good ingredients, excellent taste. The mutts approved by begging for more. We're happy to see better ingredients for our girls.

Will definitely purchase again.

Summary: No wheat, corn, or soy - my dog loves them
Text:
First of all, these chew sticks are made in the U.S. which is a must for us when it comes to feeding our dog. Well, maybe not strictly U.S. only but definitely not China as so many dog treats come from there. I don't trust China for edible dog products and never will. My dog Sheila usually tears through her treats in a hurry - but what we like about these is that it takes her a while to get through one. She has to work at it for a while, which is good for gum stimulation and teeth cleaning.

We don't feed Sheila anything that has wheat, corn, or soy in it. These treats contain none of those filler ingredients. The main ingredients are rice flour and quinoa flour. We always feed grain free food, but we make some exceptions for treats (again, as long as it is not wheat or corn).

The cinnamon spice flavored sticks smell very pleasant and they keep Sheila busy for a while. The large size works well for her - she is about 50 lbs.

Summary: The tails wag for this one
Text:
I assembled my canine product testing panel - Hunter, a 65 lb. Golden Retriever who has some weight issues and Boston, a 35 lib mixed breed who has some dental issues. I offered the treats, both testers took them readily. Boston retired to a comfortable spot and began to chew quite eagerly. Hunter took the entire stick into his mouth which caused me some concern that he would choke on it. I ordered him to drop the stick, which luckily he did. I gave him back the stick but held on to one end so he could not take the whole thing in his mouth again. I kept hold of the (now slimy) stick until Hunter chewed off a couple appropriate size chunks. Once the pieces were a safer size I let him enjoy, which he definitely did. Boston, meanwhile, was holding the stick between his paws and chewing on it, taking off bite size pieces. I had no concerns about how he was managing the product. Both dogs were quite interesting in repeating the test.

I offered the product again the following day. Both dogs were quite eager. Again Boston had no problem managing the product in a safe manner. I gave Hunter the stick but retained control of one end so he could not gulp it whole. He began to chew off a piece, and did eat the product safely. I inspected Boston's teeth after he finished his portion and was pleased that there seemed to be some lessening in the tarter buildup on the back teeth.

Both of my dogs liked the product, although to be fair neither is very picky. I also offered the product to two other dogs, a 50 lib mixed breed who managed it quite readily and a 10 lb Yorkie who chewed it a bit and then buried it. I am concerned that a larger, greedy dog like Hunter could choke on this.

I like that the product is low calorie but I think that at nearly a dollar a stick it is a bit pricey. I like that the sticks are hard enough to make the dogs chew. Boston did seem to get some teeth cleaning benefits from the product. Unfortunately due to the high price and the safety issues for Hunter I probably will not be purchasing this again.

My geriatric dog Lady loves these treat sticks.  As she is getting older, 13 next March, she has had trouble gaining a few extra pounds and has some dental problems.  These treats are low fat and they are a nicely flavored spice helping with healthy choices and helping her teeth. They also help with keeping tartar down as they are not quickly consumed. She will not eat anything she doesn't like and she takes these from me very excitedly whenever they are offered.  Very pleased with this product.

I had eliminated treats from my dog's diet when she started to lose her "girlish" figure. Turns out most treats have a lot of calories. Luckily I found she loves to eat apple slices - which gives her a little variation from her regular dry food.  But since I was hoping to give her an occassional added treat I was pleased to find these sticks.  She likes them, the ingredients look fairly healthy, and I don't mind giving her one every now and then.

At only 92 calories per stick these are a great dog treat. These are a good size treat and being hard and crunchy help keep dogs occupied and also help with breath and teeth. For dogs with sensitive digestion these are gluten free and are made with high protein grain. For human noses these have a slight smell that is not overpowering.

We have three dogs with the smallest being around 50-55 pounds. Our puppy is around 65-70 and our biggest around 90 pounds. All three enjoyed the treat stick. Obviously these are all big dogs so I can't speak for small dogs but when all of ours enjoy them I can recommend these to all big dog owners.

Chock full of power-house ingredients like quinoa and flax, these treats are thankfully free of wheat, soy and other common allergens making them nice to have on hand for puppy play dates or visiting furry friends who might have dietary restrictions. They have a neutral smell and don't leave smudges or stains on carpet the way many treats can. My dog loved them.

The compact, resealable bag is great for travel. My only word of caution is that with only six treats per bag, they go quickly!

My 50-lb Beagle/hound mix loved them! Definitely a good choice if you want to give your dog a real treat (and not a frozen carrot or an ice cube) and your dog is on a diet. I wish they lasted longer, though. Our dog is food-motivated so eats quickly, so maybe it will last longer for your dog, but she finished this in about 3 minutes.

The treats aren't super-large, either. I'd say they're just right for my dog, so for a bigger dog they might be a bit small (but not a choking hazard or anything, I don't think).

I have two labs who love to eat and will eat everything. I also have a foster Lab who is more choosy about what she likes to eat. I offered this treat to all three dogs and they loved it - there was no hesitation about taking or eating it. While they enjoyed the treat, it didn't last very long (I would say at most a minute). If you're looking for a treat that your dogs will take time eating, this isn't it (or maybe it is if you have a smaller dog). But if you're looking for a treat that's healthy and an alternative to the other dental chews out there, this is a good option though a tad expensive (almost $1 each).

Summary: Surprisingly, All 3 of My Dogs Liked These!
Text: I say surpisingly because the ingredients were sort of unusual - Cinnamon was one of the main flavors and 1 of my dogs is picky. All three of them took off with them as if they were special treats, and I had wanted to try them because one of my dogs is on a diet, and this was a low-fat treat. Unfortunately, there were only 7 in the package, so it's doubtful I'll be buying them again. I prefer the Get Naked Low Calorie Dental Chew Sticks for Dogs, Small/6.2-Ounce, 18 sticks/Pack, because although they are smaller in size, they lasted about as long as this treat, and they weren't all gone after the 2nd one. Still, The ZOE Low Calorie Chew Sticks would be great for a household that had fewer dogs.

I have a Doberman and a Sharpei (they are both 4 years old) who love these chew sticks. They smell like cinnamon and are not messy or gross in any way. They are gluten free which is important for many breeds who may have allergies or skin issues. I would recommend these to other dog owners as long as their dog does not have dental issues. They give the dog a nice chew and crumble a bit so that your dog won't swallow a big chunk by accident. They also have healthy ingredients which more and more dog owners are paying attention to these days. No corn, white flour, or unhealthy animal fats here. Ditch the crummy milk bones and get these.
The dogs liked these one's pretty well but they weren't totally excited over them. They are larger than I expected and they don't create crumbs or discolorations on the carpet. Not bad.

I give 5 stars to anything my dog likes because she's so picky. People will give her a doggy snack/biscuit and she'll let it drop out of her mouth and onto the ground. So embarrassing. When I first gave her one of the Zoe Low Calorie chew sticks, she trotted off with it and then laid it down, seemingly forgotten. I was was ready to say she didn't like them, but, when I gave the stick back to her during her brushing(I have give her something to chew on so she doesn't chew on me), she gobbled it up, and in fact, it took 3 sticks to get through her half hour brush-out(she's a rough collie, like Lassie).

Though Zoe treats are low calorie, something my dog doesn't have to worry about, they still apparently taste good. They smell like doggy-treat with cinnamon to me, nothing I'd want to eat, but then I'm not the one testing the product.

These treats are gluten-free, something I watch out for with my dog because collies are prone to skin problems. The ingredients are as listed:
Brown rice flour
organic quinoa flour, vegetable glycerin, gelatin, water, tapioca starch(I've heard this is good in prevent cancer)oat fiber, oat groats, chicken, natural chicken flavor, calcium carbonate, organic flaxseed, carrots, chia seed, cinnamon, carrogeenan, furtooligosachride(A natural probiotic found in bananas), L-carnitrine(helps turn fat into energy).

With all this good stuff going on, I wish the kids were still young enough to get them to eat these sticks. It would be a whole lot healthier than most of the human snacks out there. And they were never as picky as Daisy.

My dogs are pretty enthusiastic about these chew sticks [however, they are not very discerning.  They eat anything.]. These treats are substantically sized so it's good they are low-calorie.  Took my dogs less than 2 minutes to eat.  Dogs with poor teeth might have trouble chewing them.

I have two large dogs, one is 80lbs and the other is 140lb.  They both took these treats immediately, without even the usual once-over sniff and inhaled them in under 3 minutes. You'd think with the cinnamon flavoring they would have hesitated but not in the least.  Both dogs then licked the carpet to make sure they'd got all the crumbs and then looked at me for more. At $6 a bag I will definitely limit these to once a week.

Summary: If my dogs could shop they'd buy these treat sticks
Text:
Zeus, my 11-year old, 120# Alaskan malamute is fussy about treats. He approaches all treats with suspicion. And cinnamon spice is not exactly his favorite flavor. He prefers chicken or salmon. Even though these contain chicken and natural chicken flavor they smell like cinnamon and nutmeg. I assumed he would turn up his nose. I set a treat stick at his feet.
