Text: My twins love apples and carrots, so this was an easy win.  Also, much less sweet than all the other flavors (also try Plum Baby's carrot apple). Great for car & stroller snacks. They've been slurping these down since they were 12 months.

I've compared this product to the competition (Plum, Earth's Finest, Happy Baby) and none came close to the exceptional nutritional value.  120% iron - that's amazing.  I pack one of these in my toddler's lunch boxes every day, and she views eating her spinach as a treat - even more amazing.  So although this product is far more expensive than alternatives, given the taste and nutrition, this has become the one 'vegetable' I am guaranteed my daughter will consume every day.

We tried all of Ella's flavors, my 6 month old loved them all.  I tasted them too, yummy!!  My only complaint is that this product is very expensive. If money isn't an issue for you, I highly recommend this product.  If money is an issue and you want organic I recommend Earth's Best or Plum.  I've decided to just make my own.

I started my daughter on these when she was 7 months old- she is 12 months old now and she still sucks these down in one breath! So glad that she loves these- they are super easy to carry around and they are healthy for her! Thanks, Ella's Kitchen!!

Summary: BUYER BEWARE! Read the nutrition label on Ella's website
Text:
This stuff is garbage and Ella's Kitchen should be ashamed for false advertising. I was really surprised to see a fruit product like this one had so much calcium (10%) on the package compared to most of the other baby fruits out there (usually 0-2% unless veggies or yogurt's added in) and chose this over other products, thinking the extra calcium would be worth the extra $ for my baby in the long run. When you check it against Ella's website, it HAS NO CALCIUM%! Same goes for all the other stage 1 Ella's fruits (butternut squash, carrots, apples, prunes: 30% calcium on package but 2% on the website, carrots, apples, parsnips 30% calcium on package vs. 0% on website all the same serving size) -- there were other differences too in protein, iron, etc. It does cost a lot more than some of the other organic baby fruits out there and tastes awful. If your baby is just as content with the other less expensive organic baby fruits out there, go with the cheaper alternative because nutrition wise, Ella's no better!

What a disgusting marketing ploy by Ella's Kitchen to get parents to choose their products because it is falsely more nutritious when it's the same as other organic baby fruits in terms of nutritional value.

I am very happy with this product. It tastes really yummy and doesn't have lots of "extra" ingredients. I love the variety in the Ella products and that my baby is getting lots of healthy foods in one meal. Also, it is very easy to just squeeze it onto a spoon to feed. No mess!

I almost stopped giving my son iron drops thinking that this product was giving him much of his daily iron needs. The sweet potato/pumpkin flavor says it contains 45% of the daily iron needs but really it only has 2%. I don't understand how this company can just lie on the nutrition label.

My 14 month old loves this stuff.  i tasted it and it seems healthy and delicious enough.  My only reservation is about not being able to visually see and inspect what she's ingesting with these new tetra packs.
My son had a little trouble on occasion with constipation and when he did, this would be our go to meal. The prunes always seemed to help, and he loves the taste.
My two Year old LOVES these pouches!! She sheen eating them since she started on solids. Ill continue to buy until she's doesn't want them anymore!  Very healthy! And they have a great huge variety!

I worry about genetically modified foods, and Ella's doesn't contain any.  In the long haul, this is really important for my grandchildren, and is just one more reason to give them Ella's Organics.  The more you know, the safer the child in your life is!
I wish these were cheaper so I don't order them as much as I would but they do taste good and is a unique combination of flavors. Baby loved it!

I thought broccoli and peas are good for my baby, but pears seem to be the most ingredient. It tastes sweety. I don't hope my daughter has a sweet tooth. BTW, the package edges may be not safe as teether.

Purees are not supposed to be this thin.  What a mess!!  I make most of the food for my twins, but bought a few organic pouches to try while we were on vacation for Memorial Day.  I had an assortment of Plum Organics, Earth's Best and a few Ella's Organics.  The Plum are a much more normal consistency AND taste better all around.  I mixed this with Brown Cow cream top plain yogurt (as I have done with all the other fruit pouches I brought for the weekend). This particular packet was so runny it was like spoon feeding them a bottle! Can you say disaster?! Won't buy again.

Organic food pouches are wonderful. They are easy to carry and to eat (children can manipulate them on their own as soon as they can hold things with both hands). My child enjoyed Ella's kitchen pouches a lot till she was almost 18 months old.  She seemd to like apples+bananas the best.

That is what these are called in our house. After naps each little tike gets one from the fridge and they think it's a smoothy.
I give them all sorts of fruit and veggie mix flavors and they never fail me. It's the incentive to get the nap in there too.

I recommend putting them in the fridge, just popping the top of and handing it over to any baby who's done with their bottle.
I started giving them directly to the kids at age 13 months. A bit messy for the first week, but the youngest is 15 months now and
she knows exactly what to do with her "sak ouwt"

When my son was an infant he willingly ate a wide variety of fresh fruits and vegetables. Now that he's a toddler he refuses almost all fresh fruits and vegetables, even the ones that he used to love. I use these to sneak healthy food into him! I keep some organic baby food pouches in the car, so that I always have a healthy snack on hand for him. He loves them!

Note that these aren't as sweet as some of the other organic baby food pouches (such as Happy Tot's Spinach, Mango, and Pear). If I give my son a sweeter pouch first, and then this pouch, he refuses this one. If you think your child will eat more than one pouch, offer this sweet potato/pumpkin pouch first! I am so grateful for these!

Summary: The Only Veggies My Daughter Will Eat!
Text: A little expensive, but theses pouches are great on the go. They are BPA free and all organic. My daughter wouldn't eat the jar food (peas, carrots, etc.), but when mixed with fruit she will. Great product!

My son is now one, and looooves these little pouches. I can't even go through the baby food aisle at the grocery store without him seeing these and crying for one. I love the packaging because it is so easy for him to hold and eat off the spout. Plus, these are great to put in his diaper bag for snacks when we're out running errands or to feed him at a restaurant. He loves all the flavors of these, there are other brands out there that he didn't like and when I tried them they were not very good. I have tried these and they are very tasty, which I was surprised because some of the combos don't sound like they would taste good (spinach, apple, rutabaga?). I am from Dallas and I get them from a grocery store here called Central Market and they normally sell them at less than $2 but will have sales where you can get them at around $1, so that is when I stock up. The product is excellent, but I think the price you pay on Amazon is very high compared to other places where you can get a better price.
Can't say enough about these products...Amazingg...my daughter throws these back like nothing..Absolutely loves them!..I just wish Stage 2 was more readily available
Can't say enough about these products...Amazingg...my daughter throws these back like nothing..Absolutely loves them!..I just wish Stage 2 was more readily available

I have twin 14 month old girls and they have been eating Ella's Organic fruit/veggie pouches since they were about 4 months old. They LOVE them and they are a great snack to take on the road or outside. While I would prefer for the girls to eat actual fruit and veggies, they are going through a picky stage right now and these pouches are the next best thing. We buy them in bulk and can't keep up with the demand from our girls.

It is hard to get my 9 month old to eat vegetables, but luckily she likes this blend! As another review mentioned, it is pretty runny but I just thicken it up with rice cereal. I'm a little torn on what I think of packages like this - I am glad they are BPA free, and they are convenient for when we're out and about, but in general I prefer glass containers that we can recycle or reuse.

This food is not as smooth as some of the others and is a mixture of 4 foods, so I didn't start feeding it to my baby until he was 6-7 months old.  He's 9 months old now and still loves it, and I think it's better now that it isn't as smooth.  I could see feeding him this for awhile longer alongside solids or as a snack.  The only downside is the price, but I guess it's not much more than other pouches.

Summary: Looks and smells gross, but my baby wouldn't stop eating it!
Text: Our pediatrician recommended this flavor combination when we first started solids because it has 120% of daily iron needs.  Well, when I sat down to feed it to my baby, all I could was, wow, this is so gross!  It looks pretty much the same way going in as it does coming out, if you know what I mean.  To my surprise, my picky eater gobbled it up!  She ate more of this than any other baby food flavor we had offered.  A 2-3oz package of anything else was lasting two days, but she ate almost the whole 3.5oz package of this in one sitting.  I did taste it, and the apples make it sweet and appetizing (and I really do not like spinach).  We've had more success with Ella's Kitchen than any other brand, but this flavor especially has been great.  Looks gross, smells gross, sounds gross, but I say, give it a try.

Summary: Helpful for kids with special needs, too
Text: My son is 8 but due to his disability is on a very low calorie diet and has issues chewing many low calorie foods such as raw veggies.  These packets are a fun way for him to enjoy a low calorie snack when we are on the go (only 35-40 calories for many of the packets).  He loves the taste and of course there is no worry about choking hazards.  I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because they are extremely pricey, even at the lowest price I could find it really adds up.

When my 4 month old son sees these brightly colored pouches he sits straight up in his high chair and starts to get excited. All the flavors are really yummy. ... I've tried everything that he's eaten at this point.

I really like that these have no additives... They didnt even add water. Just pure organic fruit and vegetable purée. I figure that he's going to have so many processed food options in the future that I might as well give him the best I can now.

I purchased the Boon Spoons (got a 3 pack of the 2-spoon sets from the big T for less than a 2 pack here on amazon) and they work perfectly with these pouches too. Very convenient to take on the go.

I continue to purchase these pouches, though I usually buy a couple individual packs from T before buying the 7 packs here on Amazon so I can make sure he likes them.
My 7 month old son likes this. We tried this after first doing peaches and bananas separately, and he likes them together too.
When I can't get my son to eat anything else (fussy, teething, etc) he'll always eat this.  Tastes delicious with a mix of baby cereal and formula.

I have been buying Ella since my son was 6 months old. Once I moved back to the States I was pleased to find the Ella product here. I was also buying Gerber Organic and then one day I studied the label and realized that only Ella was truly just pure veg and fruit whereas the other organic baby food as other random things to help the shelf life. Ella is worth the price and is so easy to mix in with chicken or fish to make it easier for your little one. Although my son is now 16months, I still use Ella when I am short on time and don't have time to make fresh veg or fruit.
My baby loves this product. I even tried it and it was very yummy. I cant wait to get more for him.

Summary: Like eating a tube of jam!
Text: My daughter is a strawberry fiend so I thought this would be perfect for her, but she just spits every bite out pretty violently, LOL! I tried it myself in exasperation and it really tasted like a spoonful of strawberry jam. GROSS.
when my son is teethy and/or fussy and won't eat anything else, this is the one thing he will eat.  Awesome!  I tasted it and it really gets five stars for something that's got veggies in it, too.

I love Ella's Kitchen organic baby food. It's easy to take on the go. It is also the first baby food my child ever ate. She refused Earth's best and Gerber. The sweet potato, pumpkin, apple, blueberry flavor was always her favorite. I tasted it...and it is actually really good!  Great product and healthy!

I was hesistant about such a mixture but I want what's best for my baby so I bought it.  It doesn't look the most appetizing but my baby LOVED it!  This will be a constant food for him until he moves on to the next stage - love, love, love this brand!
I orig. bought this for my 6 month old, but my 2 year old loves it too! She has been hard to feed lately... picky 2 year old. She loves the pouches... I guess it's a new novelty. What ever it takes!

My 5 month old LOVES these mixtures. Great job ELLAS I promised I would never feed him something that I wouldn't eat myself. They ALL taste good. I would eat any of them if I was so inclined to eat a pureed meal. They are easy to pack & throw in the diaper back/suit case for travel. I had no worry about them leaking (like a small plastic tupperware). The price is right, shipping was quick, and they store really well in the pantry in the ready made box. Happy Baby = Happy Mommy

BUT HE LOVES IT. My 5 month old LOVES these mixtures. Great job ELLAS I promised I would never feed him something that I wouldn't eat myself. They ALL taste good. I would eat any of them if I was so inclined to eat a pureed meal. They are easy to pack & throw in the diaper back/suit case for travel. I had no worry about them leaking (like a small plastic tupperware). The price is right, shipping was quick, and they store really well in the pantry in the ready made box. Happy Baby = Happy Mommy

My 5 month old LOVES these mixtures. I promised I would never feed him something that I wouldn't eat myself. They ALL taste good. I would eat any of them if I was so inclined to eat a pureed meal. They are easy to pack & throw in the diaper back/suit case for travel. I had no worry about them leaking (like a small plastic tupperware).  The price is right, shipping was quick, and they store really well in the pantry in the ready made box.

Summary: Best snack out there, but buy elsewhere!
Text: We love Ella's! Amazingly pure and delicious portable snack. But this price is crazy - it is cheaper at our Whole Foods in Manhattan! Eek!

Summary: My Baby Doesn't Care For It
Text: But I love that it is organic. I didn't think it was that bad, I will just stick to other flavors ;)
I hope it's really healthy because my 1 yr old seems to love them - we just tried them and the package is already gone!  recommend!
My son LOVES these but Amazon's price is ridiculous!!!  You can get them on sale for a dollar a piece.  Yikes!!  I'm shocked!!

Summary: Healthy food, happy Kids, no mess - happy mom too.
Text: My kids love Ella's Kitchen Apple Banana sauce.  We have purchased various flavors and various brands of this type of product - fruit sauce in a pouch.  There are only a couple they like.  And this is one of their favorites.  They are older children (not babies).  They love the taste and the packaging.  They like it so much that they beg for it.  It is so easy to give this to them in the car.  Healthy food, happy Kids, no mess - happy mom too.

My baby LOVED the Ella's kitchen items, especially the peaches & bananas.  I love that it is all organic!  The consistency is very runny...so it mixes well with things like oatmeal & other baby cereals.  The cap will go back on the package, but must be kept upright in the fridge or it will leak.
Love all Ella's Kitchen products...my babies LOVE it.......can't find stage 2 in the stores or online....but the Drugstore 911 prices are really outrageous..more than half the normal cost ><
My baby is a picky eater and LOVES, especially this flavor.  I try everything that I give her and these are something I would eat too!

Summary: Ella's Kitchen Organic Baby Food Strawberry and Apples
Text: My son loved this. He actually likes this more than any other baby fruit. This is also very convenient. If you do not use it all at one time, then you just put the cap back on and put it in the fridge. They also take up less space in the diaper bag, and you do not have to worry about the jar busting.

Summary: My Toddler Vegetable Snob is a BIG Fan!
Text: These little pouches are great for toddlers who refuse to eat their vegetables in the conventional way. My son started getting picky around 18 months and I was on the verge of desperation when I found these at BRU. (They are also carried at a certain big box store that has a bulls eye logo.) Yes, they are marketed for babies, and are almost two bucks a pop, but my son ALWAYS finishes these pouches, which is more than I can say for most things he eats, and I feel much better knowing he ingested something green! Yay for Ella's kitchen! Oh. and I also recommend the pumpkin version. Super yummy!

My toddler, my 9yo daughter, and I all love this!  Delicious.  A little pricey, but worth it right now while my little guy won't really eat "real" fruits and veggies :)  The Subscribe and Save price here is the best I've found.
Tastes just like what it is, but my will not even touch a vegetable nevermind eat one daughter sucks these down. I'm happy!

My 21 month old son absolutely loves these - he will happily eat them right out of the package, but I also use them to make yogurt smoothies or to flavor oatmeal and he love that as well.  I love that there really isn't a lot of sugar and that they have so many truly YUMMY flavors - we've probably been using them since he was about 12 months old - only wish I had known about them even sooner!

I have an 11 month and 3.5 year old. These pouches make for a great yummy snack. My kids love to eat them right out of the pouch. My older child eats her whole veggies and also these pouches. My baby, is not a huge veggie fan like my eldest.. she loves these however. When I cook for the baby if I don't hide the veggies well, she will reject the meal. So, when I can't get my baby to eat the organic veggies I have made or when I need a quick snack while shopping or out and about, Ella's takes great care of us! Def a must have. Oh, I just give my baby the whole tube and she sucks it all out.. great for the baby who had always refused me feeding her.
My toddler loves these, great snack for during the day and easy to take in the car as a bribe :)

My son is almost 18 months old and these are great for healthy snacks on the go. They are a great combination of fruits and vegetables without all the extra water and junk that comes in other baby food.  It's like a special treat for my little guy and I'm happy he's eating something healthy.  Only complaint is I wish they weren't so expensive.

My child took to this flavor of Ella's immediately, moaning with delight with every slurp. Soon enough, she was able to drink down the container on her own using the spout, which was a new skill of hers I can attribute to the spinach, apple and rutabaga Ella's!

I just started buying this product. It is not available in local stores. I went to Target last Sunday and saw these so I decided to gave it a try. My baby happen to love these as much as Happy Baby products. I am surprised to see it here on Amazon. So next time I will buy it from here. It tastes great. My baby loves it. Yeah it is kind of expensive but if your child loves it then I would buy it for the child. They do go on sale too. If you have WIC ( Women , Infant and Children) You can buy these from Target Because only Target carry these here. I am not sure if Amazon accepts WIC.  Over all a great product I would recommend it.
Product is great.  Amazon price was overpriced- once calculated on per pouch, it turned out to be twice that of Whole Foods pricing.  Not worth it.
I mix this with nonfat plain yogurt and it's the best dip around -- I can eat veggies all day with this stuff.  Hard to find in grocery stores so I'm THRILLED it's on Amazon!
Our family loved spinach dip with Knorr Leek Soup mix, but it is a bit difficult to find in small towns! I ordered a case so that I'd have plenty on hand!

Summary: Very tasty and we use it to mix with fresh vegtable
Text: Good price compared to safeway, so it worth to buy it from here. Though not all kind of knorr soup is in safeway! I should check the wallmart perhaps?

This stuff is delicious and hard to find here in VT, so I ordered a case!  Mix 1 packet w/ a pint of sour cream and voila!, you've got "Mom's Dip."  It must be eaten w/ Ruffles potato chips for maximum effect.  It's freakin' delicious.  Not the fastest processing in the world, but that's kind of normal for this site.  Also not the fastest shipping, but it's free, so you can't complain there.  It did arrive on time.  Thanks Amazon!

Summary: Great for recipes, hard to get at stores.
Text:
Knorr leek soup mix makes the best chip and veggie dip; better than French onion! You just mix a packet of mix with 1 pint sour cream, stir, and let sit a couple of hours. Completely addictive. However, it's hard to find in grocery stores, so I turn to Amazon and buy boxes of the stuff. Perfect service, good expiration dates.

BTW, for the low-fat version, whip up cottage cheese and a little milk in the blender until it's the consistency of sour cream and use that with the Knorr mix instead. Really good!
Can't find this in stores anymore (knor leek soup mix), and can't cook without it - so glad I found a source
Pear's Gourmet Colombia Supremo Ground Coffee, 8-Ounce Bags (Pack of 6)has an excellent price but the taste is not so good. This product has a funny chocolate after taste that is not a good taste.
The tea tastes great and is very soothing. It's one of the teas I reach for when I want to relax.

I got hooked on candy-coated fennel seeds when I first tried them through a purchase I made with an online Indian cooking supply store. They were delicate and delish and addictive. I finished them up and then I bought theses packages of fennel seeds to stock up, also from India.  They are good, but apparently all sugar-coated fennel seeds are not created equally. The candy coating on these is much thicker and because of this, they are like little rocks to chew on, VERY crunchy, borderline "hard" crunchy. You can visually see the difference in the size of the individual seeds from the two different purchases; it's not my imagination. It isn't helping me any that I am going thru costly dental issues for the past year, so I am more sensitive now than ever about what I'm chewing on. The packaging is very nice, though; they have very user-friendly, slide-lock tops, very secure, nothing will come out. I was impressed with that.  When it's time to replenish these, however, as I eventually will, I will seek out the ones that I tried first and preferred. I will use these as little giftables since I have five bags of them left!

These are wonderful. I shared them with a class of mine (I teach at a college) to share some of the flavors of the world. Of course it was different then what most of them had been exposed to, but even then a majority liked them.

These sugar coated fennel seeds are much more tasty than the ones I originally became enamored with from nutsonline.com. These seeds are very tiny and the coating is delicate so a very easy and tasty mouth feel. They are like "Good and Plenty" candies only all grown up. I would highly recommend.

Update: I think the company might have gotten some other kind of seeds mixed in. I keep thinking I taste possibly cumin seeds, possibly others. For sure, not all of the seeds are fennel. It spoils the taste a bit, but still a good after dinner snack.
Really good product, they are sweeter than other ones I've tried and that disguises the fennel flavor a little bit so they're good for people not used to spicy flavors.

Summary: Delicious! Good For You! Tastes like candy!
Text: These are great! Ever since we were first introduced to eating them in an Indian restaurant we have ordered them here online at Amazon.com. We always found Amazon helpful and trustworthy, no matter what we order. For years now we order from them and are always satisfied. No matter what you want or need it seems to always be on Amazon! Amazing! Anyway; After the meal they had these candy fennel seeds for a last minute treat for breath and digestion, at the cash register. We enjoyed them so much ever since!

Yummy! I bought these awhile ago and a little go a long way. Eat a small handful on their own or mixed with plain dried fennel seeds after dinner, helps with digestion & much better for you than M&Ms. When I run out, I'll be buying this brand again.

Summary: Excellent Product but Watch Out Price Keeps Increasing
Text: We absolutely LOVE all the Plum Organics Pouches. They are awesome for lunch boxes. I am a parent of 3 1/2 yr. old twins. One cannot process fresh fruits and veggies but with these products I don't have to worry. He will now eat five different varieties. The only complaint I have is that they keep saying the item is no longer available for subscribe and save then one day later it becomes available at a higher price.
Was easy to order, got what i wanted in no time !Barista Coffee: Making the Perfect Cup of Coffee and Delicious Cakes to Have with It

Last time I ordered two 7 lb. bags of these Mexican Hat candies. They are always so fresh and chewy. Everytime my grandsons come to visit they always bring a few friends along, because they know I will always have these spicy flavorful little hats handy for them.

I'm 66 years old and have loved the different spicy taste each color has since I was just a kid myself. Orange is my personal favorite, because it taste like clove.

Please send it asap. Like one of the neighborhood kids, I can't wait to eat one.

S.Kay Cook
Used it for the first time...love it!!!! Locally, red food color is $1.78 an 1 ounce! Crazy! You have a shopper for life, Ozbo!

Summary: McCormick Large bottle of red food coloring.
Text: At the cost of $2.89 per ounce at the store, this was a much better price for a baker like me. The cost was very reasonable.
Nice product like the 1 oz bottle but a lot more for the money. We bake a lot of red velvet cakes and it gets expensive buying the 1 oz bottles. This large bottle goes a long way for the money.

There is nothing like the look and taste of a homemade red velvet cake! Box versions or bakery knock-offs will not do. You can make the cake at home without the color. But who's ever heard of a tan velvet cake? But the cost of the tiny bottles of red food coloring sold at grocery stores adds over $5 to the cost of each cake. So what are you to do? Get this big bottle and make lots of cakes for a fraction of the cost. A feast for the eyes and the mouth. Enjoy! Mmmm!

Summary: A toy, designed for a child to play with
Text: This item is not a collector's item.  It is a plastic toy racecar with candy.  Great if you are trying to give a little novelty gift to a young boy.  Seller was wonderful to work with.

This flavor is the sweetest Orbit gum I've had so far, almost like mint candy. It seems to last a little less long than flavors like wintermint, but it's almost more of a treat if you're a fatso on a diet like me. I usually use another flavor for a post-meal breath freshener though, but I love the flavor.

I like orbit gum and it is vegetarian friendly. This bulk pack gives me an abundance and keeps me from having to buy a Costco membership. Even Walmart doesn't carry this quantity packaging so it's a good deal.

Housemate specifically wanted this flavor and thought it was a good deal.

I like it too... good chew, good flavor, nice size, lasts long enough. Lots of it!
Doesn't get much more affordable than this!  The gum arrived fine, and lasts forever so why not buy it in bulk and save it.  Beats paying 3 times as much in a drugstore.
This was a great way to buy gum.  It is much better priced than buying it at the store in 3 packs.

In my opinion, the Sweetmint Sugarfree Gum is the best flavor made by Orbit.  The taste is wonderfully sweet and flavorful and lasts longer than any other brand of sugar-free gum I have tried.  The fact that it is better for your teeth, being free of sugar, is only icing on the cake!
This is one of my top flavors of gum. It is smoother than most and won't make your eyes water (there's a time and a place for that) but still has a minty taste.

Summary: One of my favorite flavors of gum
Text: Orbit's Sweetmint gum has a very unique flavor that almost reminds me of mint chocolate.  It's definitely not too sweet of a flavor, and you'll feel like you're chewing mint gum still.  The best way I can describe the flavor is a toned-down mint; the sweetness is noticeable but not overpowering.  I'm a fan of Orbit gum because after trying everything else out there, the flavor really does last the longest out of all the gum brands.  If you're looking to try a new gum flavor then you should give this a shot.

these are delicious and full of green foods-what could be bad? my daughters fight over these bars, i had to get a case. the flavors are natural and realistic, not too sweet. true, the chocolate coating may melt in a toddler's hand or on their face, but that always happens.  i keep them in the fridge to keep that at bay. enjoy!

I was a little dubious...I couldn't believe that green stuff would taste good since I'm kind of veggie-phobic, but these things are great!  They don't taste like green stuff at all, just a nice chocolate peanut butter flavor.  The bars have a tiny bit of crunchiness, but in a pleasant way and aren't too sweet.  I just found a tasty way to get more green in my diet, I'm so happy!  The bars are greenish inside, but if you don't look you'd never know it.

OK, so its a green bar and you have to take that into consideration. It's not a dessert by any means, but it is loaded with good stuff so when Im hungry and need a pick me up, I feel better about eating these than junk food. Plus, they keep my blood sugar in check for a pre-work out meal.

Love the taste and the nutrition of these.. great product.

Regarding the concerns about alfalfa use, I emailed the company, and within a few hours they nicely described how the alfalfa they use is safe:

Thanks for taking the time to write in with your questions and feedback. We chose to add alfalfa into our products because of all the amazing benefits from it. We harvest the alfalfa leaves for our greens. Alfalfa is one of the world's deepest roots plants absorbs many trace minerals and nutrients from the soil. It's root structure that can grow up to 20 ft. deep, letting it absorb minerals in the sub-soil that many plants can never reach. It also contains all essential amino acids and is a great source of Vitamins A, D E and K. The alfalfa leaf also contains:

. Calcium- bone and tooth formation, muscle contractions, heartbeat.
. Phosphorus- needed for normal bone and tooth structure. Interrelated
with action of calcium and Vitamin D. Improves nourishment of nerve and tissue.
. Silicon Magnesium- constipation, steadies the nerves, has protective
effect on skin and body, stimulates brain function

To add to that, we don't produce or incorporate ANY alfalfa seeds or sprouts into our products. The negative info you've likely seen only refers to the seeds or sprouts. Whole Leaf alfalfa has long been revered for it's incredible green leafy vegetable properties and incredible trace minerals. There isn't any controversy about it that I've ever heard of.

These bars are so healthy you would think they would taste plain.  They are fantastic.  Wonderful chocolate and high in protein with the peanut butter.  I originally purchased them for a snack....they can be a meal replacement anytime.....you never feel hungry.

I am not sure why others are complaining about the taste. This tastes great to me! I have also tried some vegan bars and those are pretty hard to eat. Sure, the chocolate is probably the unhealthiest part of this bar, but it really improves the taste. The only reason I am giving the product 4 stars is because it is a bit pricey.

The old recipe was really sticky and the chocolate melted. It also tasted only ok. With this new packaging, it seems like they have also updated the recipe. It is now more solid, easier to eat, and less 'grassy'. I was going to cancel my subscription, but not anymore!

I am officially addicted to these bars. I love the peanut butter / chocolate flavor.
I eat these for breakfast 3 or 4 times a week with a tall glass of iced green tea.
A good way to sneak in extra veggies early in the day - plus enough protein to keep me full and energetic for hours!

Summary: Not Completely Organic. Better bars out there that are 100% organic
Text:
Not Completely Organic.
Better bars out there that are 100% organic.
The chocolate can melt easily- so beware if you live in warm area.
Product contains ALFALFA- a controvercial ingredient as that it may aggravate Lupus and is a possible toxin. There are other companies who make bars without this ingredient for this very reason.

Price is rather expensive for NON-100% organic.

Summary: A Visit to the Peppermint Room
Text:
Several years ago, I went on a tour of the Celestial Seasonings tea factory in Boulder, Colorado. The guide showed us the bales of tea as they arrived, machines that ground and mixed the tea, and a machine that put the tea in tea bags. The tour included a visit to the room where the peppermint tea was stored. Our guide told us that peppermint was stored separately so that it would not contaminate the other teas. He did not tell us what was to come.

The doorway into the peppermint room was surrounded by bright red stripes. This should have served as a warning to us. We all innocently strolled into the peppermint room. The smell of peppermint was overpowering. It entered my nose, my head, my lungs, and then my whole being was infused with peppermint. What a rush! The crowd stampeded out of the room in a hurry. For the rest of the day and into the next, all I could smell and taste was the mint.

I am now addicted to Celestial Seasonings Peppermint Tea. Every time I have some, I am reminded of that fateful day in Boulder. The events of that day have changed my life forever. Amazingly, the tea is still legal, openly sold in stores and on the Internet. I think that the tea is great, but then again I am not an unbiased observer. On your next visit to Boulder, take the tour. Or go a safer route; buy the tea from Amazon.

Summary: Good decorative green tea that can be steeped many times...
Text: This tea blooms into a very realistic looking sea anemone.  I use it in a large Pilsner Glass, so the anemone opens full.  You could use a wide bottomed wine glass too.  You just have to wait a while for the glass to cool so it is drinkable without burning your hand.  This tea can be soaked over and over, I got eight glasses out of one anemone, so it is pretty economical, you could drink this all day, with the flavor only getting lighter after the fifth glass or so.
This was a great tasting coffee had a pleasant aroma and a bold taste. You will be delighted i love starbucks but this is really good.

Well, I don't know anything about the Gold Coast coffee issue but I know I've liked Morning Joe as soon as I found out about it and tried it.  Even though my favorites were Verona and Italian Roast, Morning Joe quickly became my favorite.  Unfortunately, it has been discontinued in all the grocery stores in my area.  With the price increases in coffee, I think this 6-pack is a decent value.  Hopefully the coffee itself is not being discontinued.  (I still drink Verona as well.)  :-)

Summary: Morning Joe is the same as the old Gold Coast
Text: I was skeptical at first when Starbucks started calling Gold Coast morning joe (lower case on purpose) but after drinking a couple pounds now I am completely convinced it is the same and just as great as the old Gold Coast.  I'm been drinking Gold Coast for several years now and it is the only ground coffee I stock at home.  Up to now I've always purchased it at the store but am switching to Amazon since it is about 30% less expensive and I just signed up for Amazon Prime.  My only concern is that most vendors who sell Gold Coast on Amazon don't seem to honor Amazon Prime.
Starbucks and Amazon thinks this coffee is Gold Coast. It's not. It's labeled Morning Joe and does not taste like Gold Coast. I guess we'll be brewing House Blend--until they change that.
I loved that I was able to purchase the formula at such a great price and received it in just a couple of days! Would definitely buy again. Hope you will be selling another pack of 4 soon.

Saw this in my Hotel Mini-bar and gave the Apple Pear a try. It was absolutely delicious! Really refreshing and lightly flavored, not super sweet with that aspertame-bite like so many flavored waters have. This stuff was just great after my long flight and cab ride. I actually drank 2 bottles of it in the hour I was there, trying the Cucumber Lemongrass next, and it was even better than the apple-pear.

Love the bottles, too, they're shaped like an old-fashioned flask.

I've looked for this in stores and haven't found it, but thank goodness for Amazon, they have everything.

Really great product, very sophisticated and delicious flavor.

This was a nice starter pack containing all of Icio's water flavors.  I found the Lychee Watermelon to be very refreshing without being too sweet- this was probably my favorite.  The Apple Pear was more apple than pear, but I liked it too.  The Peach Ginger was much too strong for me.  Personally, the Cucumber Lemongrass tasted like grass and dirt-- I couldn't even stand to finish it.  I would order the Lychee Watermelon and Apple Pear only next time.  As far as the packing, a co-worker commented that it looked like I was drinking liquor from a flask instead of a bottled water.

Summary: Pricey water, full of flavor and delicious but so $$$$
Text: ICIO water is so good!  It is best when it is ice cold - but why does it have to cost so much?  The cost puts it right into the "treat" category and outside of the daily category.  I would love to be able to enjoy ICIO on a regular basis but it is soooo expensive!
Great on meats and fries.  Really liked it with corned beef.  The garlic flavor is a little more subtle than I would like though.

This is an excellent commercial version of aioli and makes an interesting dip for vegetables-as well as for more traditional uses. I have made aioli from scratch using olive oil and hand whisking and find the Benedicta version to be lighter-a bit thicker but having an appropriate intense garlic and lemony taste. It can be thinned out  with milk or cream before use if desired. Personally, I wold not bother making aioli from scratch for most uses but would rely on this product.

Earlier on browsing the same product on Amazon sight, description said it was made with Garlic and Olive Oil, only. Product label on the bottle said Canola Oil and Egg yolk besides other things. Being a vegetarian it was useless for me. It would have been more trouble sending it back than moneys' worth so I gave it away to someone for free.
This was my first time ordering from this company. They're fast and a great product. Will def be ordering more flavorings in the future.

my grandma told me not to use ground cinnamon to make applesauce but to find the oil. She was right, of course. I thought the ground cinnamon flavored it fine, but this stuff made just that extra bit of difference.

We bought this Pecan pie to serve with Christmas Eve dinner as one of the deserts.
It was good,but just a little too rich and sweet for most of the tastes of the people. Everyone agreed that it should be served in very small portions with lots of coffee to wash it down. Those that like sweet sweet foods thought it was very good.

Wow is this better then finger licking good ! It's laying in bed dreaming about the piece left in the fridge, and getting up to the nightmare that someone else ate it, GOOD! I need to buy stock in this winner ! GOD BLESS SYLVIA !! weeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee

We just love the flavor of this breading but don't always want it deep fried. What I do is first preheat the oven to 400 degrees and then spread about 4-6 tablespoons or so of peanut oil on a release foil lined cookie sheet, with low sides. Then wet and bread chicken with Sylvia's mix according to package directions. (I don't always use the egg though.) Place skin side of chicken pieces down onto the oiled cookie sheet and bake in oven for 30 minutes. Then turn chicken over and bake for another 30 minutes or until done. It tastes just as great as the deep fried, but without the added grease and mess. Easy cleanup and oh, so good!

I won't use any other chicken breading except Sylvia's.

This is a wonderful product, makes fried chicken so easy.  I haven't had much luck w/ just wetting w/ water, then breading the chicken so I dip in an egg first & then put the mix & the chicken in a plastic bag.  I then shallow fry in canola oil just to get it crispy, then bake for 20 min.  Perfect every time.  I use separated wings for this.

I've been using this mix for several years now. I always bought it at the grocery store and when I moved to a different state, could not find it anymore. Fortunately, I purchased about 20 bags of it before I moved and it lasted a long time.

Once I ran out, I hit the computer to see where I could purchase it and lo and behold, it was on Amazon. And it was even cheaper than what I used to pay at the grocery store!! This mix can not be any easier to use or, any better than making it from scratch because that's what I did for years until I found this through my mother in law. I'll never use anything else. I use it for chicken tenders as well as regular fried chicken!
This mix makes the best fried chicken ever!  Just roll the chicken in some of the mix and fry in a small amount of oil. It is not greasy just yum-o!

Summary: Now I know what all the fuss is about...
Text:
Sylvia's is for real, y'all. I only wish I could get this mix in bulk to save a few bucks.
While the mix is good itself, I add some white pepper and MSG to perfect it.
This seasoning is very hard to find in the grocery stores.  I was very happy to find it here on Amazon.  This seasoning really gives your chicken that extra kick without being spicy.
We love this breading for chicken and the fish breading as well. We are not able to find it in our area anymore , so I ordered it here, Try it, I am sure you will love it too. The flavor is amazing!
This mix is very good.  I use it all the time.  I usually fry my chicken in flour but I don't anymore now that I found out about this.  It makes the chicken fry up so crispy.

Summary: The Best Chicken Fry Mix I've Ever Found
Text:
Sylvia's Chicken Fry Mix is simply the best! My husband and I once found it by chance at a local grocery store, and absolutely loved it. Unfortunately, the store stopped carrying it soon after, and we were never able to find it again at any other area grocery stores. Rumor had it that if I drove to the South Side, I may have been able to get it... but that was not a drive I wanted to endure.

So, one day I had an amazing idea: "Hmmm... Amazon is a place where I can find almost anything, and since I'm a Prime member, I can get free second day shipping." I gave it a shot and there it was! My day was made!

Now I have a nine pack of Sylvia's Chicken Fry that should last us for quite some time, and the product is as great as it ever was!

I ordered this because someone said something about it being better than kfc.

It's completely unlike the KFC flavor, and nowhere near as good. I really like some of Sylvia's other products but this one wasn't a home run. I ended up giving several packages to a neighbor. I knew I'd never use them. It just doesn't have "it" when it comes to the seasoning combination. I just got Kentucky Kernels seasoned flour by Hodgkins (spelling?) Mill and I love it, closest prepackaged seasoned flour to KFC yet.

Used Tony Caschere original for 12 years now and nothing else.  Every kind of meat on the grill or in the oven. On roasts, and the Christmas turkey too. Once you try it you'll know nothing else needed or wanted. ENJOY!

Nasty, nasty, nasty! Much too salty! If the "more spice" version is still far too salty, then this original kind is even worse. I can't taste the spices at all. The salt overwhelms them.

I have 17 ounces of this stuff to use up (I bought one container, not 12, thank goodness). Rather than just throw it away, I'll use it up as salt and not expect to taste any flavors.

Summary: What A Deal if you bake Irish Soda Bread
Text: This item has 32 ounces, two pounds of Caraway Seeds. If you bake its a buy.
We purchased several containers of these seeds for makeing bread.  They were very fresh, the price was reasonable, and the taste was excellent.  We consider this an excellent purchase.
If you use a lot of caraway seeds, as I do,this is an incredible buy. I'd been buying the same brand seeds at the store, 1 oz for $4.69, I can't believe the price of these, and perfectly fresh too!

This is corn beef at its best. I have tried other brands and they dont taste as good and fresh as the GRACE brand. This goes well with dumplins and ketchup or just with Cabbage and rice. However, the recommended price should not be more than $6 as you can get this in the supermarkets for less than $5. Too Pricey!

THIS COST IN THE SUPER MARKET $4.50 SO WHY I GOING TO PAY ALMOST $I6.00
FOR ONE CAN OF THIS PRODUCT?

These are by far my most favorite chocolates. They're light, flavorful, just about creamy enough, just about crispy enough, and perfect as a special treat every now and again. They're relatively hard to find in stores, so it's great to know that they're available online. The only other confection that can compare are the kinder brand milk chocolates, but those can be too sweet; these, however, are just about perfect. Shipping was very fast for me here in Southern California.
This bag of nuts is made up of broken pieces...would be great for baking cookies...they have a very rich deep flavor..and a very high fat content...but worth it..esp if you get on sale like I did!

I only received one package instead of ten: there are ten 'packages' of six cookies in each box but that equates to $1.05 per ounce, not $.11 per ounce as listed. I am going to complain. We'll see what happens.

Update: Amazon said they will replace this order. I will upgrade/change my review when the new packages arrive. (The cookies are pretty good!)

This product is basically the spices that you would put into pho broth if you were making it from scratch.  You use this instead of going out to the market looking for whole spices.  Each box contains 4 spice pouches (basically big tea bags).  You use it by cooking up some plain chicken broth or stock and adding the tea bag to the cooking broth.  After it's steeped for a while you can taste to see if the spice is strong enough for you, if not, leave it in longer.  Once you're done with it, you just remove it from the broth.  I like it much better than the powdered mixes, because I find that they are usually much too sweet and/or salty for my taste without providing enough spice.  It also allows you to control how weak or strong of broth you use.  I really liked the pho broth that resulted from this and highly recommend it.
When my daughter-in-law used them for Pho soup, they were so weak as to not impart any flavor to the soup.  Would not recommend!
There are no directions written in English on this package.  A friend of mine uses these packages to make Pho but I had to ask her for help incorporating these into a Pho recipe.
I ORDERED THE WRONG THING AND I CANNOT RETURN I WAS VERY UPSET I NEVER OPENED ANY OF THE BOXES

Easy, tasty mint tea brew. For months I used k cup just for one over sized mint tea cup, but accidently used it again and found that the weaker 2nd cup was very tasty! SO I recommend getting the best value and use it 2x for yourself and it becomes twice as good. Well worth the price for the convenience and taste. :)

I'm a big fan of mint tea - particularly peppermint.  Sadly, most mint teas are weak beverages.  In order to get a strong, clear minty flavor one has to steep tea for a long time or use more than one sachet; but not with this tea!  The Bigelow k-cups are terrific, much better than the other mint tea k-cups I've purchased in the past (Gloria's and Celestial Seasonings) in offering a bright and brisk cup of tea.  But please note: these might be a bit too vibrant for those with a more subtle palette.
This mint medley has a delightful mint tea taste and works well as in iced tea.  Being decaf is a great bonus. I use the 6 oz setting brewed over a lot of ice to make a great iced tea.

Summary: Love these K Cups!  Mint Medley Tea is awesome ! But Strong~
Text: I love my tea strong- This does great with my Keurig maker, and the tea is nice and strong- I use the large cup setting as well, and its still super strong- I love Mint Medley and am extra happy I can make it with the easy of my Keurig !!!

I've loved this flavor of tea in the regular tea bags for a long time so naturally when I got a Keurig I had to find out if they made K-Cups. I am so happy to say that they do. It comes out perfect when I use my machine on the 10oz setting. It's very refreshing and what I especially love about it is the hint of spearmint. The mint flavor in my opinion is just right- not too overpowering, but not weak. It makes great iced tea in the summer as well. Love this stuff! A++ in my book!

Rich, bold, flavorful tea which brews stronger through the Keurig Brewing System than through regular tea bags. Great for on-the-go. A larger cup selection is recommended for am milder flavor. Definitely recommended for those who enjoy their daily tea.

Marti Melville
Author of "Deja vu: Farraige"
[...]
I enjoy drinking hot tea during the day.  I drink this tea without any sweeteners and it tastes good.  I have especially enjoy this tea during this cold winter.
This K-Cup provides a VERY MINTY, refreshing taste even on the largest cup setting. Highly recommended for fresh, minty breath after the cup is done!
The flavor of this mint medley tea is awesome. It is great on a cold winter day
I love Bigelow tea. It is hard to find decaf tea for k-cups. This is a very tasty tea.
This is a wonderful tea!  The flavor is very intense, with a nice round-off from the hibiscus.  If you like a good mint tea, this is the "BAM!" upgrade!

This tea is too strong for our tastes. It's SPEARMINT and not the mint that we expected.
I think it would be better if it was less intense. If you would make a second cup and drink it, it may be ok, but I won't order it again. We prefer MINT.

I've had a couple of cups. Have sweentened with a little sugar and it is plenty minty. I bought it thinking it would be nice this winter for helping with cold symptoms and I think it will be great for that but it just a nice cup of tea for evening time. Recommend if you enjoy the flavor of mint.
This tea has the perfect amount of mint.  Not too strong, not too bitter.  I liked this tea so much, I've started buying the tea bags.
I enjoyed the flavor of the tea not too over powering. The item arrived very quikly. Definitely would order again.
Great mint tea -- smooth, not too strong, not too light.  Great when you don't want a jolt from your tea.

Summary: Could be better- very strong tea!
Text: I like to drink herbal tea every once in a while as a break from coffee.  I love Mint Medley tea bags, but it doesn't work so well in k-cup form.  It seems to come out very strong, so I add more hot water in (which kind of defeats the pupose)!  My Keuring brewer can only make an 8 oz. cup.  If your brewer can make a 10 or 12 oz. mug, this tea would probably be worth a try.  I'm sure personal taste preference is also a factor here.
My Keurig is one of the best purchases I have ever made.  I don't drink soda, I drink tea instead and Mint Medley is my favorite.  Bigelow has done a great job of getting enough tea in the K-cup.
I am addicted to the flavor of this coffee, and order it even out of season. Thank goodness Amazon keeps a good supply!

Summary: healthier than coffee once in a while
Text: Decided to get this for those days when a soothing, calming drink is needed more than the usual coffee. Good flavor for nearly instant tea. Will buy again when I run out.
my husband loves it. I am okay with it. Maybe just a tad too minty for me. might be good iced as well.
You have got to like mint, first on all; the mint flavor is outstanding.  I like the thought of making ice tea; will give it a try this summer...
There's a couple other mint tea K-cups out there that are a little stronger, but they're almost twice as expensive as the Bigelow.  The flavor and odor are pleasant, and the price is right.
This tea is not "minty" enough. I have Stash Peppermint tea bags and they are so much stronger.

I bought these because they were on sale. I thought it'd taste like the tuna salad that comes in the cans, but it tastes like nothing of the sort.
the salad is creamy and stringy with no texture of the tuna left in it like it's been mixed too much.
I will not buy this product again. Maybe I'll buy the individual tuna cups that are only tuna.

Summary: It is cheap but the taste is not good for me
Text: I bought because the price is very reasonable and low calorie.  However the flavor is not my taste.  It is very creamy but doesn't taste like tuna.  I end it up gave them to my friends.

In taste and consistency, this is nothing like any tuna or tuna salad I've ever encountered. Not a single friend I've shared this with thought it was any good. Gloppy texture. Strange sugary-pickly taste. Practically inedible.

I find the product arrives in excellent condition. It keeps well in or out of the refrigerator, unopened of course. Best taste is cold. Great for desk drawer for a quick lunch or snack at work. Great for trips or around town. Quick and easy and I find has a good taste. Some may find it has too much pepper, in that case empty into a small bowl and add some relish and or Miracle Whip or Mayo. Its great with the 99 cent salad at your fav fast food place. Comes in very handy as can be eaten right from the carton with bread or crackers. You can make 2 sandwiches from one small container or one very thick sandwich. Comes two to a carton and the 2 can easily stuff a hogie roll along with lettuct and tomato and whatever other trimmings you prefer. GREAT VALUE!!Chicken of the Sea Tuna Salad, 2- 2.8 Ounce Cup (Pack of 8)
This stuff is beyond gross.  It's seasoned with what tastes like rot, and tastes spoiled right out of the container.  You have been warned.

Summary: Is this really the brand it describes?
Text:
I'd really love to buy these rawhide chews...if indeed they are Wholesome Hide brand. That was the title of my search and this product came up. Yes, Wholesome Hide is what is in the description but not the title. The price is also almost 2/3rds lower than the nearest competitor's price, which makes me wonder. Also, is this being sold by KV Pets or by Southside Pet Barn?

I'm confused...and can't take a chance. I'm only posting this because some Amazon users don't always read the fine print. Buyer beware!

My dogs are absolutely in love with Wholesome Hide products.  It is the only brand we let them have though...  It took longer than I expected for this product to ship and the packaging was really leaving a lot to be desired (a torn up garbage bag inside a box.)  They were a deal compared to the other store that I buy these bones from, but I'm going back to the other store for the better shipping time and packaging care.

Summary: GOOD SERVICEABLE OIL AT AN ATTRACTIVE PRICE.  I LIKE THIS STUFF.
Text:
I first purchased Colavita oil a few years ago out of pure desperation and lucky. Ever have one of those days when nothing goes right? Well my wife and I were having one of those at the time. We had guests coming over for dinner, things were running late and as is our luck, we found we were completely out of olive oil. We use olive oil a lot, but it was an odd occurrence. Anyway, I rushed to a local grocery story...we were living in Virginia at the time, and being in a bit of a hurry, I grabbed the first can I came to. This happened to be Colavita. This was a very lucky break on my part.

Now I cannot look you in the eye and tell you that this oil in anyway is as good as some of the premium oils we have used in the past and still use. But what I can tell you is that for oil that is classified as a "grocery store oil," this is very nice stuff. We still use it. Now there are certain considerations to be noted here. I have looked over some of the reviews and feel a need to have my little say.

First, any olive oil that is old will taste rancid and simply will not cook well. The same hold true for an oil that is not stored correctly. If you use a lot of olive oil in your cooking, then you should buy a lot. If you use it less often, then buying in bulk, or in a large amount is a sheer waste of money. This stuff will go bad on you quicker than you think. And for goodness sakes don't store it in a clear container...that is not a good idea!

Secondly, I noted that Cook's Illustrated recently proclaimed that "all supermarket brands" of olive oil where horrid. While there may be some truth to this on some level, I must admit when I saw this, the first thing that flashed through my mind was "Aaaah, snob patrol in action again, slamming it to the unwashed masses." Personally I put about as much validity in this type of report as I did in the old Play B*y magazine article from back in the early 70s that proclaimed your kidneys and liver would drop out of place if you were a runner, and that you should stop running as it was bad for your health...yeah, like I trust my health to an article like that. Folks, you have to consider the source. Your top cooking publications are good, don't take me wrong, but a big part of their appeal is to appeal to the bit of snob that is in all of us...they write stuff like this to sell their publication and the products featured there and to make you feel good about yourself when you make an outlandish purchase.

Anyway, we have found this Colavita oil to be quite adequate for most use. We do use it for cooking and it gives off a very nice nutty/earthy aroma. It is light enough to use on most of the salad dressings we make, and we do use it extensively in the various vinaigrette and herb soaks we concoct. I will say that we do not buy this in large quantities as you can purchase it in a very nice attractive little bottle of 17 ounces...Actually we buy it two bottles at a time, always using the older bottle first and then rotating.

This certainly in not the only oil we use, but for everyday use we find that the quality you are getting for the price simply cannot be beat. Not that I would ever do it, but I dare say that you could prepare a nice salad dressing with this product and tell your guests that you used some of the "really good and really expensive stuff," and that 9 out of ten would buy off on that statement. Now don't do this because if your luck is like mine, the first one you told that to would the that one in ten I am talking about...embarrassing!

This is good oil that will not take your last dollar to purchase. I recommend it highly. I am comparing it to like oils in this price range, so I am giving it five stars.

Don Blankenship
The Ozarks

Summary: Love the oil, love the price!
Text: I have been using Colavita for years. It is one of the finest all around X-Virgin olive oils on the market. Its extremely fruity and works very well in salads and pasta dishes. I have been struggling with olive oils since I can not find it in the stores where I now live. Now I get it shipped to my door, with free freight, and at a lower price than I used to pay in the grocery store.

QUALITY
In my opinion, having used a dozen or so brands of olive oil, Colavita is simply the best reasonably priced olive oil which is widely available. I've been using Colavita for several years now, and have never been dissappointed. Colavita is excellent quality, dependable, and reasonably priced---the perfect combination for a daily general purpose olive oil.

FLAVOR
Although not an "olive oil gourmand", I'd describe Colavita as "rich, smooth, and neutral". Gourmands probably have other silly terms for the flavor, such as "fruity" (but a "civilian" would never call it fruity). It is not harsh or bitter like most common olive oil, not spicy like Whole Foods 360, and not notably "olivey". Colavita is an evoo ("extra virgin olive oil"---to us non-olive oil snobs), which means "first pressing". Most olive-oil nuts consider the words "extra virgin" to be sacred. Practically speaking though, the mere label "extra virgin" is not a guarantee of quality---most grocery store brands (evoo or not) are harsh and bitter, but some are good cooking oils.

PREMIUM OILS
Botique premium oils are are as variable year to year as wines, comparably expensive, and have to be bought the way you buy fine wine (that is, ideally at tastings, where you confirm the quality and flavor before purchase). Some are genuinely (as in NOT-gourmet-speak) buttery and nutty---great for dipping. Some taste like the fragrance of flowers---great for salads. Never cook premium olive oil---use it for dipping or drizzling, or on delicate salads. Colavita is a good general purpose oil, better than most grocery store olive oil, but is not a premium oil.

COOKING OIL
Non-extra virgin olive oils (second or later pressings) are usually darker and stronger flavored---which adds complexity to soups, sauses, stews, bean dishes etc. If you are using a bitter or strong-tasting olive oil, cook it WITH the dish. I add 1/4 to 1/2 cup of olive oil to every sause, soup, stew, chili, cassrole, or bean dish, etc. However, olive oil can "go bad"---so unless you use alot, it doesn't sense to use a different cooking oil than you use on salads, for dipping etc. One usually purchases good cooking oil in multi-gallon tins. Colavita is a very good general purpose oil, and therefore a good cooking oil---albeit a bit expensive for a cooking oil.

DIPPING OIL
Traditionally (and in the best restaurants), Italian bread, oil and balsamic vinegar is served as an appetizer. The diner usually mixes his own oil and vinegar at the table. If all three are top quality, the combination can be delicious, and can even be a light meal. Add figs or slices of apple or pear and some olives, and you do have a meal. Byzantine Fresh Olive Antipasto, 5-Pound Bag Albeit probably heresy, in fact you can substitute fine wine vinegar or fresh lemon juice. If I don't have olives, I usually add soy sause or Braggs for saltiness to the mixture. Bragg Liquid Aminos, Natural Soy Sauce Alternative, 32-Ounce Bottle , (Pack of 3) Colavita is a very good "everyday" dipping oil.

SALAD OIL
The requirements for an "everyday" salad oil are a little less stringent than that for a dipping oil, because the heavy flavor of the vinegar, and often pamessan, bacon bits, etc. usually dominate. However, I rarely prepare use oil and vinegar the traditional way. For everyday salads (or as a dip for raw vegies) I prefer olive-oil based mayo with a little freshly ground pepper, and some citrus zest. For special salads, I use a fruity premium olive oil (and just a hint of lemon and/or orange juice and zest). Colavita is a very good "everyday" salad oil.

DRIZZING OIL
A drizzling oil is an oil you pour over a dish immediately before serving, or which you serve in a carafe on the table. If you REALLY like the flavor of "ordinary good" olive oil (I don't)---then you will find Colavita to be a good drizzling oil. My hispanic wife frequently drizzles Colavita on the dishes I've cooked (with Colavita), because she likes the olive-oil flavor. By the way, the same principle applies to the use of butter, pepper, garlic, cheese, even soy sause---if you want the flavor to dominate, add it just before serving; if you want the flavor to be substle, cook the seasoning with the dish. For most dishes I prefer a rich blend of subtle flavors.

HEALTHY COOKING
I go to a great deal of effort to minimize animal fat in my diet, by very strict trimming, thorough cooking, and by chilling broth to remove the solidified fat. However, the body needs fat and craves fat. The ideal solution is to replace animal fat with vegetable oils which are high in omega-3s. Olive oil is ideal for the purpose.

My Southern grandmother could not cook any vegetables without a thick slice of fatback (fatty bacon)---and indeed her vegetables were very tasty. Speaking of which, what is the point of healthy vegetables if no-one will eat them? The solution is to add several tablespoon fulls of olive oil, and a teaspoon of chipped ham Hormel Premium Real Crumbled Bacon to the vegies. For the best flavor, cook the vegies with the olive oil (do NOT add oil to the cooked vegetables---unless you really like the flavor of the oil). Season as necessary with pepper and fresh lemon juice. Truly delicious vegetables are possible---I eat them daily.

ECONOMY
The 34 ounce tins is about half the price of the bottle per oz at this time, but is expensive compared to the last time I purchased it. The tins are small enough to use directly. But I prefer bottles, because controlling the flow of the oil is easier (since you can see the oil approaching the spout), and it is easier to gauge the amount of oil I'm using by eye (how far the level drops in the glass bottle). So, I refill bottles from the tins. I've been told that olive oil stays fresher in tins (measured in months and years) That becomes relevant when you don't know how many months (or even years) a bottle may have sat on a grocery shelf.

GENERAL RECCOMENDATION
After major grocery shopping expeditions, sit down at your computer with your reciept, and check if you can buy any of the non-perishables through Amazon. When you find items (even if more expensive than you just paid), put the item on your Amazon wish list, and add a note to the wish list of the price you just paid. Check your wish list frequently, and when you see an item you need at a bargain price, buy it.

Ordered this because, at the time, I was having trouble finding this brand in a can in my local stores. Product is pretty good and arrived with only one small dent in one of the cans and no leakage, so I guess I got lucky there.

Since ordering, it's become available in a neighborhood store in single cans at a price only slightly higher than Amazon's, which seems a little high for two cans. Given that, I'll buy locally from now on unless Amazon lowers price. The oil itself is pretty good and doesn't have that "rank" taste or smell that I associate with some EV olive oils.

In our home, we only use extra virgin olive oil (evoo), a little real butter, and sometimes a little coconut oil. 95% of the time, it's evoo. For frying and other cooking uses, I keep a large container of a store brand around. Otherwise, I use Colavita.

From what I have tasted and researched, Colavita is a great oil. I like to use it on my skin as well as cook with it. It's great to drizzle on cooked food, raw food, in homemade salad dressings, dipping, or anywhere I need a "finishing" oil. The quality and taste is there. They say a sign of quality evoo is a "bite" or catching feeling in the back of your throat when you drink it. After drinking Colavita straight, I will get that feeling in my throat within 2 to 5 seconds. It shows that the good, healthy components in the evoo are still there.

I recommend this oil as one of the best, if not the best supermarket brands of evoo.

Summary: Best olive oil for every day use
Text: We started using Colavita Extra Virgin olive oil years ago. it doesn't have the funny taste some reasonably priced oils have. It isn't cheap but beats all in its category. It is hard to find in the grocery stores now for some reason - Safeway affiliates try to peddle their own and it is not as good.

Summary: Great Olive Oil for a Bargain
Text: I go through olive oil like a mad man and Colavita is my brand.  I used to buy the glass bottles in stores that were expensive until I found these tins on Amazon.  They're very easy to open and close and the oil tastes great, in fact I would say it tastes better than from the glass.  If you're a Colavita fan or are looking for a quality olive oil brand thats not super expensive get this, you wont be sorry.

Yes there are much more expensive brands and cheaper ones,too. My wife and I buy this and Frantoia. We both like this better. I am not impressed by who cooks with what on TV. I just like this oil as it suits my taste.

Summary: Best olive oil in the US market
Text: This is truly the best olive oil you can get for a decent price in the US. It is neither waxy nor bitter in taste. It costs almost half the price (per oz) when compared to grocery stores such as Publix (South US). I highly recommend this product.

I purchased this based on the positive reviews ... I was looking for a better quality EVOO than I was using.  I've been very happy with it ... use in a lot on pasta sauces and I love the light flavor. I also recently bought Santini EVOO at Trader Joe's and that's a nice one as well if you don't want to buy thru the mail.

I happened upon Colavita by a happy mistake! Needless to say when I tried out this product I was immensely pleased, especially since after using it at a dinner party, I turned 2 other people on to the marvelous mellow and wonderful taste of Covavity EEVO.  And I can only thank Amazon.com for putting this marvelous product on their "grocery list" for me to take advantage of their discount and delivery.  Bon Appetit!!!!

This really is a nice oil.  As other people have mentioned, this is good oil to use for dipping.  It has a very nice flavor and I'm happy with my purchase.  Do note the size of these cans though before you order.  While they were fine for me, some might be expecting a larger size.
this product is equal to or better than any product on the market in my view....i really like the way over easy eggs turn out and have no after taste....buy it you will love it!!!

Summary: Colavita Extra Virgin is The Best Ever
Text: I only use the Colivata Extra Virgin Olive Oil - it's great for dressings, it's great to cook with - it has a mild flavor - it doesn't over-take the flavor of what you're cooking, but instead enhances it.

The small can in which the olive oil is stored are very handy and does perserve the fresh flavor of this very good oil. The quality
of this oil is high enough to use it as a dipping sauce, especially when mixed with fresh herbs.

Summary: good product, good price, arrived dented
Text: This is a good olive oil at a good price, but I was disappointed at how poorly packaged it was for shipping. Both tins arrived dented, one minorly and one substantially.

I'll start off with the disclaimer that neither my husband nor I are any kind of trained chef, but we do have a decent idea of what tastes good (at least to us). This olive oil is much better than anything we've used before, which is generally bought at the grocery store. Since buying it, we have made some very yummy dressings and it's great over pasta with fresh tomatoes, basil and cheese. It has a much lighter taste to it than what I'm used to as well as having a lovely nutty smell when it is heated. Lastly, we mostly decided on this product based on the price for the two tins and I think we ended up with a great item for not too much money!
Check you local grocery for a better price.  The oil is good but overpriced on Amazon.

I have not purchased this oil in this container format, but have purchased in a smaller format in the past.  It's a very good buy for the money, but let's be clear that it is not a "Good" olive oil.  True, it is extra virgin and cold pressed, but remember that any oil from large brands like Colavita, Bertolli, etc.. is filtered and mixed which means that it is not the way nature intended it.  My recommendation is that this is a great oil for cooking, and frying;fry an egg in Olive oil and you will never eat eggs another way again.  But if you want to make a simple greek salad for example, where olive and salt is the only dressing, you should go for the premium stuff that you'll find at your local gourmet food shop or in a meditteranean market.  My personal favorite (and yes I am biased because of my background) is Greek Olive oil from Messinia (southern peloponesus), but there are some varieties from Crete that are excellent as well.  Try to find one that is from a single source (meaning that it is not mixed with different varieties of olive oils to make a consistent taste), it's okay if your olive oil is different from one batch to the other, because that is natural.

Summary: Colavita extra virgin olive oil, 34 ounce tins (pack of 2)
Text: This oil is excellent, and for the time being, I only use it on italian bread adding extra spices.  The only reason I do not use it on my salads, etc., is that the item is really expensive to pour into salads and veggies.
I use this olive oil daily.  This was a great price and the free shipping made it even better.

This is a great Olive oil. Great price. I love Colavita products in general.
Delivery was fast. Shipping was a bit pricey.
this oil is great for not only health, but taste. very light great in salads and dipping

I didn't pay as much attention as I should have regarding the volume. I often see the larger cans at the speciality stores and foolishly assumed that was what I was buying. I have never seen these smaller cans at the store.
But, my own fault for not getting up from the desk and looking in my own pantry to see how much 34 ounces exactly is! Fine olive oil, I suppose. Not sure that the price is competitive, however. Will go back to Trader Joe's for such things.

104 once tin at local store $18.99.I thought I'm getting better deal at Amazon for two  this size and not 34 ounce.My bad ........... I should've pay more attention.If you have only seen my face when I opened the package ;-)I didn't know they make tiny tins like that.Funny! Too bad I cannot return it ;-(....The highest price I've seen so far in other stores is $27.99 for 3 L (104 fl oz)........still cheaper than here!!!!!!!!Check your local store!
I use this brand all the time for cooking, just like Lydia on TV. Even after paying postage it was cheaper than buying it locally. You can buy cheaper Olive Oil but you get what you pay for.

Summary: Good Oil, Good Service, Good Price
Text: This is very good oil - and the price is right.  Delivery was good too.  Highly recommended.
This is very high quality olive oil for the price.  Nice flavor and color.

The olive oil is quite good but the packaging was a little challenging for certain members of my household to figure out and the screwtop/popup spigot is now inside the first can we bought.  I will transfer the olive oil to a seperate container once one is procured.  Other then that great buy!

The oil was good for the price I paid $18.
One can came a little dented, but was ok. Amazon should
pack them tighter, when I received them, they were sliding around in the box.
I used olive oil for most of my cooking, and I like the flavor of this olive oil.

I have only purchased Berio light EVOO in the distant past.  I wanted something to take, one Tablespoon daily, and liked the 34 ounce bottle with the wired stopper. I wonder if i got "a bad batch" as the oil has a very bitter taste. It is not pleasant, nutty or fruity at all.

Summary: Colavita Extra Virgin Olive Oil, 34-Ounce Tins (Pack of 2)
Text:
The respesentation of this item is extremely misleading. It is true that the description of the item includes the correct liquid weight however the image and price shown represents the larger actual size gallon product.

Who would ever think this oil came in miniature tins replicating the larger gallon tins that is prevalent in the marketplace. The price of this product also coincides with what one would expect from the larger gallon sized product.
For 68oz totally, you can get same kind of olive oil(different brand) for $16 in Sam's.

Great tasting red fish. I thought 5 lbs would be a good amount for me. Little did I know the wife ate over half of em. Shipping is a bit expensive but they are hard to find in the sea of stores near my house.

This was on special so I decided to give it a try and I'm so happy I did!  This tea is not like any I"ve tried before.  It smells delicious and reminds me of a banana split. That sounds strange, but there is no banana taste, just a lovely fruity, vanilla flavor.

The only thing I'm suspicious about though are that "Acai berry, pomegranate and vanilla flavours" are used. Are these really "natural"?
Otherwise an EXCELLENT tea.

I just finished my first cup of Dilmah Tea. I hate fruit in my coffee, beer and especially tea but this stuff is amazing. It smelled so good I didn't even make it 5 minutes before I started sipping. The flavor was perfectly light, fragrant and divine. I'm going to see if this bag will yield another cup of tea. Even if it's half as delicious - it will still be amazing. I would definitely buy this flavor tea again and am really interested in trying Dilmah's other flavors. This tea puts all others to shame.
I loved this product, everyone that I gave a bag to raved about the freshness and taste
This had to be the worst popcorn I ever eat.Stale and came all stuck toghter.Its had a bad aftertaste.I threw the rest away.What a waste.

I purchased Popsalot Gourmet Popcorn, Pecan & Clandestine Caramel Corn , 8-Ounce Bags (Pack of 6)for a gift I was SOOO embarassed it was so STALE no one (even the kids)could or would eat it. You can not return it so I am out the money. DO NOT Purchase!!!!!!!!!!!!!

One night while visiting my friend the subject of candy came up.  "I LOVE Nerds Rope!" I enthusiastically exclaimed.  To which my friend replied, "What is a Nerds Rope?"  I was so shocked that my friend had never experienced this fantastic indulgence that I came right to Amazon and bought a 24-pack.  Excessive? Probably.  Worth it?  Totally.  If you are reading this and have never had this candy I don't know how to explain it except as the deliciousness that nerds are packed onto a gummy, fruity, rope.  In the words of Yo Gabba Gabba, "Try it.  You'll like it!"
