NO morning tea I ever drank comes close to this tea.  Refreshing, bracing, full of deep full flavor and a so full bodied, I can't imagine life anymore without a cup of this surpassing tea.  If you are a fan of breakfast teas, I think you'll agree this is the best there is!

This is one of my regular morning teas. The leaves are fine and expand to nearly 3x their dry size. The tea is robust, as an Assam should be, complex, but is just a hair heavy on tannic acid. Don't overbrew to minimize the dry tannic bite.

Review is short and sweet: no artificial or real sweeteners are needed. Added bonus, flavor is strong enough to add to another glass of water, making it a bargain. Wish this were in every soda machine the world over rather than the sugar water out there. GREAT product.

Summary: Pretty darn good water with zero caleries!
Text: If you are tired of tasteless water, then you are in for a surprise with Hint! I've only tried the Honeydew-Hibiscus but will try others. It's also great for the gym.
it was a very interesting and healthty product.  at first i was a little leary of it cause it wasn't as sweet as i like drinks but i ended liking it and it was a great price.

Summary: Tastes like Potpourri, but makes good bong water.
Text: I ordered this water after receiving a glowing recommendation from a friend. The shipping was quick, as always (1 star), but the product is simply not edible. I tried my best to finish a bottle, yet ended up pouring into the extra cat bowl; where Chief, my 5 month old kitten, decided it was better than his normal water(2 stars). Now stuck with a full case of flower power flavored water, I decided to try it out as bong water, and my -I was impressed (3 stars). The flowery essence matched well with the pungent bubba kush I had.

I love this clean, unsweetened drink.

I taste both the Hibiscus and the Honeydew Melon and I think it's fantastic. I sometimes put half of a bottle in a tea pot and add warm water for a warmer drink.

We have opted for the subscribe and save program for over a year with this flavor and my husband prefers and very much likes the Pear flavor. What a great program.

We used to get the Blackberry and the Watermelon which are very good too but narrowed it to our two favorite flavors to be delivered once every other month. Lately though we have increased the delivery to 1 or 2 times a month.
I love the aroma of this water.  I love the fragrance, and the blend of Hibiscus and honeydew is great.  No sugar, no additives, no cal. or other junk; more reason to love it.
I love Hint water but this flavor taste more like a hibiscus than it does honeydew. I do not like the taste of flowers so i do not like this one.
I love most of the hint waters, but this one was too flowery/perfumey for my tastes. It tasted kind of artificial. I won't be purchasing this flavor again

Summary: HINT ---- Simply the best bottled beverage.
Text:
I started drinking Hint Water a few years ago when Smartwater discontinued its similar line of no-calorie, no-artificial-sweetners, lightly flavored waters. I find that I drink a lot more water during the day with these than with filtered water. The taste is absolutely wonderful and refreshing ---- just a tiny hint of flavoring. No syrupy flavor like all the trendy "fitness drinks" out there and no carbonation or harmful artificial sweetners like with diet soda.

I was an absolute Diet Coke junkie for fifteen years until I found this product. No hyperbole ---- it's literally the only thing that I can keep in the fridge that will keep me away from Diet Coke. It might seem a bit pricey, but for my health I think it is worth every penny. I just wish they would stock a larger size so I wouldn't feel so bad about all of the discarded plastic bottles. Also, this may seem a small point but I am a sculptor and thoughtful graphic design is very important to me. I always get compliments when I hand these out to guests ---- both on the flavor and the wonderful packaging.

My favorite flavors are the pear and the watermelon. They are very subtle. My husband's favorite is the honeydew-hibiscus. I like it, too, but it has a tiny sour floral tang to the taste.

Overall, I cannot recommend this product highly enough.

I have been drinking Hint waters for a long time.  I don't use artificial sweeteners or carbonation, so these wonderful waters fit the bill perfectly!!! I love the Pear, the Honeydew Hibiscus and the Mango Grapefruit!  No calories, refreshing, flavorful, what more could you ask for!!  And oh yeah.....free shipping! YUMMY!
Love this water and especially the Honeydew-Hibiscus flavor.  I have it on subscription and look forward to the day it arrives.  Just water with light flavoring and nothing else.
I have tried all Hint flavors. This is my second least favorite, the least favorite is cucumber. This one tastes like eating a flower. No honeydew here.

I ordered several flavors of the "Hint" water and all of them taste very medicinal to me.  I was expecting a little more "hint" of flavor of whatever was on the label.  Not so...I had to add Crystal Lite to them just to make them palatable, which obviously defeats the purpose of buying flavored water in the first place.  The one big plus is that they are not carbonated, but otherwise...YECK!

Summary: It's Water with a hint of Honeydew....
Text: I recently purchased this water expecting to get a nice refreshing drink with a hint of Honeydew-Hibiscus flavor. Well, in the end there isn't much flavor, and it's basically water. And of course water is very refreshing, but I was expecting a little more than just the occasional linger of honeydew flavor, but absolutely no hint of hibiscus. This one is definitely better than the blackberry version that HINT offer, but I wouldn't rush out to recommend it.
This is a really great product, not sweet at all. The name describes it perfectly. However I am not sure why it is $40 a case. I would buy it in the store. Much cheaper
Seriously, the worst gas I've ever experienced from candy.  Started like 20 minutes after eating the first one and last for a day.

The sugar-free Jordan almonds are outstanding! The coating around
the almond has a great flavor and the almond itself is very good.
Buy lots of these, they won't last long!
Great emergency storage size at a great price. Will mix the Dark w/ the Breakfast Blend. Order enough to get free shipping and you're way ahead of the game.

Summary: Does not taste anything like curry
Text: I've been buying curry powder from different companies for about 20 years. This powder does not taste anything like curry powder. I even can't tell you how it tastes because it's the first time that I taste something like this. All I can tell you is that the taste is not pleasant. I think they made a mistake in mixing the ingredients. I got a refund on it.

I bought this coffee because it was on sale and I couldn't pass it up.  Turned out to be a great purchase.  The coffee is strong and buttery.  It doesn't have that bitterness that some strong coffees have.  It's robust, has a deep flavor, and a smooth finish. If you love coffee it's worth the cash.

This is a thick mole paste that you'd thin down with hot water to make mole sauce. I got one jar of it at the grocery store and found it to be too salty for my taste and it had a bit of a metallic aftertaste. That could be an off jar, but the saltiness turned me off from it. There are better canned/jarred moles out there.

Shame amazon has it for so much. Good product but I'd recommend a local supermarket.

I use this for chicken tamales all the time.
DON'T USE WATER.
Mix a few* tablespoons with a small can of tomato sauce. It really tames it and tastes much better.

This is the best mole I have ever used! My husband, who is hispanic, says that this sauce is very close to authentic as you can get without making it from scratch.
Anyone who likes mole will love this!

Initially learned about this product from a friend who brought it back from Mexico;
Fortunately I checked Amazon and your customer stocked it...It was great.
A very good product...the only problem was...as well packaged as it was...the oil
did manage to seep from two bottles...after-all shipping oil laden products is
quite difficult. Dona Maria Mole
This sauce is OK, but you have doc it up to make it your own. It would have been helpful if they gave recipe suggestions or a website to get recipes.  Larger print would have been nice too.
I bought this as a Christmas gift for my son-in-law.  He loves it. If he likes it, that's good enough for me.
A perfect blast from the past for a friend for christmas. She was very suprised that they still made them.

Summary: Not for the weak of tooth
Text: This is a delicious (I might even say addictive) candy from Spain.  It's one of several turrons that my husband, who was from Spain, went looking for every Christmas in small Spanish groceries around Atlanta.  This candy brought back memories of him (now deceased), and of good treats from Spain during the holidays.

Summary: Healthy, and Tasty, but not for everyone
Text:
I originally discovered this product at Whole Foods when looking for a healthy fiber-rich carb source to add to my daily breakfast, and think the taste of this is absolutely great. If you are used to a high sugar baked bean product (eg, Heinz Baked Beans), this will surely be less sweet, however. My girlfriend, who also eats healthy, seems to only taste one ingredient in this - the Sorghum, and doesn't like it at all.

I'd suggest trying it once (if you can buy it in a local supermarket, buy just one), and if you like it, buy it in bulk from amazon as the price is much better here.

Summary: Healthy - Yes! But The Taste? - Hard To Swallow
Text:
"Eden Organic Baked Beans" have some great things going for it. Low salt, fat free,cholesterol free, organic, a good source of,protein(8 g per serving),potassium, calcium and iron.All those things are what I'm looking for and the only reason I give 2 stars. But the one area they are lacking is good taste. I am not new to low sodium foods. I have been using and on the look out for it for years. Always trying to find something that tastes good as well as is healthy. The products seem to be getting better and better and I have recommended several items. My favorite at this time is Amy's brand. I would especially recommendAmy's Light in Sodium Organic Minestrone Soup, 14.1-Ounce Cans (Pack of 12) (see my review for details)to anyone trying to switch over to low sodium as an example of how good it can be. But Amy's didn't have any low sodium baked beans, so I decided to give this Eden brand a try.

I guess if i could only use one word to describe the taste - it would be "blechhh". It leaves a horrible sour sort of after taste in my mouth that makes me shudder, and they are really dry going down. I wouldn't recommend buying these in bulk. If you see these at your local market and want to try a can for yourself, that would be advisable, but have some applesauce or some other favorite side to wash these down.

One other good thing I could say is that they have a long shelf life. Which is where they will stay - on my shelf - unless I have some big emergency, and even then I'd have to be desperate.

Ingredients for those interested are:
Organic Navy beans,Water,Organic Sorghum,Tomato Puree,Organic Apple Cider Vinegar,Organic Mustard seed,Organic Onion and spices, sea salt.

Sorry but this is one healthy product I can't recommend.....Laurie

I had such high hopes for these. I really wanted an easy quick and healthy meal for my toddler on those days we spend too long at the park and needed a really quick lunch before nap time. I thought I'd throw some cut up soy hot dogs in with these and it would be like 'healthy franks and beans.' Not so much. The taste was just awful. I wound up using them up in chili to hide the flavor. I was so sad because these were the only Eden Organic canned items at my Whole Foods. Glad I found a wider variety on Amazon, but I will be sure this time to have a recipe planned for them rather than eating them plain!

Summary: A little different, but still good.
Text: I have been looking for canned organic baked beans for quite some time, since my children love them and I don't always have the time to make them from scratch.  When I saw Eden made organic baked beans I immediately bought a case and prayed they would taste decent.  My prayers were answered when I opened the first can of beans and tried them.  They are a little different, for me anyway, but overall they are quite tasty.  The only "complaint" I have is the sorghum.  I'm just not used to it!  I'm more used to baked beans being made with brown sugar or maple syrup, so the sorghum is a little strong for me.  However if I add just a tbsp of grade b maple syrup or agave nectar it sweetens it right up for me.  And of course my children just love them and always ask for seconds :)  The can lining being bpa-free was also a major selling point and plus for me.  Who could ask for more?  Thank you Eden for another satsifying prodcut!

Vegan. Organic. Kosher pareve. Fat free. Low salt. Beautiful homemade flavor. Best vegan baked beans I have ever tried. Wow. Eleven stars. Very high quality. Great side dish, with rice, on crackers, or "on toast" for breakfast (or anytime) as our friends in the U.K. love to do. Approx. 525 calories, 28g protein, 0g fat, and 455mg sodium per can. Made with organic navy beans, organic sorghum, organic tomato puree, organic apple cider vinegar, organic mustard seed, organic onion, organic spices, and sea salt. This review is out there for those for whom this makes a difference. See all of my reviews for more great choices. Check out "Vegan Grocery Favorites" and "Vegan Grocery Top Ten" in Listmania. Your "helpful" votes count and will be greatly appreciated to benefit the search of others. Thank you.

Summary: Tasty beans and I trust the brand
Text: These beans may be a bit bland for some, but I found them very enjoyable.  You can always add to them if there is need for more flavor/sweetness.  I'm very concerned about bpa being in cans of the foods we eat, and I know that the cans of beans by Eden do not have bpa.  Another huge plus.

I picked up a can of these at my local grocery store. I love baked beans and am always looking for new kinds to try. I prefer organic beans and BPA free cans, so these seemed to fit the bill. I happily opened the can and heated them in a pan on the stove. The smell was not appetizing, but I figured I needed to taste them to make up my mind. I took a bite. Oh my, are they terrible! I mean really terrible. I don't know how Eden screwed up baked beans so badly, but they really did. I offered them to my dog, who loves beans, and she took one bite and stopped. Then she looked at me like I was punishing her. Sorry, doggie!

Summary: Very good product, very bad price
Text: The product quality is great, but the seller is really taking advantage of the limited distribution of the Stella D'Oro brand due to the ongoing strike. The retail price clearly marked on each package is $2.79, so a case of 12 packages should retail for $33.48 plus shipping. Since the cost of this product is $47.95 plus shipping for a case of 12 packages, make sure you really are desperate for a Stella D'Oro before ordering.
If you are into Lebanese cooking, this is a must have. I like to also put a couple of drops with my water. It is wonderful. Cortas is a true brand made in Lebanon, not the fake stuff.

Recived very quickly. Found a recipe that called for this , so this was first time trying
Product is very strong only need a drop or 2

I love this product - and the rosewater also.  I use the in my humidifier at night for aromatherapy, and also in my iron to impart frangrance in my clothes.  This seller was quick; items were well-packed, and price was very affordable.

I have been buying this product from my local Mediterranean market, but I started ordering it online when the shop stopped restocking them. The Packaging was great to ensure none of these broke, and the quality of the water is intense and great as always. Would definitely recommend this brand to anyone as well as the rosewater form this brand.

I have tried this Turkey chili several times. It is very good for a lower fat product. The flavor is very similar to regular Hormel Chili no beans, but a little bit dryer tasting. Still in all very tasty.

I 'discovered' this product at Walmart; it's not available at my local grocery. This product is not greasy (as implied on the label) and tastes great. It's not a substitute for a good home cooked meal, but it will serve you well in a pinch. Highly recommended.

Summary: a product to kill your health
Text:
I bought this product today 06-28-2010 and upon serving it it had to be thrown out in the 15oz can it states 51%sodium sorry to admit i did not bother to read before i bought ,it should be against the FDA standard to put that much salt in a product ,we had to throw it out trust me I will imform everyone not to buy this product
Do you not have anyone you does quality control,taste what you put on market to possible kill someone with a problem that can't tolerate salt
not a happy camper----I am refering to Hormel chilli turkey no beans 98%fat free====51%salt
oleta

Summary: My bulldog & girlfriend both love this food!
Text:
Don't make the mistake of thinking I meant that my girlfriend eats this as well... LOL
The way the food is designed to help keep it in his mouth instead of all over the floor is just great. She just loves the fact that she does not have to clean up after Blaze tears through a bowl of it!

As for flatulence... Sometimes this dog farts so loud people turn and look at me like I have some sort of problem! I stopped trying to explain that it's the breed since they usually don't stick around very long due to the horrid aroma that exudes from his anus... After switching to Royal Canin, I noticed him put on a few extra pounds of lean weight. His coat also picked up a great shine to it.

All in all I will say the price is a little high, but you know the old saying "you get what you pay for". If you decide that a bulldog is the dog for you then at least do him a favor and get him this food!

My dog weighs 55lbs. & is 4 yrs old
#30lbs usually lasts about 1 1/2 months

Summary: Royal Canin Keeps my Bulldog Running and Happy
Text: I had concerns that Royal Canin had changed the Bulldog formula too much.  However, after comparing the old ingredients to the new ingredients I decided to stay with Royal Canin.  I gradually switched to the new food the switch was successful.  My bulldog did have a day or two of gas during the switch, but that is no longer a problem.  Will purchase again because my bulldog's coat looks beautiful and she loves the food.  I also use softened Royal Canin as training treats during our walks.

We have given our bulldog Iam's for most of his 12 years. Over the last year he has lost a significant amount of weight and had grown several bald spots. Knowing the normal life expectancy of a bulldog we had assumed the inevitable was upon us. However my wife saw the reviews for this food and we decided to give it a try. The results are amazing. He put on weight - returning to his normal size - and his coat looks better than it has in years. The bald spots have regrown hair over the past two months and the overall sheen is great.
We could not be more happy to have found this 'fountain of youth' food. Atticus even feels up to visiting parks and playing with other dogs. After a couple days of adjustments, even the flatulence seems to have improved. This product easily gets five stars despite the cost. We are a Royal Canin family from now on.

If you have a bulldog, you are probably aware of the room clearing gas that a bulldog can produce.  This is the first bulldog food which has eliminated that problem and is probably worth its huge price. If it were not for the high price, I would have given it 5 stars.  For now, I will keep purchasing it.

After going through Blue Buffalo and Eukanuba, we finally settled on this food after my Bulldog's gas pretty much completely stopped after about 3 days on Royal Canin. My 1.5 year-old Bulldog has been on this food for about 8 months (Royal Canin Medium Puppy before then but after the other brands). It is so nice to have a non-flatulent Bulldog! Her coat is shiny and smooth. She has never had any hotspots or allergies. I started her off before Royal Canin supposedly switched recipes (red and white bag to gold bag) but did not notice any reactions from my Bulldog to the new recipe. If you abide by the recommended feeding amount on the bag, you should have a nice, lean bulldog and you can avoid the medical issues and vet bills that accompany overweight Bullies. I highly recommend this food as it keeps my dog healthy and active!

Our dog loves it. Easy for her to pick up this food. She had an allergic reaction to her previous food although she had been on that food for some time without any problems. She broke out with bumps all over her back. The breeder told us that she had experienced this also and told us to try this food instead and it worked. It is definitely worth the cost.

We have been feeding our Bulldog this food for almost all of the 6 years we have had him and he loves it. We have noticed consistently small stools, virtually no gas, great skin and coat health, and best of all, our dog has never gotten tired of this food. We normally mix in a different brand every six months or so to keep things interesting for him, but every time we have tried another food on its own without the Royal Canin, our dog does seem happy or interested.

Another great point of this food is how little our dog eats. He is about 75 lbs. and only eats 2 cups of food a day. His weight stays consistent with only daily walks. He is an apartment dog and sometimes it is difficult to get him a lot of exercise.

We are very happy with this food and so is our dog. Best of all he is very healthy and we only see our vet for annual check ups.

This food is really excellent for bulldogs.  My 2 bulldogs prefer it over all other dry dog food and they have way way less gas issues.  It is the only thing I have given them for the past couple years.
Our bully is 1.5 years old. He loves this food. Clearly there is less mess to clean up due to the unique shape of the food. He still passes gas but without aroma therapy.

Summary: Daisy The Bulldog Loves Royal Canin
Text: Daisy very much enjoys the Bulldog 24, it agrees with her digestive system.  She still has flatulance, but much less than with her previous food.  Would suggest use to fellow English Bulldog owners.
I have a Frenchie. This is one of the few foods that I've found that really reduces his gas. Better for him and better for me.

My bulldog does so well on this food, I doubt I will ever switch him off of it. It has helped tremendously with his gas, which I once thought I was doomed to deal with the rest of his life. His coat is shiny and pretty, and his weight is just perfect according to the vet. He also doesn't eat as fast as he used to (I think the shape of the kibble forces him to slow down), which is of course a good thing!

Summary: The Only food for my French Bulldog
Text: My 3 year old French Bulldog was raised on the Puppy version and now the adult. The shape of the food means he has to slow down when eating and cant just swallow it whole. It keeps his gas under control as well (notorious for bulldogs). He's at a healthy weight, skin and coat look great and always get compliments from the Vet on his overall condition. It's more expensive then the grocery store food, but Bulldogs have certain needs that can be properly met with traditional dog food. If you have a bulldog (any variety) This is the food you should be feeding them.

My vet recommended that we use this product for a special "treat" for our dogs.  We don't have Bulldogs but my dogs go crazy when we pull out the container and give them these chunks as treats for good behavior.  It's nutritious and good for them and they think they are getting something really special!

My BD is about 20 months old and has been on this food since he was a year. He weighs about 54 pounds and each bag lasts about 6 weeks.

This food definitely helps with flatulence. It is not completely gone but much better. As some people have mentioned the shape is very beneficial to allowing them to pick up the food easier making less mess.

I save about $6 a bag having it delivered to the house. The only thing that would make this better would be a subscription service.

Summary: So much easier and a little cheaper
Text: My 5 year old English bulldog has never had anything but the food.  Its so much easier to just order it every month and have it shipped than go to the pet store and be tempted by all the toys and treats, lift the bag, etc.

My English Bulldog loves this food.  He thought it was treats when we were switching him off of Eukanuba.  It's easy for him to eat.  The only hard part is not every pet store sells this food.  The Petsmart near us has it, but the Petco doesn't.  The price is cheaper on Amazon, plus if you are a prime member is free shipping.

I have been feeding this food to my bulldog for the past four years and out of all the brands I've tried, this has been the best!  I hear people say all the time what bad gas their bulldogs have, but I don't have that problem with mine, and I am sure that what I feed  him makes a huge difference.  I would definitely recommend this food!

This dog food pricing is getting out of hand and the manufacturer of the top quality dog food products are NOT offering many coupons or breaks on pricing. AMAZON is almost ten dollars cheaper and (to date) no taxes and as a PRIME MEMBER free delivery? No brainer and prompt service. Now if you guys could only come and cut my English Bulldog's nails!
I have tried many good honeys but this is by far the best ever,you'll never want clover or orange blossom after this!Please keep stocking this as there is no substitute nearly as good.

The honey is a mid amber color. It was good but not the best honey I've had. Sweet and thick. Be warned, you will probably NOT receive the Comvita honey pictured.  Instead I received a generic New Zealand Raw honey.
This is one finger licking good honey.Don't waste in tea or on toast.Keep this for eating right from jar.Taste is the best i've have yet.Eat 2-3 tea a day makes me feel great every day.

This Honey is perfect, it has just the right consistency and the flavor is great, if you arent used to REAL honey the look
and texture may throw you off a bit but trust me dont worry, after using it several times I have fallen in love with it and
knowing it is All Natural truly puts my mind at ease! Thanks for this great product!
This is good, but not Comvita honey. Comvita is more expensive and better. This is an acceptable alternative at a cheaper price.

Once again I did NOT receive COMVITA Raw Honey.  This is not the first time that the supplier substituted another New Zealand honey for the Comvita Honey which I had ordered.  The two are not the same and I will not order the 35.2 ounce jars again because I do not have this problem when I order Comvita honey packaged in small jars.

Okay - I was told by Amazon that my review was way too short and I only needed to post a review of the actual product itself. I made a comment about the shipping charges being way too expensive but - whatever. It needs to be said.

Anyway! About the chorizo itself - it is as a chorizo should be. I was looking for the small links that I grew up with that we used so much in our dishes. There are so many products out there that you can buy that don't even come close to what the real thing should be. And this is the real thing - alot of paprika. I still have 2 links left that I am saving for a rainy day. And despite the shipping charges, I would buy these again.

Summary: This is a wonderful wing sauce
Text:
I saw a bottle of this at my local grocer. I love jalapenos and seeing a red jalapeno sauce made it a must buy.

The sauce was not what I expected, I was expecting a thin vinegary kind of Mexican hot sauce. This sauce is much thicker than that, but not as thick as ketchup. It is a bit tangy with a balance of sweet and heat. The label says "Very Hot", but it will only seem this way to those who are more sensitive to heat than the average spicy food fan.

After my first taste the first thing that came to mind was hot wings. They have the perfect tangy/sweet/hot sort of flavor profile, along with a consistency that lends itself very well to sticking to wings (both cooked and raw). It is also thick enough to be brushed on wings while they are being cooked on a grill. I began to wonder if the brand name was called "Bufalo" because it was intended to be used for wings, but after some research I found out that the company name precedes Buffalo Wings by quite a long time, the name is pure coincidence.

As a wing sauce this stuff is a welcome addition. It is a very slight change from your standard hot wing flavor, being made with Jalapenos, while still very true to the flavor you expect from hot wings. As a hot sauce on its own it is good but each time I try it on something else I keep coming back to how much this tastes like a wing sauce.

I recommend giving this stuff a try to see what you think. Definitely try it on your next set of wings. My next bottle will be the larger sized bottle because I plan to make some more wings with this stuff.
This summer I had a dinner party and served this tea. Very refreshing and everyone loved it. Also, the lemon flavor and peach flavor were a big hit.  Although I don't see lemon flavor listed here.

This bacon-flavored salt can be used on pretty much anything to give it a little extra (non-fat, probably non-pork) flavor. I've even used it to season other meats (hamburgers, chicken), which is probably a little strange and just one of the things that gives Americans a bad name in the rest of the world :)

Good stuff, albeit a tad pricey...but then again, a shaker of this size will probably last the average user a year or two (and if it doesn't, you've got bigger problems than reading reviews of what flavor of salt to buy on Amazon).

I've been using this for about 8 months now, have used it for gifts for holidays. Spread the word! Try 1 tsp in 8 oz of mayo and you've got Baconnaise...great for dips and sandwiches. Add a little milk or buttermilk to that and you've got a great salad dressing. Use it on and in almost everything to give a new layer of complexity to your dishes. Use a little and it adds a new layer of depth and flavor, add a lot for the distinct bacon flavor.

You might as well get the big jug, as it is very reasonable for what you'll get. There's enough in the jug for you to share your Baconsalt with friends, without cutting your supply short. Believe me, your friends will be scratching at the door for more.

This stuff just might be the best new product of 2008....and 2009! The boys that invented this stuff are getting rich...the stuff is VERY popular. With good reason.

Let the sunshine in! You'll love this. Plus, IT'S KOSHER so your jewish friends can get in on the fun!

This season salt is AWESOME~ we love the flavor of bacon but hate the calories so this is a perfect solution. Great so far on eggs,added to brisket and green beans. We will keep on experimenting with it.

Summary: Bacon salt? More like AWESOME salt!
Text:
Okay, let's get this out of the way - There is no bacon in this product. In fact, there are no pork or any other kind of animal parts in this product. It's kosher and even vegetarian-friendly.

So for everyone complaining that it doesn't "taste identical to bacon," get over it.

This offers a BACONY taste with zero guilt to easily add bacon-goodness to any dish you can imagine.

Some things I've found that NEED bacon salt:

Chicken salad
Potato salad
Salad
Veggie dip
Veggies (radishes dipped in bacon salt = WIN)
Casseroles

And probably tons of other stuff I'm not thinking about. This stuff is so versatile and delicious it's absurd.
I laughed when I saw the first Bacon Salt product.  Now I cannot cook, BBQ or eat a meal without using a little of this wonderful line of products.

I love this stuff. It makes the best baconless, lettuce and tomato sandwiches. Just toast your bread, slice up a tomato, ad some lettuce and mix a little J&Ds Bacon Salt with the mayo and you have a delicious low cal bacon, lettuce and tomato sandwich. It is also great when making soup(don't need all the fat from bacon or ham) to flavor it up nicely. I love it on eggs, grits, baked beans, even salads, you name it. All the flavor of home country cookin without any of the fat and calories of using the real pig. YUM!

Summary: Not a pure bacon flavor; simply a smoky sesoned salt.
Text:
Dissappointing purchase. This Bacon Salt by J & D is touted to be a true bacon flavored salt; yet tastes nothing like bacon. The best I can describe this product is "a seasoned salt with an artificial smoke flavoring; no bacon flavor".

This was too expensive to dump; will use it up & not buy again.
Wish I'd found this stuff a long time ago.  My family loves it on eggs, pork chops, hambergers, and more.

Bacon salt is AWESOME!!  It goes well on anything you throw on the grill and it is crazy good on popcorn.  I use it as much as humanly possible on just about everything.  I would totally recommend it to anyone who enjoys the flavor of bacon but not the choloesteral of it.  It tastes JUST like bacon and is low in sodium

Being a Bacon lover I have to say that J & D's Bacon Salts are wonderful. I initialy tried a variety pack (Good starter) and have Restocked periodicly. you will love this product and they are always adding new items.
Great on Grits, Mac and Cheese, Eggs, Veggies maybe everything!
This bacon salt is absoutly amazing.  We use it on almost everything.  Eggs, salads, vegetables.  My two toddlers eat zucchini because of bacon salt.  I have my whole f amily addicted to it to now.
This item is easy, convenient, inexpensive and adds a nice bacony flavor to a multitude of various foods.  Great on baked potato and popcorn!!

Summary: Doesn't make anything taste like bacon
Text: because it isn't bacon.  It tastes like Baco's, which don't taste like bacon.  I fail to understand how anyone who really loves bacon can be satisfied with an imitation.
Barely has a hint of the taste of bacon. Tastes more like the main ingredient..paprika. It's not terrible...just nowhere near tasting like real bacon.

Summary: Less Than the Sum of its Parts
Text:
I LOVE bacon. And I LOVE salt.

I expected my head to explode when I tried this, but was disappointed with how artificial and un-bacon-y it tasted. I didn't like the taste to much on it's own so it hasn't replaced my regular brand of plain old sea salt.

The nutrition facts are listed on here but the ingredients are not (or at least I couldn't find them.) This product contains CORN SYRUP, MSG and PARTIALLY HYDROGENATED VEGETABLE OIL (which is a TRANS FAT.) To add insult to injury, I can't return the product. I wouldn't even want to donate it, inflicting sugar, MSG and trans fats on someone else. Buyer beware.

Summary: Better to make your own... Not bad but not as good as home made
Text: Anyone who has a food processor can make far better... And you can make better by using real bacon!  For what this large cannister of bacon salt cost me I could have fried up 3 lbs of lean crispy bacon, bought a cannister of salt, pulled all the fat off my crisp bacon and tossed that bacon in the food processor with the sharp blade until it was pulverized to a fine powder.  Then I add the salt and pulse it a few times to incorporate as I think that salt probably isn't the best for my sharp metal blade.  Instant bacon salt and way better!  Want the other flavors?  Add a few drops of hickory liquid smoke to pick it up a notch.  Jalapeno bacon salt?  Buy some fresh jalapenos and dry them in the oven then toss them in with the bacon when you pulverize.  This isn't rocket science and I agree with other posts... if ya want to know what this tastes like just buy a bottle of bacos and smash them into a salt like substance to sprinkle around.  I am not a fan of bacos as they taste like all smoke and salt with a fake bacon taste you burp up for the next 2 hours.  Home made is way better but I got to hand it to the inventors of this... they are getting rich!  Great Idea!  Maybe someday they'll add a "natural line" made with real bacon.

It goes well with popcorn ,eggs Pizza and as a general condiment however I would not compare to the real taste of Bacon, a delightful alternative for the diet conscious person , I will buy again though when i run out.
Arrived as described and on time. It's a little pricey for a seasoning, but it's worth it. The bigger bottle makes it a little easier justify. ;)

Summary: Not a very strong bacon flavor
Text:
This Bacon Salt tastes more like the paprika that's in it than it does like bacon. I guess I was expecting something like ground up Bac O's, with a real bacon flavor even though it's vegetarian. The taste isn't bad, it's salty, but you have to use a really lot of it on anything to have the bacon flavor come through. And when you use too much, it's just too salty.

I wanted something I could put on popcorn or on spinach salad or vegetables. This didn't taste great on any of them. I have a smoked paprika seasoning by another company that tastes more like bacon than this does.

I think they need to go back to the drawing board on this one. The concept is good, but the end result is not. I'm going to cancel my order for the jalapeno version based on this.

Update - 8/6/12 - I just realized that I still have about 3/4 of this bacon salt in my cupboard. I guess that's a good indicator of how much I liked it.
It tasted more like BBQ potato chips than bacon, but it's an interesting flavor to add to food.

Bacon Salt isn't a terrible food additive standing alone. To my mind, however, nothing that costs over two dollars -- I paid $5 for a little bottle -- should contain both corn syrup *and* trans fats. (Why does a spice need fat?) I probably shouldn't have paid for it, but I heard rave reviews and was sucked in by the prospect of making my spinach salad taste like hot, salty, fatty pork. For the money, I can't say it's worth the price.

Also, it's a major "caker." Don't use it for a month, and you've got a brick of barbecue potato chip seasoning.

Summary: Flavor okay - but not gluten free!
Text: J&D's Original Bacon Salt 16-Ounce Bottle I purchased the large bottle of this, and used it a few times. It is what I would say so-so on the bacon flavor, but okay. However, my daughter read the ingredients, and we found that is has wheat in it, which is a no-no for gluten free diets. Bacon salt speaks to me of bacon flavored salt, not something made with wheat. Ergo, most of the bottle is in my cupboard, and I will not be re-ordering. Disappointed, because who doesn't love bacon?

Summary: Hints of bacon only, but still good.
Text: The Bacon Salt had hints of bacon, but it did not taste "just like" bacon by any means.  Of course, I didn't expect that because it's pork free and kosher.  It is a delicious seasoning and definitely adds a little extra pizazz to your food.  It's good on meats and vegetables alike.
Taste like BBQ chips! Taste nothing like bacon. I would put money on it that this wouldn't pass a blind taste test as being close to bacon.

Summary: Excellent food for dogs who need lower protein then orijen
Text: Acana is manufactured by a canadian company that is also a maker or orijen, but its designated for dogs who dont do well on high protein, which was a case with my dog, hes moderately active 3 year old weim, but was putting on weight on orijen, so this was a great addition to his diet. He loves the taste just the same and I've had no issues with it, glossy coat, lots of energy, no ear or eye infections. Plus I like that fact thats they use free range chickens which appeals to my ethical side, since I only buy organic and free range myself.

We have tried MANY different foods trying to find a food that doesn't cost an arm and a leg, but gave our dogs the proper nutrition they needed as well as the health benefits they deserved. We have a dog with super bad allergies and this food hasn't gave us any issues. We have tried california natural (couldn't digest the rice), organics (had an allergy to an ingredient) and then taste of the wild (feed over 15 lbs a week between 2 medium sized dogs!) and now we are on acana and this food is worth it! You feed less because it has higher nutrient values therefore they poop less and you save money, and our vet says they are some of the healthiest dogs they see! Acana is well worth the money, it is made from Orijen which is a very good company!

Summary: Highly rated - and my keeshonden love it!
Text: I have two 6-year-old rescue keeshonden to which I feed a grain-free diet. The three grain-free Acana varieties are the major portion of their food rotation.  One of my two has a delicate constitution and cannot handle the foods with the highest level of protein.  However, they both do extremely well on the moderate-protein Acana.  Other foods with which they have had success are Canidae, Instinct, Barking at the Moon, and Wellness Core. But for the past several months, it has all been Acana.  Acana is highly-rated by dog food rating organizations.  It is made by Champion Pet Foods in Canada, which also makes Orijen.  Champion uses local sources for their ingredients - nothing from China or other questionable areas.  Sometimes I think my dogs eat better than I do!

I purchased this after the Taste of the Wild recall. My dog is a 2 year old Border Collie, extremely active and sensitive to high protein foods. We have done Orijen before, but the protein levels brought out aggression in him and he put on a bit of weight despite lack of change in amount or exercise (he runs on average 8 miles/day). I am extremely happy with this food and do not plan to switch! It is pricey, but having him on grain free means our only vet visits are the annual check up. He is extremely happy and friendly on Acana, his coat looks great (shiny, very little shedding), and his breath has even improved since eating TotW. We will be feeding only Acana from now on!

The 5 star review is totally accurate. This is an expensive food, for some that might be an issue. But if you can work out the cost factor, all I can say is my dog loves this and he no longer bites his paws. We had huge issues with his paw biting for a long time, even when we had him on California natural. It seemed like nothing we did worked, until we switched to Acana. He's happy now, and he is super excited to get his food. And I mean like way too excited, he will quickly pace back and forth and whine until he gets it.

Summary: Let your dogs be the judge!
Text:
I have two Cockapoos age 8 and 6 and have always gone out of my way to find the best rated healthy dog foods for them. Unfortunately they have never been crazy about any of the many brands I have tried which to name a few have been Evanger's, Solid Gold, Taste of the Wild. They would eat a few bites and leave the bowl or maybe not even eat a few bites but turn their noses up.
We are now on our second bag of Acana and I can honestly say that when the food is put out into each of their bowls there is no walking away until the bowls have been emptied. Great! Finally found one they love! I think the first bag was the Pacifica and they seem to like the Wild Prairie the best. I worry about heavy metals in fish these days so I think I'll stick with Wild Prairie for a while.

This dog food is so hard to find. I was driving nine miles a week to get a little bag, waiting for them to get the 30 lb. bag I ordered. Never happened. A few days from Amazon and I got it. Great food. Better price than picking it up personally (saved about $5)

I've been experimenting with different dog foods for the past year and a half and this has been by far the most heavily favored dog food by my bird dog (Gordon Setter). It best's all the other foods I've tried in a side by side taste test performed by my dog, who eats the Acana to the exclusion of the other foods. If he likes it and he's healthy and looks good - I'm in! Thanks for the great product.

Summary: Acana Prairie is hard to find but the best Dog Food
Text: I have 3 dogs and I used to feed them Ultra dog food. My 6 yr old rescue lab mix was eating it but would throw up often. I read reviews for Acana and Origen. I first switched to the high protein Origen with chicken and it made my dogs very gassy. I switched to Acana Prairie which is also with chicken and they LOVE THIS FOOD. Even my fussy Papillon loves it. The other 2 wipe their bowls clean. It is hard to find and a little pricy so I just signed up for automatic deliveries. This is a great dog food!

Both of my dogs love this food, even my picky one.  My one dog was scratching less after just a week of eating.  I can tell the dogs' bodies like it better too because there is less poo and it is more firm for easier pick up (a major plus).  I would highly recommend.

After the recent recall with certain dog foods I was very concerned about what to feed my two German Shepherds. They were raised on grain free foods... My daughter suggested I try Acana, Wild Prairie... I was worried about the chicken... but did a gradual switch and my two girls are doing great. They have picked up weight (which was needed), their coats are looking beautiful, even during coat blowing season!!! The food was delivered as promised... and in excellent condition. Acana Wild Prairie Grain-Free Dry Dog Food, 29.7lb
My didn't care for this food to much... It was an alternative to Orijen, which they loved, it didn't have as much protein. For some reason they didn't seem to like it as much.

I have a Papillon and he loves this stuff. He's very energetic and happy and has had no health issues so far while on this food. I tried feeding Orijen but I think my dog was having issues with the protein level as he started peeing inside which was not normal for him. This one seems to be perfect.

I bought this three times. Last Easter, this Easter, and now for my mother's birthday. It's the best coconut cream egg I've ever had! It's about the size of a man's fist. The chocolate shell is the best chocolate I've ever tasted and the inside is even better!

I love my cats. For many years I fed them the cheaper brands of cat food. It was not until I had a cat diagnosed with heart disease that I found out more information about feline nutrition. Basically, protein is very important (it's what they would be eating if they were in the wild) and grains can be hard for them to digest. Since that time, I've tried to do better in making sure they get the proper nutrition to keep them as healthy as possible.

Science Diet has a new line of cat food available called Ideal Balance. It features fresh chicken as the first ingredient, fruits and veggies as secondary ingredients and is free of corn, artificial flavors and preservatives. It is conveniently available in the Kitten, Adult and Mature Adult varieties.

When I gave my cats this dry food, they enthusiastically ate it. This is actually nothing new. They do that with all cat food. But, I was pleasantly surprised to find that as the days went by and they continued eating the food, there was less throwing up from one of our cats who apparently has a sensitive stomach. I have no doubt the switching of brands is what caused her throwing up to lessen. Although Science Diet does cost more than other brands you can find in the big box stores, the higher price is worth it to be able to give my cats good nutrition.

Disclosure of Material Connection: I received a bag of Science Diet Ideal Balance Cat Food free via BzzAgent. I was not required to write a positive review. The opinions I have expressed are my own. I am disclosing this in accordance with the Federal Trade Commission's 16 CFR, Part 255: "Guides Concerning the Use of Endorsements and Testimonials in Advertising."
I got this for free through a rebate offer and my cat really just didn't care for it that much.  It cost at least twice as much as other good brands.  Won't be buying it again.

These yummy granola bars do indeed taste like a coconut chocolate macaroon. They have 200 calories and 8 grams of fat per pack, and 8 grams of sugar.
I LOVE coconut anything...and have never had a granola bar that had coconut in it. The coconut flavor in these really stand out! These bars are crunchy and crumbly but not hard in any way...you won't chip a tooth or anything like some other bars. They arent exactaly healthy - but a slightly better choice than a candy bar because of the low sugar and fiber. Oh and Amazon has a great price on these!
Quality is good, because sometimes with pieces you tend to get the crappy leftovers, but that wasn't the case here. Good product for a reasonable price.

We received the coffee immediately and it has a very smooth taste which is really nice first thing in the morning.  I love that it's fair trade and organic and the price competes with a standard grocery store price of mass produced coffee.  I will be ordering this again.
If you like them small you won't be disappointed. Tasty though. I would upgrade to the bigger ones.
This doesn't take like the typical licorice flavor. It is sweet and the only herbal tea I'll drink.  I first tasted it at a spa and had to get the name of the flavor. It is yummy!
and smooth (really helps) for sore throat there is no doubts. The taste though not all that "usual tea" :))))))))) if you know what i mean.

If you are a licorice lover this tea will be a special

treat without all the calories.

Torani's" Sugar Free Vanilla Flavor Syrup", is a nice way to add a little variety to your coffee, without having to run out to a Starbuck's for a sugar free Vanilla Latte.. As I mentioned in the title, there are no calories, fats, carbs or sugars. The taste is very sweet and vanillery, and you can use it in anything you want to add a little variety or flavor. I like it in my Pellegrino. Makes a nice Vanilla Soda. In my coffee, I found I did not have to add anything else. The syrup was good enough and tasty enough on it's own.I use it whenever, I get a sweet tooth, to get me past a craving for something with more calories involved.

It is sweetened with "Splenda", and if you are not used to using Sugar substitutes, you may not like the little bit of an after taste it leaves.

Ingrediants as listed are: Water, Vanilla Extract,other natural flavors, Potassium Sorbate and Sodium Benzoate(there are 5 mg sodium listed on the label), Citric Acid,Xanthan Gum,Sucralose(the Splenda), Acesulfame Potassium.

It's a bargain for the 750 ml, sold here.I paid almost as much for 375ml at my local grocery store. You'll probably use about two tablespoons per drink.(more or less) You'll get your money's worth. Add it to anything you want, hot chocolate, iced tea, etc. Maybe with the holiday's coming, it would be a nice change in other beverages as well. It is also sold with sugar added,and there are several other flavors with or without sugar, just click on other products by Torani at top of page. .

Cheers....Laurie

Summary: Excellent product if you have a sweet tooth
Text:
If you haven't tried this product you really should buy a bottle and experience it for yourself. I think that it is good enough that you won't miss the sugar.

Water is so good for us, but so boring. If you are trying to increase your consumption of water, try a little of this in the water.

This product can also be used to make an Italian soda (a little syrup, a little cream, and some sparkling water). Another yummy treat, if only they made a fat free cream it would be perfect. I have not tried to make an Italian soda using the Land-O-Lakes Fat Free half and half but it should work.

My husband and I have been buying this brand of sugar free syrup for years. A pump of this syrup into your coffee changes it from a standard morning beverage into a liquid candy bar in a mug. I recently switched from half and half to soy milk in my coffee. With this syrup in my coffee the switch to soy milk was very easy.

This product can also be used to drizzle on fruit if you need a little extract sweetener.

The ingredients in this product (listed in order) are as follows:
Purified water
Vanilla extract with other natural flavors
Potassium sorbate and sodium benzoate (to preserve freshness)
Citric acid
Xantham gum
Sucralose (splenda brand)
Acesulfame potassium

Nutrition Facts label reads as follows:
Serving Size: 1 oz.
Servings per Package: 25.4
Calories: 0
Calories from fat: 0
Total Fat: 0 g
Sodium: 15 mg
Total Carbohydrate: 0 g
Sugars: 0 g
Protein: 0g

If you find that you like this product I would suggest that you order a pump for the bottle. It allows you to dispense the same amount into your coffee without having to tediously measure.

I find this to be much better tasting than Davinci Syrup.  I'm not a big fan of anything with artificial sweeteners, but wanted to made a try to get off using so much sugar.  So far, this has been great.  I honestly don't taste the difference with this in my coffee.  I had previously tried the Davinci, but didn't care for it at all.

I mistakenly bought 3 bottles of the stuff without tasting it first. This syrup taste like a bad diet drink from the 70's. I guess they just have not been able to duplicate the genuine flavor of sugar. I ended up trying it in coffee as a flavor and it still came up short. Three bottles down the drain.

I buy the sugar-free vanilla syrup for my husband to use in his coffee.  It definitely has a great flavor.  I recommend buying a pump to go with it so that you can easily measure it.  Nice, sugar-free way to sweeten and flavor coffee.
Vanilla Torani flavoring is great in coffee, protein drinks and all types of cooking recipes.

Summary: Make's Your Coffee a Dessert With Fabulous Torani Syrup
Text: I love Torani Syrup.  The flavor is rich and comes thru with every, in my case, cup of coffee.  Coffee just is the great without Torani.

Summary: Great Pasta - Good price with subscribe and save
Text:
Product Quality: De Cecco pasta is the best widely available commercial pasta. If you want better pasta, you'll pay through the nose or you'll make it yourself. It is a step up from Barilla (which does not make Orecchiette), and cooks up a little differently. It tends to be a bit creamier without loosing its firmness. Orecchiette is a wonderful summer pasta that is perfect with broccoli and sausage.

Value: For some reason, the De Cecco pastas are all different prices. This one is the least expensive and is one of my favorites. Amazon's price (as of April 2011) is considerably cheaper than the grocery store's non-sale price, and slightly less expensive than the on-sale price.

Packaging: There is a lot of plastic and a cardboard backing preventing the pasta from shattering during shipping. I'm glad to have in tact pasta so I don't mind too much. The five-pack is shipped in a box that is too large for it adding another layer of waste. I suspect that the packaging could be reduced without any increase in breakage.

i bought this pasta after reading the reviews -- something different from sketti  -  i made a white sauce, added some sauteed red onions, used pink salt, some freshly ground pepper, about a half pound of shrimp, a can of organic shrooms,about a tablespoon of garlic/red pepper spice, and this turned out to be a beautiful delicious dish.  i can tell i will be using this pasta regularly.  i like the shape, the creaminess as mentioned by another and how my own creativity will be in play as i think of new ways to use it; i got plenty of time now.  thanks for making it available amazon.  and the s&s price is affordable for anyone.

The delivery man laughed when he shook the box and I told him it was "macaroni" but, oh, yes, these are worth ordering online. They are toothsome and flavorful. I was reminded how flavorful recently when I mixed in with these the last of a box of another pasta. In the bowl, the differences were obvious. Compared to these, the other pasta was mushy and flavorless.

An added bonus? When I did the math and with free Prime shipping, these were the same price they would be in the supermarket if we could get them here.
We had this at a local restaurant and it was delicious. I could not find it in the grocery stores.

Being Italian I love my pasta and what better way to get it than through Amazon, great price and delivered right to my door. great tasting pasta nice and Al dente. Kids love the shape with cheese sauce for mac and cheese.

I originally learned of this shape through a dish at Olive Garden, we rarely eat there anymore, not as much tolerance for chain restaurants, but I love orecchiette for use with pesto. It is a fantastic little "dish or shell" to hold a little pesto, also great with wine sauces. I buy this on amazon not so much for price savings but because typical grocery stores (non specialty) in this area don't tend to carry this.

We love De Cecco pasta, but our local grocery chain charges a preventative amount for it. We can get it for a reasonable price through Amazon, and get a bunch of it at once. No downside. So far, we haven't found a comparable pasta, especially for the price, and we eat a ton of the stuff. Perfect bite, perfect taste... if I had a gripe, I'd say that you have to cook it for one minute less than the recommended al dente time in order to get it properly al dente, but once you know that, you're golden. I might also say that the pieces stick together quickly once they're drained, but every piece is cooked, and I think that's a fault of the shape, not the company.
I enjoyed this product very much and am a little disappointed that I couldn't get more of it but will definately check back to buy more.

And as the owner of a much-loved dog, isn't that what's most important? So far I've purchased the peanut butter flavor most often because that's my Doberman's favorite, but she's also had the beef flavor and the bacon and cheese (which she hated). So far, no staining on her bedding at all. When she brings one to me that's all slobbery, wanting to play fetch with it, none of the food dye is left behind on me or my clothes either - and she's gone through well over a dozen of this brand of rawhide.

One of the things I look for when I buy rawhides for her is if they are completely coated in flavor all the way through, or if they just cover what is visible through the packaging. The reason I do this is because my Dobie is a greedy monster and she will just lick off the goodies and cast aside the rest. So far, with these bones, they have been completely covered and she makes them swiftly disappear.

The only reason I gave them 4 instead of 5 stars is because the bones that were shipped to my house have always been slightly smaller than advertised. For instance, almost every single 7-8 inch bone I ordered topped out at just a bit over 6 inches. I know it's a small thing, especially if the dog is happy, but she goes through 2-3 of these a week, so it can add up a bit. I just wanted to explain why not 5 stars. If they start showing up the way they are supposed to be, I'll happily change my rating.

Dog loved this bone.  I think there should be a star section for price and value comparison.  I probably would have taken a star off for price, but I believe more in reviewing the product for the product, not the price.
WHAT A JOKE --PLEASE PUT CHIAHUAHU ON PROFILE SO I GET A 4 INCH BONES AND NOT 40 FOOT ONES ANOTHER JUNK ANIMAL WHATEVER --SOMESDAY I WILL GET IT RIGHT AND YOU WILL TOO --PUP PERONI SAUAGE HINT

I purchased the cream of asparagus mix and along with the seafood mix and cream of mushroom mix. I use them as a addition / help for a homemade soup. I add stock and vegetables, seafood....
We like all 3 soups but I think the cream of asparagus is my favorite. The soup comes out very smooth and creamy and the taste is great. I added fresh asparagus along with other vegetables but you don't have to.
You do get 48 packages - it would almost be good to split it with somebody - but it really is very good, does not taste like a package or can soup at all. If I ever run out of the supply I bought, I'll buy it again....

Summary: Almost as Good as Mom Makes
Text:
I make 99% of all my son's food- this is the only food item I DO buy.
(peas require a little more work to make)
Great product!
Their prunes are good, too.
My b/g babies love it; and I love the fact that is organic.  Even though is 1st stage, is not runny, so is much easier to feed. Babies like the thick texture, is their favorite food.

Wanted my daughter to keep organic as much and long as possible so we tried this brand first & this veggie when she started solids. I hate peas, but from the first spoonfull (it's not so runny it won't stay on a spatula style spoon) she loved it! This is her one of her fave veggies so far which surprised me.

She'll eat a jar of this even after a full bottle if I let her! No side effects noticed and I even tasted it & found it bland but wholesome.

This is a great deal and cheaper than in store; arrives bubblewrapped to death and no weird or broken jars so far.
My daughter loves these peas.  They're the perfect size jar and perfect consistency.  Peas from other brands are often too thick but this is perfect.

The babies love these peas.  They taste naturally sweet and have a smooth consistency, no artificial or overcooked flavor to it.  A nice, convenient way to add fiber to their diet.  I like to make my own food whenever possible, but it is too difficult and time consuming to make my own peas.  This is definitely a better option for me.

This was the second solid food I gave my daughter, after her introduction to rice cereal. I snuck a taste of it myself and, while I don't normally enjoy peas, I liked how these tasted. She seems to enjoy them too. The texture is not too thin, and it hugs the spoon nicely.

Summary: The phrase "this tastes like feet" comes to mind
Text:
I've been very happy with the majority of the Earth's Best products, but the peas are TERRIBLE. I am amazed that this received any positive reviews. I have never seen my 1-year old son refuse a food as violently as he did these peas. He immediately spat out the first spoonful of these peas and looked at me indignantly, as if to say, "What kind of garbage are you feeding me?" He then went on to turn his head to one side, refused to eat for the rest of the meal, and start struggling to get out of the high chair. Since he's generally a good eater with a healthy appetite (and he wasn't sick), I was puzzled by this response and tried the peas myself. I nearly gagged, and tipped over MY chair in my haste to expunge these peas. My son just watched me spit out these peas and grinned, as if to say, "See - I told you they were BAD!"

If you do decide to go ahead and buy these peas, try them yourself first before subjecting a poor innocent child to them! I will NEVER give my child this product again.

I just learned that these lids are lined with a material that contains BPA. I fed lots of jars to my daughter so I am quite upset. Just canceled all of my subscriptions to Earth's Best jars. I am very disappointed. If you want to get this confirmed I would encourage you to contact the company.

Summary: DO NOT BUY---HAS BPA IN LIDS!!
Text: I absolutely LOVED EB food...as did my baby.  That is, until I read that EB uses BPA in the sealing of their lids!!!!  How in the world does a company who cares about organic, gluten free, kosher, and products free of being genetically modified think that it is okay to use BPA?!!?  I called EB to verify this information and the lady admitted it.  (But they are "looking into an alternative packaging". That can't happen fast enough!!!!)

I really don't understand why, but the English Breakfast tea made for UK is mountains better than the US version sold in the US grocery stores. We have colleagues in UK, and someone brought this version of the tea, and I couldn't believe how much smoother it tasted, compared to all the other brands I tried in US. So if you like smooth taste, this is the one to try.
A friend of mine was the recipient of this tea, and she just loves it.  In fact, I'll be ordering some more for the Holidays.

And as the owner of a much-loved dog, isn't that what's most important? So far I've purchased the peanut butter flavor most often because that's my Doberman's favorite, but she's also had the beef flavor and the bacon and cheese (which she hated). So far, no staining on her bedding at all. When she brings one to me that's all slobbery, wanting to play fetch with it, none of the food dye is left behind on me or my clothes either - and she's gone through well over a dozen of this brand of rawhide.

One of the things I look for when I buy rawhides for her is if they are completely coated in flavor all the way through, or if they just cover what is visible through the packaging. The reason I do this is because my Dobie is a greedy monster and she will just lick off the goodies and cast aside the rest. So far, with these bones, they have been completely covered and she makes them swiftly disappear.

The only reason I gave them 4 instead of 5 stars is because the bones that were shipped to my house have always been slightly smaller than advertised. For instance, almost every single 7-8 inch bone I ordered topped out at just a bit over 6 inches. I know it's a small thing, especially if the dog is happy, but she goes through 2-3 of these a week, so it can add up a bit. I just wanted to explain why not 5 stars. If they start showing up the way they are supposed to be, I'll happily change my rating.

Dog loved this bone.  I think there should be a star section for price and value comparison.  I probably would have taken a star off for price, but I believe more in reviewing the product for the product, not the price.
WHAT A JOKE --PLEASE PUT CHIAHUAHU ON PROFILE SO I GET A 4 INCH BONES AND NOT 40 FOOT ONES ANOTHER JUNK ANIMAL WHATEVER --SOMESDAY I WILL GET IT RIGHT AND YOU WILL TOO --PUP PERONI SAUAGE HINT
i love hot sauce, i live in the west indies.... i love this stuff- the best bloody mary's, the best in anything.. it's great to be able to access this in the states!!!!

I enjoy the other basic flavors of Nutri-Grain bars but this one is one of my favorites.  I keep them in my desk at work to hold me over until lunch or dinner.  The price is good and it comes packaged great.

Summary: Taste Good But Not So Filling
Text: When I think of a cereal bar I usually think of a quick breakfast. If I grab one of these for breakfast then the stomach would be growling long before lunch. They do taste great though. The multi-grain gives it a nice flavor and great cereal texture.

I have purchased all the Pet Botanics Training Rewards flavors.  My dog loves them.  For some reason the chicken flavor was not available until recently.  These are a little cheaper than the pet stores in my area.  Very glad they finally included the chicken as that is the flavor with which my dog was originally trained.

For the 3 seconds the flavor lasts (the outside strawberry flavored gum mixed with a lime liquid center) it's pretty enjoyable. After that, it's all downhill. Not since chewing Fruit Strips gum as a child, can I remember a gum losing flavor this quickly. You maybe get 5-10 minutes of flavor and after that it's like chewing rubber.

The packaging is another annoyance it's a foil blister pack with a cardboard sleeve containing nine pieces of gum. It's a waste of packaging if you consider the whole thing could have been put in a Mentos-like package.

I made the mistake of buying a 3 pack. If you must, go with a single pack. It will be enough to turn you off.

Okay, I am eating this gum as I write this, usually I don't review food but this is an exception.This is a mix of stawberry and lime,it actually taste like both if not sure how but it does.It has a hard outer shell ( the stawberry) but inside is the lime goop which taste very good.So if You are looking up gum this is the one you should try.

My Grandma made Whip 'n Chill for me and my brothers when we came to visit them back in the late 60's and early 70's.  This is the same stuff, same taste and everything!!  It comes in institutional 15 oz. pouches, so I divided it in half and mixed it with 2 cups of water and that taste brought me back to when I was a kid!!!

Thanks to another review, not the ad, I found out these are institutional package sizes.  There's no way I want to spend $72+ for a dessert.  I would like to have 1 package of each flavor and would like to know where I could purchase a sensible amount for a sensible price.  To try all 3 flavors would cost over $210!!  Get real!

I used to buy Mother's Quick Cooking Barley locally at Whole Foods and it became one of my food staples, but my Whole Foods stopped carrying it. My Amazon order arrived promptly and was undamaged. Barley has a wonderful taste and helps reduce cholesterol because it has soluble fiber. It can be used in soups, as a side dish, or in many rice recipes. Cooking time is short because this barley product is rolled flat, like oats for oatmeal, so it's done in just 10-12 minutes.

Ricotta cheese is awesome when placed in lasagna.  True story- a few months ago my dad made a huge tray of lasagna for his girlfriend and myself, and he literally dumped the entire container of ricotta in the tray.  I thought it was too much but didn't say anything.  I didn't dare question my dad's experience in cooking for years and years (over 30 to be exact) at several different restaurants.  Anyway the cheese gave off a VERY strong taste, and in fact, it was the *only* thing we tasted in the lasagna, lol.  The sauce, other cheese varieties and everything else practically disappeared.  Still, I love the taste of ricotta cheese enough that I really would have trouble complaining about an abundance of it.  I find it's quite delicious.  Just be warned- use it accordingly and not the entire container (or in this case, bag) in one go, haha.
This is a quality product in my opinion. I enjoy the taste and convenience each time I make a cup. YUMMY!!!

I currently compete in triathlons, and have been battling cramps on the bike for over a year now. I tried many different companies drinks, but still continued to get leg cramps. My coach recommended EFS Drink, and I haven't looked back since. Unless it's a brutally hot day, and I'm training for over 2 hours i don't even take salt/electrolyte tabs anymore.

This is as close to a perfect sports drink as I can find.

Pros:
* When used at the recommendation concentration the solution is 7% carbohydrate. Studies have shown 7-8% is ideal for gastric emptying and absorption rates. Many drinks are much sweeter, which makes the gut draw water from muscles to dilute the mixture. Thankfully that is not the case here.
* It mixes very well, and tastes great.
* Good price.

Cons:
* Only one: it has 200% RDA of vitamin C per serving. Since about 2g of vitamin C in a day is the safe upper limit, that puts a limit on how much you can drink in very long activities.

Neutral:
* Contains glutamine and BCAAs (2mg per serving). If you have an energy deficit, which you almost certainly will when you drink this, they will probably just be burned as energy.

Other drinks all seem to be either a) expensive, b) more sweet than they should be, c) mix poorly and/or taste terrible, or d) full of protein that is not appropriate during or immediately after a workout. I won't be using anything else now that I have found this.

Got into EFS thru my training group. I had been having stomach issues with hard training, and decided it was time to ditch the Gatorade. This seems to fuel me much better, and the lemon lime flavor is pretty good. I only use it for cycling, not for run hydration. As long as you only use it for serious training and racing, one tub (altho pricey), will last you a good long while. Worth the switch from Gatorade!
I have tried many products over the years and so far this is one of the best. Overall very happy with the product. Great mellow flavor, something you can drink all day racing.

Summary: does what it's supposed to do
Text: OK I can say I've used Infinit, Accelerade, Gatorade, Hammer and Powerade. This is by far the best for me. Others were either real thick and sat in my stomach, did nothing for me or made me a little nauseas or gave me gas. EFS is light and easy to digest, does what it's designed to do and gives me more energy and fuel to push myself harder than if I drank water alone. Also I don't cramp up,or not nearly as much which is a big issue for me on really hard rides or ride and run days. And it even tastes better than all of the others as well. I get the orange and mix some crystal lite with it for more flavor and a little caffiene.

I have had lots of problems with cramping when riding hard despite using lots of different products. My coach had me try EFS and it has made a big difference for me. I have tried both the fruit punch and the grape flavor and the grape flavor is the best for me. No stomach issues, great subtle flavor, and it works reduce/eliminate cramps.

I really like this product. The electrolyte works well as advertised. For a new cyclist, I can feel an immediate improvement on replenishing electrolytes when I drink this. After some serious research, I have to agree that this is one of the better electrolyte drinks out there.

Downside: a bit expensive; a bit on the sweet side which gives some people diarrhea; you need to drink a whole bottle for all those electrolytes added to your body so it may not work as well for some.
I want to say this grape flavor has no flavor, tastes like water.  I don't recommend.  The red bottle was sweet, tasted like sugar.

Not too sugary, mixes well in cold water and doesn't come out of solution. The difference while running or working out (Cross Fit) is definitely noticeable. I can drink 18-24 ounces before a run in very hot (Phoenix) weather and not need to hydrate mid-run. Ditch the Gatorade!

Pricey but worth it. You can mix your own strength, the taste is easy to swallow and easy on the stomach, and it's easy to drink even after hours on the bike when it's no longer cold. Mark your bottle so you know which one is fuel as it is clear once mixed.

I suffer from acid reflux and can not take any solids in on the bike. I also suffer from cramps in heat and "over doing it". Last year, I did my first 140.6, and used EFS and Carbo Pro mixture, along with the EFS gels.

The EFS drink goes down very easy and does not have any HFCS like others. It also has tons of electrolytes and tastes good too! Carbo Pro went in and mixed great with it. Highly recommend.
Trained for two months with another product and water with poor results. Switched to EFS and was suddenly filled with strength and stamina. I could feel the difference and believe!
Firt Endurance is the best, i like Grape.I really recommend it, I have tried several times and if it works.

Summary: Good Taste and Disolves Fast with no after taste.
Text: The product is great for endurance rides as it does not leave an after taste and the flavoring is light enough to give a hint of the taste. The product dissolves easily in water versus creating chunks in the water bottle. The included scoop gives just the right amount for 20 oz bottle.

Since I have only been buying this in Orange it's not fair to compare with other drinks besides Gatorade.
The first several times it did take me a while to get use to the taste, but now, it's like drinking anything else.
Easy on the stomach.
I have went thru 4 tubs (25 servings each), BUT, you don't get 25 servings unless you have a small container bottle. I have to use 1 1/2 scoops for a 18 oz bottle. It does say 1 scoop for 12 oz.
I enjoy drinking th Orange flavor. Keep searching around for the best price like I do each time I reorder.
Usually I get it for $30.00 and sometime a bit under, and that's counting the shipping charge.
Great First Endurance product. Seems to work better than other drinks I've tried (Cyto, Hammer, etc.). Fruit Punch tastes the best.

I am a 12 - 24 hr adventure racer.  Every race, after 3-4 hours of strenuous activity, I get leg cramps.  I was hoping the EFS would be my "silver bullet" to put this issue to rest.  I used it in a 12 hr race.  The label says you can mix it up to double strength if needed and I did.  I still cramped around the 3-4 hour time frame.  Pretty sure my case is on the extreme end of the cramping scale, as the guys I train with don't cramp in the races and we train very similarly.
Extremely tasty and the mustard seeds add a nice nubbly texture (the seeds are not hard).  Fantastic melted over bread or by itself.  Its only drawback is that you want to eat it all in one sitting.
I absolutely loved this cheese.  I pair it with fruits for a sweet and savory experience that is unbeatable.  The mustard seeds add the most delicious unexpected bite to this gem of a cheese.

Thank goodness for Valentine Day gifts: my pallet said "Thank you!" for Somerdale's RED DRAGON, "mature Welsh Cheddar Cheese" with absolutely delectable Wholegrain Mustard Seed and Ale.  Oh-my-goodness!!  Excuse me, I must close . . . and order more RED DRAGON.

I agree with the other reviewer that the danger of having this around is that you will eat it all at once. This is one of the cheeses we keep in our home almost always. Great with crackers and a good beer, it is a big hit anytime we serve it to guests.

If you are looking for something a little different with great flavor, this is the cheese for you.

Summary: Only problem is that it's TOO good . . . .
Text:
. . . and I eat it too fast. It's not cheap, either.

This is SERIOUSLY delicious. With wheat crackers, some fruit, and a couple of IPAs? Nirvana.

I bought what was left from this site due to Gerber decided to discontinue the glass jars and use the plastic containers. Well the glass jars are much easier to travel and heat up with and easier to store in the fridge. I will miss the jars once these are used up.

I started giving my son this at 9 months. He eats it cold or hot. No preference. So we order it monthly. The portion size for feeding is good too. He'll eat it all, and not still be hungry - fills him up.

Only thing I don't like is that this food stains his sippy cups.

My daughter loves it, but it's nearly twice as expensive than at the local Target. I also can mix and mach so she doesn't eat the same thing every day, since all the 4oz Gerber baby foods are the same price.

I bought six can of these wafers and all the wafers were smashed!!!, what a pity!. It is most the cost to return them, that I just put them on the trash. AMAZON SHOULD BE MORE CAREFUL WHEN SELLING and PACKING THIS TYPE OF ITEM, THIS ARE VERY FRAGIL, SO WHEN I OPENED THE BOX THEY WERE NOT WELL PACKED. I am so disappointed because I wasted my money.
When they say "hint of pepper jack", that's what I'm expecting, but these taste more like nacho cheese Doritos. They're pretty good, but totally not what I thought they would be.

Arrived on time and was exactly as pictured.  Customer service was great.  Product tasted fresh and would definitely use this company again. One con is chips were in small pieces, packing problem, still price was great and would order again.
