This is a really good tea.  I am drinking it during my pregnancy to tone the uterus.  Very good taste!

This tea really works. Drink a big cup before bed and in the morning you will have to use the bathroom. Sometimes I have to eat just a little something before it kicks in, but it always works within 1-2 hours after waking up. It does not really taste that great, but it is okay. Definitely helps me keep my weight even.

Personally I like Kleritea better (more gentle, tastes better) but that costs almost 4 times as much. So I stick to Alvita Senna Leaf Tea now.
A refreshing cold beverage and a soothing, perfect, hot cup of tea. Offers healthful benefits.
I have purchased this brand of tea before and knew the quality was great but glad to have gotten a great price also!!  Delivery was prompt and service was great!

This tea is great.  I cook it in gallon batches and sweeten it with agave nectar and keep it in the fridge.  I guess it "worked" because my daughter was born after just 4 hours of labor and 20 minutes of pushing.  I'm still drinking it since I had just ordered another 3-pack of boxes of it the day before our baby was born.  My husband loves the tea too and he doesn't even have a uterus.

I have a friend who is a dandelion warrior.  Everytime she see's one, she pounces and that plant is history.  As a little joke, I ordered and sent her the tea.  To my surprise, she reported that she actually liked it, mentioning it had a rather nice smooth flavor.  Although that has not stopped her from still being a dandelion ninja, I give it 5 start just knowing that if she liked it - it HAS to be good!

We use it at night to lower diabetes sugar and it works.  My husband has been able first to reduce the medications and now has been off for 2 months.  Of course this is together with exercise, weight reduction and proper nutrition.

I purchased these tea bags in hope for a good night sleep. The first night I drank it, I slept great.  I have continued to drink this every night and I still sleep well but I find myself waking up in the middle of the night once in a while.  I do find myself urinating more often so maybe it is cleaning me out.  No bad side effects, tastes good alone, no sugar or honey needed.  I recommended this to my family and co workers and they all love it.  I discovered this from Dr. Oz.  Hoping to continue to sleep well.

Maybe this is a placebo effect however, since I have been drinking this tea, sometimes in the morning and some times at night, I have felt more calm and my mood is somewhat lifted. The taste is fine- I sometimes add a little honey but it is fine as is. I will continue to use this tea. I do think it helps with your mood.
Love the aroma and the taste. Orange honey goes great with it. I drink it daily. Seems to work great when I get any stomach issues... would highly recommend this product.

Summary: Works, economical alternative to other 'diet' teas
Text: This stuff works. As reported by real doctors, do not use this all the time, only when needed.  Listen to what your body is telling you.

I love this tea and drink it all the time. The taste is very nice and I do not even have to sweeten it or use lemon, as it has an almost sweet taste all it's own. I take alot of medicine and have much trouble with my bowels. When I drink 2 cups of your Senna tea I am opened up within 2 hours.
Thank you very much, I would not use that much laxative.

Pat Kamadulski

I found that this tea really helped increase my milk supply. It tasted a little funny at first, but I quickly got used to it. The price on Amazon is unbeatable, especially if you use subscribe and save.

Summary: Good at first, but quickly became overbearing for me
Text: I bought this tea at my health food store because I thought it looked interesting. The name and the description really pulled me in, as well as the picture on the box. At first I was confused as to what the taste reminded me of, but then I realized it reminded me of pink Necco mints. I don't drink sugar in tea, but I think if I did and I had put some in this tea it would've made it overbearing. However, after drinking this tea once every day for a week or so, I'm finding it to be almost like a chore. I love the health benefits and this tea has actually helped me feel pretty good after drinking a cup, but the taste is becoming a bit overbearing. As I mentioned early in my review, the taste is reminiscent of pink Necco mints (minus the mint part, of course) but it can be hard for me to get through a cup of it because after awhile that Necco taste begins to remind me more and more of chalk. Yes, it definitely has a chalky flavor. I will still continue to drink this tea until the box is gone but I don't think I'll be buying any more of it unless it has some sort of miraculous effect on me later on down the box. Still, it was worth a try because it was nice at first.

The product was fine, but the cost of shipping was more than the cost
of the tea. Won't make that mistake again.

I got this tea because it is supposed to help with PMS and supposedly helps "prepare" the uterus for conception. I figured it can't hurt, so why not? I think this tea is very light flavored. I usually put some honey in it and it goes down great.

As for the rest, I've only been using it (3 times a day) for the past 7 days and haven't gone a full cycle yet, so I don't know if it really does work for PMS yet or not.

Summary: A great product, you must try!
Text:
I study plants and I am into alternative healing. I learned about Mullein a number of years ago and found that it's very useful for sinus, cold and flu issues. Often times I have treated many of my friends with it to help them get back to feeling well. This particular brand is high quality and good medicine. I highly recommend buying this tea as we all need to get away from Western medicine as much as we can when other opportunities are out there. The idea is to stay in balance and not get extremely sick by using products like this early on when symptoms first start developing. I think you will find this product very useful and effective.

* Please note: Do not mix to many herbs and or prescriptions medicines as they can counteract and amplify the strength or effect of the meds or herbs.
I love this stuff. It has really helped me with a lot of things. I absolutely swear by it. I probably drink this tea at least once a week. Sometimes several times a day if I feel the need.
I purchased this item a month ago and i drink a cup morning and night. I love it! I drink it with clover honey...

My mother-in-law recommended this tea to me to help me naturally alleviate my menstrual cramps. I have to warn that the tea doesn't "kick in" for a couple of cycles, so don't drink this expecting a magic cure-all within the first cup. I used to be very dependent on Advil, Tylenol, etc. so this tea was a lifesaver.

It's a very mild tea and you don't need a lot of sugar or honey in it. I recommend it.

Recommend it to all.  Lovely natural sweet delicate flavor and add some raw honey is a great cold kicker.  I loved it during a URI, upper respiratory infection and it was fabulous.  Soothed my sore throat and helped ease the coughing.  I now brew it for cold tea as well.  Very refresshing.

I trust Alvita's brand because all of the teas I have tried from them are pure and excellent quality. The Raspberry leaf is no exception. The taste is mild and it works like a charm to ease menstrual cramps. A must have during your moon cycle. Good value for the price.

Also check out Yogi Woman's Moon Cycle, Herbal Tea Supplement, 16-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 6)

I drank this tea after my first trimester of pregnancy for its numerous health benefits.  It is pure red raspberry leaves and great organic package.  They are  not individually packaged, they come in a foil lined paper lije package and there are no strings or tags, just steep add agave or honey to sweeten...it is a little bitter but not bad and drink!

Summary: Good Things Come in Stinky Packages
Text: I have very bad insomnia and panic attacks, and this tea calms me down and helps me to sleep. Research suggests that Valerian works on the brains in similar ways to benzodiazepines, and was used in the past as a muscle relaxant and for DTs. This tea has an obvious effect, though it takes about half an hour to kick in. I smells like crap, but if you mix it with mint tea, it isn't as noticeable. I don't see any problem with the flavor, it does not taste like it smells.

I bought this product because I read on a couple other sites that it can help with head and chest congestion. I also read it is safe to use while breastfeeding. So I tried it. If I drink it on an empty stomache it does seem to help with my cronic nasal congestion due to allergies. I saw no difference with chest congestion. I only drank the recommended 2 to 3 cups a day. Maybe I would see longer or more results at higher doses. I have noticed that I do smell alot like maple syrup even 4 days after not drinking the tea. I do mix it with Honey, if not it tastes awful to me. I never noticed a maple syrup smell on my 3 year old breastfeeding son like another site mentioned might happen. He does only nurse a few times a day now tho. Overall I like the product and will continue to use it when I am feeling congested. I even recommended it to somebody I know.
I ordered this product because of the Dr Oz show for anti-aging, a nice by product is I swear my knee pain has improved since I started drinking a cup a day, oh yeah and it taste good.
This is a great product to help with insomnia.  Really great.  Some do not like the smell or taste, but I actually love it.  Maybe it is an acquired test.  A+++ for this product, it is excellent.

"They found that two of the licorice compounds, licoricidin and licorisoflavan A, were the most effective antibacterial substances. These substances killed two of the major bacteria responsible for dental cavities and two of the bacteria that promote gum disease. One of the compounds -- licoricidin -- also killed a third gum disease bacterium. The researchers say that these substances could treat or even prevent oral infections."

file:///Users/roaeja/Desktop/Health/Dried%20licorice%20root%20fights%20the%20bacteria%20that%20cause%20tooth%20decay%20and%20gum%20disease,%20study%20finds.webarchive
I bought this product and love the flavor.  A great and relaxing way for me to end or begin a day.

The first time I drank Fenagreek Seed tea I did not like the smell or the taste very much.  I added a very small amount of Stevia to sweeten it.  The more I drank it, the more the taste grew on me.  It is now my favorite tea by a long shot!

A friend suggested this as I have been taking pain medication which tends to bind the bowels. He told me that this would help keep me regular. He was so right. A cu p of Senna Tea with my dinner has been better then metamucel for regularity. It tastes good, and I recommend it to anyone who has constipation problems due to medications. If you eat out, you can take the tea bag with you and ask for a cup of hot water to steep your tea in, and you do not have to worry about missing a dose.
Not enough flavor, murky brown color, lacking in aroma. I enjoy other varieties from this line but prefer a different brand of rose hip tea. I'd drink it over regular black tea though.

After reading reviews from baby sites, I was ready to get my red raspberry leaf tea on and strengthen my uterus and I was so excited that I got the first one I saw, which was the Alvita brand. I love the flavor, just LOVE the flavor, but I read more reviews and a lot of women gave the Traditional Medicinals better reviews so I after I ran out of the Alvita I purchased the TM. I have to say, the Alvita has a stronger tea taste and I actually got contractions when I drank it. I'm only 37.7 weeks along, but I have to say that I think this tea will help move my labor along quite well. I'll update this review later with how it went.

UPDATE 3/28/2012:
I totally forgot to add my update! Well, as I'd previously believed, this tea helped me tremendously through my labor. I had my beautiful baby boy on December 12th. I had a 17 hour labor because my bag of waters prematurely ruptured and I wasn't dilating the way I was supposed to. I had to be put on pitocin (without meds for the first 14 hours) then I got the meds and then got the epidural about 45 minutes before I actually gave birth. Let me tell you, I only pushed for about 20 minutes and I was done. I attribute that 100% to the tea. I had friends who didn't drink the tea and were in labor for very short periods but pushed way longer. Also, my uterus went down very quickly and I stopped bleeding quickly as well, I forgot how soon but the doctors and nurses were amazed. I'd definitely drink it again next time around.

Summary: People Either Love or Hate Valerian!
Text: I love Valerian and I love it's earthy smell! But just because a previous reviewer hated the smell and threw a tantrum, (which is ironic because Valerian is used for its relaxing properties) doesn't mean it doesn't work! Keep that in mind when making your decision to purchase a natural product! Valerian is not like raw garlic! It's simply a very safe and effective herb which, to me, has a wonderful smell!

Seems to help, I sleep well and if I do wake up I'm not long getting back to sleep.
I ordered two boxes and I'm about to buy two more.

This tea was very good. I was Very happy I got it. A tea that is so good for you and will help many things in your body. My breathing felt better after the first cup. I will be buying more again soon. Doug in Calif...
I ordered this to serve at a "tea" where I was speaking about roses.  It was a hit with those who were brave enough to try it.

You can compare it to unsweetened black tea, but palpable and soothing. It is one of nature's best blood purifiers in addition to being great for women anytime. It's great year round and for flu season, and you can ice it too. Sweeten it up with a bag of chamomile or red clover. Spearmint & peppermint tea compliment it well too -- or add value to that flavored stuff from the supermarket w/this.

You can drink this like water and I can't say enough about how good this tea is for well being, you'll probably instantly feel better.
Its a nice wind down at night.  Taste takes some getting used to but not too bad.  Sweeten with a litte honey.  The health benefits make up for the taste.  The product arrived as reported.

I bought this because I heard about the benefits of Sage tea. I got used to the taste pretty quickly and love to pour it in a glass of ice to enjoy during the summer days.

I took a star off because I've been drinking it for several weeks and I'm not seeing the work of benefits that is claimed of Sage tea (but then, I've always believed that you lose some benefits when the teas are in bags as opposed to still being in leaf form?).

Summary: Sage tea definitely promotes a good night's sleep.
Text: It was touted by a friend as a sleep inducer, so I tried it and it works.  It tastes kinda mediciney, but it definitely does the job.

Summary: Not as rose-flavored as you might think, but still good
Text:
I bought this tea thinking it would taste like a rose. I was only half right. While the rose flavor is still there, you have to really search for it. I think it takes a few cups to do that because this is primarily a fruity tea. After you knock the first few cups down and find the subtle rose flavor, you'll find that it tastes like what a rose would taste like if it were a fruit. Which is basically what rose hips are. After drinking this entire box, I found that I really liked it. I was sad when the box was gone and I do intend to get some more soon.

Just as an added note, I feel this needs to be mentioned. If you're like me and like to suck on the teabag, I do not recommend doing it with this tea! The bags themselves are not very thick and will break and you will have an explosion of mushy rose hips in your mouth!
It came in a timely fashion & it was a good price for the quantity I received. This tea is good for occasional constipation or to help your body along when it feels irregular.

I used a higher priced senna for several years and out of the need to economize I tried alvita. Works just as well and is not individually wrapped as the others are and for me it's just one less thing I have to do considering I fix this every evening for me and hubby... I have medical problems so anything that saves me extra step I'm happy for it...

When I opened this alot of the tea sacks were broken and the tea emptied out and spilled everywhere. I steeped some inside my cup and noticed that all sorts of the tea leaves had come out (I even took a picture and posted it under customer pics) and when I sipped my drink, tea leave crumbs got inside my mouth! I havent noticed any effect from the tea though but I have only used it for a few days so maybe it takes awhile. However, if they'd be able to keep the sacks closed that would help alot!
I love this tea. It is delicious. It came in a timely manner and I was very pleased.

Summary: I drink this for arthritis pain...
Text: ...and something seems to be working! It could be this alfalfa tea which tastes just like...alfalfa tea. My aunt has pain too and does not like to be without this tea.
This tea works for me.  It calms down my anciety and makes me sleep better.  It may not work for everyone.  Thank you!

Summary: Sage Tea - helping with hot flashes
Text: When I bought the first box I had a cup of tea every night and thought the hot flashes subsided a bit, so I bought another box.  The second box, not so much.  I am not sure if the tea builds up in your system and stops working or if it is just me.  The tea does not have a bad taste, doable for its purpose.  Sage tea has been recommended by many as a means of cutting down hot flashes, vs taking meds that can be linked to cancer.  Give it try, it might work for you.
I bought this for treating symptoms of menopause.  It has been a life saver.  thank you
I bought this Tea for my girlfriend who is ery health conscious. So far she is loving it and it tastes good too. :)

Dr. Oz recommended fenugreek tea for your digestive track,(not this brand specifically). It was a good introduction.
Personally, don't care for the taste by itself, but with a bit of honey,yum! Will purchase again.

I purchased this tea because it is recommended for helping women's PMS symptoms and menopause symptoms.  I've only had one cup of it, so I can't say if it has helped my symptoms or not.  I have purchased other teas of this brand.  I would recommend their teas.  I wasn't crazy about the taste of the red clover, but that is just my personal opinion.  It's a little bitter but bearable.  Add some sugar and you're good to go.
I didn't realize it but my tea wasn't arriving as promptly as suggested. The company also noticed and sent a box out immediately! WOW! I was very impressed!

The tea has a mild, pleasant flavor and is easy to combine with others, without overpowering the mix. I've just moved to a new town, and I don't know where to look for the teas I need. Buying online saved me a lot of headaches. The boxes I ordered arrived promptly.

I read about the benefits of Pau D'Arco tea and decided to give it a try. It's hard to find this tea in the market. The Whole Foods near my house doesn't have it either.

The taste of this herbal tea is interesting: it's got a hint of sweetness with a very slight medicinal bitterness. Feels quite dry and alkaline to me. Color is light brown. Not particularly delightful or tasty, neither does it have a strong, captivating aroma like the Japanese roasted green tea - it's just weird beyond description. Reminds me of dried summer leaves. Not unpleasant though; I am still glad that I tried it!

Summary: Saw this on Dr. OZ for eliminating crows feet
Text: I watched Dr. OZ on television and he was explaining how to minimize and/or avoid crows feet. His advice? Drinking Fenugreek tea, taking L-Arginine supplements and getting a good nights' sleep (6 hour min.). Well, I am going to give it a shot. This tea has an interesting taste-not your typical tea but not bad. It tastes pretty good with a bit of honey added actually. I wasn't able to find this tea in any local supermarkets but here it is on Amazon. Seems they have everything!

Tea comes in bags inside a large foil lined pouch.  There are 2 bags 'attached', and you peel them apart to use one.  They are not individually wrapped, and they do not have strings.  Strong flavor, great price.

Summary: Sage Tea helps with night sweats
Text:
I have one cup a day and it really decreases my night sweats. I'm in amazement at how much it helps!

The taste isn't great, but I don't think it's as bad as some other reviews have said. If you're concerned about the taste, you can use some sage from your spice cabinet and make a cup. It tastes pretty much the same, but it didn't seem cost effective to use the sage you buy in the spice aisle.

Summary: Yes it does have an odor that some will find disagreeable, but it works for me and I will continue to purchase it
Text: I read some of the reviews on here and I almost didn't purchase.  But I reached a point where due to my erratic work schedule, trying to fit in my studying time and completing assignments, my sleep pattern was disrupted and it was affecting my mood and concentration.  So I bit the bullet and purchased this at a local B&M store.  When I got home after work, I boiled some water and opened the package.  I noticed that this tea was packaged in a plastic bag so I guess it did has a pungent smell.  I opened the plastic bag and took a big whiff.  I was kind of disappointed.  It doesn't smell as bad as some of the other reviewers made it out to me but then again my nose has been wonky for some time so it could be me.  Yes I will admit that it does has a funky odor but it is not that strong to me.  To me, smells like this health food store I used to frequent in the Hyde Park neighborhood.  Very musky but weirdly comforting.  I have tried it with peppermint, turmeric (for a different affliction) and I have tried it plain with stevia and it taste okay to me.  I wouldn't say I have an iron stomach because I can easily get sick if food is left out in the open not at the proper temperature.  For me, this product took about two days for it to kick in and I am now able to sleep for a full eight hours straight instead of sleeping in fits of four hours here, wake up for about two hours, sleep for three, wake up for a hour and sleep for another four hours.  For those with sensitive noses and sense of taste, you have been amply warned by other reviewers.  For others, I say give it a shot or at least pair it with some other teas to dilute the taste a bit.  For example, mints like peppermint or spearmint will help.  Some folks will use lavender to mask the smell.

Summary: It works for me and that is all I care about
Text: I read some of the reviews on here and I almost didn't purchase.  But I reached a point where due to my erratic work schedule, trying to fit in my studying time and completing assignments, my sleep pattern was disrupted and it was affecting my mood and concentration.  So I bit the bullet and purchased this at a local B&M store.  When I got home after work, I boiled some water and opened the package.  I noticed that this tea was packaged in a plastic bag so I guess it did has a pungent smell.  I opened the plastic bag and took a big whiff.  I was kind of disappointed.  It doesn't smell as bad as some of the other reviewers made it out to me but then again my nose has been wonky for some time so it could be me.  Yes I will admit that it does has a funky odor but it is not that strong to me.  To me, smells like this health food store I used to frequent in the Hyde Park neighborhood.  Very musky but weirdly comforting.  I have tried it with peppermint, turmeric (for a different affliction) and I have tried it plain with stevia and it taste okay to me.  I wouldn't say I have an iron stomach because I can easily get sick if food is left out in the open not at the proper temperature.  For me, this product took about two days for it to kick in and I am now able to sleep for a full eight hours straight instead of sleeping in fits of four hours here, wake up for about two hours, sleep for three, wake up for a hour and sleep for another four hours.  For those with sensitive noses and sense of taste, you have been amply warned by other reviewers.  For others, I say give it a shot or at least pair it with some other teas to dilute the taste a bit.  There are some great suggestions mentioned by other reviewers, like mint for example.
this is a great product,it helps to relieve my bloating.I will order it again.Thank you.its better then anything else i have tryed

Summary: Torani changed their original Hazelnut flavor!
Text: Have used the sugar-free Hazelnut syrup for a couple years now. Just got this 3-pack and discovered the flavor is waaay different; and not in a good way if you liked the original. The new product is quite 'artificial' tasting. Called Torani's and was told that 'yes' the formula had been changed and there had been so many complaints that they will soon be releasing the original flavor again (which has a richer, more mellow taste) but under the name 'Classic Hazelnut'. We will order again when it comes out...

I was using this product and loved it. They just sent me the new and improved and I thought I had soap in my coffee cup. Washed it out and found out it was the new flavor. It taste more like butterscotch or carmel. It gives you an after taste. Not impressed, canceled my other orders. Amazon it still the place to shop, there shipping is great etc.

Summary: Do NOT buy.  Amazon is messing this up just like the Caramel.
Text:
Do NOT buy this product. Although Amazon is showing the Classic Hazelnut flavor, they are shipping the regular Hazelnut flavor. The regular flavor is terrible and tastes like 1/2 peanut butter.

I wish Torani would stop messing with their flavors and/or test them with someone who can taste. This tastes nothing like hazelnut. It tastes like some kind of sweet chemical caramel flavor dominated by an off peanut butter taste.

If you want the REAL hazelnut taste, look for "Classic" Hazelnut. Unfortunately, you cannot trust Amazon to ship you the right version. I have purchased this several times in past years, but now I receive the regular Hazelnut.

This is just like the Caramel versus Classic Caramel debacle I experienced with Amazon last year. If you use the subscribe and save, you will really be screwed because ALL grocery items are non-returnable.

I suggest you buy at a local grocery store to be sure you are getting the CLASSIC Hazelnut flavor. Hopefully, in 6 months and enough customer complaints, Amazon will fix this. They also need to fire their Torani rep who keeps supplying Amazon with the wrong product or is "helping" by switching to new formulations.

Loved the original formula, but the new and improved tastes burnt or like burnt caramel - it's awful.  Just returned a bottle marked "original" on the bottle but "new and improved" on the neck.  Coffee shop across from work has switched to another brand for the sugar free hazelnut due to all the complaints.  Bring back the original original - I'm keeping my eyes out for the "classic"

Summary: Plenty of aftertaste, doesn't taste like hazelnut.
Text: I can't wait to finish the bottle of this so I can rid my pantry of it. Of the 4 flavors I've tried - coconut, mango, caramel and hazelnut this one tasted the worst. Coconut is probably the best, in terms of delivering a good flavor with minimal after taste. I have been using this in tea primarily.

ProfileName: MagnoliaSouth "As soon go kindle fire with sn...
Text:
I have to agree with everyone else. I once accidentally purchased the DaVinci Gourmet brand caramel and I remarked to my husband that it tasted like pancake syrup to me. When I bought this though, I was thrilled to be saving money. Imagine my disappointment then when I tried it the very first time. I believe this is the same syrup as the caramel, but with a different label slapped onto the bottle. No, really I do. I honestly cannot tell the difference between the two.

Well whatever it is, it is NOT hazelnut.

I would recommend the DaVinci Gourmet brand of sugar free Hazelnut OR hazelnut flavored Splenda packets instead. Amazon sells both DaVinci and Splenda, but neither have super saver shipping at the time of this writing. You have to balance for yourself whether or not the extra money is worth it to you.

Got this 3 pack and I shouldn't have.
It's gross, I'm not a fan.
Does not taste like most hazelnut flavors I've had and I don't think it's just the sugar free.

Summary: Good Tasting Sugar Free Syrup - Recommended
Text:
We generally like the Torani brand of sugar-free syrups and the Hazelnut is no exception. This has a fairly subtle flavor that tastes great in coffee or in baked goods. For a slightly stronger flavor, we also like Da Vinci SUGAR FREE Hazelnut (Toasted) Syrup 750mL with Splenda.

Recommended!

I bought this, really hoping to get something decent. Maybe not perfect, but decent.

How wrong. I added just a few drops to my coffee, and immediately, I noticed bubbles, like when you add vegetable oil to water. When I took a sip, all I tasted was a chemical-taste. I can't describe it more than that. I didn't taste hazelnut. It was merely a chemical taste.

I will never by from Torani again. Highly disappointed.
This was my favorite flavor of the Torani SF syrups, but I agree with other reviewers, the taste has changed. And I also agree - not in a good way.

Summary: coffee shop flavor at home! autoship from Amazon.
Text: I just love this torani syrup it has the most wonderful flavor. I could buy them at world market for twice the price in a glass bottle. Why? this is convenient and just as I am about to run out my autoship at the door. The hazelnut has such a sweet delicate flavor. Its like gourmet coffee at less than half the price in my pjs.

Summary: Sugar-free syrup makes my coffee SPECIAL!!
Text: Since this is sugar-free yet Hazelnut, it makes my morning coffee at work really special yet no calorie worries!! The 3 bottles are used quickly even though I only drink 1 cup/day!

I always order this syrup for my coffee online, because it is convenient with the price I get, plus I can not find that size at the market, here at the east coast, they deliver it promptly, so I will keep ordering. Happy with it.

Summary: perfect for making a coffee smoothie
Text:
Sugar Free Coffee Smoothie
1 cup strong coffee
1 envelope of Sugar Free Carnation Instant Breakfast (vanilla)
2 T Sugar Free Hazelnut Coffee Mate
1 generous splash Torani Sugar Fee Hazelnut Syrup
1 cup non fat milk (or 40 cal Almond Milk)
3/4 tray of ice cubes
Put all ingredients in a blender. Blend on high until ice is crushed and smoothie is smooth. Pour into large cup with straw and enjoy!

To begin with, compared to my local supermarket I am getting nearly double (15.4 oz to 25.1 oz) for one dollar more per bottle with this amazon 3-pack. This alone means good things for me, because I can get great flavoring syrups for a more reasonable price. The flavor is pretty good for a sugarfree syrup, although the hazelnut flavor is slightly lacking compared to the "sugared" version (this is the reason for the 4-stars). But all in all this is a great deal for anyone looking to cut some calories (a starbucks beverage has about 300 sometimes more from syrup alone) and overall a pretty good taste.
I did not like this brand as well as the Da Vinci brand It has a very strong after taste.  And now I have 3 bottles of it to use up or give away.

I love this product, I have been looking for something like this for a while.It taste great and does not take room up in my refridgerator. It is a lot like what they use at Dunkin Donuts I can only wish they had it in sugar free coconut.
I have purchased this product twice - the first time it was great!  The second, I returned it because it tasted "off".  I tried to rate it "zero" stars, but couldn't.

This syrup is perfect for making Italian cream sodas or flavoring your coffee.  I love the taste of hazelnut and I recommend this flavor.  I like the fact that I could get 3 bottles instead of just one.  And the price is the best.  If you were to buy this size in a store, it would cost you twice as much as Amazon does.  Great deal!
This product is great, it adds to the flavor of my coffee without the sugar or calories.  I really love it.
Torani Sugar-Free Syrup, Hazelnut, 25.4-Ounce Bottle (Pack of 3) Very good flavor! I use for coffee, on my cereal instead of sugar, and in my yogurt.

Use this in my Lattie's every day.. Used to get this product at different stores here in Sacramento until I found it here on Amazon.. So much cheaper, easier and I love the plastic bottles much better than the glass that you get at the stores..

I agree with some of the other reviewers. I have been buying this product, mostly to add to coffee, for several years. At some point, I noticed that the flavor changed, and (to my palate at least), it was a change for the worse. After noticing some of the recent reviews, I made sure to order the "Classic" flavor when my supply started to run low. When it arrived, I taste-tested vs. the "non-Classic?" that I still had on hand, and (again, to my palate), the "Classic" tasted far superior. I suppose other people may prefer the new flavor, but for me, the Classic is the one I'll order from now on.

Well, what do you expect from sugar free products? they all suck anyways
it has same shitty chemical flavor which diet coke has.
no joke but this syrup tastes more like a toothpaste then hazelnut.

I love the flavor of this product and the best part is that is sugar free. They came in plastic bottles instead glass (the ones i bought before at the supermarket were glass and half side and almost the same price). Very good deal
I use Torani sf hazelnut for a few applications. I do enjoy an asian salad dressing and am very sensitive to sugar and cannot eat peanuts or peanut butter so this is an awesome substitute.

Summary: sickening after the third or fourth use
Text:
I bought is on S&S and that's unfortunate because I'm not even finished with the first bottle and I already am soooo disgusted by the flavor. It has a really strong smell that is quite nauseating. I actually think the smell is the reason I don't like it rather than the taste.

I do LOVE LOVE LOVE the peppermint flavor as well as the vanilla one. So if you're wanting a solid sweetener without added calories/sugar then choose the vanilla.

I've ordered the sugar free Hazelnut syrup from Amazon before and it tasted just as I expected (like my local coffee house).  However, my most recent order (a pack of 3 bottles) tasted like caramel, smells very sweet and has no hint of hazelnut. I thought perhaps is was a packaging mistake since all 3 bottles had the same horrible taste. However, I was told that Torani changed the recipe. If you're expecting a hazelnut flavor, don't order this product anymore unfortunately.
This is so hard to find in this area of the country!! I am so thrilled to be able to add it to my coffee, AND have it on auto resend!! It arrives on time and wrapped safely in plastic bottles.
Good product. I use it everyday with my coffee. Use a shot of it in a 10 cup coffee pot. I buy this product via the subscribe service - good program.
I really like Torani Hazelnut sugar-free syrup.  Every night I use it in my coffee somtimes 2-3 times a night. It is very refreshing and I really enjoy it, very relaxing.

Love this!  I use it in my coffee every morning.  The aroma is wonderful and the flavor is perfect. I decide how much hazelnut flavor I want, and with NO added calories.  Using the Ship & Save program saves me so much money, and I never run out.

I had subscribed to have monthly delivery of a 3 pack of Torani Syrup...The Torani Syrup is fine...After about 6 months, I stopped getting delivery...I contacted Amazon and was told that they no longer had my current address, I have not moved and I have made other purchases from Amazon during that time period...My account at Amazon still has my current address and I have not moved in 10 years.
Someone at Amazon is incompetent..

I have been a user of Starbucks sugar-free syrups for about 5 years.  Their price has gone up from about $7 a bottle to over $10 a bottle.  I started looking for a replacement.  I ordered the Torani syrups as a lower-cost alternative.  The order arrived on time.  The price was good.  Problem is, I found I don't like the taste of the Torani syrups.  I should have tried the syrup as a local coffee house before I ordered.  My bad.
I LOVE this stuff!!! It's sugarfree, sodium free, calorie free, but soooo full of flavor! You cannot go wrong ordering this!

I prefer hazelnut flavored coffee and used instant Taster's Choice brand until they stopped packaging it in the 6 or 7 oz canisters.  After experimenting with various flavoring agents I found this Torani syrup to fill the bill.  Don't add any sugar or sweetener as the syrup is already sweet.  Personally I am very happy with the results.  I have my hazelnut instant coffee again at a reasonable price.

Summary: Torani Sugar- Free Syrup in the Plastic Bottle
Text: Frankly, I was dissapointed.  I bought the same product in the glass bottle (smaller size) in my local grocery store and loved it.  Unfortunately (for reasons I do not know) this product had a slightly unpleasant chemically after-taste that the product in the glass bottle did not have.
While I am a big fan of the Sugar Free Torani syrups, when I received this packaged of three bottles, one was leaking.  Not really sure how to get it replaced.  Great product though.

I purchased 6 bottles of the sugar free Hazelnut hoping that based on the comments, it would taste like what I have bought in the past.  Unfortunately, it is like other people have commented...it doesn't taste the same and it doesn't smell the same even though it says "original" recipe on it.  I guess on the plus side I use less of it but that isn't good for the manufacturer :).  Delivery was timely and they do come in the plastic bottles.
The Torani syrup (sugar free Hazelnut) was better than expected! I'm glad it came in a three pak, because I am using it often!! Highly recommended!!

Fast delivery; got it the day after Labor Day. Items just as described, packaged well, and the least-priced of this same item as compared to other web offerings. A very pleasant transaction. Done And Done!

Not bad as far as syrups go.  Has the right viscosity but it leaves behind an unpleasant aftertaste.  Must be the artificial sweetner.  Another downside for me is that the hazelnut flavour isn't very strong but this may appeal to other customers.
I do not use anyother flavoring that the hazelnut from Amazon.  Please continue to carry same.

I bought this thinking some of the reviews were old and must have changed the formula by now.  Wrong!!  I don't like the taste and probably will throw two full bottles away - I was using the DaVinci Original sugar free and that was very good, will go back to that brand and buy it at Sam's Club.

I love all the Torani sugar-free syrups I have tried.  I use them in my coffee (hot or iced) nearly every morning.  I frequently mix the Chocolate sugar-free syrup and the hazelnut sugar-free syrup in my coffee for a custom flavor.  The price and selection are the best at Amazon.

Summary: torani sugar-free hazelnut syrup for coffee
Text: Taste is great in coffee.  Also, love the plastic bottles.  The ones I previously purchased in the store had glass bottles.

Summary: Best Sugar Free Syrup on the market
Text: I've tried several popular brands, including Artisan and Da Vinci (a close second) but Torani beats them, hands down. The hazelnut is a particular favorite and I use it in coffee, iced coffee, plain yogurt and trifle recipes.  Purchase it in the 3-pack and rest assured that Amazon has the best price out there.

Summary: Zero calories and lots of flavor.
Text: No calories and great taste. I use the hazelnut in my coffee. Amazon's price is fantastic on the three bottles especially if you "subscribe and save". The bottles are plastic unlike the stores where they are glass. I have about five different flavors and use them in carbonated water as well as smoothies. I wish Amazon offered more flavors at this great price.

I've used Torani syrups before and the only problem I had was that they are pricey if you buy them at local stores.  I've eliminated that problem using Amazon and still get the same quality.  The sugar free hazelnut is very tasty.

We love having this syrup in our coffee sometimes, but didn't want to keep buying the small bottles at the grocery store (bad value for money to buy it piecemeal like that, and bad for the environment with all the small bottles). So this was a great solution, and we've been very happy with it! The same great taste we love, but better value all round. Highly recommended.

I have been using this syrup for quite sometime now and it never disappoints me. I have bought just about every flavor there is. I only wish that Torani would come out with a sugar free cinnamon. I use the Hazelnut religiously in my coffee every morning

Torani Sugar-Free is an established sugar free syrup in a wide variety of flavors.  They are delicious and the Amazon price is a nearly 30% discount from the regular price at various stores, including Walmart.

hazelnut and irish creme are my 2 favs from torani. i use them and the
sweetener stevia to add to coffee. delisciouso
I make my own ice coffee and use Torani Sugar-Free Hazelnut Syrup and I love it!

Torani sugar free syrup mixed with regular liquid coffee creamer makes a great low-cost, low calorie flavored creamer. It only takes about 4oz per quart of creamer to make creamer about half the price of those high priced coffee creamers.
I bought this to make my lattes at home and try to save some money, unfortunately Starbucks has there own formulas so it didn't work out as I had hoped

Delicious, not overly cloying sweet, perfectly balanced, good hazelnut flavor, not artificial.  Good concentration.  Husband loves it and since I bought it for him, that's what's important.  I'm not a hazelnut person but even I like it in iced coffee.  Husband likes it in iced and hot.

It was hard for our cats to get over their fancy feast addiction but this helped a lot!  I went through newmans own which they didn't like much, organix they didn't like much, one food from zealand which I didn't like (the smell).  So this was the winner.  They still didn't like it as much as fancy feast but since they have gotten over their addiction they scarf this stuff down in seconds and beg for more.  Plus it isn't too expensive and is healthy for them.

Summary: Good stuff, according to the cat
Text: My 18 year old Maine Coon loves it!  She has a hard time with dry food, so she eats mostly wet.  This variety she loves mixed with a little water.  It's about all she'll eat now!

I purchased this Lick your Chops Delicacy in the Chicken and Catfish flavor. The ingredient list sounded like a "to die for" mix of things that my kitties would like. When the case arrived and I opened the first can, I was appalled. It looked like your average cheepo catfood. It is a "pate" type formulation with everything ground together and molded into the can. My 4 cats get 7, three oz cans per night for their dinner rations. Needless to say, Dinner is an exciting time at my house. But I put this pate in the bowl with a sinking hear. I figured that I had just bought a case that would end up with the recsue kitties as a donation.

However, I was pleasantly surpirised. The first night the kitties had this, the entire bowl was eaten, so the ingredients and taste must be good, though they are indistinguishable! The second night I put this out, about an eigth of the can remained at the end of the day. I had given this choice on consecutive days. My kitties are quite spoiled and ONLY a FEW things will be eaten two nights in a row.

So I waited a week, and, sure enough, the third can was eaten in its entirety. So I give this four stars. I try to give 5 only to the foods they will eat everyday, everytime. So, If I have to strectch out the offerings, I only give 4 stars. My kitties agree and say "thank you" from Gabriella, Trinity, Wisdom, Mercy, and Yellow Kitty.

Of all of the sheep's milk cheeses available, Kasseri is just my all-time favorite. It is smooth, creamy, mild, and delicious! Wish it was more readily available, as it is an exceptionally good cheese...bar none.

I'm trying to watch my weight (ain't doing well, but....) and I like things sweetened with Splenda best, so this syrup is great for me. I used the subscription plan to get 3 bottles a month sent to me with a small discount applied. I go through it faster than I thought I would!

I like that it comes in plastic bottles, instead of glass like other brands....so I just throw them into our recycling bin when I'm done.

I bought it to pretty much just use in coffee, but I'm more often than not making delicious sugar-free vanilla sodas with seltzer. Tastes great, no cals, and no tooth decay....yay!

Torani Sugar-Free Syrup, Vanilla, 25.4-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 3)

Edit: 5/15/11

Well, I really loved this syrup when it was $14.85 for a 3 pack using Subscribe & Save. Then it went up to $17.20, and now it's $22.82, which is really irritating to me. Especially when the other sugar-free flavors are a lot less than the vanilla now. So I switched to DaVinci for $14.75 for a 3-pack. I hope I like it as much!

Summary: Perfect for Coffee...and a great price
Text: This is the perfect addition to any cup of coffee. The price with subscribe-and-save is the best around! Enjoy!
This syrup helps me enjoy my diet coke. Diet coke without Sugarless Torani Vanilla is not good.

Summary: The only sugar free variety I use
Text: I generally don't like sugar free syrups as they generally taste little like their counterparts.  However, this vanilla variety is an exception.  In a latte or other coffee based drink, it is nearly indistinguishable from the normal kind and it sweet drinks, I cannot tell the difference.

Summary: Great Diabetic Friendly Flavoring - Highly Recommended!
Text:
We have tried most of the Torani Sugar-Free Syrups and like them all. The Vanilla flavor is very good, being rich and creamy, while not having an "aftertaste" that other sugar-free products can have. The real test for me is if our teens will use it, and they also find it tasty.

We use this syrup in our coffee and frappes, dispensing it with Espresso Supply 750-Mililiter Syrup Bottle Pump,.

Highly Recommended!

CFH
Sugar free Torani vanilla syrup tastes great in coffee and one of the best sugar free flavors I've tasted.

My husband and I love the SF Van iced coffee at McDonalds and I have tried several syrups including DaVinci and could never achieve the same taste.  With the Torani Syrup, good brewed coffee and half & half it was easy and perfect.  I will definitely purchase more and will probably try some of the other flavors, especially the ones that are sugar-free.

Love to mix this with my espresso and occasionally with some sparkling water.  Great flavor with no aftertaste like some sugar free products.  One word of advice, a little goes a long way.  Don't overdue it with the pump.  I have used the sugar-free French vanilla and sugar-free caramel, I find the regular vanilla to be the best.
I use this daily in my coffee, along with the sugar free chocolate & hazelnut syrup....very flavorful!

I love this stuff!! I add it to coffee (both hot and iced) on a daily basis. When I bought it on amazon I received three bottles for 16 and FREE shipping!!! I just wish I could find that deal all the time.
INSTEAD OF BUYING ICE COFFEE OUT, I MAKE MINE AT HOME AND USE THE SYRUP. IT SAVES US MONEY AND CALORIES IN THE LONG RUN.
It makes everything good taste better.  I use it instead of sugar in Mojito.
Flavored syrups add to the taste of your latte.  Amazon handled this order quickly and at less expense for shipping and handling than any other site I visited.  Recommended.

As I stated on my review of the sugar free caramel syrup, I also use the sugar free vanilla syrup. I make a cookie shake almost as good as Applebees and with a lot less sugar.  Use sugar free Murray's "oreo" cookies, sugar free cool whip and sugar free vanilla syrup along with skim milk and vanilla protein powder.  I use zero carb isopure.  It has no carbs.

I bought this from a small local world food shop-a bit more expensive there.  But I love the product.  I love it in my coffee, no need for flavored creamer or sugar.  Its great in tea also.  I want to try the raspberry in hot chocolate-I hear its to die for.
Tried Torani vanilla sugar free as recommended by Hungry Girl. Delicious! Just wish it was offered in smaller bottles. I now have PLENTY of Torani Sugar Free Syrup!

I didn't know what to expect as far as how long the product Torani sugar-free syrup would take for me to receive or how it would be packaged.I was delighted to receive it the very next day and will continue to order from this seller.I had no idea that the product came in plastic bottles which is so much easier for me to use due to pain in my hands.Great job! Thank you very much!

Summary: GREAT FOR DIABETICS AND LOW CARB DIETS
Text: UNLIKE THE PHONEY LOW CARB AND NO CARB(ACTUALLY LOADED WITH CARBS) BREADS AND ROLLS THEY ARE SELLING THAT RAISE PEOPLES BLOOD SUGAR TO PLUTO,THESE ARE REALLY 0 AND 1 CARB PRODUCTS,AND THE VANILLA AND CARAMEL ARE ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS WITH NO AFTER TASTE,ALSO VERY CHEAP FOR WHAT YOU GET(3 GIANT BOTTLES)ESPECIALLY IF YOU USE SUBSCRIBE AND SAVE,TRY IT,YOU WILL BE HAPPY YOU DID.

Summary: Good way to wean yourself off sugar...
Text: I drink a lot of coffee and ergo use a lot of sugar, but am trying to cut sugar out of my diet.  Although I will use Splenda, I am not fond of the aftertaste.  I've tried Truvia too, which also has an aftertaste.  I guess since none of these sugar substitutes are really sugar, they're all going to have an aftertaste.  So while this product is no different, the slight vanilla flavor helps to either cut down on the aftertaste or distracts your tastebuds from it.  One downside is that the bottle goes quickly for hardcore coffee drinkers, which probably more expensive than just straight Splenda.  Overall, I think it's a good alternative to sugar and would recommend it to those who are trying to cut down on sugar consumption.

Summary: Taste Really Bad - better brands out there
Text: We bought this thinking it would be as good as the DaVinci.  It isn't even close.  This brand has a terrible after taste and doesn't even have a decent taste.  I love vanilla coke zero.  This ruins it!

I normally buy this product in a larger city a couple of hours away.  Have not been able to find it in my town.  The price is better on Amazon but the shipping will kill ya!  Makes it just as much as the one I buy out of town.  Course I don't make a special trip for it but when I have to go for a doctor's visit I always stop and buy what I need there.  Sorry Amazon!!!

Summary: Not as good as I hoped
Text: Torani Sugar Free Vanilla Syrup was good but not great. I picked up a three pack on sale and I was not pleased. It does not have the richness that DaVinci syrups have. Now I will admit the reason I out this was the three bottles cost less than three bottles of DaVinci. Until my finances straighten out, I am going back to black coffee.

Summary: does not taste good in milk
Text: when added to milk,this leaves a bad aftertaste in the mouth. vanilla essence has a much cleaner and stronger Vendela flavour than this syrup

Summary: Torani Sugar-Free SyrupVanilla good value and flavor
Text: The sugar-free vanilla Torani's is a very good value and flavor although the Sugar-free French Vanilla is the best and would like to get it on Amazon
If you buy this product from DAB nutrition, you'll pay almost as much for shipping as they charge for the product -- don't believe their shipping fee chart.
I found this in the natural category. Trust me it is not natural! Splenda is as toxic a sweetener as aspartame (NutraSweet/Equal). Check out the site Splendaexposed(dot)com.

ProfileName: On a Mission "On Mission for the Truth"
Text: It's beyond me why this product shows up in the natural and organic section.  What's natural and organic about Sodium Benzoate and Potassium Sorbate, Acesulfame Potassium, and worst of all Sucralose (Splenda Brand)- nothing but poison IMHO!  No, I don't own it, and no, I won't buy it for that very reason!

Summary: Boo if you live in Hawaii
Text: Great product & price, but if you don't live in the 48, you're outta luck!  As usual, products like these aren't being shipped outside of the continental 48...

Summary: Excellent flavor, made in the USA!
Text:
Torani Sugar-Free syrups are some of the best in the business. This makes an excellent flavor addition to both smoothies and coffee and it tastes just like the full sugar versions. What makes it even easier to use is Torani and Davinci syrup pump. According to my favorite barista at Starbucks, a venti takes 5-6 squirts, although I think I normally use only a couple of squirts to obtain the perfect flavor for my smaller cups of coffee made at home. Amazon grocery currently sells 3 flavors of Torani Sugar Free syrups, Torani Sugar-Free Syrup, Caramel, 25.4-Ounce Bottle (Pack of 3), Torani Sugar-Free Syrup, Hazelnut, 25.4-Ounce Bottle (Pack of 3), and this syrup. Since Torani currently makes 27 different Sugar Free flavors, it would be nice if through Amazon they would offer a combo pack of 4 flavors, or just make more flavors available on Amazon. I really enjoy this syrup and have tried other brands, but always come back to Torani. I was pleased to see this available as a auto-ship item at Amazon and will be buying many more bottles through the Subscribe & Save program.

I would love to see Peppermint, Vanilla Bean, and Irish Cream flavors added. These also make excellent Italian sodas, and dozens of drink recipes can be found at the Torani web site.

Update: I'm pleased to see that Amazon has added 3 new sugar free flavors:

Torani Sugar Free Raspberry, 25.4-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 3)
Torani Sugar Free Chocolate, 25.4-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 3)
Torani Sugar Free Irish Cr¿me, 25.4-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 3)

Great price, too! Better than my grocer.

Summary: Diet Cream Soda is available again
Text: I have always loved cream soda and when the A&W version was no longer available to me I started looking for a substitute.  This is it!  All it takes is sparkling water and this syrup.  No sugar, and still the great taste of cream soda.  I LOVE THIS PRODUCT!

Torani's" Sugar Free Vanilla Flavor Syrup", is a nice way to add a little variety to your coffee, without having to run out to a Starbuck's. As I mentioned in the title, there are no calories, fats, carbs or sugars. The taste is very sweet and vanillery, and you can use it in anything you want to add a little variety or flavor. I like it in my Pellegrino. Makes a nice Vanilla Soda. In my coffee, I found I did not have to add anything else. The syrup was good enough and tasty enough on it's own.I use it whenever I get a sweet tooth to get me past a craving for something with more calories involved.

It is sweetened with "Splenda", and if you are not used to using Sugar substitutes, you may not like the little bit of an after taste it leaves. Otherwise - consider this a 5 star product!

Ingrediants as listed are:
Purified Water, Vanilla Extract With Other Natural Flavors, Sodium Benzoate and Potassium Sorbate (to Preserve Freshness), Citric Acid, Xanthan Gum, Sucralose (Splenda Brand), and Acesulfame Potassium.

It's a bargain as sold here compared with my supermarket per bottle. I'll probably use one to two tablespoons per drink.(more or less depending on the drink) You'll get your money's worth. Add it to anything you want, hot chocolate, iced tea, etc. Maybe with the holiday's coming, it would be a nice change in other beverages as well. It is also sold with sugar added,and there are several other flavors with or without sugar, just click on other products by Torani at top of page. .

Cheers....Laurie
bought the product beliving it's gr8 but it turns out it just tastes as bad as sugar free vanilla creamer ,, leaves a bad taste on your tongue ,,,, can't even return it since i've already opened it.

Torani Sugar-Free Syrup, Vanilla, 25.4-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 3)

I love to make my own cappuccino, and the Torani Sugar-Free Syrup adds a delicous flavor to the milk. I use it every morning. Making my own coffee drink saves me a bundle, and with Torani, the flavor is as good or better than a $5 coffee at a specialty coffee house.

ProfileName: Jolly Green Giant "You can try Birchbox too! ...
Text: I LOVE this syrup. I add a teaspoon of this and a teaspoon of cream to my green tea and it's heavenly. I also use this in coffee, cola, and recipes. If you want to make homemade whipped cream this replaces the sweetener and adds a nice vanilla flavor. I even used this in a homemade egg nog recipe and it was amazing. If you love vanilla and watch your sugar, this will become a staple in your pantry.
Very good flavor and not filled with a bunch of chemicals. Although there are still questions about some of the ingredients, it is a great alternative to what's on the shelf in the grocery store.
I put it in my Diet Coke since Diet Vanilla Coke us no longer available.  It does not have that chemical taste that vanilla extract has.  I prefer it to the Da Vinci brand.
I liked the vanilla but have not tried any of the other flavors.  This product and page is the vanilla flavor and people are complaining about the carmel and hazelnut!  Ok then!! lol!!
I love this stuff!!! Great in coffee, milk, over berries, mixed in drinks, etc. Best of all, it adds no additional calories and tastes great too!
Of the several brands I've tried this is the best one. It has a richer vanilla flavor than any other. Great in coffee or egg creams :-)

Summary: Great Sugar Free Syrup and a Great Price
Text: I was purchasing this Torani sugar free syrup at my local grocers.  I love the taste for my home made iced coffee.  My grocer decided to discontinue carrying this product. Thank Goodness or I never would have known I was paying way too much there!  I paid $5 for a bottle half the size of ONE of the bottles included here!  This 3 pack is a great value for a super yummy item.  Thanks Amazon!
I LOVE THIS SYRUP!!!  I USE IT IN COKE ZERO & TEA.  DON'T THINK I WANT TO GO WITHOUT IT!!!!

Decided to try a small bottle from the store & once I blew through it in less than a week I decided to go ahead & get the Amazon deal. My husband & I drink coffee everyday, this syrup (& the caramel) are fabulous for flavoring coffee one those days when you want to feel fancy & pampered. I was afraid the artificial sweetener would give it a chemical aftertaste - but not at all. It's an inexpensive luxury, both in cash & calories.
The price was great,No carbs and auto shipping keeps me in stock, fee shipping to boot  what more can you ask for  tx amazon

My wife loves these Torani Sugar Free Syrups.  We have found them rather difficult to find locally but on Amazon they are very reasonably priced (especially since we went with the scheduled shipping option).  Excellent deal and outstanding product.

Was skeptical ordering the sugar-free version... but what can I say - the reviews were spot on.  Tastes great - I don't taste the "Splenda" flavor .. and you could have fooled me that there was no sugar in this.  I use it in sodas and other drinks and it's fantastic!

Unable to get this product on a regular basis in any of the local groceries stores.  I am now receiving it a monthly basis and so happy to be able to enjoy it in my coffee every morning.  I love this flavor in my coffee and can now avoid the coffee shops.

Buy it, you'll like it!  This stuff is delicious!!  There is no after taste that I can detect.  Goes great in just about anything you would like to add flavoring to, especially coffee.  The kids like to use it to flavor chipped ice and so do I.
This is the same syrup used by many good coffee shops and is excellent in flavor.  The Sugar Free uses Splenda and has no aspartame so does not have the bad aftertaste or allergy issues.

Summary: Add it to diet coke for a great vanilla soda
Text: If you are fan of flavored diet cokes such as the cherry, lime, or vanilla--this is a great way to make your own.  Sometimes it is difficult to find drinks that have that extra special flavor sometimes--but this is a great way to add to the ordinary diet coke.  It is easiest to add to 16 or 20 ounce bottles.  I have been adding the vanilla and found that it tastes great.
Torani Syrup, Sugar-Free Vanilla, 25.4-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 3) Best price anywhere. I use for coffee, cereal and yogurt. Very good!

Just over a year ago we decided that it would make a lot of sense (financial and otherwise) to cut down on the number of Starbucks drinks that we purchased on a daily basis. I did a bit of searching online and came across some recipes for making our own drinks --- and many recommended this syrup.

My wife particularly likes sugar-free vanilla, non-fat lattes and they're surprisingly easy to make. We use a 16 ounce cup, two shots of espresso, 3 tablespoons of this SFV and fill the rest with steamed milk. Truly --- she says she either can't tell a difference from Starbucks or that (gasp!) the homemade variety tastes better!

We've probably saved well over $1000 this past year by doing this and this syrup really is the cornerstone of the drink.

Pro tip: sign up for the automatic renewal and buy this stuff several at a time. If you run out and have to reorder, you can easily end up spending $20 on Sbux drinks while you're waiting for the UPS truck to show. :-)

Summary: Amazon has the best price for this!!!
Text: I started out buying this at the grocery stores and quickly became addicted.  All of a sudden they raised the price and I started looking elsewhere for a cheaper solution for my "addiction".  lol  I found it sold in 3 packs for cheaper than at the store!  Then, when you sign up for the subscription you get it even cheaper!!  Win!!! I love knowing I can just come here if I'm running out before my next shipment and adjust it to come faster.  I am an Amazon Prime member so I know that in just 2 days I'll have my next shipment with FREE SHIPPING.

Summary: A sugar free alternative for your morning coffee
Text: Trying to cut back on sugar hasn't been easy and so far hasn't been too successful for me. But if I can incorporate a few items into my daily routine I figure it helps, which is why I purchased the Torani Syrup, Sugar-Free Vanilla. I drink 1-2 cups of coffee a day and normally add a spoonful or two of brown sugar with my cream, but now I've started using this syrup. Although I can tell that its sugar free it has a more pleasing taste than other artificial sweeteners I've tried. I've also found a little goes a long way. By the way I purchased this on Subscribe & Save and it was worth that pricing in my opinion.

Best way I have found to purchase this syrup yet. Especially if you do the Subscribe & Save option. Plus the syrup now comes in plastic bottles ensuring breakage will not occur during shipment. All in all  great buy!

Can't argue with the price. Have been using this brand for several years and always come back to it. Like the French Vanilla as well, but that wasn't an option at this price.
Not too sweet and doesn't have the after taste many sugar-free products can have.

ProfileName: James Beswick "In my day, we had 9 planets."
Text:
One of the big challenges of the low-carb diet regime is finding substitute products that are low on sugar and carbohydrates, but taste reasonably and function "as expected" in recipes. Well, Torani delivers on both counts, and the vanilla works wonderfully in espresso drinks and desserts. It's actually hard to tell the product is sugar-free, since it doesn't have the aftertaste you would associated with a sugar-free sweetener.

I think you'd be hard-pressed to beat the price on Amazon (I found the same product in retail for twice the price). Although we've been used the vanilla quite frequently, the 3-pack looks like it's going to take a long, long time to use up - it really doesn't take much syrup to infuse the flavor. Finally, in terms of packaging, the bottles are plastic which definitely affords them better protection in the mail too.

This is good in about anything. I love diet coke with vanilla and this makes it better then you can buy. No added calories and tastes just like the one with sugar. It's also good making ice vanilla lattes. It does lose some vanilla flavor in hot strong coffee, but still adds sweetness. Wonderful product. Buy the Espresso Supply 750-Mililiter Syrup Bottle Pump, to go with it! It is less mess and you can control how much you put in better.

Summary: You'd Never Know It's Sugar Free!
Text: My Husband & I have been on lower carb/higer fiber/less sodium lifestyles for nearly 10 yrs. & are always looking for new SF items to fit our needs. We use this for our oatmeal, in baking, in our coffee...well you get the idea! We need MORE SF flavors!

Summary: Lots of sweetness with no calories!
Text: I bought this product the first time because of Hungry Girl's endorsement. I like it to sweeten and flavor coffee. To me it tastes better than other similar products.
Much better value than what I can find in my local supermarket.  Now I have it on a scheduled delivery from Amazon!

Torani Syrup, Sugar-Free Vanilla, 25.4-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 3) This syrup is great. It has lots of vanilla flavor. It can be used in soft drinks to add a touch of vanilla to cola products and I also use it heated up in coffee. As an added bonus, by microwaving a small amount in my cup before adding the coffee to my cup, the coffee stays warm much longer.
Having a family tendancy towards diabetes (I am OK so far) - this product is wonderful.  At $5 per bottle (delivered) this was a great price.  Very satisfied.

Never in my life have I had so many uses for this product.  You cannot imagine all of its wonderful uses.  I find myself using it to enhance the flavor of everything.  I started out using it in Sparkling Water.  And the next thing I new I was adding a dash to this and a dash to that and now I have used one and a half bottles and this morning I was thinking...Now you ONLY have ONE bottle left, maybe I need to put my order in for more.  I have frozen raw cranberries and this morning I put some in a blender and added a couple of drops of Stevia and a dash of my Torani and then I added that to my Sparking Water and OMG!!!  Simply divine.  I was JUST thinking to myself...I don't think I can live without this stuff.  I put it in a blend of Almond/Coconut milk with a little Stevia and you can make a wonderful low fat/low cal milk shake with a few ice cubes.  If  you are trying to watch calories or sugar intake this product will help you to prevent feeling like you are being penalized.  So I encourage you to take a chance if you are looking for this type of product.  In my opinion, I do not think you will have any regrets. :-))) I have even thought about making a food goody bag and giving this as one of the gifts in it.  And once you get on a creative roll you will realize that you are GLAD you got the 3 bottle deal.  Now I would not even consider just buying one bottle at a time.  LOL!!!

Summary: Excellent for home use to avoid buying out!
Text: This syrup is delicious. It is the same syrup used to many chain restaurants and coffee shops to make a variety of iced and hot coffee drinks. It does not have the "aftertaste" some people find with sugar free products, in my opinion. It allows you to make drinks at home that are comparable, if not better than, those bought retail. What a money saver!

I  love these flavorings in tea or coffee, my favorite being Irish Creme.  I am on a strict low carb diet.  This allows me to enjoy a "sinfull" cup without the sugar and it is so much cheaper than the grocery store.

Summary: Great taste in a sugar free syrup!
Text: Such a good taste that it's sometimes hard to remember that it is sugar free. I make my own coffee vanilla lattes and use skim milk so it is a great tasting low calorie treat.  I get the Torani Sugar-Free Vanilla Syrup on subscribe and save which saves me money and gets free shipping.  I live in a small town and only 1 grocery store sells it and they are frequently out for several weeks.  So getting it from Amazon is a great way to make sure I don't run out.  I also have a pump on mine so no measuring, couldn't be easier.

Summary: Not bad, but don't love it
Text: I bought the Torani Sugar-Free Vanilla Syrup so I could make homemade diet cream soda.  I absolutely LOVED the Canfield's/Graf's Diet Swiss Creme soda, and have been craving it since they stopped making it several years ago.  Because this syrup had gotten such good reviews and the 3-pack price was good on Amazon, I ordered the pack and couldn't wait for it to arrive.  I bought a couple 2-liter bottles of carbonated water in anticipation of the delivery, and had made my first glass of diet cream soda within 5 minutes of receiving the package.  While it wasn't bad, I wasn't very impressed.  For lack of a better way to explain it, the flavor wasn't as 'full-bodied' as I had hoped.  I found that I had to use quite a bit of the syrup to get enough flavor, but even then it wasn't what I had been hoping for.  I would be 100% okay with having to use a lot of it if it tasted like my favorite pop.  I had high hopes for it to taste similar to the Canfield's, but it really didn't at all.  It basically tastes exactly like what it is -- diet vanilla syrup.  I'm hoping to come up with other uses for it, so the remaining 2.5 bottles I have don't go to waste.

Summary: Great Tasting, Economical Size, Amazon Dependable Delivery!
Text: I use Torani Sugar-Free Vanilla syrup daily in frozen coffee drinks as well as in oatmeal.  I am very pleased indeed.  The flavor is excellent for a sugar-free product and the larger sized bottle available from Amazon makes it efficient and economical as I now go through only one bottle about every two to three weeks (thus the three pack lasts about two months before I need more).  As always, the combination of Amazon's fast free delivery and fair price (no added taxes) makes this a highly recommended buy on an great product, plus if you want to save even more you can buy it on Amazon's subscription basis where you select the delivery frequency that suits your needs.  Torani and Amazon can't be beat for the combination of quality, reliability, and price.

I love this sugar-free product I have purchased 12 bottles for my morning coffee.  I have also purchased 6 bottles of not sugar-free and gave them as gifts.  I originaly purchased this at a warehouse store but they no longer carried this produce and found it on Amazon.  Yeah!
Torani Syrup is a great way to make yummy beverages in your own home or office.  It cuts down on the cost of buying them out all the time and adds gourmet flare to normal beverages!  Very fun!

I love the tea lattes served at our high priced coffee shop, but with this syrup I can make one at home for pennies.  The price offered at Amazon is very good on auto delivery.  Much cheaper than buying it locally.  I use many of the Toriani syrups, but the sf vanilla goes with just about everything.

We had been buying our sugar-free vanilla syrups at Costco until it was discontinued. Amazon's Torani sugar-free vanilla syrup is an excellent replacement -- and it's delivered to our door at no charge. The price is a little higher but the flavor is far superior -- no unpleasant aftertaste.
We like our morning coffee with flavoring and Torini is about the best we've experienced. We actually find the sugar-free (Splenda) tastes better than the sugar sweetened. No bitterness and very convenient. We'll continue to order our syrups from Amazon...

Torani sugar free syrups are a true life-saver for those on a sugar or carb restricted diet. I am happy to have tried the Vanilla one as I now use it for a variety of things!

-My morning Cafe Americano gets always gets Vanilla and one other flavor. The Vanilla isn't an overpowering taste, so it creates a perfect base for sweetening up the coffee and allow another flavor (such as Caramel) to take over.

-Makes amazing cream soda! Just add a couple of shots into your can of soda and you get the creaminess of cream soda, without the lingering aftertaste real cream soda gives.

-My own whipped topping! Low-carb muffins can be pretty dry, so I make my own topping/sauce for it. The Vanilla syrup added to my whipping cream makes a perfectly sweet and tasty topping!

-Also use in the above stated low-carb recipes such as muffins and cream cheese pancakes.

This syrup offers a variety of uses, and that's why I love it! Get creative and you will find this is a great addition to any kitchen.

I tried comparing this initially to bottles that I could get from my local grocery store. Ends up while it is the same product, it wasn't the same size. The local grocery store is 2/3rds the size of the bottles provided here, and are made of glass.

These are made of plastic, and I get 50% more for the same (or lower) price.

I have subscribed for a monthly shipment and it keeps me well supplied for my morning flavored ice coffee (at a fraction of the price I would pay for Starbucks/Petes/Seattle's Best Coffee shop prices.

Thanks Amazon!!

Summary: We use in our homemade Frappes
Text: We use in our homemade Frappes and it is my husband's favorite. The best part is that it is made with Splenda instead of aspartame.

Torani Sugar-Free Syrup, Vanilla, 25.4-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 3)

I absolutely love this sugar free syrup. The consistency is more like water but it is full of flavor and you don't need to add a ton of syrup to get the sweetness. I use this with my morning cold brew coffee and diet soda and it adds a little extra to the drink. Great for diabetics to get a little extra sweetness!

This does not taste exactly like the sugared version, but it is pretty tasty!  Much better than other brands sugar free varieties for sure.  It actually tastes like cupcakes.  Mmm.  Different, but very good!

A while back, I ordered 3 bottles of the Torani Syrup I think it was the caramel, and I really like the flavor, but it is like water, so be prepared when you start using it. The only other thing I would like would be to be able to choose 3 'different' flavors instead of all 3 flavors being the same.
not enough sweetness, in my opinion. need lots to get enough sweetness out of it. i think i will go through these bottles pretty quickly.
We've used this product several times, mostly in our coffee, and it's delicious!  You would never know it's sugar-free.  Plus the price is much better through Amazon than in the supermarket!

I use the vanilla in my oatmeal, morning tea (awesome in chai) and wherever else I want a little sweetener but not the calories. Lots of low-cal recipes call for this, so if you're watching your weight, stock up on the 3-pack -- it won't go to waste.

Summary: Do you LOVE sugar but HATE the calories?
Text: Do you LOVE sugar but HATE the calories? This is a MUST have! If you are trying to loose weight, keep your blood sugar on track, or simply trying something new this is a must. I have used this in everything from my morning coffee to my mixed vodka beverages on girls night -- and I LOVE it and so do my girlfriends! Why not try a splenda no calorie additive instead of the real stuff that goes straight to the hips? I say pour yourself a drink, sit back, and enjoy with no guilt!

We've been using this syrup for years, ever since we glimpsed it behind the counter at a Starbuck's in Cleveland. It's not too sweet and gives a good hint of vanilla with two shots into a twelve-ounce coffee, at least for me. I'm not a fan of flavored coffees, preferring black and unsweetened, but this passes muster with me and my (skim milk, light sweet coffee) wife. Also, it doesn't taste like it was made with a chemistry set. We always have a bottle next to our Keurig.
The price fluctuates, but typically three bottles on Amazon are the same price as one smaller bottle locally. The shelf life unopened is just fine.

Love this stuff. This is such a great price too. I add an ounce to my coffee with some low cal powdered creamer and it passes my taste test and is a great substitute to high calorie french vanilla creamer.

Torani Suger-free syrup is perfect for my morning latte and now that I've found it on Amazon, I will never run out.  I signed up for auto delivery and of course I can cancel it at anytime, even when they notify me that a shipment is scheduled.  Such great service.  Torani is a good choice in any flavor and they offer many.  So, great product, service and shipment - can't beat it!
I subscribe to this product and always end up needing a shipment before the schedule I set. I use it to make iced mocha's which I drink all year long. Definitely delicious!

As others have eloquently stated, this tastes great! A true vanilla flavor shines through (even though this is sugar free) As a bonus this is sold in a package of three with the option of automatic replenishment. This is a nice service for two reasons: 1) you don't have to worry about running out and not having more to add to the coffee 2) it's a little cheaper on price. It's nice to get a break once in a while!

Summary: Great value, better than sugar substitutes
Text:
Torani sugar-free syrups taste better than packets of sweetener, and are less frustrating to use and don't leave waste everywhere.

Just make sure to buy a pump, it much easier to measure and prevents spillage and sticky fingers.
This is my favorite of the sugar free flavors. I use it to make vanilla flavored steamed milk, which I top with cinnamon. It tastes like a snicker doodle cookie.

This product is great tasting and zero for calories! This is a must since I must watch my calorie intake. The local stores want over .33 cents per ounce whereas if I order this and don't pay the tax and shipping it breaks down to .22 cents per ounce. This much Torani Sugar-Free Vanilla Syrup in Wal-Mart would be over $25.00. I have kept the smaller 12.2 ounce bottle I had bought some time back and fill it as needed. Much easier to handle in the kitchen than the 25.4 larger bottle. I have purchased this a few times from Amazon, and will continue to do so since the local stores want to mark up the price to unreasonable amounts. The taste is of high quality and cannot tell it is a sugar-free base (uses a Splenda base to sweeten). I think this is a great product and a great price. If I had paid for the shipping, I still think the cost would be justified over local area stores.

If you're a fan of Sonic Drive-In and their vanilla Coke, Torani's sugar-free syrup will replicate that flavor exactly - delicious and you can adjust the flavor to your taste.  It really does make a tasty beverage and no calories. Can't beat that.
love it , use it every day! I have had difficulty finding this product in the large size bottle in stores. I was surprised to find it on Amazon and happy as well!
