I read several reviews about this product and gave it a tried. I tried to like it but didn't work out for me after several bites even though I know it packed with great proteins and low calories. I'm just going to save it for emergency purposes but not for daily workout.

I was excited to get a healthy protein treat and I was hugely disappointed.  I opened the first one and was appalled by the smell. I managed to choke down three bites and the only good thing I can say about this stuff is that it didn't make me sick immediately. I threw the rest away. Later I went back in the kitchen and thought I smelled where my little dog had an accident but it was only the open package reeking from the trash.  I have eaten homemade  ostrich jerky but this tastes nothing like it. It is hard to believe it is ostrich. Do not buy this product. Even my cats and dog couldn't eat it.

I usually buy orange and lemon zest for cooking, when I don't make my own. I decided to get this for a new toothpaste recipe I picked up. Yeah, that sounds strange, but if you make your own toothpaste you don't have to worry about how much fluoride you are getting in it, and it is probably one-eighth the cost of commercially prepared products.
I decided if I was getting fluoride in tap water, I didn't need it in my toothpaste also. And now I am not sure I need it at all. It sure didn't seem to prevent cavities for me. So, since I can't find non-fluoridated toothpaste under $6 a tube at the store, I am going to be going for the Zesty life. Their lemon zest is great also!

Very pleased with the quality. Received them package on-time and will order again. Iranian saffron is the best, Also happy with the packaging. This is reasonably priced. I've ordered and used Spanish saffron before but Iranian saffron is definitely something else, nothing bits that. This is pure red saffron and it has amazing aroma. This could be used for both cooking and making tea. Saffron has many health benefits.
I ordered a 4g package to try it as a sample.  This saffron had a deep red color and a strong aroma, both first grade.  I was very happy with the quality and ordered more from the vendor.

In the midst of boring over salted snacks, where a gallon of water is required for the ingestion of most potato chips, is the only chip worth taking a horse and buggy for. Tri-Sum potato chips have a unique, addicting and satisfying taste that nothing else compairs to.
I have been many places across this country and have never had the pleasure of tasting anything close to the delectable and crispy spud snack made just minutes away from my childhood home.
In a world of fads, tradition is found in the stranges places, and Tri-Sum potato chips are a Massachusetts tradition that will never die.
In fact, I still ship bags to friends all over the country at christmas time, by request because its an unforgettably delicious taste.
Tri-Sum are always my go to snack, and I suggest trying them with this warning attached, "If you Tri-Sum, all other chips are done!"
What happens when a Massachusetts girl moves to Florida? She loves the sun but misses her all time favorite potato chip Tri-Sum. There are no others chips like these and now I can get them delivered.
Tri-Sum chips are a favorite in my family. Perhaps it's nostalgic for us because we grew up eating them, but they do have a wonderful flavor and texture. I would recommend them highly.

Summary: Tri-Sum Potato Chips are a family favorite!
Text: I've been eating Tri-Sum potato chips since the late 1960's.  They're a huge part of our family snack time, BBQs and Picnics.  They're the most delicious potato chips with an irresistible crunch and texture.  I love Tri-Sum Potato Chips!

Summary: This has a great flavor and always turns out perfect.
Text: This Wild Mushroom and Herb Couscous is really good. It is moist and will go with most anything. It always turns out perfect. A local grocery chain carries it, but it's a better buy here.

we add cooked chicken to this mix and love the taste and lightness.
the flavor enhances the chicken and quickly makes a tasty dish.

Summary: Love the noodles NOT the price!!!
Text: Very tasty noodles.  Very versatile in lots of dishes.  OVERPRICED!  Drop the price and give America a break!  5 stars for the noodles 3 for the price.

I find this delicious. It's not too sweet, not sour, not too fizzy and certainly not flat. If you find common sodas too sweet (think Sunkist, Sprite) and like a more natural taste this is the drink for you. It will not be as sweet as a Kern's mango juice, it will be lighter and much more refreshing. I am really happy to have found this product.

It's nice to have something special to drink, ready to grab from the frig. While it contains only a small amount of juice it still is much healthier than soda. My family all have their own favorite flavor of this product.
These came early! Wonderful! WIll order from again! Great in tea! I gave a pack to my grandmother and she loves them too!

If you Love Honey you will love these Honey Filled Drops!  They are great as a candy,or a cough drop.  They are not always easy to find, so I like to stock up.  People always ask where I got them once they try them, so if you buy a lot be prepared to give some packs away!

Summary: My now Fav wine after barefoot!
Text: I tried this wine last night while out at the club and I was in love. I am not a heavy drinker, I drink on occasion and when I do drink all it has been was barefoot and arbor mist, nothing heavy. I don't want to drink hard liquor, just something sweet and light I can drink with any meal(mostly dinner and maybe Lunch).  This drink was smooth, sweet and slightly bubbly and is only 5%. I am content with that. It satisfied my want and exceeding my expectations when purchased. Had a great night even though I only had two glasses. Thanks Bartenura!!
This is delicious over a block of cream cheese and served with crackers.  Also good in a chicken stir fry dish.  Just enough spice without being overwhelming.

A must for anyone who loves to cook.  This sauce along with the Raspberry Chipotle are so tasty and add a nice twist to spice up otherwise boring chicken and steak. Also makes a nice and cost effective gift.

I love anything with Chipotle, so had to get this sauce. Yesterday I marinated sliced portobello mushrooms with it for about an hour before grilling, and just the smell of it was mouthwatering! After grilling, the portobellos were soooo delicious. Today I poured a couple of tablespoons over cooked green beans, and that was also Delicious! I'm looking forward to trying it over halibut or sea bass. Really, you can't go wrong with this flavorful sauce!

IT HAS THE BEST CRUNCH

I LOVE IT ITS GREAT I SERVED IT AT A FAMILY PARTY AND EVERYONE LIKED IT FIBER ONE ROCKSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Summary: Oh what a tasty find this was.
Text: I wanted some honey to add some sweetness to tea, The local Whole Foods had this and I thought it looked interesting. I am not a big honey fan. WOW. AMAZING! ADDICTIVE! Just try it, it is unique, delicious and unlike any honey I have ever tasted. Truly wonderful treat.

I've never tried raspberry honey before. I can't get over how tasty it is!
It smells like chocolate and raspberries and I keep sneaking spoonfuls every time I pass the kitchen :)
Definitely recommend that one.

Very happy with all of Wellness products. When my black labrador got constant ear infections that would not clear up with medications I decided it could be allergies. She was on Wellness Simple Solutions Rice and Duck dry and canned food for about 6 weeks, and her ears cleared up without continuos medication.  I would highly recommend this product for any dog which has skin,ear,or stomach issues.

Summary: Excellent dog food; especially good for dogs with health problems
Text:
We have three dogs- a small robust and healthy Coton de Tulear, and two large dogs with health issues: a nearly 7 year old German Shorthaired Pointer, who was diagnosed as diabetic two years ago, and an 8 year old collie mix who has irritable bowels. Trying to find the right food so that I didn't have to purchase too many kinds of dog food for two dogs with disparate health issues was not easy, but this Wellness Simple Solutions, along with the Wellness Core Dry does the job.

If you suspect that food triggers allergic or stomach/bowel reactions, as any pediatrician will tell you, feed a simple diet with as few ingredients as possible, and only add ingredients as needed, after waiting for a time to watch for reactions. Simple Solutions is the way to do this, and for a dog with irritable bowels, it is truly THE best way of feeding a commercially prepared dog food, instead of you cooking chicken and rice for your dog. The dogs love the taste, and Wellness brand is excellent quality.

Summary: Healthy choice for dog w/ food allergies/sensitive stomach
Text: My 8-year old Cocker Spaniel has been on several types of food (Nutro, Iams, Natural Balance, Chicken Soup for the Dog Lovers Soul, and regular Wellness). She would tolerate each for a short period of time, but then get diarrhea and would vomit. Our Vet suggested we try Wellness Simple Solutions, since it has only one protein and one carb source. We've had her on it for 3 months and she's shown no signs of upset stomach or irritable bowel. We suspect she is sensitive to chicken/chicken by-products, which the Rice and Salmon blend does not contain. The food is expensive, but it's worth the cost to have a healthy dog.....and clean house!

Summary: My sensitive Bichon loves this food. 2012 Update comment on Freshness
Text:
I have tried quite a few brands and types of kibble but none work as well in helping my Bichon to avoid skin problems, particularly itchiness, as this one does. It helps that she really enjoys the taste too.

Update: January 2012:

Wellness Simple Solution Rice and Salmon is the only kibble that I feed to my bichon. She loves it and I love the way it helps with her allergies plus the fact that she never has any digestion problems. I use to buy the smaller bags because I was concerned about freshness. Before finding this on Amazon, I had to special order it at a local pet specialty store and very often the packages had short time frame expiration dates.

After seeing how good the dates were on the smaller packages that I bought from Amazon, I switched to the larger 10 lb,8 oz. bag. I have been absolutely delighted by the freshness. The bag that I ordered in early January 2012, arrived nicely packaged and with an expiration date of July, 2012.

I'm happy that not only am I getting a wonderful food, made in the USA, but I can count on getting a fresh shipment too.

we thought lily,at only 6 years of age, had about a year left to live - she was that weak and sickly. we wondered how our beautiful, strong german shepherd had failed so quickly. we decided that we had nothing to lose and perhaps it'd make her last days or months more pleasant if we took her off her natural supplements (glucosamine,msm,yucca), as well her pharmaceuticals. at the same time, we decided to change her dry dog food from a well-known brand we got at the supermarket to a more natural one. we did research and decided on Wellness Simple Solutions. we chose this one specifically because it had so few ingredients. lily was having alot of g.i. problems - she frequently vomited and it contained alot of mucus;she was itching alot and developed very scaly patches on her skin. she was a mess! her zest for life was disappearing. But, that was 3 months ago! lily no longer vomits; her itching has improved 85% or more; her coat is shiny and beautiful (people admire her wherever she goes); she goes on 45 min. leash or free walks/runs now, where just 3 mos. ago she was only able to go 15-20 mins. i attribute Much of her recovery to Wellness. it's so gratifying to see her feeling so Well again!

Summary: Great but hard to find in person
Text:
This is the only dog food that we've found to work well for our small dog with many food allergies. The ingredients are simple and the pieces are small enough for little dogs to work with. We've been using this dog food for almost four years and he still loves it.

It does smell like duck so if you are sensitive - be warned. :)

Our dog has tried several foods, including expensive vet brands, and has been treated for ear infections, skin infections, and was constantly scratching and licking. We even tried other limited ingredient foods, only to have it upset her stomach and cause new problems. I bought this at the store thinking, "Okay, salmon and rice. This seems safe!"  I hoped that the fish would be good for her skin and the rice would be easy to digest.  We have been using this food now for a couple of months and she LOVES it, plus her scratching is gone and this food has never upset her stomach. It is sometimes hard to find in the pet stores so I'm buying on Amazon again. It saves running all over town, and the price is lower.

Understanding not all skin issues are alike, this food seems to have solved our issues. My labradoodle developed a skin irritation that turned into a nasty infection in late november. She was on Wellness Super 5 and salmon oil. We thought it was just bacterial and dosed with antibiotics, but the irritation/infection came back worse than before. I had tried grain free(Wellness Core), but things got worse, if anything. We had to do another round of antibiotics due to another infection fromt he irritation and I felt like I was out of obvious solutions. My vet suggested changing the type of protein to seafood(she has always been on chicken), so I tried this type of food. Within a week of being fully transitioned onto this food, her excessive shedding (that started in november with the infections) had gone away and her skin had stopped developing lesions. It's been almost a month and thing look great. It could all be a coincidence, but I don't think I will be changing her food anytime soon! Seems like a great solution for her. Definitely worth trying!

UPDATE July 28 2012
This formula (Salmon/Rice) has been changed to Salmon/Potato. The number of ingredients have nearly doubled. After months of doing so well on the Salmon/Rice food, I transitioned her onto this new food and her symptoms are re-appearing and she is not doing well. This is a big disappointment. I called Wellness and they said this food wasn't selling well and they changed the formulation. Too bad - I will have to try another brand that is truly a limited ingredient diet.
Our english bulldog has allergies and this dog food with limited ingredients helps keep her skin " normal" and she likes it.

My dog is allergic to wheat and grain products. It would manifest as constant nasty ear inflamations. My vet prescribed a dog food that is only available from vets but after 3 months I saw no improvement.

Finally I researched on my own and tried Wellness Simple Solutions and after 3 months I noticed that her ear problems subsided. I supplement her evening meals with the Wellness Simple Solutions canned food and she loves it. Compared with the stuff the vet prescribed, this is working out much better.

The salmon and potatoes was not what I ordered. My dog was using salmon and rice from Simple and I went to Amazon, to my last order and reorder the product.  What I received was the Salmon and potatoes.  Since I was out of his food I did give him the new product and now he his having allergy problems again.  I am dissapointed and will need to find a new food for him. He loves the taste but I would have though I would be notified that this was not the product on my products page.

Summary: Wellness Simple Ltd. Ingred. Salmon and Rice Dry Dog Food
Text:
Happy with Dog Food, and our dogs like it too! The food is made of healthy ingredients and is especially good for one dog of ours who has skin allergies, and there are many ingredients he can't tolerate. I've found the 26 lb. bag to be the best price.
Wellness Simple Solutions Dog Food, Rice and Salmon Formula, 10-Pound and 8-Ounce Bag

Lamb and rice formula was awesome, used it for years without any doggy digestive problems.  The photo and description on Amazon are wrong now though.  Amazon is currently shipping out the new OATMEAL and Lamb formula which my dog cannot eat because of digestive issues with oatmeal.

I have three dogs, and one of them kept having bouts of diarrhea.  My vet gave her antibiotics and other prescription drugs to resolve the problem. These would work for about a week, and then the problem would return. My dog groomer suggested that there might be a food allergy involved.  I looked on Amazon.com and saw the "Wellness Limited Ingredient Diet for Dogs with Food Sensitivities Simple Food Solutions" dog food. I noted that the primary ingredent was lamb instead of corn...I ordered some and the first day I fed it to my dogs, it worked!!! My little dacshund Sugar had no more diarrhea or sickness from that day forward. I feed it to all my pets and I believe that they are actually happier now.  I am too!!!!

Summary: Hot Spots can be from food allergies
Text: After spend $$$$ and several years of trying to find out what was creating fur loss (hot spots) and itching on my poor dog, it all came down to food allergies. This food is wonderful. It is one of the few choices out there that can be purchased on line or at a pet store without a perscription. So many pet owners try shots and pills that may be unnecessary. Start with the food!!! My dogs LOVE it, too!

Our dog developed diarrhea last fall and we tried several "cures" before finding this product.  We gradually switched her food and by the time I got to 3/4 this and 1/4 old food, her poop had firmed.  She's been on this formula for several months now without any problems.  So nice to find a healthy food that worked for her!

Summary: Not sure if it works for allergies
Text: My two Shih Tzu are picky eaters.  But they seem to like the Wellness foods better than any other I've tried.  However, this particular variety doesn't seem to be quite as big of a hit with them as the other Wellness canned varieties we've tried.  But they do eat it.  As for it helping with food allergies.. and for sensitive stomachs.. I'm not so sure yet.  I've been feeding it to them for several weeks now, but don't see any diference so far.

Summary: Perfect for Dogs with Food Allergies
Text: I have two yellow labs - one of which has severe food allergies (ear infections).  I have been using Wellness products since both were puppies and specifically the Wellness Simple brand since I discovered the allergies.  My female lab used to have persistant ear infections but since I started using the Simple line of dog food - the problems have disappeared.  I rotate between the duck and lamb flavors and she seems quite happy.  Never tried the salmon flavor.  I also treat both dogs with the Wellness biscuits (peanut/honey is their favorite).  Quality dog food well worth the cost!  My female lab is almost 7 now and the male is 5.  Both love the food and are very healthy.  Thanks Wellness!

Summary: Mostly cured the red bumps on my dog's skin
Text: Even our vet could not cure the red bumps on my dog's skin.  The rash and excoriation was unresponsive to oral antibiotics and topical steroid spray.  Our pet sitter recommended we try a dog food without known allergens, so we tried Wellness Rice & Salmon.  It really works! Our dog still gets some redness but she is so much better.  The only negative is that apparently the food doesn't taste that great. Our solution is to mix it with a very small amount of canned cat food (about 1 tablespoon of our cat's Newman Organics), and our dog gobbles it right down.
Dozer has never loved a dry food before this one. Who knew he would love the only one he could eat? He literally drools over it almost every day. Can't wait to try the other flavors on him.
I have been buying this food locally but began to have a hard time fInding it. I searched online and it was a little more cost effective. My pups seem to love this food.
I have been buying this food locally but began to have a hard time fInding it. I searched online and it was a little more cost effective. My pups seem to love this food.

My dog loves this food and I like it because it's low residue and doesn't upset his tummy.  Less waste when he goes makes it more comfortable for him and easier to pick up for me.  The only complaint (besides the price!) would be the smell of the food if you sniff it.  It doesn't make his breath smell.  I may try the lamb one next time (to compare smells), but I definitely recommend this food.

Summary: Excellent! My dog's skin looks amazing and he loves this food!
Text: I honestly wish the other reviewer would have not given this product such a poor review. While the kibbles are not small in this food (about the size of a lima bean in length and half a grape in girth), and I do believe that this product is perfect for medium to large dogs, this is most definitely a quality dogfood. My lab-mix has suffered a great deal in the past from skin problems, and since changing to this food, he has improved 85%, and I am thrilled! Don't let a bad review dissuade you from trying this; it's great! And perhaps the small to teacup sized dogs could try the cat food in this brand, which my dog and cat love! The cat food kibble is the size of a small pea. To good health and happy feeding! :)
my 4 dogs all had allergies and are just fine now that i switched to Wellness.. The fush one smell abit but .. they still love it ..Either the dried orthe canned r terrific flavors..WITH NOOO GRANI!

Update 11/12/11: I previously posted a review on the Simple Solutions Lamb & Rice Formula a few months ago, which I have since deleted. I gave it a negative review because my dog, a miniature long-haired Dachshund, initially did not want to eat it. I would mix it with his old food, a good quality mostly all protein food (Orijen) that he loved--Orijen gets 6 stars at dogfoodanalysis.com, which is why I chose it. My dog would pick out the Orijen and leave the Simple Solutions in his bowl untouched. However, my dog was getting constant ear infections that would not clear up with medication. I spent quite a bit on vet bills. I finally decided to try a different dog food to see if there was an allergy and tried Simple Solutions. As I said, initially he did not like it, but I continued to give it to him, and now he's eating it just fine. When the Lamb & Rice almost ran out, I decided to try the Duck & Rice formula, which I'm slowly incorporating into the Lamb & Rice. He really loves the Duck & Rice food and literally jumps up and down when he knows he going to be fed. Also, the ear infections are completely gone. I think this is an excellent food for dogs with sensitive stomachs or allergies, which apparently includes my dog. I do wish some of the stores close to me would carry it though so I didn't have to purchase it online. Fortunately, Amazon is selling it with free shipping, which was pretty fast also.

I want to add that dogfoodanalysis.com only gives Wellness Simple Solutions 4 out of 6 stars because of the protein level, which is why I haven't given my review 5 stars. It states:
"Overall, we are happy with the quality of most of the ingredients in the food. The ingredient list is deliberately simple and designed for allergic dogs who may not tolerate a wide range of ingredients. We have concerns, however, at the apparently low level of meat content of the food."

We have searched and searched for a food that would meet our dog's nutritional needs as well as address her issues with allergies,this food was totally the answer for us and it's not near as expensive as all of the one's the vet's wanted to put her on. She loves it, we love it and that makes everyone happy. :)

I started a LID for my dog when after a regular yearly check up, my vet noticed that her paws were tinged a redish color. The vet said that it was probably an allergy to something in her food and suggested a limited ingredient diet. We have been using this food for about 4 months now and we have noticed remarkable results. She no longer constantly licks her feet and they are returning to their normal color. Worked perfectly for our dog!!

Our rat terrier was losing her fur, had pinkish skin, and sores.  The vet put her on a hypoallergenic food, but in time she started vomiting that.  We found Wellness Simple Solutions and now her skin is normal, fur is growing back, no sores, no vomiting. I highly recommend this product.
My dogs do well on Wellness Simple Solutions; it's great for dogs with allergies.  Purchasing through Amazon is easy and reliable.

I have used Wellness SFS for some time - I have two cocker spaniels and one with bad allergies. This is the only food that helps
It may be pricey - but I'll pay the price to keep him comfortable and good food means less vet bills !!!

My dog is allergic to wheat and grain products. It would manifest as constant nasty ear inflamations. My vet prescribed a dog food that is only available from vets but after 3 months I saw no improvement.

Finally I researched on my own and tried Wellness Simple Solutions and after 3 months I noticed that her ear problems subsided. I supplement her evening meals with the Wellness Simple Solutions dry food and she loves it.

Compared with the stuff the vet prescribed, which looked like a waxy tube coming out of the can, the Wellness Simple Solutions canned dog food looks and smells like real food. It contains no wheat, corn, soy, dairy, or eggs and yet is high in nutrients.

The first ingredient listed on the back of the can is duck and it states " This is a naturally preserved product". Considering that, I am very happy that the best by dates average about 2 years out because I keep extra dog food on hand in case of an emergency.

Wellness is an incredible food.  I have used it for both of my dobes for almost 7 months.  They were shedding before I switched to this brand but no more.  Since the switch almost 7 months ago, their coats are amazing - like silk and I have no shedding at all.  I have one dobe with a sensitive stomach so switched him over to this formula when I saw it came out.  He loves it - sure, its a little pricy but so worth it - no loose stools, no throwups and no shedding - I get comments on them all the time about how beautiful their coats are!

I've been feeding this dog food to my older female pug for several months now. In the fall of this year she began to experience allergy related skin and stomach issues. These allergies resulted in excessive licking and nibbling at her feet as well as occasional throwing up. She hasn't thrown up since she started eating this food, and overall her skin issues have lessened (that could be a result of the change in seasons as well). She is always excited to eat her food, but what pug isn't? I mean they're always hungry right? Also, as she never seems to drink enough water, I'm glad she's getting some moisture as part of this soft food as well. The only thing I find displeasing out this product is that we buy it in cases, and the cans frequently arrive dented. I wouldn't buy dented cans for my own food, for fear of the food being tainted in some way. So I feel a little nervous feeding my dog some of these dented cans. Oh well, she seems fine thus far and the smell and look of the food is fairly consistent, so we're going to stick with this food for now.
this product is clean & good but oh, so very expensive.  may have 2 find a more reasonably priced food.

Summary: not much better than I the salmon flavored one.
Text:
Obviously, any dog's reaction to various foods are dependent on their own allergies. I switched from Wellness Simple Salmon because of the fishy smell of the food and my pit/lab's fishy breath. If it wasn't for the fishy breath, I would have kept him on it. I was actually very pleased with the results of that food. I decided to switch to the duck flavor hoping that his breath would improve. His breath for sure has improved and has been normal for a dog, but he has had diarrhea and loose stool on it since we put him on it for the past 4 weeks. He has also been biting his paws and itching more than he had been on the salmon flavor. We have had to mix 1/2 a cup of the duck flavor with boiled chicken, rice, and sweet potato in order for his stools to return to normal. But at any time we feed him just this dog food, he will have extremely watery diarrhea. Quite disappointed with this and would definitely recommend purchasing a small bag first to see if your dog can tolerate it.

Not quite sure what we're gonna do next. We might have to put our hyper allergic pit/lab mix on a homemade diet because that seems like the only thing that works for him.

ProfileName: Dawndy12 "Barely Surviving The Loss of My Dau...
Text:
I CANT REVIEW THIS FOOD...BECAUSE THE KIBBLE SIZE IS H U G E
UNLESS YOU HAVE A GIGANTIC DOG....I DO NOT THINK YOUR SM-MED DOG WILL WANT TO CHEW THESE! IM SO UPSET BECAUSE THEY LOVE THE CAN OF THIS WANTED TO MIX THE SAME AS CAN WITH THE DRY!

Summary: Dog Health is Important to Our Dog VitaHound
Text:
Our family has 2 dogs- a lab energetic and healthy named Jake, and a Terrier named VitaHound with certain health issues: VitaHound's digestive system is sensitive to typical commercial dog food. The high grain content triggers allergic symptoms and causes him to have bad dog breath.

On the recommendation of friend that has tried tried several premium dog foods and determined Wellness to be a superior brand, we started to to feed VitaHound the rice and duck formula. VitaHound's bad dog breath disappeared and his allergic symptoms reduced to manageable. I believe the few extra bucks is a good investment for VitaHound's dog health.
There were none left from the Wedding Candy Bar.  That says it all...Wish there had been white chocolate pretzels available.

Summary: Like drinking from a young coconut, fresh off the tree!
Text: I don't get it -- everywhere I go now, mediocre coconut juice is in stores now for 5 times the price as this brand.  This brand uses young THAI coconut, which is far sweeter than the young coconut from the Caribbean and Brazil that other products use.  I am such a fanatic that I cut down several young coconuts fresh from trees while on trips to both Hawaii and Puerto Rico and those were not even as good as this product.  I've been fortunate enough to also sample fresh young coconut juice once while on a trip to Thailand and while, admittedly, this product was not quite as good as having it fresh off the tree in Thailand, it does give you an approximation of what that is like.

Summary: The Best, Most Authentic Coconut Water - Amazing seller!
Text: I just got back from Thailand, and  I think I drank at least one coconut per day.  Upon my return I wanted to find something that compared to the original (it's hard to keep coconuts in the fridge!)  I thought Zico was ok, but it tasted watered down and nothing like the Thai Coconuts I was used to.  I tried Amy and Brian's on a whim at whole foods and fell in love.  It's naturally sweet, so flavorful, and I love the pulp's texture.  I was hooked.  Finding it here at an amazing price was the kicker.  I saved SO much money, which is good because I didn't think I could afford my new addiction.  Thanks for the fast, free shipping!!

The other reviewers are right: hands down the best coconut juice out there. The flavor is natural, good-bodied, and with none of that tinny after-taste you get from supermarket brands. One 17 oz can is amazingly filling and low calorie, which makes this an ideal mid-afternoon snack with none of the suspect ingredients in protein bars. With summer coming up, here's a tip: we also use Amy & Brian coconut juice in our hotel bar to mix unusual and refreshing cocktails - big hits. We prefer the version with pulp.

If you're going through chemotherapy or radiation you truly know how dry a mouth can get.  A whole body can get.  This juice was the only thing we found to alleviate that dryness.  It's slightly sweet, but not too much, making it easy to get down and stay down.  While this may not be appetizing to non-cancer sufferers, it means the world to someone going through cancer.  It's price makes it a bit prohibitive, but believe me, the cost is worth it!

I was recently introduced to coconut water and really enjoyed it, however it was one of the sugar added brands that only had 80% juice (with pulp). After some searching, I found some pure coconut water (for twice the price as the sugar added one) at a grocery store and was eager to try it only to be let down. It was decent enough, but pretty bland. There weren't other options, so I searched Amazon. Amy and Brian's was a great deal compared to the bland grocery store option and had good reviews so I ordered a case.

A couple cans came slightly dented as others have mentioned, but it clearly happened during shipping and did not compromise the product in the least. When I finally opened a can, I was so excited by the amount of pulp in it (a lot!). Even better, they had the same sweetness as the sugar added ones but with a much cleaner taste. They use Thai coconuts, which are naturally sweeter than others. I love the pulp - it's really soft, so you can easily drink without chewing it. I've got a major sweet tooth but I've been working on eating better. A cup of it after dinner or throughout the day provides just enough sweetness to curb my dessert cravings, especially taking the time to chew the pulp. I definately enjoy it more at room temp too.

A wonderful side effect I've noticed is it helping with dry mouth! A medication I'm on causes pretty bad dry mouth and this helps much more then those dry mouth mouthwashes. It's rehydration properties are amazing for hangovers too(or preventing/lessening them when drinking a cup before bed).

I love coconut water and juice beverages, and I've tried the majority of coconut water/juice brands out there ranging from Zico, Vita Coco, O.N.E., Harvest Bay, C20, Naked, etc. I've tried coconut juices/waters when I traveled to places such as Hawaii, South America, and Thailand. I've actually also drank straight up from real coconuts while I was in Hawaii, South America, and Thailand as well. In my humble opinion, the country that produces and makes the best coconut water and juices is Thailand. Maybe I'm a little biased because I'm Thai American, and the majority of my relatives live in Thailand. But I've traveled to Thailand many times in my life and drank coconut water and juice beverages several times while in Thailand. The Thai-based brands that Amazon currently sell are: Amy and Brian, Taste Nirvana, Nature Factor, Foco, and Chaokoh. And of course, as a Thai American, I've drank from all these Thai-based brands as well. They're all pretty good - Amy and Brian, Foco, and Chaokoh have been around for a long while when it comes to coconut drinks. Foco is a Thai-based company that make many Thai exotic drinks including dragonfruit, basil seed, mangosteen, chrysanthemum, lychee, and even pennywort. I've tried many Foco drinks over the years, and even had their canned pennywort drink in February of this year at Ha Long Bay restaurant in St. Petersburg, Florida (By the way, that Ha Long Bay restaurant has an excellent variety of delicious Boba Teas. I love Boba Teas! The best use of boba pearls I've ever seen was when my sister and I visited a Yogurtology store in St. Petersburg, Florida in early June. You get your choice of frozen yogurts self-serve style, and then you put whatever toppings you want. They had different flavored boba pearls to choose from besides fresh fruit and other dessert toppings. My sister and I thought that was a great idea, putting boba pearls on top of frozen yogurt. Yogurtology is a new chain of stores based in two states so far, Arizona and Florida, and it's such a great place, that they should have this chain nationwide!) and it was the most unusual drink I've ever had so far in my life. It tasted different and unique at first, but I read on the Internet that Pennywort/Gotu Kola is supposed to be good for your body helping strengthen your immune system, reduce arthritis, and helping alleviate other health-related issues. There's even a blog on the website, Too Many Chefs, and people have been exchanging, over several years, their opinions on what they thought about Foco's Pennywort drink. I never read that blog until after I drank the Pennywort drink in February. The reason why I chose that drink is because the name caught my attention at Ha Long Bay restaurant's menu, and I'm often the curious type who always tries my best to try something new at least once. It's kind of amusing to read people's opinions on that Pennywort drink. Chaokoh, besides their coconut drink, make the best coconut milk to cook Asian and Thai meals at home. My family uses Chaokoh coconut milk all the time to cook Thai meals, and Chaokoh also sell a lot of canned Asian/Thai items such as: rambutan, longan, bamboo shoots, sugar cane, banana blossom, and jackfruit. Taste Nirvana, of course, is known for all their coconut beverages and their Thai teas and coffees. They also sell Thai chili sauce as well. And finally, Amy and Brian are known for their excellent coconut juice beverages. Amy and Brian also sell an amazing line of mangosteen juice beverages. In the end, when it comes to the best tasting Thai coconut beverages, Amy and Brian and Taste Nirvana are tied for number one. (In fact, Thai coconut water is so good that even my favorite tea company, Harney and Sons Fine Teas, currently sell Taste Nirvana products directly from their website. They admit that they love Thai coconut water and beverages. Click on Harney and Sons' bottled beverages link on their website and you will see what I mean, and Taste Nirvana is not their own brand or product! Now that's a true testament to how excellent Thai coconut water is! I'm being really truthful when I say that you haven't really tasted good coconut water or juice if you haven't tried Amy and Brian or Taste Nirvana! I've been drinking Amy and Brian's coconut juices (with and without pulp) for many years now, and the majority of coconut waters out there don't measure up to this brand (or Taste Nirvana). You truly get your money's worth when you buy Amy and Brian's drinks.

Summary: Fabulous tasting coconut water...NOT unnaturally sweet in the larger cans. YES, too sweet and AWFUL in the small cans.
Text:
I was leery of trying the Amy & Brian's again after having this experience: AMAZING pulp-free tall cans. Horrible candy-water 10 oz cans. So, I have several cases of the short cans I refuse to drink. Awful. But I went through the cases of the tall cans. Wonderful.

I wondered if the inconsistencies would show up in the tall cans, and I did not reorder. THEN..this big sale and sub/save showed up. Tempted me. I ordered TWO cases of this one, with the pulp.

WONDERFUL. I like it even better than the pulp-free (which is weird, as I normally avoid pulp-containing packaged coconut water). I even found myself enjoying chewing the bits of pulp.The flavor is NOT too sweet, very nicely coconutty, not at all sour or weirdly salty like the new Zico, nicer than ONE and VitaCoco.

So, I feel free to order more now. Clearly, there is some issue with the smaller cans. I strongly recommend you avoid those like the plague. They taste nothing like coconut water. They taste like you dropped some generic sugar candy in water and let it dissolve. Really icky sweet and NOT AT ALL coconutty. (I have had fresh out of the shell coconut water since childhood, my family being from the Caribbean, and have tasted virtually every brand available locally and on Amazon, and I know coconuts vary according to region and even harvest areas etc. Coconut water IS variable, so I don't expect homogeneous flavor. I do expect it to be coconut water and not candy water (or corn cereal milk like new Zico)). So, yeah, avoid small cans. Amy & Brian really need to look into why that stuff is disgusting, cause it's ruining their reputation whenever someone tastes that horror.

The Tall Cans: Yes, buy these. I've sampled out of four different cases sent to me, always good. The pulp-free was more sweet compared to the tetra pak CW's I've tried, and the higher carb count makes sense. I even emailed the A&B people about it, and they said it was due to the blend/selection of coconuts that theirs is sweeter with a higher carb count. I can see how the selection could do this. I like the sweeter flavor, personally, but always have with meals cause it is higher carbs. When I want to drink coconut water by itself--I choose a lower carb variety, like original Zico was or ONE in a smaller quantity than the 17.5 ounce can.

Thumbs up. Refreshing, sweet, coconutty, lovely. I love, love, love this coconut water in the TALL CANS.

But I beg the Amyy & Brian folks to investigate and revamp the processing for the smaller cans. That stuff is vile and I have two cases plus sitting in my kitchen that I cannot drink. (Add that to the Zico I can't stomach and preordered and that's a lot of my money going to waste cause companies can't get it right/screw with a tried-true formula).

Happy sipping!

Easily put, the stuff tastes good. Fresh, slightly sweetened but not overly so, coconut pulp. It's delicious.

HOWEVER, I think someone had too much fun joyriding the UPS truck, because each and every one of my cans when I opened the box was dented. The cans seemed pretty tough, so not a single one broke, but it's unnerving imagining just how much punishment the box went through in order for them to get THAT bad.

Also, on another note, the can itself is deceptively heavy. Every time I'm almost done drinking one, the weight of the can will trick me into thinking there's more inside. Sadness.

Surprisingly with pulp taste a lot better than without pulp one.

Pulp is just few tiny pieces of coconut floating and not really much pulp.

Summary: Tastes exactly like the real thing
Text:
I've tried all the other coconut waters out there and I have a problem with two things. First....the coconut water itself always tastes musky and sour. Second, the packaging is completely unrecyclable. The whole point of drinking fresh natural coconut water is because it's also sustainable. But to package the water in these useless vacuum packs just adds more waste to the landfills
Amy and Brian's products, first and foremost taste EXACTLY like a fresh young coconut. There is no sour musky taste that is often associated with the vacuum packed waters. Also, ta da...the can is recyclable...a huge plus in my book.
I can't say enough about this product. It's delicious, healthy, refreshing, low-calorie.
This one and Naked are the only 2 that I drink.  Shame on Vita Coco - I've tried all of their flavors, and they are all foul. A&B is my favorite, by far.

In the last couple of months, I have been on this adventure searching for the BEST and Natural coconut juice.  I have tasted many brands such as Vitacoco, O.N.E, and many other Asian brand.  Hands down Amy and Brian has the best taste out of all.  I was a firm believer Vitacoco was the best until I tried Amy & Brian.

Summary: No additives, good size, good price
Text:
I've tried quite a few coconut waters - all of the major brands found on Amazon in addition to imports and the like. Most canned, "affordable" coconut waters (generally, what you find at the Asian and Indian supermarkets) have a preservative in it which really affects the taste. No chemicals here, and yet they still manage to keep the price competitive versus the average $2.79 for 11-12 oz at the grocery!

Judging by past personal experiences, I don't think you'll find a consistent taste in a coconut water unless the supplier mixes it all together in a giant vat or something. It's a natural product, so slight variations are to be expected. That said, I've never had a coconut water from this brand which tasted "bad". Just different.

The green can has pulp, which I prefer. One reviewer who gave this a low star rating cited the inconsistency in the pulp texture - some was soft, some was harder, chewier. If you've ever cracked open a young coconut after drinking the juice to scrape the pulp out, you'll have experienced the same variations. The pulp layer within is very thin and both textures are to be expected. I don't mind it that way - it seems like more of something to expect than something to be shocked by. Don't order it expecting the pulp to be like that of oranges! Coconut pulp is its own thing.

Great for doing yard work, sports, and as a substitute for pedialyte/gatorade when someone's ill (though this does have some natural sugar content).

Most of us are dehydrated & don't even realize it. The effects on our organs, therefore, is usually not seen until there's a major problem, and of course we'd like to eliminate that possibility if we can. Enter coconut water.

With all the potassium contained in a single serving (I drink the whole can in two sittings per day!), and electrolytes to replenish after structured exercise, sauna sessions or anything which causes you to sweat, this is the perfect solution from nature to correct the imbalance.

I anxiously awaited my order and it arrived yesterday. I immediately popped open a can (it was slightly dented but juice was clear & delicious!) & enjoyed the delicious thirst quencher. I'm going to drink it daily for health food, whether or not I get my sweat on!!

PULP: Others have noted dry bits of pulp & that they found this undesirable. I purposely crunched down on many of the tiny bits of coconut meat and found it juicy & tender - perfect consistency, and I enjoyed that it's included in this coconut water.

PACKAGING: The case of cans was packed VERY well with many layers of bubble wrap, then the case with cardboard base was shrink-wrapped, but there was still a dent on at least one can thus far, so it must have happened at the packing facility, which is NOT Amazon's fault. No matter. I drank it immediately & it was perfectly delicious. I've got two chilling now, and put the can back in the fridge yesterday after pouring half in the first glass, and it's delicious either way. Room temp or cold - both amazing!

Summary: the best coconut juice on the market
Text: Nothing but coconut juice + coconut pulp.  Nothing added, no sugar, preservatives, stabilizers, etc.  Even if you don't care about that stuff, it is the best tasting coconut juice out there, hands down.

I am OBSESSED with this product. Honestly, my husband thinks its a problem! I live in Hawaii so it's sooo expensive here, so I have my local market order cases for me so I wont have to pay the shipping! Thanks for doin what you do, Amy and Brian! Keep on keepin' on!

Wendy Taylor

This coconut water was pretty good, although i wouldn't say it's remarkably better than Zico and certainly not better than VitaCoco. The coconut chunks varied quite a bit with quality, ranging from tender and delicious to a little too thick and tough.

Also, almost all of my dozen 17.5 oz cans were dented in some way, with one can being a little too compromised for me to consider consumption. After reasonably extensive storage in my refrigerator, all of the remaining coconut waters acquired a distinct, unpleasant metallic taste. Maybe this should be expected with a tin storage container, but I certainly don't get unpleasant tastes with tetrapaks and plastic bottles after extended refrigeration.

Despite the overall pleasant drinking experience, I doubt I will be ordering again.

Summary: Yummy & refreshing taste, healthful, a little expensive!
Text:
UPDATE (10/9/12):

I asked the company on Facebook about how much magnesium and potassium are in each can, since it is not listed even though the can advertises having lots of both (?). Their reply was "about 676 mg Potassium and 29.12 mg Magnesium."

---

It seems that coconut water is one of those love-or-hate flavors that exist in the world (kind of like avocado). There doesn't seem to be a middle ground, either you really dislike it, or really like it.

I'm definitely in the really-like camp. And I had to get to this brand to discover that. I had tried both Vita Coco 100% Pure Coconut Water, 11.1-Ounce Containers (Pack of 12) and O.N.E. Coconut Water, 11.2-Ounce Aseptic Containers (Pack of 12), and found both of them insipid tasting. But I find this brand refreshing and full of body.

I compare the difference between "good" and "bad" coconut water to the difference between apple juice from concentrate and not from concentrate. The former has a watery taste, like it's not the real thing, whereas the latter is more like drinking an apple.

This brand seems more like drinking a coconut (although that's something I've never done). But it doesn't have the icky blandness to it that the above brands have.

I also really enjoy the bits of coconut pulp, they had to the experience and taste.

This makes a great base for powder mixes, especially flavored ones like Vega Whole Food Shake & Go Smoothie - Tropical Tango - 300g - Powder and Sequel Naturals Vega Shake and Go Smoothie Bodacious Berry -- 10.6 oz, and even Garden of Life Perfect Food Raw Organic Powder Nutritional Supplement, 240 Grams.

It's also great to drink as-is, straight from the can, as both a pre- and post-hydrator. I often drink half the can before a work-out and the other half after I'm done. If you research, it is best to pre-hydrate so your body has the extra fluids/minerals readily available as they are being depleted, rather than only hydrating after you are exhausted and dehydrated.

This 12-pack will last you a long time, especially considering each can is two servings (~2 cups).
I ordered this for the 3rd time. The first and second time I liked it and the 3rd time was disgusting. I can taste the tin can, and the pulp tasted old. I never leave feedback, but this was so gross.

This is a great product; all natural with no preservative. However, it's gotten so much more expensive than what I see in the Asian grocery. If price goes even higher, I'll probably switch to the less expensive ones even if they don't taste as well as long as they don't have preservatives.

Amy and Brian and Taste Nirvana are the only two brands of coconut water I like. Both taste much sweeter and have a stronger coconut flavor/aroma than the rest I have tried. As to the drink being unnaturally sweet I frequently purchase young Thai coconuts at my grocery and the water tastes just as sweet. The price on Amazon is a little higher than locally available to me ($2 per can). The pulp pieces can be a little harder, but I enjoy chewing on them and feel like getting a meal.

I like the way coconut water makes me feel and frequently drink one in the morning instead of coffee. It may be a sugar rush, but I definitely feel refreshed after that and the feeling lasts quite a while. Overall good product and tastes just as good as water you just got from a coconut.

I have been drinking Vita Coco for a while, but took a chance on a can of this the last time I dropped by Whole Foods. So glad to see it here, because it is excellent! The pulp is very tasty!!

I have tried all the major brands of coconut water and this is the best by far.
i think all the brands out there charge too much, but i love the taste on amy and brian's the best -- not too "green" and not to sweet, just right!

I love the Amy and Brian Coconut Juice as an after workout refresher.  I do CrossFit which is a high intensity workout program.  This juice is great for rehydrating and it has tons of potassium to help with muscle recovery.  What sets this coconut juice apart from most other coconut juices you find in the grocery store is that it doesn't have any added sugar.  I'm very into eating natural foods and this juice is just 100% coconut juice, nothing added whatsoever.  There are other brands out there which are similar that I haven't tried so I can't compare this to others but I can say this brand has a great taste.  I also like the pulp but other people who have tried it say they prefer the non-pulp cans, it's just a matter of personal preference I guess.  Enjoy!

The only thing wrong I found with this product is that after a week and a half in my fridge, a couple of cans started tasting "rusty" and the water and pulp were slightly pinkish in color when poured in a glass. Otherwise, when it doesn't do that, it tastes wonderful! The size is perfect for when you're extra thirsty. Very refreshing.

THIS IS THE BEST QUALITY COCONUT JUICE I HAVE TASTED! THERE ARE OTHERS OUT THERE THOUGH.
THIS PARTICULAR JUICE IS FROM YOUNG COCONUTS, A HUGE DIFFERENCE IN FLAVOR, IT'S SWEET.
MANY OTHER BRANDS TASTE SOMEWHAT SOUR OR TANGY. ALSO READ THE LABEL THERE IS NO PRESERVATIVE JUST JUICE!

EVERY LABEL THAT I'VE READ ON THE MANY OTHER BRANDS OF COCONUT JUICE FOUND IN STANDARD GROCERY STORES HAVE PRESERVATIVES.
I HAVE FOUND ONLY THE HEALTH FOODS STORES, WHOLE FOODS AND AMAZON CARRY THIS BRAND SO I PURCHASE BY THE CASE.
ALSO WHOLE FOODS GIVES A 10 PERCENT DISCOUNT ON ANYTHING BOUGHT BY THE CASE, THEY ARE ACTUALLY QUITE COMPETITIVE.

COCONUT JUICE IS ALSO SLIGHLTY ALKALINE, I HAVE ACTUALLY TESTED IT WITH THE SMALL METER THAT TESTS ACIDIC / ALKALINE LIQUIDS.
WHENEVER I'VE BEEN OVERHEATED OR AM JUST REALLY HOT FROM BEING OUTSIDE, I DRINK ABOUT 6-8 OZ AND IT REVIVES ME.

SINCE LIVING IN THIS WARM WEATHER, I'VE BOUGHT SEVERAL BOOKS ON THE BENEFITS OF COCONUT, I READ THAT DURING WAR TIMES COCONUT WATER HAS BEEN USED AS BLOOD PLASMA WHEN NEEDED.
HAVE NOT VERIFIED THIS INFO FOR MYSELF BUT INTERESTING, NATURE DOES PROVIDE.

Summary: amazing! addictive in a good way
Text: This is THE BEST coconut water out there. I have tried the tetra packs and they taste gross. Not as naturally sweet. I also LOVE the chunks! I could drink 2 or more of these a day- wish it was a little cheaper, but the Thai coconuts DO make a difference so it worth it.

Summary: Love this stuff -- no extra ingredients
Text: I also first tried this at Whole Foods and was hooked immediately.  The taste is just like the freshly cut young coconuts you get while vacationing an island.  Take a look at the ingredients... it's just coconut juice and pulp.  Many of the other drinks have sugars, preservatives, water, etc... I have it on auto-ship 2 times a month!

Summary: Pricey, so try to get it while it's on sale
Text:
This was ridiculously delicious: I've tried Vita and Naked versions of coconut water/juice and they weren't as good.

I like how there is some pulp inside- not sure how environmentally friendly the can is.

As a Whole Foods employee I have tried several different brands of Coconut Juice, but none compare to Amy and Brian. This product only lists two ingredients; young coconut juice and young coconut pulp, yet it's so sweet and delicious. The pulp adds a nice little bit of coconut to the beverage that is a nice little snack. I don't know what else to say but to try this stuff! I'm not even really a fan of coconut but this juice is great.

Summary: The REAL Coconut Juice, the Healthier Alternative to Coconut Juice BLENDS with Sugar added.
Text:
If you have never drank coconut juice fresh from the coconut, you are missing one of Natures most refreshing drinks. If your only experience is drinks served at Asian restaurants, you need to know - this is NOT the same thing. Most places sell the cheaper - with sugar and water added - version of this drink. I am so happy that AMY & BRIAN have stuck with the more expensive PURE coconut juice.

It is definitely less sweet. It will quench your thirst better. You won't have to worry about the extra calories. It's the real thing. You will not want to share the can, so be sure to count all of the 2 servings of calories.

I used to buy this by the case on Amazon, but sadly the price went way up (from $18) and I got cases with dented and leaking cans. So $$ was not worth it. I can not find it locally, and so am suffering with the sugary stuff again. I wish the price would come down and shipping did not kill the cans.

We have sampled a good number of different coconut juices from different companies and these Amy & Brian juices are the best, hands down. A number of the other brands had a bitter taste and/or after taste, or seemed watered down (lacked flavor). Amy & Brian's juice is sweet through and through, no nasty after taste, and reasonably priced.

The only thing I think they could do better is to package the juice in a better container. It is somewhat annoying to drink the juice from the can due to the "tinny" taste and because the pulp pieces zip through the small opening, which is disconcerting. I just pour it out into a glass and enjoy it fully that way. Another brand we tried had a glass, wide-mouth container which was easy to drink from and cool because you can see the pulp pieces suspended in the drink. If Amy & Brian adopted packaging like that, it would improve the product by a lot!

Still though, despite the packaging, this is THE BEST coconut juice out there that we have tried.

Summary: So delicious!  Best tasting coconut juice I've tried (other than directly from coconuts)
Text:
I've tried a handful of coconut juices and -- in comparison with Amy and Brian's coconut juice -- they've ranged from meh to eh?! For instance, the vitacoco juice has a slightly acidic/bitter tinge to it.

But this Amy and Brian's coconut juice just tastes awesome! And I love the little pieces of coconut. Some may find it a bit awkward to "chew their juice" in a way, but I like the texture. And the juice is sweet without being cloyingly so, with no odd aftertaste.

I do wish this stuff was cheaper. I could easily go through two cans a day, and that's a lotta moolah a month :\. So for now, I'm saving it for after or before boot camp workouts.

But, despite the cost, I'll likely order this again. Wonderfully refreshing!

(CAVEAT: Do keep in mind that this isn't exactly a "diet" beverage. The 17.5 ounce can (which contains two servings) does contain 152 calories, which is about 9 calories per ounce. But compare that against, say, Coke, which not only has a ton more (non-naturally-occurring) sugar and pretty much no nutritive value at all, but also packs 33% more calories per ounce. Or orange juice, which has *66%* more calories per ounce :-o.

This is the best coconut water I've tasted.  The pulp is a little chunkier than I expected, which is not a problem for me, but if you don't think you'd like that you might want to try the pulp-free version.  Naked is a close second to this brand, and I do buy that in aseptic packs since the cans aren't always as convenient.  But there is no metalic taste with these cans.

Summary: Great taste, natural, no added sugars
Text: Was looking for coconut juice that's not from concentrate and has no added sugars, but is still tasty. This one fits the bill perfectly!

Summary: I love It at the 1st drink.
Text:
It s better than Zico because it 's less sodium .I gonna order more.
After 3th order I am sure it s the best taste coconut water but my digest system did not go along with the hard chunks (coconut juice with pulp), so my next order
is Amy&Brian coconut juice without pulp.Overall The tall cans are the best canned coconut juice today and you can find it on Amazon.com only with free shipping.It is the best price too.

Summary: Taste like it is straight from the coocnut
Text: I could not believe how much this juice tasted just like the coconut water I had from the coconut, no aftertast just pure and refreshing - will buy over and over again!

I ordered the "All Natural Coconut Juice with pulp" & found it rather disappointing...The water
taste a bit stale & the hard chunks of coconut are a big turn off ..I thought that the can would have soft jelly... I know about coconuts & the correct taste, because I grew up with many coconut trees....I was expecting much more....
I read the reviews & liked what I read...

Another problem all the cans have dents in them
that could be the fault of the delivery service.
or distribution center....

I also paid for "NEXT DAY" delivery and item was
delivered in 2 days...(2 days is FREE!)

I will not be re-ordering this product...

Summary: Not great but I prefer Taste Nirvana
Text: This isn't bad but it isn't anything spectacular. I've tried this and Taste Nirvana's brand and honestly I prefer Taste Nirvana because it tastes more natural.

The first case I received was great! The water was sweet and refreshing and the pieces of coconut (pulp) were tender a few harder pieces here and there, but that didn't really bother me. I liked it enough to go with the "subscribe & save" and had a case delivered every month, that was until this last case came in. The water was great as usual, but the pulp was HORRIBLE the pieces of coconut were very soft and mealy. They didn't really taste bad, it was just the texture, yuk! And it wasn't just a can or two, but the whole case. After about 3-4 being like that, I canceled my subscription. If I were you I would skip the pulp.

I read many rave reviews of this product which is what prompted me to purchase Amy & Brian over other brands.  I love fresh coconut water, coconut milk and coconut pulp but this product didn't resemble any of those.  It didn't really taste like coconut at all and the after taste is unpleasant. I bought it to use as a sports drink for our children but they won't drink it and I can't say I blame them.  Even if I take away the expectations of coconut I can't imagine choosing to drink this.  If you are thinking of buying this product I would find someplace to buy a single can and try it first, wish I had.

I'm an avid coconut water drinker - I've tried most brands sold by Whole Foods and Trader Joe's and this brand is always consistent (flavor/color/freshness). If you enjoy coconut water you need to give this brand a try ...you won't be disappointed.
This is the best coconut juice water I've ever had. My husband and I tried a lot of other name brands and will never try anyothers again. Amy&Brians are the ones

This coconut water tastes good and is well priced. The best thing about it is that the taste is consistent. Many company's coconut water does not taste good on a consistent basis. I have tried many different coconut waters and this is my favorite. I also really like the little pieces of coconut meat in it. For anyone new to coconut water make sure whichever one you get that there is no added sugar. There is a lot of coconut water out there that has added sugar, aside from it being unhealthy coconut water does not need it. Natural coconut water has a slightly sweet pleasant taste.

Some of the cans did show up a little dented, but that didn't compromise the product in the slightest. Amy & Brian is the best Coconut Juice on the market. By purchasing a subscription instead of going to my local CoOp, I'm saving a $1.20 per can. After my 2 cases ran out I bought some VitaCoco to hold me off until my next shipment and it paled in comparison.

I just upped my shipment to 3 cases at a time and will probably push it to 4 cases next month.

Summary: Good qualities overshadowed by odd taste
Text: I pitted this against another leading brand of coconut water, but I'm not sure I would order it again. While there were undoubtedly some positive tasting qualities, likely owing to good practices and Thai sourced coconuts, these were considerably overshadowed by a metallic taste. I could only say I've known this taste before in... SpaghettiO's. Texture wise the pulp was also mushier, which has the benefit of a higher ratio of the rich, buttery bits, but I'm left wanting a hint of crunch somewhere. That's to be expected from young coconuts though, sought for their fruit rather than the mature nut. I favor a mix, which I at least believe I've found in two other brands. Another problem I found was these arrived in quite bad shape, the cans were variously dinged and punched in. The other guys' cans were too, except those were pressurized and so held up better. The real drawback for me was these practically require refrigeration. Now I'm well aware most people don't like room temperature coconut water, but I actually prefer it and regret to say I found Amy & Brian's too unpalatable to enjoy naturally.

its ok but still not good as taste of nirvana coconut drink. i wonder why amy and brian use young coconut? young cococnut is not ripe. if you like really coconut taste i highly recommend taste of nirvana.

Summary: very fresh and nice... better than other brands
Text: i tried this after trying some f the other brands and found it to be naturally more sweet and tastful compared to others. its slightly more expensive but i think its worth it for the nice taste.
We order these as if we needed them to survive.  No added sugar, just juice and pulp, and still plenty sweet.  One of our favorite coconut juices we have found.

This is the best tasting coconut juice around.  It is so addicting that I cannot just drink one can; I have to drink at least 2.  It provides potassium and magnesium which are both necessary for our bodies.  I must be low on those nutrients because as soon as I take a sip of the juice, my body just craves and craves more.  Its not even the same craving as for sweets or junk food.  Its like my body is saying this is just what I needed and just sucks it down!  Yumm.  I enjoy the coconut juice with pulp because the one without pulp seems to taste odd to me. But try it out, you won't regret it.  Your body will thank you for the magnesium and potassium!
I love this coconut water it taste a lot like C20 water and is cheaper too. I just bought 3 cases.. Im hooked

I am a relative new comer to the world of coconut water, and as such have not had a lot of experience with the variety of waters available. In fact, it was rather overwhelming when looking at all the varieties available.
Given the price of a case of water, it would be prohibitive to buy a case of everything and find the one I liked.
So I went to the local health food store and bought single cans of everything they had.
Out of all of them, Amy and Brians with the pulp tasted the best to me.
I have never had the water directly out of a fresh young coconut, so I cannot vouch for its "Authentic" taste or anything like that.
It didn't taste overly sweet to me (the can even states that its unsweetened)
It tasted like coconut flavored water w/ pulp and that's what I was hoping for.

As for some of the packaging issues mentioned in other reviews, someone must have been listening, because my case came superbly packaged with nary a dent.
Enjoy!

Summary: Maybe if stranded on an Island?
Text:
Stopped in Fresh Market for some things in Destin, FL new to Florida all together. This was the only brand I had yet to try. I have to be honest Nirvana Coconut water has this beat by far. This was difficult to finish at times it had what most coconut waters have a funny not sure if you like it taste???

Not Nirvana Coconut water it is clear clean, slightly sweet you feel good just drinking it, just simply the best. Sorry Amy & Brian "Nirvana" has you beat it must be the coconuts in Thailand like the can says!

Summary: Excellent product!  No sugar, but naturally sweet!
Text: These cans are the right size for a smoothie in the morning and a refreshing drink later.  I bought the version with pulp and I love the crunchy pieces, but not the other pieces.  I will get the pulp free version next.  But this is the best coconut juice/water I have ever tried.  I will definitely be ordering more with my subscription.  Can't beat the price either.

Summary: My sons can't get enough of this coconut water!!!
Text: My boys (13 & 14) absolutely love this coconut water.  They have tried less and more expensive brands and nothing compares.  The health benefits are wonderful and this is why I don't get too upset when they drink 2 to 3 a day.  We joke about my oldest son having withdrawals when we run out.  It is just a top quality product.

Summary: Amy & Brian Natural Coconut Juice with pulp
Text: Yummy.  I like this coconut juice very much.  I drink about 2 cans a day and I'm happy to have it for my grandchildren when they are here.  There's only benefit to drinking coconut water so it pleases me that we all enjoy it so much.  I'm thrilled to have found it available through Amazon.com..

I love this coconut juice so much I asked for a case of it for my birthday. I'm now panicking because I have only nine cans left. This is by far the most refreshing beverage in existence, not to mention probably one of the best for you.

This coconut water tastes almost identical to that of the water from a freshly opened young coconut.
I found the sweetness, texture, and taste of Amy&Brian's coconut water to be nearly indistinguishable
from that of a freshly opened coconut. Purchase if searching for authentic coconut water without the
hassle of opening up one yourself.

Summary: AMY & BRIAN NATURAL COCONUT JUICE WITH PULP
Text: This coconut juice is without a doubt the BEST coconut juice I have ever tasted.  It  comes in a great size--17.5 ounces, it is just sweet enough to be refreshing, and I love the pulp.  Aside from tasting so great, coconut juice is a great hydrator.  I like it so much I am having it shipped to my home monthly.

Summary: Best  tasting coconut water on the market
Text: Really love this product. Tried it at my daughters and couldn't find it where I live so ordered it from Amazon.  To save money I tried the automatic shipment.  Really like that too.  They always e-mail about a week before they ship and to give an opportunity to cancel. It has been 3 months now and I still look forward to the shipment as I am always out!

Summary: Best coconut juice. Love the pulp!
Text: I am surprised how many people like the pulp! My friends tell me its like having a meal. I always feel great after enjoying a can of coconut juice!  Thanks Amy and Brian

Just got through a case of Amy & Brian's Natural Coconut Juice and it's flat out great.  Other Coconut waters and juices I have tried are so bland and tasteless.  A&B has some flavor to it and the bits of pulp are nice to chew on.  Bottom line give it a try and you won't be going back to your old Coconut drink.
Easily the next best thing to drinking straight from young coconuts. I was curious because I've never had coconut juice that includes pulp and now I don't think I can go back to pulpless.

Summary: Does NOT taste like milk from a bowl that had corn flakes!
Text:
Try all of the coconut juice beverages out there, and more and more, they are becoming to taste like the milk that is left over from your bowl that had corn flakes in it.

This is the best tasting to date. Not artifically sweet tasting, but actually quite good. Slightly sweet, naturally, but not artifically with sugar.

Get the type with pulp.

Only negative I could say is that nearly every single can is dented. Some are dented so badly, that they are sqaure (4 sides are flat) when they are supposed to be round like a coke can. None were opened because of the damage but they were all dented.

I am in the process of ordering more... Due the math. Other vendors like the Zico brand, give you less product (some are 9 oz and others are 12 oz, for 2.99 in the store), for more money. In other words, with most brands, you are getting less juice (which tastes like corn flake milk), which costs more. With amy and brian, you are getting more juice (which tastes like young sweet coconuts), with pulp, FOR CHEAPER. I know it sounds wierd but punch the numbers!

:)

Oops, almost forgot to order another case!

I have tried a few different coconut waters and I was very impressed with the flavor of this completely natural one, the perfect amount of natural sweetness.  Great value.  I crave one after a long run!

We have been trying different coconut juices for quite some time and since we have tried Amy & Brian's we have not been buying other brands. We also like the coconut chunks that give the juice an even better texture.

I drink a lot of coconut water and have tried all the various brands. A chef friend steered me to this brand. I like it. No spoiled or rancid taste as I've found with some brands; slightly sweet but none of that overly sweetened sugary taste from many of the canned products that are on the market. I very much enjoy the pulp. I like that it comes in a can I can recycle (I can't recycle drink boxes in my neighborhood).

I love this product.  It does not have any added sugar and has more potassium than a banana.  This one has pulp in it which is like little pieces of the flesh cut up into small cubes like 1/4 in by 1/4 of inch(easy to swallow).  They sell a pulp free version if texture is an issue for you.  Best served cold, Coconut juice is refreshing and tasty.

My husband and I had tested almost all the coconut waters out there and Amy and Brian's is the best. I grew up in Hawaii where fresh coconut water/juice is a staple. This is by far the closest to fresh out of the nut coconut juice. We're addicted.

Summary: acquired taste, try it a few times before you decide
Text: i love this product.  the first time i had coconut water (zico) i did not see what the hype was about because it was salty, bland, and a strange thick consistency.  i tried this next and found the flavor to be better but still nothing i would crave.  the third time i had it, i truly enjoyed it - extremely refreshing.  i've had a couple others since; some have preservatives or sweeteners, some from concentrate.  this is simply the best bang (taste/nutrition/quantity) for your buck.  i drink it chilled after a workout and often blend it with fruit for a smoothie.  highly recommended with or without pulp.
Great flavor with a bit of actual coconut. Only coconut water brand I have found without added sugar.
We have tried other coconut water products (Zico and Vita Coco) but this one tastes more natural.

Summary: Almost like putting a straw in a coconut
Text: This is the closest I've ever gotten that's not straight from a coconut.  Still not 100% the same, but at least 97% :)  I personally prefer it at room temp (65-70 degrees), when I think the flavor is the best, but my husband likes it cold, so I think people should try it both ways.

Summary: Healthy and Refreshing, Gotta Try It
Text: I recently got into drinking coconut juice.  I tend to be health conscious so I started using coconut juice in the smoothies that I make.  It adds such a light, refreshing and delicious zing to my smoothies.  Since discovering Amy & Brian's coconut juice, I love to drink it straight as well.  My favorite are the ones with the pulp.  They are a great alternative to sports drinks because of the amount of potassium inside and don't have any artificial sweeteners or colors.  I drink them after exercising and they help me from getting sore afterward.  I recommend this drink to everyone I know and they're surprised how good it tastes.  It's become as good as gold in my home lately.  Next time you're in the grocery store and see one of these, put it in your cart and remember that your body thanks you.

Based on reviews, I ordered this bigger size because I read the smaller size had a weird taste. I was happy with some although there are some cans that had a weird taste. I went abroad and since I was enrolled in the auto delivery I received the second batch while I was away. I figured maybe the first batch was just a bad batch but once I opened the first can of the second batch, I still had that taste. I tried to do an exchange but I was not within the time frame.
My daughter says it could be because they're packaged in cans and she adviced I just switch to Vita Coco. I did order the Vita Coco 17oz and am very happy with it. Unfortunately it doesn't have the auto delivery that Amy and Brian has so I just have to put in an order every time.

Being from the Caribbean and living in Washington DC, I've been going through different products to see if I could find something close to the original. Well, I haven't tried all the products out there, but this weekend I saw this in a local food store and was sooo happy to see that it's sweet and good, not the awful artificially flavored ones that I've tried, even if it said 100% natural they tasted awful.

Haven't compared prices but it looks like it's cheaper buying from here.

Summary: Way too sweet for my tastes
Text:
I gave this one a shot when it was on sale and while I definitely couldn't complain about the price the taste was a little too sweet for my liking. I did like the pulp in the can, but when trying to down one of these a day I just couldn't do it. By the time I got through the entire 12 pack I could no longer bear the thought of having to drink the rest of them. This isn't to say that the product wasn't decent and I might be inclined to want to drink it again, once in a blue moon, i.e., very rarely; it just didn't have the same light refreshing properties that I have perviously found in other brands.

As a once a month treat I could find myself enjoying this, but the overly sweet taste makes me refrain from wanting to consume anymore.

Summary: Unnaturally sweet; far more carbs than others
Text: I found the pulp to be uncomfortably large chunks, that settled on the bottom. I also found this to be unnaturally sweet. (I have tried many different coconut waters; both packaged and fresh from the coconut.) The product lists far more carbs than any other packaged coconut water I have tried. Given these two things, I'm thinking it's likely this product is boiled, or otherwise condensed.  This may be good for those weaning off sugary beverages, but if you are looking for a coconut water that tastes like fresh from the coconut, this is not it.

Summary: Yuck ! Will stick to vita brand
Text: I have now tried them all and choose vita coconut water. This stuff and all the others taste terrible ! Vita is way more expensive but so much better and well worth it!

Amy & Brian's coconut juice is fantastic. There are only two ingredients in the Pulp variety: young coconut juice and young coconut pulp! It seems they must have filtered out the coconut fat at some point in the process, because there's no fat content.

Definitely a good buy when it's on sale. I think I'll try one of the pulp-free versions next time (maybe the one with lime). I do like pulp, but the little cubes were too heavy to float as well as orange pulp--I had to give it a quick stir or shake to set the cubes in motion before drinking.

I placed these in my fridge and always looked forward to having a tall, cool glass of coconut juice!

Summary: Did not care for this coconut water
Text: Since O.N.E changed their formulae or process or something and has started tasting awful, I have been on the lookout for a different brand. I love eating the tender coconut pulp, so was excited about this product. The "pulp" is not really tender for most part and is some sort of diced coconut flesh. I didn't care for it and that meant that I'd have to strain the water to drink it. My search is still on
Product was good,but each an every can was crushed on the last two orders.i would not purchase it again for that reason.

Summary: Delicious Coconut Juice but Dented Cans, Thick Pulp Pieces
Text: Juice by itself is delicious - the best coconut water out of the brands I have tasted (Zico, O.N.E., and VitaCoco).  Very pulp-y, which would be fine if the pieces were not so thick.  Took off another star for the severely dented cans. 9 of the 12 cans were dented, 7 were dented so much at the seam that I have chosen to discard them rather than risk drinking.
