This product is acceptable. I find the raspberry flavor fine, though I am disappointed at the large amount of added sugar.

It's hard to give more than 3 stars at this price, though, my grocery store sells the items individually at a slightly lower per unit price...
The 3 pack is a great deal. The syrup itself is tasty very sweet and slightly tart distinct raspberry flavor.

Summary: A disaster supply MUST HAVE.. Sooooooooooooo tasty in just bottled water ..........BUY only Amazon Sub & Save
Text:
Having gone thru the largest and longest power outage ever on the books here in SW VA - we only had 2 days without BUT so many others still not back on as of today Sunday July 8th, and it is now into 100's again - these Torani syrups are a must have - many flavors to choose from and Amazon's [sold by and ships by] Subscribe & Save is the only way to go. Torani Syrup, Raspberry, 25.4-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 3)

Watch out for 'shyster' vendors - only trust Amazon............. one can control their subscriptions -

The quality is flavor perfection. Somewhat thin to be called syrup, but then again - no settling to bottom of bottle or sharp taste as Kool-Aid* and other dry powder drink flavorings have a tendency to do.

Working in a coffee shop on a college campus, people have a lot of complaints about the products we use, however, the one product people never seem to complain about is our flavoring.  I recommend Torani brand syrup to anybody wanting to add flavor to their drinks.  When I say drinks, I mean all drinks.  Coffee, Soda (these work great when making Italian Sodas), Tea, anything.  Torani makes an excellent product.  The one thing I would say to somebody buying for the first time would be to play around with measurements.  It's very easy to go overboard with the flavor.  It's also easy to put too little flavor.  It's always embarrassing to have somebody come back to the counter because their drink didn't have enough flavor.

Summary: Wonderful in hot or cold coffee!
Text: This is an awesome product.  I use it to sweeten my morning coffee, and also for iced coffee later in the evening.  Just add milk, coffee, ice, and a little syrup.  Yum!
I received the product on time, deliverd to me just as promised. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for tea flavoring.

I tried this in coffee at a small cafe,and was pleasantly surprised. It really does taste like real fruit. However, I was disappointed to see that it is NOT "all natural" as claimed. It contains FD&C color, and sodium benzoate preservative. For those reasons, I won't be able to buy it to take home - I feel these are unwholesome additives. Too bad!

This is the second time I have purchased this syrup.  The raspberry flavor is so flavorful and the perfect sweetness that I do not have to add any sugar to my iced tea.  I use one tablespoon per cup of green tea and it is delicious cold with ice!!  Highly recommend this one.

The raspberry syrup is very good. The peach syrup is even better. The price for the size of the bottle is excellent. I add these syrups in a pitcher of hot tea that has been seeping, add some sugar, let the tea cool, and
then pour over ice. I have gotten great comments about my tea. I also add syrup in water to encourage myself to drink more water.
I found this at Walmart in Alaska but could never find it near my home in upstate NY.  It it wonderful in iced tea.  I've used it in lemon-lime sodas also.

Summary: Rather sour, not the greatest raspberry flavor
Text: We bought this when the local Starbucks was too low on the raspberry syrup we put in our morning coffee to sell us a bottle, hoping after reading reviews of raspberry syrups availabe from Amazon that this would be a good substitute.  The only members of our household who seem to like it are the ants that appeared to cluster around the top, which cracked when we opened the first bottle.  We bought a pack of 3 bottles - not sure what we'll do with the other two, but we find the bottles of syrup we buy from Starbucks to have a much stronger and slightly sweeter raspberry flavor.  There's no comparison.
This is a great item. AND the price is excellent.. Just make sure you do the Subscription thing and then the shipping is free too !
Tasty. We use half strength in a glass of tea for a really refreshing drink.

This is my first cup of coffee! My husband wasn't crazy about purchasing a Keurig machine, but now that we have it, he uses it all of the time. And, his favorite coffee is this half-caff!  We were always mixing regular and decaf in our coffee maker. But this is easier and tastes great! The only thing that would make it better would be if it were organic!  Love it.
I love the Green Mountain Half Caff K-cups. It is a great tasting cup of coffee, never bitter. I am trying to consume a little less caffeine, so this is the perfect solution!

Summary: Just right in oh, so many ways
Text:
This is the perfect afternoon cup of coffee.
I'd rate it - in K-Cup strengths (which I regard as stronger than the usual grocery store can brewed coffees) as "medium". And since all other K-cups are all-or-nothing when it comes to caffeine, this one hits the middle.

Summary: Yay!  An alternative to (high-sodium) baking soda!
Text:
I'm relegated to eating low-sodium for the rest of my earth-bound life, so most baked goods were either severely limited or totally off-limits. But not any more! This product has re-opened the door to a plethora of baked goodies. Be sure to pay attention to the instructions and double (at least) the amount of product you use in recipes. If the recipe says use a 1/2 teaspoon of baking soda, use at least 1 teaspoon of this substitute, maybe even a bit more. And, like some of the other reviews point out, because this product starts working RIGHT AWAY as soon as it's wet, add it last ... i.e., just before putting your recipes in the oven.

Other folks have complained about the price and the fact that you have to use more. My response: I don't mind. I'm thrilled that this product exists and allows me to eat foods that were previously on the "do no eat" list.

Is there a taste different? Very slight / hardly noticeable. Do I mind? No. I'm just glad to have something that gives me more options. The mere fact that this product (a) exists and (b) actually works means I give it five stars.

Requires 2X the volume when compared to normal baking soda.
This is on the jar. So, buying a 3 pack if you are a frequent
baker isn't insane.

No noticeable taste or performance difference.

Definitely worth buying if you are trying to reduce
sodium in your cooking.

At any price this is an outstanding, smooth, wonderfully rosted coffee, without the bitter, or burnt overtones of some coffees.  One of the best coffees out there (and I drink six to 8 cups a day and have tried LOTS of different coffees).

Great coffee. Was very fresh and hubby loved it (He is he coffee drinker)
No complaints here and plan to buy it again

Summary: Millstone breakfast blend, whole bean coffee
Text: This is absolutely the BEST coffee I have ever had. Coming from a navy 20yr vet thats something!!!

Mildest of all coffees I have tasted. Consistently smooth drinking. My favorite. Highest caffeine is in lightest roast, so this one has a good kick for your mornings. If you like dark French roasts, do not buy this item.

Love this coffee!  I used to buy this coffee in the store and couldn't find it anymore.  When I found it on Amazon, I was thrilled and the automatic delivery is great.  This coffee is so smooth, never bitter.  I have tried others, and there is no comparison.  I highly recommend this coffee to anyone who justs wants a great tasting, smooth cup in the morning or anytime!!

Sometimes you're just not in the mood for the oily, burnt flavor of many dark roasts. This blend is the antidote.  Fresh, fragrant, foamy, just right. Drink a potful...no acid stomach. Stick with the Breakfast Blend beans, tho, for best experience. The ground is not as flavorful. Also, the Bed and Breakfast blend is farther down the roasting spectrum toward espresso.
Great coffee, not bitter just the right flavorMillstone Breakfast Blend Whole Bean Coffee, 12-Ounce Packages (Pack of 2)

My bad because I failed to check over the ounces, but the store sells this coffee for less than one half what I paid for it her.  I assumed that it was the large bags and it would have made it fair not great but I won't get caught again  THey advertise 12 ounce  it was only 11 not even pound packages for 8 dollars  WOW

Summary: My Order was Placed June 30, 2011 Has not been shipped yet, 23 Days after Ordering!
Text:
Amazon.com Millstone Coffee Order, Placed: June 30, 2011

My Order was Placed June 30, 2011 Has not been shipped yet, 23 Days after Ordering!

I have been ordering this Coffee regularly for over a year. And it has a nice mild chocolate flavor and smell. By it's self, it does have an after taste, that is not pleasant. But, I Mix it with Millstone Breakfast Blend Whole Bean Coffee to give it more of a real Coffee Flavour. The natural Oils in the Millstone Breakfast Blend Whole Bean Coffee, makes them both taste pretty good together, to me. It usually arrives in between 1 to 2 weeks on Free Super Saver Shipping. Which is slow, but bearable to get the Free Shipping. If I had to pay shipping, then the Coffee would cost too much to buy. But this time... my order has not come and it has been over 23 days now, since I placed my order. And I cannot find any place on this Managery of a Web Site to contact customer service to find out why! I found this on my Order History Page...
"Not yet shipped"
"We'll notify you via e-mail when we have an estimated delivery date for this item. It will ship separately. You can cancel at any time."

Millstone Chocolate Velvet Ground Coffee, 12-Ounce Packages (Pack of 2) (I have not received yet, after 23 days!)
Sold by: Amazon.com LLC

Shipment 2 of 2
Shipped
Delivery Estimate: July 9, 2011

Millstone Breakfast Blend Whole Bean Coffee, 12-Ounce Packages (Pack of 2) (which I already received)
Sold by: Amazon.com LLC

They have already gone way past the original Estimated Delivery Date! I would just cancel this order! But, I figured... If I canceled this order I would be charged shipping for the other Items on the order which made it eligible for "Super Saver Shipping". And I was right...

"You will not receive FREE Super Saver Shipping on your order if any eligible items are canceled, bringing the total below $25."

Read 'The Fine Print"...
[...]

Don

Summary: Please offer this tea through Subscribe & Save!
Text:
Delicious decaf tea! Don't know how Good Earth did it, but they created a masterpiece in this tea. And one GREAT bonus: it doesn't stain your teeth like black tea and even green tea do.

I wish Amazon would offer this decaf version through Subscribe & Save, to bring its price down. Amazon sells very few decaf white teas, and this may be the only *flavored* decaf white tea on Amazon. Why does it have to cost so much more than the caffeinated version of the same tea?

I love tea; our family owns and drinks many kinds. However, this is my favorite decaf white tea. Its flavor is delicate yet refreshing.

I bought mine at a local grocer and am so disappointed that they don't carry it any more. I haven't been able to find it lately at *any* stores. It's one of the few teas I'm willing to purchase by the case.

Summary: Great decaf option for green tea lovers!
Text:
I recently had to stop drinking caffeinated beverages because they were making me jittery. My favorite reasonably priced green tea was Yamamotoyama green tea. I loved that tea because it tasted clean and refreshing, and it had a great color to it.

I kept searching around for a decaf option and found this on sale at the grocery store. I did not like this tea at first--since it was different. The color is certainly not as pleasing to the eye (it's not such a bright green). However, it has really grown on me. It has a hint of lemon grass too, which took some getting used to. However, now I drink it all day long at the office.

And the best thing is, this tea doesn't bother my acid reflux or give me heartburn. Sometimes, teas can also make me feel a little nauseated sometimes. However, this one is gentle on my stomach as well. A great product.

Can't find this tea on the shelves in the supermarkets anymore. The lighter the tea...the more health benefits...White tea is the best...green tea close behind. The Good Earth company added a light flavoring...vanilla...which makes it tasty and enjoyable!

I purchased this item after seeing it on the Dr. OZ show. I like the idea that it is gluten free and made with brown rice and flax seeds.  Because I normally use whole wheat pasta, I have found the texture of this product quit different. I cooked it for a few minutes longer than the time recommended on the box. Overall, I think it is OK but I need to get used to it and experiment with different recipes.

I was looking elsewhere, seeing this stuff rated at 500,000-700,000 scoville units. I don't think so. I can put a spoonful of this directly on my tongue, and the burn is very mild. It's also very sweet. If sweet with a mild burn is what you are looking for, go for it. Otherwise try something else.

If you want to purchase a can of Northern Catch sardines, get the one with the mustard sauce. The ones you see that is packed with water has a very fishy taste to it and this may repulse a few. If you need to eat a can of this strongly recommend that you either add mustard or some marinara sauce. Yet it is very cheap when you can find it at my local Aldi supermarket.
This is, by far, the worst product I've ever purchased. It is shredded crab meat, with the added bonus of shredded crab shell. It's like eating moistened saw dust with a fishy aftertaste. Terrible!

Purchased this exact item at my local Big Lots for $ 1.50. Not worth it.
Fresh supply came in. I was planning to buy quite a few cans.

It's tasteless. Has the crab meat smell, but not the taste.
Didn't specify what type of crab it was. Mediocre product.
Very disappointing for a name brand product.
I have a fish (swimming type) allergy and this gave me the same reaction when i eat fish.....If you have a fish allergy beware!!!!
Barry Farms delivers promptly and their products are moderately priced. Highly recommend this vendor and their products. Very pleased.

The bag arrived in very good condition.
The one star reason:
I was very disappointed that the bag of cracked wheat was not the coarse kind but was like very fine flour. It is the coarse kind that gives bread the nutty texture we so love in our family. I don't think it was advertised clearly enough for me to catch the difference but it's been awhile since I ordered it so I could have forgotten.

The good news - the cookies are tasty and fresh. The bad news - the most current packaging (summer 2010) means the contents are powder by the time they reach you. In the past, Salem used a well-padded interior honeycomb packaging which protected the cookies. The newest packaging offers virtually no protection, and the cookies are mostly reduced to crumbs and powder.

These cookies are very thin, paper-thin, and crisp. It's hard to eat just a few!

These are extremely thin, delicate cookies. They are delicious, but I will not order them from Amazon again. I sent them as a gift and my friend reported that only half the cookies weren't broken. Almost half of them were reduced to crumbs, and a few were broken into pieces large enough to handle. They were sent in a box with no padding, just a couple of air-filled bags, one of which was completely deflated. Such a disappointment!

This is the second time i have ordered Moravian cookies through Amazon.com.  The cookies in themselves are delicious, however, most of them are broken because Amazon does not ship them correctly.  I will not order cookies from Amazon.com again.
These cookies have a great, lemony taste.  The only bad thing was that they're thin and many of them were broken.

The first time I tried these we had gotten them in a gift basket at work. It was love at first taste! Not your typical ginger spice cookies. First, they are paper thin, well maybe not paper but perhaps potato chip thin. Which makes them as addictive! They also have a little more bite on the end of the flavor. To me they are my favorite cookies! I can see having these with ice cream, whipped cream or just all on their own. They are the best!

THESE ARE ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL COOKIES AND WE WERE LOOKING FORWARD TO RECEIVING OUR ORDER. HOWEVER, WHEN THEY ARRIVED, MOST OF THE COOKIES WERE BROKEN INTO CRUMBS. I THINK THESE COOKIES ARE TOO THIN TO ORDER BY MAIL; BUT I WAS REIMBURSED, THANKS TO AMAZON.

First off, these taste wonderful. However, they crumble which is very annoying.

Mine came fully intact but as I take each one out of plastic wrap inside the tubing, they just crumble in my hand before I can get them to my mouth! Almost seems like they are too fresh and need some time to firm up!

Found an easy solution - I just emptied the entire contents into the tube they came in and I just drink them. LOL

Summary: A little pricey, but ohhhhh so good!
Text: I get these every year at Christmas to go with all the usual home-baked goodies.  These are very thin crisp spicy cookies, with tons of flavor in a small size.  Everyone that tries them absolutely LOVES them.  Until I find a local source for them, I'll keep ordering them from Amazon.  (The other flavors are equally good, too!)

Summary: cookies great....but too many broken ones
Text: I love the cookies and have for years. But this shipment came with too many broken ones.

These cookies are very thin and crisp and remind me of gingerbread with a slight kick.  Everyone I have given these to wants to know where to buy them.  These normally sell in 6oz tubes for about the same pice in department stores so this is a great deal.

These cookies are fantastically tasty,& arrived with only a little breakage (other reviewers complained of this, but given how ridiculously fragile these cookies are, it's not surprising).Perhaps the packaging folks at amazon were more careful-either way they arrived in good shape, the cookies themselves are quite tasty & remind me of lemon "Trix" only WAY better (I consider it a good sign when a food item brings back seemingly random childhood memories) they are so tasty in fact, that I'm eager to try their other cookies as well...the cans are useful when empty too....
These cookies are delicious and remind me of Christmas.  However, they do not ship all that well.  About a quarter of them were broken into small pieces.

ProfileName: Pat C "Reader who likes to  cook"
Summary: Not as good as I remember`
Text: I've bought these cookies before and they were just wonderful.  But these were not as good as I remember and the packing makes it difficult to retrieve a cookie without breaking it.

I like spice cookies.
But these were cloyingly sweet.
I threw them away.

I tried this sauce on a whim, when I saw it in Whole Foods Market. It had a local label and I'm all 'gung ho' for trying out products made locally. I wasn't sure what to expect so I tasted a little bit before mixing it with my other ingredients, and was initially surprised that it truly tasted like its name as well as very authentic. But boy was I surprised after I used this with a stuffed shells recipe and really tasted the flavors! The flavoring of the herbs in the sauce were simply robust and just delicious, complimenting my other ingredients extremely well. I vowed never to buy commercial pasta sauces ever again, but this certainly changed my mind. This is very close to making a sauce from scratch, in my opinion. If you're skeptical, I would suggest buying a jar from your local health food store before buying in bulk...you won't regret it!

Summary: Good Intro to Brand and Product Line
Text:
Great sampler packet. I have tried other brands of ready to eat Indian foods such as Jyoti and Tasty Bite. This brand compares favorably and I do plan on buying this exact product again. It is not overly hot but is spicey - so while it may be a bit much for some children, adults should do fine.

As these types of vegetarian items (or near veggie since some of the sampler includes paneer cheese which is like cubes of tofu but with a cheesy taste), are highly pureed in texture, except when there are beans, they can be used as sauces over rice, shell pasta, quinoa, couscous, polenta, potatoes, etc. The bean ones could be heated and used in lieu of soup or chili for lunch with a crusty french bread for instance. Would pair great with a fresh salad.

Product is excellent for those looking for all those great spices like cumin, curry, tumeric, peppers, and the like. Also qualifies as a whole food.

Highly portable since packaged in tear away foil packets which are light weight and could be eaten out of them in a pinch if don't mind your fingers getting a bit messy reaching in and out of the foil to spoon out the food. I don't recommend trying to eat with a fork as even the bean ones are in sauces. Foil packages are not for the microwave but product eats fine at room temperature. Great for camping, picnics, road trips, etc.

This is a wonderful array of some classic Indian dishes. They are very nicely spiced, very flavorful, and good alternative to expensive take-out. What my family of three has done is make 3 packs at once. Everyone gets a portion of each with basmati rice and homemade raita.

While not quite homemade or restaurant quality, these also make a quick and impressive meal for guests who drop in. These dishes smell wonderful and complex as they heat up. If you can keep some frozen nan (or even pita) on hand to heat up in the oven, your guests will rave. (even the non-vegetarians!)

This variety pack is a wonderful sampling of Indian cuisine. First off, the brand: I have tried many Tasty Bite Indian ready-packed meals and they are not in the same league as Kitchens of India. The Kitchens of India flavours and spices are much more tantalizing in equivalent entrées.

The only problem I previously had with Kitchens of India is we'd order one variety at a time and before the family finished them we'd be ready to move onto another. Not a problem now! We order these variety packs for quick meals on the go and never get sick of them (although the wife doesn't like the spinach one and says it looks like a poopy diaper... but more for me!).

Summary: no substitute for authentic indian cuisine
Text:
i subscribed happily but was very disappointed. I'm from South Asia so I'm familiar with this kind of food.

Dal Bukara - Black Lentil Curry : this was alright. I had to put more spices to make it better
Palak Paneer- Spinach w/Cottage Cheese: alright; not too special
Rajma Masala - Red Kidney Bean Curry : I didn't enjoy this and ended throwing it away
Navratan Korma - Mixed Vegetable & Cottage Cheese Curry; I couldn't eat more than a few bites. it smelled really bad and tasted WORSE. all i tasted was cumin.
pav Bhaji - Mashed Vegetable Curry:
Pindi Chana-Chick Pea Curry: this was the ONLY packet I actually enjoyed from the 6 but not enough to make me buy this brand again

all i tasted for most of the 6 products was cumin and more cumin. if you've never tried indian cuisine before; I wouldn't advise you to have your first impression from here.

My husband is a huge fan of Indian food...  me, not so much.  The dishes in this variety pack are *YUM*!!!  After a long day, whip up a little jasmine rice, and heat a pack up.  Voila!  I quick, tasty meal for 2.  You will likely want a side dish, if you require a large portion.  I originally bought these on sale, but will purchase more, whether they are on sale or not.

I fear that these spicy convenience foods are too high in fat to eat often. They taste well enough and will satisfy a craving for Indian food if you live far from a good source. Not really as good as "the real thing", but fairly yummy. There is a very high  ratio of calories from fat to total calories on some flavors. As well as being to plentiful, I think the fats are saturated or hydrogenated and not well tolerated by my system. I tried the sampler pack and had some facial breakouts! I will probably not buy more, dispite my love for spicy foods. I think I'll try an Indian cookbook.

We've only tried 3 of the 6 flavors so far, but all have been VERY tasty (definitely on the spicy side, but that is what you want from Indian food) you can literally heat and eat, but my husband and I prefer a little more substance - so we added 1/2 a pound of cooked chicken and served it over rice - WONDERFUL!!! We enjoyed them so much we ordered 4 more sets before the discount code I had expired. If you are going to try just one the Mixed Vegetable Curry is Fabulous!

This is a hard review to write based off the fact that every pack is different and has a different taste and different good / bad things about each.

I bought this package so that I can try them out and see which ones I liked.

I gave this product 3 stars because I liked 3 of them a lot and the other 2 were OK, and 1 of them was just straight up UN UH!

So...for the most part, I am 98.9999% vegan. But on occasion I will have some cheese, butter, and milk here and there if they are included in something that I did not make myself. That being said, when I am 'bad' I want it to be GOOD! However...I honestly like the taste of the ones without the dairy products so much better.

And I am Italian, so I definitely used to have a special place in my heart for cheese, but the cottage cheese ones were kinda off.

The mashed vegetable one (which contains butter) was just ok.

So to review, in order...best to least:

Rajma Masala - Red Kidney Bean Curry
Pindi Chana-Chick Pea Cu
Dal Bukara - Black Lentil Curry
Navratan Korma - Mixed Vegetable & Cottage Cheese Curry
Jpav Bhaji - Mashed Vegetable Curry

Notice I didn't place Palak Paneer- Spinach w/Cottage Cheese on the list?? That's because it was NASTY! Definitely didn't like this one. I mean, It wasnt so bad that I threw it away. I still ate it, but I wont ever buy the Spinach one again.

Don't let me sway your decision to buy Kitchens of India products though. The ones I did like tasted better than most Indian restaurants I have been to. And I've been to quite a few. Not to mention it is much cheaper than going out to a restaurant by far!

And if you live on the north eastern USA and have a Wegmans near you, they just started making different kinda of packaged Naan breads which are also very good (they are not vegan though sadly).

I've ordered a 6 pack of the Kidney Bean curry, lentil curry, and chick pea curry because I liked them so much. And thankfully out of the 6 choices in this multi pack, the 3 that I like the best have the lowest amount of fat and sodium, which seem to be very high in all of Kitchens of India products. Especially the Sodium. So be careful, and eat them in moderation as I do.

Hope this helps!

Hi. Been eating these for about a year or two now and absolutely love them. Simple as that.If your new to Indian food, this stuff is fairly authentic and very tasty for a prepackaged meal. stick it in the microwave for about 60-65 seconds and your done. i suggest putting some rice on the side and perhaps some naan bread and you are all set. my only warning to newbies is the pindi chana is considered "very spicy" (I am used to it so it has no effect on me by now). All the other dishes are simply very tasty.

One thing i want to point out is, the salt content in almost all indian food is super high so if you have high blood pressure this is not for you.

I only eat about one package a week due to the high salt content but would indulge more if they offered a lower sodium version.

Thanks to Kitchens Of India (the other companies such as tasty bite are ok, but nothing compared to this company)!

Ps. they are hard to find in most supermarkets and now that i discovered amazon carries them.... well that's the end of that search!

I like Indian food, and have bought other brands of packaged Indian food before. In comparison, these taste extremely salty - to me, the Biryani was so salty as to be inedible unless mixed with yogurt. I'll finish up what I bought (this pack plus a couple of others that sounded good) but I won't buy this brand again.

Wow!!! The amount of sodium is simply insane...
You eat one of these and you are almost at the recommended daily amount of sodium.
You can also taste too much salt...
good enough i/ve set this up for 24 dinners per month to be delivered. no preparation other than heat and eat. the food tends towards mildly spicy, but is really very good for what you pay.

This has to be the worst Indian packaged food I have ever eaten. Tasted stale and salty.

Save your money

These packets are really great, but they function best if you add vegetables and rice -- they're not so good just by themselves.  By themselves, they are too salty and spicy.  If you add vegetables and rice, each packet makes much more of a meal, and the flavor is just right.

We got these when they were on sale and they were surely good value for money but they aren't super quality, tasting a little bit like what they are (premade vacuum sealed meals).  Certainly good and i'd eat them again no problem, and buy them if the price was right but don't expect gourmet.

Well, I'm not much of a cook, especially Indian food and the sheer amount of spices I would be wasting trying to make any of these outstrips the cost of purchasing these meals. I tried to make Palak Paneer before, and it didn't work out. So until I can get in that Indian Cooking class, I resort to pre-made or take out for a fix.

All of the varieties in this pack are good. Some are better than others, the only one that is lack luster is the Palak Paneer. The down side to these is that they contain a lot of your daily salt intake. The upside is that they don't have to be refrigerated, you get a good variety and they are fast to make. If you pre-cook some rice, you can just put some in a bowl, pour the contents of the pouch on top and pop in the microwave for a minute or so and you're read to eat. And with fresh cooked rice, just dump it on, the heat from the rice will warm it up.

Warning: Besides the Palak Paneer, I would characterize these a fairly spicy for Western gullets. If you suffer from anything thing that precludes spicy foods, I'd stay away, most of this is probably nothing you want to deal with.

I'm actually not ordering this anymore because I have tried to cook more myself and these were making it too easy to just say screw it.

Dal Bukara - Black Lentil Curry - this is good, not much of a lentil fan until I had this.
Palak Paneer- Spinach w/Cottage Cheese - just so-so, cheese is not consistent, no real mph to it.
Rajma Masala - Red Kidney Bean Curry - I do not like kidney beans, but I love this, this one is a little spicy.
Navratan Korma - Mixed Vegetable & Cottage Cheese Curry - Good, again, the cheese is not great, but better than the Palak
Jpav Bhaji - Mashed Vegetable Curry, - super good, spicy.
Pindi Chana-Chick Pea Curry - I love this one with the chickpeas.

The kidney beans and the chick peas really reminded me of chili. You could put them over fritos and you wouldn't be disappointed.

For fast, easy Indian dish from your pantry, you could do worse than this product.

The product arrived promptly - I had not expected to receive it so quickly. {A definite Plus} Thus far, we have tried two items; Saag Paneer, and a Dal dish. The dal was tasty and the spices were not too strong. We also tried out the Saag Paneer. The flavor was perfect, however I only found 1 piece of the cheese. Served with rice, the meal was filling and satisfying. Husband used some chicken to round out his meal. This will be a definite Meatless Monday menu for me. I'll have to get some onion naan from our local Indian grocer. Hubby can augment one of the dishes with a protein of his choice.

I'm looking forward to enjoying the other meals very soon!
I recommend these dishes to non- vegetarians [like me!]

Summary: Wonderful Indian food that I can carry anyplace
Text: I love Indian food; and I am a vegetarian. I don't own a microwave and I spend a lot of time on foot with a backpack. So, these prepared dishes are really perfect for me. I can carry a pouch or two in my pack so I have a delicious, vegetarian meal that I can cook anyplace I have hot water or a burner or fire. I find them a little bit magical, actually. No need to keep them in a fridge; no need to have a can opener. These can even be cooked in the pouch they come in, so I would imagine it's even possible to just leave them in a very hot, sunny place for a while and be OK. Delicious food. Amazingly convenient and affordable. Thanks!

I like these a lot. I've tried several ready made Indian products, but this is the only one I've "subscribed" to. Great flavor and consistency. I wish there were a little more variety, but enjoy the flavors of each.

The quality of this brand was very very good. I really enjoyed three of the six but the other three were bland. The three I liked were a little less spicy then I would eat but made for the masses.... I bought a 6 pack the the Kidney Bean Curry and spice it up to my liking and it's great.

Summary: Ready made meal in a pouch
Text: I love the Kitchens of India meals. They're all gluten free and so flavorful. They are so convenient to open, heat, and eat over quinoa or rice. I will continue to subscribe to this product.

I am an avid cook and therefore have become picky overtime because I can taste the difference when something is a quality product or not. I was skeptical when my husband ordered these but they were so inexpensive that I figured "why not?" They are surprisingly delicious! I love Indian food and these have made it so easy to make a quick, filling meal. Cook up some basmati rice or naan to pair with one of the packages and you have an easy, cheap meal for two. Some of the food combinations sounded bizarre to me, but they are all really tasty. Also, when we ordered, each individual package came with a CD of Indian music which I thought was hysterical, but in an endearing way. Maybe it aids with you digestion? They're fun in any case.

These would be a great idea for emergency food storage and were a lifesaver when our kitchen was being redone and the only appliance I had access to was my microwave.

We enjoy spicy foods, and this did not disappoint. They are easy to prepare, and full of flavor. Our 3 kids (ages 9, 7, and 2.5) asked for seconds and thirds! I ordered this on a whim when it was on sale for $7 for the pack of 6. Though the  current $17 price is too expensive for me, I would buy this again if it goes on sale.

i've tried only the navratan korma so far, so, i'm hoping the others will be better. good indian food uses lots of spice, but they are supposed to blend into a harmonious whole. the cloves in this dish hid the other spices.

This was my first experience with Kitchens of India products. Of the six varieties I especially liked the Black Gram Lentils CurryKitchens Of India Ready To Eat Dal Bukhara, Black Gram Lentil Curry, 10-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6) and the Red Kidney Bean CurryKitchens Of India Ready To Eat Rajma Masala, Red Kidney Bean Currry, 10-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6): so much so that I ordered these two varieties individually on a recurring basis from Amazon. The other four varieties were OK, but I probably will not buy them again.

Summary: Great Variety, Convenient and Kosher too!
Text: Tasty, very convenient, especially if you don't live near an Indian restaurant (closest one to me is just over an hour's drive away) These packets are way easier and cheaper than takeout. Easy to microwave, but cover it very well, it likes to splatter. I do a paper towel *and* a paper plate on top of the bowl. Trust me, it's messy if you don't. You'll probably want some rice or naan to go with it, as there is a lot of sauce. Also, if you're concerned about portions, you'll want to know that the packet is more than one official serving, but it is so good that I usually have it all for one meal. The spinach paneer is just a bit less flavorful and spicy than the other dishes, but if you're in the mood for something a little more toned down, it's perfect. It was fun to go through the different kinds and flavors to see which ones I like the best. They're Kosher too, and some of them even look ok for Pesach, based on the ingredients list (and your own practices) Sounds like a lot of details, and a bit more prep than some nuke and go meals but it so worth it. Yum.
I can not find these products in my area.  Have found that it is cheapers and more efficient to order on line.  I save money and it is delivered right to my door-what could be better?
Tasty and would last quite a while. It is a little spicy for my taste buds but I would probably buy this again.

Summary: Great Indian Sampler Set - Highly Recommended
Text:
We really like Indian food and find most "Kitchens of India" dishes fairly authentic tasting. The meals in this "Variety Pack" are all good and range from fairly mild to very spicy, which provides something for everyone in my family since we all have different tolerances for spicy foods.

These are very easy to make using the microwave method and just involve opening the foil packet, dumping the contents into a microwave safe bowl, cooking for about 1 - 2 minutes, stirring, and serving. My only real issue with these is that most of the packet say they contains 2.5 servings but it is closer to 2 for my family. These make an excellent main course or side dish for an Indian themed dinner and they make for an enjoyable snack as well.

Highly Recommended!

CFH

Coming from NYC, Ive had Indian food since I was in my early twenties... I found it to be delicious and amazing with many different dishes from Korma to Jafrezzi..

These curries are some of the worst oily tasting gritty messes Ive ever had and I am not new to instant foods or curries that are out there on the market.

I dont know what else to say but dont trust the reviews that seem too detailed and are clearly corporate spokespersons; these are not worth your time no matter how cheap and how steep the discount

We're vegetarians who love Indian food.  But this just didn't taste good.  (And we bought two...)  It wasn't terrible, but wasn't great.  Amy's is MUCH better.  So is Tasty Bite.  (Try their Madras Lentils, OMG).

The package arrived this morning before I walked out the door, that is fast shipping! Tried the mixed vegetable curry with cottage cheese for dinner this evening, 2 thumbs up, tastes great. Looking forward to the rest of them.
Bon appetite

Since I live in an area without a local Indian restaurant, I have tried these from a few different companies.  The flavor and spice level of Kitchens of India products is by far the best.  The food tastes as good as what I have eaten in restaurants and almost as good as when my friends from India prepare Indian food.  I will be buying these again.

I first discovered these several years ago on a trip to San Francisco, at the Rainbow Market. They are not only vegetarian and gluten-free, they have no preservatives. However, while authentic tasting, they are not quite spicy enough for me.
After my young son decided to become a vegetarian, I started ordering this variety pack on a regular basis. Even though the price each is the same as it is in my local store, I can never find all six flavors at the same store at the same time, so it is worth it to order it this way. I serve these over basmati rice, and it's more than enough to feed two people.

Having never really eaten Indian food, I can't really say how authentic it is. It's a variety pack of ready to heat foods. It's fast to microwave or put it over a stove top and goes well with rice. It's worth a shot if you are done with cup ramen and have rice or noodles handy.
Taste of the items are ok. I wont say feel them too good. The preservatives can be reduced a bit. Overall rating is ok for the money.
Good stuff. More expensive than some of the other brands, but it's fun to try more than one kind. I'd buy again on sale.
I got them during the gold-box deals so they average out to be less than 2$/pack. They are easy to heat up, flavorful, and delicious. I would definitely get them again. I love the variety pack.

Summary: Good little variety pack for vegetarians.
Text: I am a vegetarian and a fan of indian food, so I decided to try this sample pack of Kitchens of India food products. I find it difficult to come across a deal that involves all vegetarian friendly foods, and so I purchased this when it was in the Daily Deals section. The vegetable curry was the best of the six, and I got them for a decent price, so I am happy with my purchase.
The food packets are easy to fix and very quick.My wife finds them a little spicy(hot). Eat them with more rice to tone down the heat.

Summary: Good deal, good food, no preservatives
Text:
It's good Indian food for a good price.

I get these at World Market when I visit the city for 4 to 5 dollars each. So Amazon's price is good. But I have flavors that I love and others that I don't. So getting all 6 might not be good for you if you don't like all of the different recipies.

If you want to try some preservative-free Indian food, this isn't a bad way to start. But it's not restaurant or true home-made quality.

You'll want to make it with Basmati Rice to get the best taste and intended texture.

Here's a link for good basmati: http://www.amazon.com/Himalayan-Pride-Basmati-Rice-Pound/dp/B002CSMDLM/

I bought these when they were the gold box deal, and I am so glad that I did.  I have made 2 of these so far, and they are soooo good.  My husband is a believer that if there is no meat, its not a meal, so I just take some chicken breast and sprinkle it with adobo and serve it along with the packet of food, and some basmati rice.  Its nice to have Indian food at home, this is so much cheaper than take out, and cheaper than having to buy all the seasonings and making it yourself.  I am very happy with my purchase.

My husband and I really like these meals. They are so convenient when you're in a rush and we love the taste.
Have to say that the serving size is a little off, or maybe we're just overeaters. We use 2 boxes with rice on the
side, cucs and yogurt, a little chutney and naan (or pita if we don't have any). High in fat so don't have as often
as we'd like.
we love these!  not as one or two servings, however.  way too spicy for us.  i add one to a whole potful of wild rice and cabbage (or the like).  adds great flavor and not too spicy anymore.

If you have had Indian food at an actual restaurant or at someones house, you may want to skip this.
These packets: Indian food :: velveeta: Vermont cheddar cheese
These packets: Indian food :: pop tarts: french bakery
These packets: Indian food :: 49c canned tuna: sashimi grade tuna
These packets: Indian food :: blow up doll ... well you get the idea

basically the same thing but not really

These are intended to be little lunches but I can't eat them by themselves.  They are basically ethnic mush in a bag and as some reviewers have said, very salty. If you have some rice or other food to pour this on top of, then they would be better.  Otherwise you have to pretend you are eating salty soup.

Summary: :-) Almost as good as an Indian Restaurant
Text: We live in a small town with no Indian restaurants.  This variety pack is excellent.  All we have to add is the basmati rice.  The spicing is excellent for a premade dish.  We keep these in stock just in case we need an Indian food fix.  The dish with red beans is best, but the variety is nice,

Summary: Pretty much all taste the same.
Text:
I've tried 4 out of the 6 packets.

The worst one was the Dal Bukhara. It was hard to get past the paste like consistency and the overwhelmingly bad taste of which I could only identify the butter ingredient with my tongue.

The Navratan Korma and Pav Bhaji taste about the same. Basically nothing like the dishes of the same name I've tried at home or at local Indian restaurants.

Pindi Chana was okay. I think Trader's Joe's version is better though.

I have yet to try the Rajma and Palak Paneer, which have gotten among the highest reviews on amazon, so that's why I err with a 2 star rating instead of just 1 star.

Summary: as good as packaged food goes
Text: This is about as good as a packaged Indian food can get. Has a slight processed taste, but still good.
Its a really good quantity and taste is good too, As far as 6.51$ for 6 pack, its not  a bad deal.

The dishes are very convenient, not doubt. However, I thought the taste was pretty middling at best. (Except the spinach with paneer...it was great!) Also, some of the dishes gave me heartburn.

Conclusion of my review: By the 6 pack of the spinach paneer dish. I do.

Summary: NO CURRY !!!  And you pay for packaging...
Text:
NO CURRY. These products contain "Red Chili Powder". And too much of it.

In addition, each package has over 30% sodium!

Each package arrives with a free CD promoting their mission. We now have 6 CD's of the same music!!

The portions are NOT as photographed. Maybe for two people, maybe. The "Spinach with Cottage Cheese" has 4 cubes among a small portion of spinach sauce. Not even worth the time to heat.

The flavor is good, with the above exceptions. And the ingredients tasted fresh. The packaging is prepared for NASA...(sealed in a silver pouch) so it makes one wonder how fresh indeed it is. And made us lose our appetite.

If you purchase this, you pay for the packaging. And a free CD.

Food is quite tasty, and preparation is very quick & convenient. Since they needs no refrigeration, they make good camping or MRE rations. The sampler pack is nice so you can try a variety of flavors. It is pretty salty, but since I don't have high blood pressure and enjoy savory foods, that didn't bother me. Free Indian music CD's were included with our sampler pack, which was a nice surprise. There are 5 different CD's in the " Colors of Indian Music" series.

Summary: Like a little piece of Mumbai...
Text:
Two thumbs waaaaaay UP! Like a trip to the moon on gossamer wings! A must have, must taste, must experience! Savor every bite...then go clean the plates (no fair stacking in the sink or dishwasher)! :)

A very tasty treat!!

The taste is ok. Of course can't taste like its from India restaurant.
I realize it's all vegetarian until I got the package, but I added meat when I cook it...

Summary: Good but has to be a hitch coming overseas without refrigeration!
Text: I've tried these before individually, but this was the first opportunity I had to get them together.  First, the food is relatively good quality for this kind of product, but I would say that it's more oily than what you'd find in a restaurant (and definitely moreso than homecooked) and of course significantly higher in sodium.  The taste, however, is reasonably good.  Second, the price that I paid for these was very good (I ended up getting a 20% discount), and so from a value perspective I would say decently good food + good price = very good value.

Greetings fellow amazonians I just love indian food! I have always said that if I had to go vegetarian I would move to india for all the great flavors that the put into their food. Being on the road so much has limited my availabity to great indian restaurant and when I saw this on amazon I thought wow I must have these. Well the shipment came quickly (as always) and I was excited to share these great flavors with my trailermates, mongo and eugene. Mongo was in (he always is when it invloves food), but eugene was going off to a local comic book show because he wanted to get an autograph from one of the original borgs from some star trek show. Anyhoo I decided to make mongo the pav bhaji and myself the palak paneer. I loved my and mongo had eatten his before I even sat down. He screamed "more! more!" And started to beat his head on the table so to stop him I quickly put together the pindi chana and he scarfed that down too. As I was cleaning up mongo started to hold his stomach and make gurgling sounds. He wheeled himself into the bathroom and for the next two hours I only heard what sounded like his intestines giveing up what ever that had stored in there. I actually left because my trailer started to smell too bad. While outside I realized that mongo had irritable bowel syndrome and the indian food must have. fired that up. Wow let me tell you I made sure to wait until eugene showed up to clean up the mess that mongo made before I reappeared. At least I had some good paneer tonight

If this is supposed to be Indian food, then I don't like Indian cuisine.  The curry vegetable tasted like canned vegetable soup with curry in it.  The spinach and cottage cheese looked so bad that my husband wouldn't even taste it.  It was like baby food spinach with chunks of tofu in it.  I ate it with lots of rice.  I don't even want to open the others.  No thanks to these.
can't recommend.  lacking in every way.  waste of money.  would only be worthwhile if the nearest indian restaurant is at least 100 miles away.

Summary: stuck in the smallest room in house for 6 hours
Text:
After eating this food,I was very ill. Having bought 2 six packs, I felt ill at ease about giving 10 dinners to the food bank.
This product is made in India.
http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B002GQ6OEM/ref=cm_cr_rev_prod_img

Summary: Horribly Obnoxious - Same Spices -Same gravy in almost all
Text: Horrible taste. All the packets tastes the same. Same gravy and same kind of spices in all the packets except the palak panner, which indeed does not have any taste to it.  Don't get it. Its not even worth buying even if u get 80% discount on the items. I would grade -5 on 10. When u eat u'll feel oh isnt that taste like the previous packet.

It is a fact that I am a dehydrating fan. My vegetable garden products are not only eaten fresh but I conserve them by canning and dehydrating on a regular basis. I was a bit hesitant to try food that someone else had dried until a friend introduced me to Harmony House dried foods. She is an avid backpacker and hiker and practically lives off dried food on her rambles. Once I had tried the dried tomato dices I was sold. This product is wonderful and has a rich very satisfying tomato taste without the aftertaste that some products have. It is pure nature in all its splendor. Since then I have added a number of Harmony House dried foods to my emergency stash and use them on a regular basis in soups, stews, breads, dips, etc. Take my word for it, you won't go wrong with this product. It makes you smile!

I like to add dried tomato bits to soups and stews and sauces, but I hate throwing away unused and rotten tomatoes. Solution: dried tomatoes. And these are good quality. They are just about the right size: too small and there would be little texture and too big and they probably wouldn't rehydrate well and would be chewy. These are just right and very convenient.

I just placed another order with Harmony House, and the tomato dices were in it. I throw these tomato pieces into everything I can for more flavor and nutrition. The pieces are small and rehydrate quickly, so it doesn't add extra cook time if you're just adding a little extra to your existing recipes.

The shipping cost is a little steep for ordering a single item since it is a USPS flat rate, so it's worth looking at the rest of the company site and adding more items to your order.

Summary: Not as flavorful as sun dried tomatoes
Text: I was a little disappointed in this product.  I do buy more and more dehydrated vegetables, finding them more flavorful than canned or freeze dried.  These tomatoes disappointed me.  If you cook them too long they lose their flavor.  But I have used sun dried tomatoes, several different brands, and I guess I expected their intense flavor. I plan to stick with sun dried from now on.
Chewy rather than crunchy, I found these great right out of the container and will also use them on salads and in nutrasystem lunch cups. Great for where you can't keep fresh food like at the office.

Diced tomatoes.

Harmony House is a family owned NC company.

This is a perfect product. You can use them
in anything--soups,salads,snacks etc.

I believe all the products are a little
pricey especially with the $7.95 shipping.

One you start using them you will find you
can not live with out them.

bbp okc ok 63 retired

V8 V-Fusion Raspberry Green Tea
If you don't mind artificial sweeteners, you might like this vegetable & fruit drink. I think it is a little too sweet, but it's a nice alternative to the water & flavored ice tea that I usually drink. Be sure to shake the can before drinking.

From the label:
V8-fusion, Vegetable & Fruit + Tea.
A raspberry flavored beverage blend of 8 vegetables & fruit juices from concentrate & other natural flavors & Green Tea extract.
50% juice contains no artificial color, flavors or preservatives.
This 8 oz. portion equals one combined serving of vegetables & fruit, providing 1/4 cup of vegetables & 1/4 cup of fruit.

Nutrition Facts:
1 8oz. can = 50 calories
0 Fat & Protein
60 mg sodium
200mg potassium
Total Carbs 13g
Sugars 10 g

Vit A 10%; Vit C 100%; Calcium 2%; Iron 2%; Vit E 10%

Ingredients:
Water, reconstituted vegetable juice blend (water & concentrate juices of sweet potato, purple carrots, yellow tomatoes, carrots), reconsituted fruit juice (water & concentrated juice of apples, red raspberries, acai, limes), contains less than 2% of natural flavoring, lemon juice concentrate, green tea extract, vitamin C, citric acid, sucralose, vitamin E.

Satisfaction is Guaranteed just call the number on the can with any questions or comments.

Buying the cans can be pricey. I pay $3.98 for 6 cans at my local shopping center.

Summary: One of the best Black Raspberry Jams/Preserves
Text: I have been searching for a really good black raspberry jam/preserves for a while and am finding it rather difficult because either they are SEEDLESS or running/syrupy and not thick with fruit.. This one so far from three others I have tried from Amazons offerings is the best of the bunch. It has lots of berries and it is farily thick not running and has a great taste. I still have a few others to try but so far this one is a good start.

This product is great for the price. My MAJOR complaint is that the packaging is really not up to par. The container is made of a flimsy cardboard with a paper like bottom. The container sides are actually "tucked" up under the bottom and not glued or secured in anyway, so what do you think happens? All of the bottoms collasp. I ordered this product without reading the reviews and I have just noticed that someone else reported having the same issue. I really do not like products that can be easily tampered with. And aside from that, the warehouse that they keep the items in more than likely has rodents and the last thing I want to think about is some rodent slithering its way into the bottom of the box or nibbling on the spillage outside of the container.

If this is how Quaker Oats packages them, than you would be better off finding them in your local market where you can at least inspect the bottom before purchasing. Imagine getting a shipment with four 42 oz boxes of oats spilling out of the containers; not great.
We have oatmeal almost every morning for breakfast so we go through a lot of it.  I appreciate being able to buy 4 boxes at a time and it's shipped quickly from Amazon.
This was great ordering 4 at a time. Really nothing bad to say about this product. It is just like you get at the store. I will order this again.

This is the first time I have purchased this product. It is excellent in taste, texture, and spreadability. I am glad Amazon has this now since the Betty Crocker one is not available here, it seems, any longer. This is just as good as that one was.

This is a nutritious snack that fits in your purse and can eat anywhere. The taste is delicious!
It's also gluten free!

I've replaced my obsession with candy and chocolate with Back to Nature snacks. They are awesome! The different blends always taste great together although be careful, cooked in oil and high fat on most of these. The higher protein and fiber content is what I needed for me and my daughter needed alternative protein sources as she is a vegetarian.

My local grocery store sells them @ $5.99 a piece so this special was great for a small stock up on these treats. Fabulous and much tastier and fresher than the average trail mix type blends you see everywhere.

I love this stuff.
Back to Nature is my new favorite brand for healthy and natural foods. My friend recommended I try one of their crackers and I was hooked.
This nut blend is delicious. I love the unique flavor combination of the sunflower seeds, apricots, and pecans. Why hasn't anyone else thought of these unique flavor combinations with higher quality ingredients at such a reasonable cost.
I used to go to Trader Joes for their nut blends but I hate waiting on their ridiculous lines during the weekend rush. Now I can skip the lines at TJs and order Back to Nature instead.

I add this to my morning hot cereal. Couldn't be a better way to start the day. It seems a little high except that I haven't been able to find it at any local stores.
So my theory is better to pay it than miss it. I've tried a lot that were less expensive but they were not as good.
The freshness and quality of this product is enough said to insure that you are purchasing a product of personal health.

This is the best commercially available beef jerky around. It's drier than most products out there (Pemican, Jack Daniels) and much more authentic. Sadly, it seems that Trader Joe's has stopped carying it and started using their own, inferior brand. Honestly, it'g going to reduce the number of trips I make to trader joe's by 1/2. Anyway, if you like authentic beef jerkey (like the kind you used to find in the glass jars at gas stations) this is the only brand for you!
I love this brand of beef jerky. It's healthy and great tasting snack. I buy snackmasters from gelson in Los angeles and its always fresh and great tasting!

Summary: Best beef jerky on the market!!
Text: I love this brand of beef jerky!! It's healthy, high in protein and has low saturated fat!! I always buy from gelsons and have never been disappointed.

I can't claim that this is the best tasting Jerky for anyone since everyone has their own opinion/tastes, but I am not afraid to admit that I buy beef Jerky anytime I see it within reach.

Been a huge fan of beef jerky since I was a little kid since I was on plenty of road trips from New Mexico to Colorado because of family. Jerky was the perfect snack. From 20 years ago to now, I always have had a passion for Jerky and never surprised by any Jerky until this came around.

Was only able to find this Jerky in my company's cafeteria. Then they stopped carrying it and immediately looked online to find it. Yes it might be expensive, but its totaly worth it. Even their customer service is great because one time I got a bad package from the cafeteria and reported it on their site. They ended up sending me 4 fresh packages (all different flavors) to make up for it.

This is worth a try if you want something new. Unfortunately I can't afford to get this all the time. Maybe its a good thing because I ordered 2 orders of the Jerky (24 packages) and went through it in 3 days.

I first tried this in CA. It was carried for a while in VA but was no longer carried a few years ago. I hope it continues to sell since it is by far the best beef jerky. It is high quality meat (not too soft, not to fatty) and has a nice flavor.
The jerky is good but the worcestershire sauce is a bit much, it dominates the flavor instead of complementing it.  If your like Worcestershire sauce a lot then you will love this jerky!
I like the Snackmasters Turkey Jerky much better.  The beef was pretty tough, though if you like beef jerky better than turkey it still is one of the few jerkys available that is nitrite free.

I discovered Snackmasters Beef Jerky almost 10 years ago at BJ's.  They stopped carrying it several years ago and now only stock Slim Jim and Pemmican.  I couldn't find Snackmasters anywhere and tried every other brand of jerky I could find - Jack Link's, Trader Joe's, anything I found.  Nothing compared.  Finally, for Christmas 2008, my wife got me a couple bags of Snackmasters straight from the company and I have to say, it's still the best.  It tastes like what I imagine jerky is supposed to taste like - seasoned, dried beef.  Everything else is soft and greasy; Snackmasters requires a lot of chewing and the flavor is perfect.  I'm glad Amazon is carrying it now.

Summary: best beef jerky i've ever had
Text: We bought the 2.5 oz "original" recipe package for $3.29 at Traders Joe's, and were pleasantly surprised how great tasting this beef jerky was - it's neither too dry nor too soft, it's just right texture. The spices used are very tasty and well balanced, and the outcome is a great tasting "gourmet" product, just like the label says. Lastly, no preservatives is used. Kids would love this product because of the texture and the taste.  This is a great food find and I'm buying more at Amazon to share.

The flavor is "O.K." Won't buy again! Very thin, and very tough! Can get any generic brand with this texture! Expected thick and soft from the description...NOT! Not worth the price at all! I eat a lot of jerkey for the low fat/high protein, but won't do this one again! Disappointed!

Jen
I agree with Michael Whitney from Seattle.  The beef jerky tasted ok but was tough as leather to chew on.  I won't be buying this brand of beef jerky again.

Summary: Great Sauce!  But a bit expensive
Text: I'm a lawyer, and got this as a gag gift.  Turns out that this is the most delicious hot sauce I've ever had.  Wonderful flavor.  I'd buy it all the time, but at $7 for a 6 oz. bottle, it's a bit high even at my billable hourly rate.

Summary: At only $100 per chew, totally worth it
Text: Hi-Chews are awesome.  My whole family fights over them and my wife has to hide them and get them out for rewards.  Like when the kids eat their veggies or when I (the husband) gets my lazy butt off the computer and spends time with everyone else.  For the low price of $1000, you can have these chews.  With roughly 10 in the box, that's only $100 per chew.  Totally worth it.

I had been looking for sorghum in Denver for quite a while.  I could not find it, so I looked on-line.  I took a chance and ordered it from Golden Barrel.  It turned out to be a great choice.  The taste is EXACTLY like I remembered at my Grandma's house.  She served it on toast, and I do the same.  It takes me back to a very cherished childhood experience.  This is a great source for a great product!

Summary: This is delicious cereal - great eaten as a snack without milk, or with milk.
Text: We love this cereal...but it is much cheaper when purchased directly from NaturesPath.com - the shipping cost here is outrageous.

Basically, the taste of this cereal is remarkably like Grape Nuts (which I have and still do like also). The difference is there's no risk of an emergency dental call with the Ezekiel cereal, which is not nearly as hard as Grape Nuts. Ezekiel will also satisfy those who mandate organic ingredients, etc.

Sprouted grain products are truly tasty and deserve to be more familiar to more people. They put refined grains (i. e., white flour) to shame nutritionally and unsprouted whole grains (i. e., whole wheat) to shame in terms of taste/texture. It's more expensive, but buy a box to sample first and then buy bulk afterwards, as I have.

Amaranth cereal has a very positive effect on me. One bowl of delicious amaranth a day, with rice milk and sliced banana - that's my recipe for good health and (regular) digestion. Amaranth flakes are delicious, too. The nuggets (discontinued many years ago) were even tastier. If you're looking for something good to eat, something that's not going to upset your stomach, something that you're going to look forward to eating every day, give amaranth products a try. You'll soon discover why it's called "the mystical grain of the Aztecs."

This is an aggravating cereal to love. The flakes have a great flavor, do not get soggy in milk and the stuff is nutritious. We eat it every day.

The aggravating part is that only 'health food' stores in Chicago carry it though the manufacturer swears we can get it in the two major chains here - Dominick's (Safeway) and Jewel (Albertson's). Neither grocery ever has it on their shelves, however. The truly aggravating part is that after two years of reliable availability from Amazon it disappeared from the website! The 16 oz. box size has re-appeared and can be ordered through Amazon from another vendor (at twice the price). I am thrilled beyond words that the 12.5 oz. size has become available directly from Amazon. Hopefully it remain indefinitely.

I used to order this cerial by the case and eat it every day.  When my most recent order arrived, they had changed the recipe.  The cerial is now terrible.  It is too sweet and tastes like molasses.  Definitely not recommended.

LOVE THIS! Great cereal! My mom and I were lookin for an organic whole grain cereal due to her being anemic ( low iron ) and I ran across this in one of my other quests for stuff! We received it on time at a very decent price for whats in it. I let my mom try it and wallaw! she loved it and I tryed it and I do too! We love all the great healthy ingrediants in here lots of Iron more than wheat. It really delivers what it say's and it tastes wonderfull.

So enjoy!

The original Health Valley Amaranth Flakes was an excellent product.  For some reason the product was "upgraded" to "sprouted" and whatever else.  The result is poorer taste and consistency.  I would advise return to the original.  We will not buy the current version.

This new formulation is absolutely inedible! hard as rocks and just as tasteless don't order these!!!
tastes like they used wet newspaper and sand to make the flakes

One of the main reasons I like this cereal is that it stays crunchy even after pouring on milk.  Most cereals immediately turn to mush but this one stays crispy long enough to finish the bowl if you pour in the milk just before eating it.  The manufacturer changed the formula for this product earlier this year (2012) and I took off one star because the new formula is not as tasty as before.  Still better than anything else I've tried though. Being able to buy it on Amazon with free shipping makes it less expensive than buying locally IF you can even find it!

My family has long loved this cereal but had to search for it constantly. The few places that sold it were always out. By chance I looked on line and was pleased to find it.  After happily receiving it a couple months the next batch came in "new and improved"!  Bummer!!! We loved the old and just right!  Almost cancelled but the new grew on us.  The flakes are harder than the old ones which we don't like and although it says less sugar it seems sweeter which it didn't need.  Prefer the former product but it is still one of our favorites and we will continue to buy it.
I only wish they made a version of this product that had everything the same except having no sweatener. In any case, I like to munch on the little flakes, one at a time, like tiny crackers.

This is a great alternative to eating cereals that contain wheat.  Amaranth is one of the few grains that has not been tainted by being genetically modified!  Eat this delicious cereal with the confidence that you are putting something wholesome in your body!

I originally found Amaranth Flakes at our local Trader Joes and at a couple other local stores. It fit into my Weight Watchers Program perfectly. High fiber, low fat, low points, and tastes great! It became unavailable locally and I was thrilled to find it on Amazon.  I now am on automatic delivery, which lowers the cost.  It's the only cereal in my house now.

When I came across this photo, I was highly disappointed. The set of 9 seasonings should be just $9.00, not $31.56. I've gone to the 99 cent store plenty of times and have seen these spices in their store for a dollar each. Total RIP OFF!
This is a delicious tasting hot cocoa mix.  It's free of trans fatty acids and my family enjoys it.  It's creamy enough for me, but maybe not for someone else.  All I can say is that I like it.

Summary: Is it sweet?  Is it spicy?  Is it salty?
Text: No, it's AMAZING!  The only candy that can deliver a sweet, spicy, and salty treat all in one.  It's got a blended texture of soft and chewy, with a little grittyness to keep you off balance.  Oh yeah, and it's super cheap to boot!!  So stop wasting time with "candy bars" and grab some Pulparindo!
Excellent purchase.  I just can't get this awesome Mexican candy in Virginia!  The candy arrived quickly, and was fresh and tasty.  Highly recommeded!

When I was little, I had no idea how to say these things. "Pul, Pulpo, pu pu..." So i just call them poo poo candy and how fitting the moniker. Looks like poo poo, but tastes like God's breast milk (i would imagine that's what it would taste like) and also gives you the runs after over consumption. These are good, if you need to try exotic stuff this year, put this on your list.

Summary: NOM NOM NOM! I love these pulp candies!
Text:
I must say I am totally enthralled with these candies. I originally purchased the "plain" tamarindo strips as well as these and found that these were not only fresher, but they had a distinct spicy bite to them that made them more enjoyable and tasty than the regular tamarindo strips.

Additionally, these didn't have the annoying corn-starch covering that is found on the plain candy, that is replaced instead with a nice layer of delicious chili powder!

I grew up in San Diego so needless to say, I ate a lot of Mexican candy growing up-- usually obtained from the Ice Cream Man.  Although I can't say Pulparindo is my favorite, I certainly revitalized my love for Mexican candy!

I was so happy to hear that my daughter and son in law overseas got their candies sooner that we expected. specially on Christmas Holiday. Candies where delicious. My son in law said. Thank you all who made it possible.....God Bless you.
Sincerely your, Ms. Esquivel

This is the best candy ever. I wish they had subscribe and save. The mixture of sweet, sour, salty and spicy is perfecto!
I'll be ordering more for sure.

*Updated on December 08, 2011*
I still LOVE Pulparindo Extra Hot but be warned it's ADDICTIVE. It's DELICIOUS and no matter how much you eat you won't get full. If you're trying to lose weight you may want to skip this.

A co worker of mines has been eating this at work. Tried it and boy was it tasty. Not for everyone, but if you like candy that's sweet, sour, and salty, give this a try.

Great price!! I see these 2 for a dollar at liquor stores..

I have purchased a number of different food gift baskets over the years online, and its always a little difficult to determine which one to get. You have to carefully read the content descriptions, as some baskets have a lot of "filler" items. This makes it appear that you are getting a lot of food, but its crackers and condiments. My father liked this basket, he said the salami and other things were of good quality, so I would recommend it to others.
I would really like to see more food gift baskets that were filled with more "hard" food items like meat & cheese and less "fluff"

Received this for Fathers Day and found the basket contained mostly stuffing and over-sized boxes. The very decorative box of Angilina's "Sweet Butter Cookies" looked like it could hold 6-8 ozs.of cookies. Inside there were 2.2 ozs of tiny ordinary cookies laden with palm oil and made in Indonesia. The 2 oz."California Pantry" gourmet water crackers were edible with the Wisconsin cheese but had a lot of trans-fat and were made in Hong Kong. The 4 oz. "Focaccia Crisps Tuscan Style Crackers" were ho-hum, slightly not-crisp crackers, made with palm oil in Indonesia. A 2oz. slice of "Italian Rasperry Cake" was dry. The most weight in the basket came from the 3.75 oz. pack of cheese, the 5 oz beef salami and a small jar of mustard. All 3 were ok, but at what price?

Sent this to my dad for Father's Day and got a note a few days later saying, "some of the items in it were pretty tastless. The formaggio e vino had no trace of vino whatsoever. Some of the cookies and crackers had no taste to speak of and were only useful to scoop up the formaggio which wasn't remarkable. Whoever sold this to you may want to rethink their source. The basket is nice, however!"

So much for a nice Father's day gift!

Summary: Anyone want to give a stale food basket?
Text: I purchased this for my sister for Christmas, because she loves receiving food and gourmet baskets. This was my first order from this company. My sister said it was mostly filled with "fluff," and most of the products were stale. I would like to get a refund on this gift or send her a new one. She said she didn't want to hurt my feelings, but she thought I would want to know. Nice basket, sis but almost everything was stale. Could this be last year's left overs? I would not reccommend this product. I give it an F for fraud advertising!

I just received this "Grand Edition Gourmet" food basket for Christmas, and am totally disappointed. For all the goodies found inside, I can purchase all of them at a supermarket for less than $10, and better quality ones too! The most ridiculous is the "White Chocolate Amaretto" wafer cookie, which sure enough contain only one 2 1/2" thin wafer cookie! Then the Cajun Mustard is of size where the restaurant would just give it to you when you order a sandwich. The "Sweet Butter Cookies" packed in Indonesia is of unknown origin and contains ten one-inch size of very ordinary Danish butter cookies. The "Double Chocolate Raspberry Cake" comes in a big flat box, but the cake is only a quarter of the box size, and no bigger than a regular piece of brownie. Other items also come in such small quantity that will amaze you! Something does come in sizable quantity: paper stuffing! The only good that comes out of this gift is the heartfelt thoughtfulness of the sender. Anything more than 1 star given is so that the sender will not feel that their money is being ripped off!

While the thought may be nice, the foods in this basket are food products and have more preservatives than nutritional value.  Save your money and appreciation and get something else.  If someone really appreciates gourmet or specialty foods, they will be horrified.

A complete waste. Cost was $51.98 ($65.51 with shipping). Contents were probably worth 10 bucks at most and mostly tasteless. My dog didn't want it. Biggest rip-off I've encountered in a long time. I should have taken my wife out for a nice steak dinner.

Summary: major disappointment with product, exceptional service from Amazon
Text: this product is not worth the price. Major disappointment when I opened the box.  This was supposed to be a gift for my mother, I could never give this to anyone.  When I spoke with Amazon customer service they gave me 100% customer satisfaction. Amazon is the best to deal with.
The grand edition food basket was delightfully received and very much enjoyed. Good choice for a gift anytime of year.

I totally loved the contents. However, it looked nothing like the picture. The contents were very yummy and were a hit amoung my husband and I and our friend. We all enjoyed it very much. I would order it again if I could. Nothing was stale, it was all very nice and fresh and I loved my godiva chocolate. I am a Godiva hound so it really pleased me that there was some in there. I get what people say about the "fluff" but to be honest, there really wasn't that much "fluff" in the thing. It was pretty much full of everything that it said. Minus the wafer and a few other things. But those were replaced by really good stuff. So all in all we were very happy with this as a gift.

Thank you!

The Art of Appreciation Grand Edition was a FLOP!  I sent it to my brother for Christmas.  He told me it looked wonderful but there was VERY little there to eat! His wife ate the ONE cookie, they each got ONE truffle.  It was all pretty package and no goodies.  I feel so badly I am going to send them a restraurant gift card!
My family was very happy with the variety of quality products. A tasty selection for the savory or sweet tooth with a nice basket & bow to keep. A beautiful composition for a great price.
I dug in to this basket and found great things. A thank you for a referal for a friend. He got the job and I got the best gift basket a guy can get!!
This was the perfect cheer up gift for some recovering from surgery!8.  He ate and enjoyed all the goodies!  Great choice

This Art of Appreciation Grand Edition Gourmet Food & Snacks Gift Basket contains all the perfect, high dollar fancy foods for us sophisticated folks!  If you were to not even give it a second look, you'd never even guess that it's actually *food*- that's how deceiving and beautiful these boxes appear while sitting in the basket.  Do try the cookies- they're the best!

Some friends in the States were going through a difficult time and I wanted to do something to help. Being able to select a basket of goodies via Amazon was a wonderful answer to my problem. It was delivered ahead of time and all the family found something to enjoy in it. I was described as Mrs Anonymous as I hadn't worked out how to include a gift card. My friends were perplexed but it all added to their enjoyment.

Summary: Sister was suprised:  Great tasting product.
Text: This was a gift for my sister.  It arrived on time and in excellent shape.  Food products were still in good arrangement with no damage.  The food products were good quality.  She was very happy with the gift.

This was very nice in the pic which is why I picked this.. I sent out two actually...well the gift is much smaller then it shows and the gift wrap had a blue wrinkled bag with the brown amazon box inside..it showed on the gift wrap option that they were wrapped individually which was absolutely not the case..it was stupid to pay to have them wrapped...I am very disappointed in this and wish I didn't send it let alone 2 of them..

We were so excited when receiving this gift, it was very pretty, However, once into the basket it was terribly disappointing. Very little of anything, mostly crackers, and nothing was even tasty. I definatley didn't tell my daughter how disappointing the basket was, didn't want to hurt her feelings, I thought the salmon would be tasty, however, it had absolutley no taste to it. very bland. It was full of I will say, empty boxes, and definately was not worth the money, I would be afraid to order anything from this company, and I think you should know Amazon.
The biggest joke of all was the delightful raspberry cake, what a joke. I'm still laughing at this one.
Art of Appreciation is a fitting title for this basket. On 2 occasions I have sent this basket to my Mother & she has been fully delighted with all the goodies. The value seems to be on target :)
Nice selection of items in the basket and the price is reasonable.  Certainly it would make a welcome gift if you are in the market for such an item.
