Summary: Easter gift for daughter and family
Text: I was very disappointed that my Easter message was never included in the basket when it was delivered so my daughter had absolutely no idea who sent it.  Also, the chocolate raspberry cake was just a bunch of crumbles when they opened it which means it was probably stale instead of holding together as it should.  I will not use this product again.

Summary: Christmas present for our adult kids from Amazon.com
Text:
Our adult kids and our grandkids really enjoyed this gift - reported back that it was the best one they'd ever received on a mail-order type. We were pleased that they responded so pleasantly, and will keep this in mind when ordering items for out-of-town gifts in the future.

And,since we had ordered this same gift for other grown kids, we do feel confident that most anything ordered from Amazon.com would be great! Thank you so much.

This turned out to be an excellent purchase. The Brie was tasty,cookies,crackers and meat were also fine.
I also like the quality of the basket. The wrapping of the basket was not so appealing,but all in all,this was a good buy.

I bought this as a gift so I don't know how the stuff tastes,
but there's a good variety of stuff and it looks nice and spiffy.
It's not as big as I thought yet not that small either.
Basket is Sturdy and it's shrinkwrapped nicely so it's a plus.
My recipient said "WOW" when he saw it.
I give it 3.5 Stars so yes go buy it if there's no other baskets.

I had this Gift Basket sent to my Daughter and Son In Law for their anniversary. The order arrived very fast And I was Amazed on how many products was in this basket. I will order again from this Company.
Although everything in basket was really tasty all products were very small in portion and very expensive.  Would not recommend.
Sent this as a holiday gift to out of state relatives.  They said basket/presentation was nice but the different food items didn't have a large number of pieces per package.

... IF this were not at a reduced price and was eligible for free shipping, I wouldn't have even tried it. I liked that it didn't have MSG and didn't use pork as seasoning. My family is adding more vegetables to our diet as we are "eating better to live better". There was an unnatural sweet taste such that I was expecting to find Sweet Potatoes somewhere, a very unsettling feeling for me. Didn't know if this batch was inadvertantly prepared with their Sweet Potatoe product. We don't like products with hidden sugar.* (*As the commenter noted sugar IS listed in the ingredients. I should have said "unexpected sweet taste". Truthfully I was expecting similar seasoning as in Sylvia's Collard greens.)

I've never been to Sylvia's Restaurants so I don't really know if this is how it's supposed to taste. I won't order this again.

OK - So I admit, I bought this for the possibility to lose weight with zero effort. I am not overweight at all but have ZERO muscle and a few curves I am not proud of. Anyway, my hopes were low but I figured I would have a healthy caffeinated tea in the long-run. So I have been drinking it for 2-3 weeks now and I don't think the scale is lying but I have lost about 5 lbs. Now, I understand that many factors could have caused this but I am pretty sure my eating habits have stayed the same. I still don't drink coffee or soda and I definitely don't exercise. I have not been drinking as much alcohol as I was during Football season so I know that might be a factor.

Bottom line is that I know anything could have caused the weight loss but the only thing that I have done drastically different is drink 1-2 cups of this tea per day. It tastes great (hot not cold or warm), gives me a healthy pep and focus, and I have not seen the scale consistently this low in a couple of years. Not to mention is comes nicely packaged. You can't go wrong here and I highly recommend it.
Good price and great taste. You can tell it is organic and of good quality. I will definitely buy it again and probably even try the white tea as well.
this tea helps me not to snack at work during the day, no chips, cookies, etc, drink this tea straight , no sugar, no cream and it helps slim your waistline, love this tea, this is my 3rd box !

Summary: Great tea once you acquire the taste for it
Text: One review said this tea tasted like dirt which, in all respect, tastes more like grass that has been in dirt.  As funny as that review was, Oolong tea is an acquired taste much like coffee or other teas.  Once you've acquired the taste, it's actually one of the better oolong teas I've tasted and probably one of the most genuine.  You get 100 bags for under $10; you can't beat that.

This is the best oolong tea i ever drank. There might be better ones out there, though to me this is the best. I keep it in for more than 5 minutes too, still it never gets bitter. It is a great taste that makes me feel like drinking it many times a day ! very good purchase.

I always enjoy Oolong Tea when we go to Chinese restaurants, maybe 3 teapots full each time between my wife and I. This tea offers all I enjoy in the tea + Organic & each teabag is individually wrapped. A Great Purchase on my part.

For those who are looking for a good Oolong tea, I think this one is truly good and ideal. It is perfect for the quality and the price, and also for the GREAT material that is used for making the teas' bags. Oolong tea is the best tea for our health, and this one is worth every penny.

You can find this tea for just over $5.00 in many Asian food markets.  It is well worth the cost.  This is a great tasting tea.  I have had some oolong/wulong teas that tasted like steeped twigs.  This is not one of them.  If you steep this tea for less than 3 minutes, you can still get a good tasting cup of tea from a second brewing with the same tea bag.  If you don't microwave (or boil) your tea water with the tea bag in it, you can even get a pretty decent third cup of tea!  You'll find that when you are brewing a pot of tea for yourself & friends, you will only need 1 or 2 bags to make a whole pot!

Summary: Delicious tea at a great price
Text:
I found this tea at my health food store about a year ago. I bought it to make kombucha but I enjoy drinking it as well. I recently looked for it at the store and it was missing. I'm glad I found it at Amazon. The price is close to what I paid at the store.

I have tried many different oolongs from an online tea company. This tea is characteristic of the biscuity quality found in many oolongs. It isn't astringent. Sweetener is not needed. It is a very good tea for every day.

This is one of the best teas I have had.  I have tried a variety of Oolong teas, and this is by far the best flavored Oolong tea I have had.  It is rich without being strong, and smooth.  Add a bit of skim milk or soy milk to give it just a touch of sweetness.  The Prince of Peace Organic White Tea is also a superior tea.  These are sold at reasonable prices.

I'm not a huge tea drinker (coffee every day) but I do enjoy black tea, Earl Grey, and Chai tea. This tea is nice addition. I bought it because I'd heard good things about it including Dr. Oz recommending it. At that point it was a question of which of the many oolongs on Amazon do I buy. I bought three. They are all very similar in flavor, require a touch of sweetener for my tastes but are very good. They are all a bit subdued in flavor with this one being the lightest. I've never had oolong tea in a restaurant so I can't compare to that but I didn't find it to taste like dirt.

Summary: Addictive Oolong that doesn't break the bank
Text: Prince of Peace has hit it out of the ballpark with this economical organic Fujian Oolong tea in unbleached bags.  This is consumed throughout the day in my home and we are not in the least bit jittery as often happens with the semi-fermented type of tea that nears black in its caffeine content.  Amazon offers the best price so far and we highly recommend the Prince of Peace Organic Oolong in the 100 count box!
Great tea. Hard to find in stores. Or if you do find it,it's in smaller quantities & much more expensive.

Ordered for a friend.  The Friend in question is not a tea drinker but he does oddly enough love a good cup of Oolong tea every now and again.  He raves about how great this Tea is, not one to drink tea myself, but I'm glad he enjoys it.

I'm not much of a tea connoisseur and I had never tried Oolong before, but I really like this stuff.  Basically, if you like the tea that most Chinese restaurants serve, you'll like this.  I was surprised when I made that connection.

My doctor recommended that I drink oolong tea with buckwheat honey twice a day to soothe coughs.  This tea is excellent, packaged nicely and reasonably priced.  I plan to buy all the tea I use from this vendor.

I purchased this tea a few months ago, and have been loving the flavor of it. However, of the 40 tea bags I've used, 4 have not been completely sealed along the side of the tea bag, causing tea to spill everywhere when I open the package or to leak pieces of tea leaves into my cup. With the price and taste, the tea's certainly still worth it, but you may need to be careful when you open the individual tea bags!

I bought this tea after reading the splendid reviews.. and EVERY 5 STAR review was absolutely on the spot! :) I love oolong especially this one because there is no awful aftertaste, just clean tea! It is just as great as the loose tea leaves but in a more convenient package. Ohh I am in love I drink 3 to 4 cups every day. Love love love :)

Looking for great tasting chinese restaurant quality tea? This is it. I searched everywhere and this is the best I have found.
It is also the best price and of course that is what I have come to expect from Amazon.Also the fastest delivery.

Uh, this tea takes some getting used to.
At first I was a little disappointed in the taste but it does grow on you.
It has an 'EARTHY' taste and that's just the nicest word I could come up with to replace the word DIRT. It actually tastes like dirt.
(I guess what I mean is that it TASTES the way dirt SMELLS.)

Except for the dirt that I've actually eaten and it does taste a lot like that.
Nah, it just needs something.
Like honey or some other sweetener and then it's pretty good.
Then it tastes like SWEET dirt.
I swear I'm not trying to be funny. It's just an interesting flavor.
I have steeped it several different ways (sometimes with another flavor of tea) for variety.
Like I said, now that I'm 'used' to it, it's actually pretty good. But my senses always take me directly to DIRT when I take that first sip.

Enjoy! :)

I love this tea, it is awesome. I actually was sick and the only tea I had in my house was green and oolong tea. I decided to take the oolong tea and I was shocked that I was feeling better internally and externally, my clothes was fitting me differently. My appetite was curbed alot. I hardly was hungry. I honestly drink 4-6 cups of this tea a day and still drinking it till this day. I haven't hopped on the scale yet I am going to wait until next month to see how much weight I have lost. Since my cold is over with I will start back going to my Zumba classes this week and I am pretty sure the results will be more outstanding. And of course eating clean that is the most important factor when losing weight. So I decided to have 2 cups of oolong tea before each meal. I will have oolong tea in my diet forever. It is a must especially if you want to lose weight and don't forget the fabulous health factors also.

Yes it is a little "earthy" (not like dirt as another review) but I like it.  It's very refreshing, and works wells to take off excess water weight.  I do not know if it helps burn fat, but that's not why I drink it.  I drink it because it tastes good.
Best flavor. I got all my friends hook up on this tea. Plus, is healthy. What else do you want from a tea?
I just fell in love with Oolong tea.....the service is great too!  I have been drinking this tea for about a year now, and could not ask for any better service.

I love Oolong tea, and have had the pleasure of drinking a great quality loose leaf Velvet Oolong. I was a bit apprehensive about ordering Oolong tea bags for that reason. The pricing on this product was too good to pass up, so I thought I would give it a try. It is not bad at all. The aroma is not as rich as a good loose leaf tea, but this tea is very flavorful. Quite delicious actually.

One tea bag provided several cups of good rich tea.

I am very happy with my order, and I would highly recommend if you are looking for an Oolong bagged tea.

Thank You!

I was expecting this tea to have somewhat of a bitter taste to it just because of its name.  Boy was I WRONG!!!  This tea can easily be consumed with or without sugar.  I prefer it without sugar, but when I want a sweet taste to it, I'll just add one packet of Sweet & Low.  My energy picks up in about 30 minutes (after drinking the cup of tea) and lasts for approximately 2 hours!!!  You can't beat that at all!!!  Doesn't give me the caffiene jitters that my coffee does.  Now I just substitute one cup of coffee for one cup of Oolong Tea!!!

Tea is ok. I expected it to be nasty (earthy) but it was fine. I usually pair it with other teas (rose hips/hibiscus blend, chamomile, mullein leaf, etc, not all at once). Even alone, it's an amber color, not golden imo. I would purchase again, received 100 bags for just over $4.

Summary: Great Organic Tea at a Great Price!
Text: I bought this tea to use when brewing my own kombucha. The tea is great quality and tastes great too. My kombucha loves it as well! The price can't be beat for a quality organic tea.

This review is for PoP Oolong tea bags. My tea background was first drinking Indian milk tea using black loose tea, milk, spices, and sugar. I added far-Eastern teas (non-milk varieties) in my search for a quicker tea to brew (milk tea needs more time to prepare). I am on my 3rd box of PoP Oolong tea. The tea is not like black or green teas. Be prepared for a bitter taste but with a sweeter aftertaste. Like black teas, this produces some kind of coating feeling on the tongue, almost similar to eating an unripened banana. It is somewhat woody in taste and smell (maybe a bit flowery. It may also be slightly sour, but less than some green teas. I have tried whole leaf oolong from a Chinese shop and that was more like green tea. If you can afford more expensive oolong teas, then you might get better quality. For the price, you're getting a good deal. I also think that the batches vary so sometimes you might get a stronger, bitter flavor but if you experiment with the brewing, you might get your desired flavor.

To brew this PoP Oolong tea, realize that ground tea in bags will release their flavors much faster. My solution is to boil some filtered water. After bringing to a boil, I turn off the stove and add 1 cup (237 mL) hot water to the tea bag. Then wait ~30 seconds (or golden brown color appears)and remove the bag. The first cup usually extracts most of the caffeine and is the most bitter and strong taste. Now I can brew with another cup of the hot water. I can brew around 4 cups with the colors being golden brown, golden, light green, and very light green. It is best to brew by the color and not the time. If you leave the bag in too long, it will be terribly bitter.

Tea brewing is an art and science, as many other things in life are. Please refer to the science of solvent extraction for a better idea. Basically, you are extracting the tea's aromatic compounds into the water. The flavor of the brew are mainly affected by water quality, extraction time (the time in water), and water temperature. You have to experiment with this for your preferred flavor. Sugar is absolutely not necessary, if prepared correctly.

I live in a remote area and my local grocers stopped selling chinese resteraunt tea. I had been looking for a while, then I read online that oolong tea is supposed to help with weight loss. I cannot vouch for this but it does speed up the metabolism, and tastes just like the tea from a chinese food place that you love, so you can have some with your delivery food or p.f. changs from the freezer, delish

ProfileName: Adam A. Wanderer "Reality is what you stumble...
Summary: A good product, would've been five stars if it was loose leaf.
Text: A good tasting tea.  The only objection is the use of tea bags instead of being loose leaf.  I can recommend it.
This tea is very good. A cup in the morning and one after lunch will get you moving. Enjoy It!

For someone who generally finds green and white tea mostly uninspiring this provides and interesting change of pace.  I drink green and white tea for the antioxidants and not the taste.  I think I would still pretty much put this Oolong in that category but admittedly I simply am a coffee and black tea drinker.  It is a good, interesting product and I may have under rated it because of personal preference.
I am enjoying relaxing with my Oolong tea.  It is very smooth and has a wonderful flavor.  Prince of Peace is the best.

I have tasted both Green and Oolong Prince of Peace teas.Both are clean,non-dusty , teas that our Asian restaurants in the Montgomery area favor.The oolong is a very light Black tea. I often blend it with another Black tea to give it more of a traditional souther tea flavor because I drink it cold . Oolong is supposed to have more anti-oxidants, however I prefer the stronger flavor of Black teas like Ahmad Engligh #1, Tazo Awake, and Twinnings Breakfast teas. These all blend nicely with the Oolong , and I get the best of each ...ch
Great tea...tastes fresh and I like that each bag is indivially wrapped.  Super buy!  This tea is good alone or with a meal.  I would recommend to others.
Great value for a organic oolong tea.  This is a smooth and mellow tea that is wonderful whether served hot or iced.

Summary: Tasty tea is a delightful bargain
Text: The tea tastes great and the giant box is a bargain compared to the over priced smaller boxes in grocery stores.

Product came exactly as described.  100 - individually packaged 2g bags of organic oolong tea.  Cannot beat for the price.  shipped quickly, great taste, even better price.  I am a satisfied customer, looking forward to buying again, but may take a while to go through 100 tea bags! great product

This is one of the best teas I've ever had. It is perfect by itself - does not require any sugar, honey, milk, apples, or pvc. I am no expert on Oolong teas, but this has a very earthy flavor that is terribly pleasant. Very recommended!
This tea can taste good with or without sugar. You can taste the quality of the tea, I have purchased this tea a few times. I love this tea!
I have really enjoyed drinking Oolong Tea, but I found this Tea at my local Chinese Market for half the price. Everyone I have ever shared this Tea with has fallen in love with it as well.

This tea has a really bad taste to it, bought it for weight loss, it didn't help. had all the other teas dr oz recommended too. no weight loss, in fact i think i gained weight while drinking teas all through the day as suggested by dr oz. but you have to remember that caffeine makes your pancreas put out more insulin which in turn makes you hungry :(
There were some issues with the initial order, but it has been resolved.  This product is important to my health and am glad to finally receive it.  This tea is good for my blood pressure and energy.

I received expedient service for this product, in addition to finding a tea th
at is good and beneficial to me health.

I was so immensly disappointed.  I was hoping to get the same tea that they serve in the chinese restaurants and kept being told that it was oolong tea.  I finally found it on Amazon and to my disappointment it did NOT taste the same!  Actually it was a bit bitter and now I have all of this tea I know it will take me forever to drink because of the flavor..  Was not happy..  :(

If you are looking for a cup of tea with no real flavor, please buy this. I am an avid tea drinker; Oolong tea has a pleasant aroma of oriental spices and good flavor that dosent require added sweeteners. If you enjoy a good cup of tea, this is not the product. This tea seems like a combination of cheap teas, none with a hint of oolong. The tea even gave me a headache! The price of Oolong tea usually ranges between $5.00 to $7.00 for 20 tea bags depending on geographical area of the country. I should have known that $4.95 was too good to be true. They wont go to waste; tea bags are great for soaking tired aching feet after a run or treating foot fungus.  Certainly not organic!
i have not gotten my order or heard anything from the seller even after sending out 2 emails

Came about a week later, when I opened the package I noticed they squeezed the boxes of corn pops in (was kinda hard to pull out) so the edges of the cereal boxes was bent and wouldn't stand up straight on the counter but the cereal was fresh.

I just love Coffee Bean direct. They have some very fresh coffee and its such an amazing deal. Grocery store coffee has been sitting there for how long? And the gourmet ones sit out in their bulk display in the air ... it gets stale.

This stuff is amazing. I store it in double sealed freezer zip lock bags (Do not store in the freezer) and it stays so fresh and good, I will keep buying my coffee from Coffee bean direct. I get it on amazon because it comes to cheaper then their website though.

Breakfast blend was a good blend. Very much enjoyed.
You can't beat the quality of the coffee for the price. I froze the beans and ground them as needed. Makes wonderful coffee for a great price.

This coffee won a taste test,at our office, against Dunkin Donuts, Starbucks, etc. Easy on the pocket book and has a great taste...even better when you buy through Amazon and have it automatically shipped to your home! Coffee Bean Direct Breakfast Blend, Whole Bean Coffee, 5-Pound Bag

I purchased Coffee Bean Direct Breakfast Blend in the 5 lb. bag to serve at our bed and breakfast. It has been well accepted. It is a light roast coffee perfect for breakfast and I will be ordering it again.

We are on the auto ship with this product and just love it!  The coffee is very good for the price.  We can't get coffee like this in our small town, and what we do get is very expensive.  I would recommend this product to anyone.
This was a good blend.  It made a decent cup of morning coffee.  I like the Sumatran and Brazilian Santos better.
I bought this tea for my mom for her birthday, and everyone in the family loves it. This is excellent chai tea.

I bought this based on other reviews here, and agree that this is the best chai blend I've tasted. Only home-made is better. The spices are fresh, the tea is bold and flavorful, and tastes great plain as well as in traditional chai fashion, with milk and sugar.

This is hands down the best chai blend I've ever tasted.  The black tea is excellent quality and the spices are very well balanced.  It's good plain or with milk.  (Sorry to all those of you who sweeten your chai - I don't, so I can't comment.)

ProfileName: Bryan M. Griffith "A business litigation atto...
Text:
This is an excellent chai tea! My other favorite chai teas are Stash Double Spice and Mighty Leaf Chai.

The Mountain High Chai is a little sweeter than some and extremely smooth. I am very pleased.

I would have given 5 stars to the original (Made in Ceylon). Those were very refreshing, had taste and texture to it. But the once I got in mail second time around are not any thing like original. On the box it says "Bold New Taste" but inside they have removed all the herbs from the tea bag and filled with some cheap loose black tea. Yikes....
This tea is great. I do not consider it the best though.  Actually this Chai is too expensive and will never be as good as NUMI Golden Chai or Seven Spice Chai.

Summary: did not have the original strength I was looking for
Text: I bought a 15 count box initially and it was perfect. the 100m count box is somehow light, and not giving the original taste.

This stuff is pretty good and I'm not even really a tea drinker. It has a great smell and is not too strong of a flavor. My wife absolutely loves it. I bought it in a store once and could never find it again so I was happy to find it on Amazon, and at a much lower price.

I drink a lot of chai, and while I switch between a few brands for variety, this one is definitely my favorite. Delicate balance of spices with notes of clove, this is a great tea if you like subtle flavor. Good with or without soy milk or milk, flavorful enough to stand alone without much sweetner, if any. The price in amazon is very good, much cheaper than what I pay buying individual boxes at my local market.

I saw this Chai Tea when I was shopping here for the Tazo Chai Tea. I read the 3 reviews which all gave 5 stars so decided to give it a try. I have to say I am totally disappointed.

No real flavor what so ever. I was expecting a Chai Tea with a little bit of bite and I got quite a bit of nothing. The description written up by the manufacture made the tea sound wonderful. Again the 5 stars by the reviews sold me, the taste did not.

I would never recommend this tea to anyone, and as for me I'm sticking with Tazo.

I ordered 2 Reverse Variegated Spider Plants on May 5, 2012 and they arrived four days later on May 9, in 4" round plastic pots. Plants were packaged with recyclable peanuts.

The plants look the same as pictured on the internet with green leaves and white edgings on both sides. One plant has two inflorescenses (stems or branches) and the other has three inflorescenses. The plants are small to medium sized. Both have healthy and thick roots throughout the bottom, with one having roots poking through the holes so I put both into larger pots for continued growth. Overall, they are very nice looking and healthy plants and I am very happy with them.

July 13, 2012 Update

As usual with Spider Plants, these are growing fast. They just need some sun and water. On July 11, I split one into three plants.

October 1, 2012

All Spider Plants are doing great. They are very easy to grow. Today, I gave away a baby I rooted.

Flavigny was the town, I think, where they filmed "Chocolat." It has a very ancient candy factory that makes all kinds of pastilles and hard candy. The Violet Pastilles are a round, pan-coated candy. They are white, deeply scented with violet extract and have an anise seed at the center. They are great for sweet breath and the taste, once acquired, is addictive.
I ate these as a kid (French mother...). The flavor is very delicate-and special. At the end, a little surprise is the anise seed inside! It's great for the sophisticated palate...

I used to purchase these as a child at the ski resorts I hung out at then passed them onto my daughter when I spotted them in a local Delicatessen, the Deli is no longer in business. Really? I did not know I had a sophisticated palette, I just thought they were the coolest candies ever I also love those little tins! OH! and yes they're addictive, Candy that tastes of flowers there is a Rose flavored one as well, and orange. . .
I love these small candies. They have just the right amount of sweet to curb my cravings without eating too many sweets. They're fabulous after a heavy meal.

When I was little, my great aunt had been traveling somewhere (can't remember where), and someone gave her a tin of violet mints. I'm not sure if these are the same brand, but she offered me a few and I've always remembered them. They did come in a little tin and they were round and smooth, as these are.

The taste is slightly violet and a little sweet. In the middle there is a very tiny bit of licorice. It takes a while to get there though. Unless you have teeth like rocks, do not crunch down on these. You have to be patient.

I'm glad I found them.

I discovered these way back in the late 1960s at a fancy candy shop in Manhattan NYC.  I loved them instantly. The delicate smooth candy coating is infused with the taste of violets and a slight sweetness. They freshen the breath without a clawing strong peppermint taste and there's the surprise of a tiny anise seed at the center.  They also seem to take the edge off a sweet craving.  I highly recommend them.
These hard candies have a uniquely flowery taste that will captivate you. I'm not sure why they are presently unavailable, but when they return, they are well worth a try.

Though to read about it, it seems rather good. Rather in trying it it's more of a
poor home made attempt to present low quality dips.
Three lg. jars of yummy salsa varieties with just a little heat in them.  Will definitely purchase again. Only gave it 4 stars because of the fat content.

I bought this product because of appreciation of a tin heather tea (loose leaves).  I couldn't find a same one around but found this tea bag package. Because of my trust to the company I just bought it.  Unfortunately, the product is not as good as I expected.  Most importantly, the tea bags are in paper bags, which are in a soft cardboard box, not sealed so that the tea has lost its favor.  Secondly, I don't see as much heather flowers as they were in the tin heather tea I use to have.  Too bad the package include 4 boxes I can never consume them.
I love the French Vanilla Granola! It is good in yogurt or just eating plain. My daughters love it when I get some french vanilla granola and they eat it up before I even get the chance to have some.

I can't find Spanish peanuts in my local grocery stores.  So to find them at this volume and price was not only a deal but a treat as well.  These are completely raw (untreated).  They are not salted.  I have been roasting them on the stove to enhance the flavor.

Herman's Nut House Raw Spanish Peanuts arrive fresh, fast, and convenient.  Right out of the bag they are pre-shelled and ready for any number of applications, my favorite of which is to roast them and make them into peanut butter.  These have become my go-to legumes of choice.

Forget all those briney jars sporting "NONPAREIL" on their labels. This is the real deal. From that hot volcanic rock off the coast of Sicily, Pantalleria, these are capers to provoke a caper of your own. I found them in Italy. Five stars for Pantalleria capers which go with caviar.

These are the most intensely flavored buds in the business. I use these salted capers in sauces including a lemon caper butter sauce for my veal. Using only the salt that clings to them, the sauce is stunning and different from sauce using other caper brands that are not Pantalleria or are stored in oil. Brine is the enemy and additives other than salt distort the flavor. For most dishes, you will rinse away the salt, or save it, because whatever you made is already salted. But beware, you kill capers if you cook them. Just add the capers after you turn the heat off. The heat from a warm pan is plenty.

I'll admit, these are more expensive. You can get good capers in salt from elsewhere including some nice Spanish ones. I will use those more often. But for special service, I reach for these. Nice to have them available here.

I love dark chocolate, and keep trying brands. I prefer something that's a little bitter and has great flavor, but still just a tad sweet. I don't like when they do 80% cocoa and its just no fun any more, all bitter.

This is now my all time favorite dark chocolate bar. There are complexities in this Blanxart bar, a little smokiness, a little bitter but in great balance with a little sweetness. I highly recommend it I you like dark but not crazy bitter chocolate. Dips nicely with a little peanut butter :) good for rationing out in small but satisfying doses.

These proved a great addition to the lunch cooler for a couple folks I know who weren't interested in mixing and bottling up powered versions.  They're stronger than plastic bottles, don't leak when bounced around, and fit well into the cooler or lunch bucket.

I added the coffee to my book order to get free shipping. The rating would be higher but I was very careful and am 99% sure I ordered Whole Bean coffee, not ground. The coffee itself is fine but stays fresher as beans. I would have ordered Dunkin' Donuts brand but couldn't get it in whole bean. Usually, items I order from Amazon are correct and as expected. It was a surprise to receive something that was not what I thought I'd asked for but it wasn't worth the trouble to return for exchange. Besides, I was nearly out of coffee by the time it arrived. The flavor is good anyway.
It's hard to find this coffee where I live so it's nice to buy it here.  Good flavor and a good price.  I'll buy more

Coffee is very good. Unfortunately, Amazon has a tendency to not send it for unknown reasons  and discontinued the deliveries without notice until I called and the deliveries were reestablished. Most recent delivery not coming.

I tried this coffee after reading reviews that it ranked better than Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts and other coffees, upon tasting it for the first time I had to agree with the others. It has a rich robust taste, very smooth and just the right amount of "umph!!" to it to get you going for the day.
Thought it was going to unlease fireworks as I drank it but it's average tasting.  Still on the quest for great coffee.  Then again, maybe I should invest in a better coffee maker.

Summary: Eight O'clock good coffee at a good "store" price!
Text:
My wife insists on this coffee and I like it too. Very consistant and always a good cup of java. We grind our own beans and like both the regular and Columbian roasts.

We had a subscription here at Amazon and for over a year getting it delivered to our home. Suddenly in the last 4 months the price of our order went up almost $5. I've cancelled the subscription and now buy it at Wal-mart for $8 less for the 3 pound order.

8 O'Clock coffee scored the highest in flavor with Consumer's Union and I was unable to find it in my area of San Diego, so I went on-line and ordered it from Amazon. I wanted to try it, and I think it's excellent in flavor and cost.
Sandy Shelver

I was told about how smooth Eight o'clock coffee was & how many awards it has won by a friend.  I was pleasantly surprised how much I enjoyed its taste.  My wife and I are used to paying 10+ for similar 12oz bags of coffee, you can not go wrong with Eight O'Clock Coffee.  Highly recommend!!

I have been drinking Eight O'Clock coffee for over 25 years. Even though  I have tried other more expensive brands, I keep going back to Eight O'Clock. It makes a dependably good cup of coffee for a lot less than those pricey brands.

I bought 4 bags because of the good review.
I love coffee and have been a coffee drinker for 30+ years.
High expectation which met with very disappointing result.
I find this coffee very weak in smell and taste.
Folgers easily beats it and far far inferior to Blue Mountain Brand.
Now, I got stuck with 4 bags! Don't buy.
I used this coffee years ago when it was sold by the A & P grocery stores but I did not like the taste of this particular coffee.

My girlfriend bought some of this because it was on sale - now I understand why it was on sale. This is the nastiest coffee I have ever attempted to drink. And it wasn't a brewing error, I use a french press, a digital thermometer, timer, and a Capresso Infinity burr grinder or my Rancillio MD40. It was a lazy mistake, I usually purchase from Intelligentsia, but forgot one month and this is what I get. Disgusting.

Summary: Can't Open The Package When Purchasing in Store
Text: I love Eight O-Clock coffee and have been purchasing the hazelnut variety for many years.  However, since I developed arthritis, I can't open the bag to grind it in the store.  So, I search out an employee to open it for me, which is a major inconvenience.  I had hoped the new packaging would be easier to open, but instead it is more difficult!  Last week, I found a young, strong-looking young Ingles employee and he struggled to open the package, too!  I may start taking scissors to the store with me along with a plastic bag to hold it after I grind it.  While I would give it 5 stars for taste, I give it 3 stars for convenience.

This coffee is very weak.  I am very disappointed with this coffee.  Not worth the price.  i would not recommend this coffee...  I signed up for delivery every few weeks. I will cancel my subscription.

I figured for $10 for 4 bags, I'd give this a shot despite mixed reviews. I usually brew with a Toddy and drink the coffee pretty concentrated (black), and this stuff is DISGUSTING! I'm not a huge coffee snob, but this stuff is undrinkable, and I'm going to have to toss the remaining 3 bags. DO NOT BUY THIS!
I heard so much about this gormet coffee for a resonable price that I just had to try it. What a let down, not only is it over priced even on sale, it doesn't even taste better than Folgers.
I baught this coffee because I saw the Consumer Report review that it tasted so great.  I was very disapointed.  The coffee was weak and had a terrible off taste.  Would never buy this again.

I happened upon this item by accident when looking at coffee makers. While I feel Eight O'Clock Columbian is great coffee I can't believe anyone would pay this price for it. I just purchased four bags for ten dollars ($10.00) at my local Giant Food Store as
it is on sale at two for the price of one. I always stock up when they have this sale which happens every few months.
This was some of the most horrid and disgusting coffee I've ever had. Something was off about it. You could make better tasting coffee through a used diaper I think. Avoid. Honestly. It was horrible.

After I read customer reports on 8 o'clock coffee I hoped to finally fine the best for me. No it is not. I will give the other 3 bags to others.I will keep trying to find coffee at home like restaurant coffee I love, maybe it's the maker or the water?  I am still looking.  Help.  Bob B

Be careful. Amazon gets you in the auto ship and save program and a good price and then automatically raises the base price so you pay more in the end. No warning, they just raise the price and the web page still shows the intro price. I expected much more from Amazon.

The Reviewers saying: Oh, it's so smooth. No bitterness Here! And what do I do? Buy a pack of 4 only to find out it is not really all that smooth, capisce? Yes, of course I can add water till it feels smooth but I thought this coffee was genuinely smooth. It is not. Besides that it is in the same category of Dunkin Donuts, not more not less and that is not saying much. I am getting to the point that the reviews sell me faster than the product itself and thanks a lot, the majority of times the reviews are right on the money. People that buy knows and I listen. Not in this case! This is not the promised smooth coffee, it is bitter, really. But of course it is being consumed for spoiled we are not. Cheap Bastards is what we are that we are expecting high quality smoothness at such a convenient and inexpensive price. You get what you pay for unless you get extremely lucky and find at bargain prices a superior product. This is not it. By we being CB I am talking about my Tribe, of course and this one gets a solid 3 Stars just like Dunkin Donuts!

When I switched coffee brands and made Eight O'Clock coffee for my husband, he commented on how good the coffee was.  This brand is so much better than the other leading brands.  It has a rich, robust flavor.

I've been drinking Eight O' Clock Coffee for quite a while now, and it never disappoints. 8:00 is easily one of the smoothest and best tasting coffees that I have ever had. It's blend of Arabica beans is never bitter and always brews up a quality pot. Rich color, good smell, and dependable flavor provide for one of the best coffee bargains around. This is easily the equal of more expensive coffees, and you won't find a better coffee bargain at this price point. This stuff sells out like mad at my local grocers, so buying in bulk may not be a bad idea.

Summary: Better than average coffee for $$$ less than coffees slightly better
Text: I have been brewing this coffee for years and like my title indicated, it is better than average but much less than coffees only slightly better.  Although I have purchased the 4 packs from Amazon before, the price here has gone up.  I can buy in my area 1 12oz bag at Target for just over $4. It turns out to be with tax $3 less for 4 bags than you can get here on line.

Summary: Eight O'Clock good stuff every bag
Text:
Have used 8:00 since the late '70. Every bag very consistent. Buy at Wal-Mart supercenters for [...] a bag. Buy at high turnover stores and you will find the expire date is always a year in the future. Smooth, flavorable and consistent. What more could you ask for. Go to [...] and earn rewards..

Update Mar 20, 2010

Had 8 O'Clock unblended for the first time in about 3 months today. Lately I have been buying speciality and micro-lot beans and mixing them with the red bag 8 O'Clock. Many micro roasters have been selling full pounds for $8, normally $13. It was real nice to have it pure again. I had forgotten how good of a overall coffee it is. And this from a 36 oz bag of beans ground at the store, that have been in the freezer for 3 months or so, and is about half used up. It is one of the better averaged priced coffee's that makes a good blending base. JMO

Update: 5-28-2012
Still my "go to" coffee 85% of the time. I like variey, but I always come back to Eight O'Clock Original.

Great coffee, not too bitter or not too acidy.  Have been drinking Eight O'Clock for years but cannot find it at a reasonable cost since they closed the Farmer Jack stores in Michigan.  Found it on Amazon.com at a very good price and will continue to buy it on line.

This is great coffee, especially for the price.

The coffee provides a very aromatic scent in the air when being brewed and fresh out of the bag. It is well packaged, the grounds are sized nicely and it makes a great cup of flavorful coffee. It is a bit on the lighter side so it may not be your favorite if you're into the really dark cups, but for a medium-bodied blend, this is great.

Summary: 8 o'clock coffee is still the best.
Text:
We've used 8'oclock since Consumers Report named it #1. We buy the ground version, and brew with a Mr Coffee, just routine.

Some months ago we decided on more exotic coffee. Bought a French Press and a whistling pot, and a grinder, and tried numerous brands of fancy coffees.

We set up a "coffee log" to keep track of all the various coffees and the details of the brew (amount, time of brew, degree of grind, etc),

My son has a several thousand dollar machine which makes all kinds of coffee, espressos, and so on, and he is quite the expert in knowing about all the coffees out there, so we had good guidance.

The results of all this experimentation? We use 8'oclock ground, 4 measures to 5 cups of filtered water (important!), normal brew in Mr Coffee. There is nothing that can beat this for strength, flavor, after-taste, and convenience.

And you can't beat the price if you have Amazon ship 4 bags a month, automatically.

There is really no other choice than 8'oclock.

Dan
I love the coffee.  It's all I drink since I discovered it a couple of years ago. I'm disappointed in the pricing, though, since I can buy it much cheaper at the local supermarkets.

EIGHT O'CLOCK COFFEE PURCHASED FROM AMAZON

Eight O'Clock Coffee is an old family favorite. My parents used to buy the bean variety, and ground it in my Great Grandmothers (hand cranked) coffee grinder. When I saw that I could buy it on Amazon, and at a great price, I just couldn't resist. Now I am enjoying the same great coffee my parents did and I really enjoy it. I've tried many brands and this is the best.

I have been drinking 8 OClock coffee since I was a kid.  It has taken me several years to find someone who sells this coffee.  It is the best coffee I have drank.  As long as Amazon sells it I will continue to buy it.

The red bag of Eight O'Clock Coffee with its mild to medium strength, smoothness, and low acidity has been a favorite of mine dating back to the time when it was known as Red Circle; in its previous incarnation, the red bag was the middle of the line of the coffees of the Great Atlantic and Pacific Tea Company, which some will remember as the A & P food market -- long before it was purchased and led into bankruptcy by a foreign purchaser.  The full line up of A & P coffees was: yellow bag: Eight O'Clock; red bag: Red Circle; black bag: Bokar.  That order represented the relative strength of the respective blends.  Fortunately for coffee lovers, after A & P spun off their coffee line into a company called Compass Foods, the coffee operation was purchased by Tata Tea (a subsidiary of the larger Tata Group).  Sometime earlier, the yellow bag blend was dropped, and Eight O'Clock name was appended to the mid-level blend.  The black bag now represents the varietal offering of Columbian beans.  Another hallmark of Eight O'Clock is its consistency from bag to bag, month to month, and year to year: A true testament to the blending and roasting skills of the manufacturer.  Add the convenience of Amazon, and the price advantage over local grocery chains, and you truly have a winning combination.

Eight O'Clock red bag coffee was for years a staple in our household and we thoroughly enjoyed it. It's a nice coffee best when brewed a little more slowly than most auto drip coffee makers allow.
We stopped buying it for several years because it became unreliable and more often than not we were getting bags that tasted "off".
Lately we have been buying several types of coffee looking for one that brews a good, consistent cup of coffee every time. Because we did enjoy Eight O'Clock red bag for all those years we decided to give it another try. First bag was fresh and lovely tasting. We were tickled to have an old favorite back in our cupboard.
One of the things we noticed first was that most times the bags available in stores were no longer vacuum sealed and were more puffy than usual with air - not sure how long it takes to get that way, so maybe those were old. Dunno.
Anyway, once more we were getting inconsistency in the taste. One bag good and the next not. Disappointing.
As the ditty goes: When it was good, it was very, very good and when it was bad it was horrid.
I love not having to go to the store just because I ran out of coffee.
This coffee is just the way I remembered it from way back in the 1940's.

I like Dunkin Donuts, Starbux, peets, and pure Kona coffee (for weekends, when I can enjoy the cup). 8 O'clock Coffee is horrible. It tastes like office coffee, even when freshly brewed. It has a rough texture, unsatisfying aroma, and very light beans in general. I'm giving away the coffee for free becuase it's horrible.

ProfileName: James McKevitt "Happy in the Sierra Gold Country"
Text: I grew up with Eight O'Clock coffee (along with Red Circle and Bokar) from the A&P back east and I think Eight O'Clock is one of the best every day blends you can buy.  Delighted to be able to get it still, even on the west coast.  It is flavorful without being overpowering or too strong and has no bitter aftertaste.  Luv it!

I love coffee, until I had Eight O'clock Brand I never knew what excellent coffee was.  I only drink perked coffee, because it has the full flavor I'm looking for in a cup of coffee.  I buy my eight o'clock at Sam's club and grind it from whole beans in their grinder.  The aroma from the fresh opened bag makes me hurry home to make me a great cup of coffee.  I have a 12 cup pot and I use 5 heaping tablespoons of grounds per pot and it comes out very good.  Thanks Eight O'Clock for a great product.

I bought this in bulk and froze it, each pkg was delicious as the first.  I drink a lot of coffee and I don't like STRONG, bitter coffes, like some of the boutique brands (Starbucks).  This coffee is mellow but has a very hardy coffee flavor.  I drink cream and sugar in my coffee and this coffee mixes very well to make my morning!

Summary: Good coffee good price, a win win purchase.
Text: Good coffee good price, a win win purchase. We have used this coffee in the past. When I saw the price and it was just rated as a Number ONE brand recently I thought why not purchase at Amazon, I could not do any better any where else. It worked out really nicely and I have a good cup of coffee now every morning.

Summary: It's not the same as it used to be
Text:
I've been purchasing 8 O'Clock for many years and had been very happy with the quality. It had a deep, rich flavor with nuances of a quality dark chocolate thrown into the mix. Smooth, never bitter and never disappointing. My guests' compliments ensured my loyalty to this company.

However, for about the last year I've noticed that the taste has changed for the worse. Whether that's due to the company's change in suppliers, weather in the coffee-growing region or formula change, I am in search of a replacement.

Every so often I purchase a 12-ounce bag, hoping for the best and unfortunately, I'm always disappointed. It still has that tinny, forgettable flavor that I've come to expect in cheaper store brands. I'm sorry to say I've lost an old friend.

As an aside, surprisingly, I've noticed that the price of 8 O'Clock coffee has actually gone down in price (by $2 a bag) at a local retail store. You may draw your own conclusions as to why.

Received the item with only 6 weeks until the expiration date, but otherwise good coffee.  I guess since I'm buying it online and the low price it makes sense, but still just something you wouldn't be expecting.

I am not into all these fancy coffees.
I just want a good full bodied cup of coffee for the best price possible.
Eight O'Clock original is the best I have found for the price. Consistant, too!
Great to be able to get it from Amazon on auto ship as it is not always available here in deep east Texas.
eight O'Clock has been a favorite of mine for years. Loved the convenience of having it delivered instead of having to run to the store.
I love Eight Oclock coffee & am always looking for a good deal on it. This was a great deal, very reasonable price. We are so enjoy the taste every morning.

Summary: Breakfast with Eight O'Clock Coffee from Amazon
Text: I just love this product.  Since I started buying it, everyone that I make it for, just loves it.  It is the best one that I have had in a long time.  I will keep on using it everyday.

I used to be one of those that had to buy the most expensive coffee. Then one day on a whim I bought Eight O clock brand. Since then I never went back to the gourmet blends.

The best part is the savings when I signed up for the subscription service. I save around $2 a bag compared to buying in the store.
Great price, timely delivery, 4 bags of coffee...can't go wrong!  Looking forward to trying them out.  But all is good so far.  Thanks!

I'm a big fan of Eight O'Clock coffee, and I can't find it anywhere in Hawaii, so when I saw the special on Amazon, I ordered several packages (4 bags to the package).  It arrived in three days and I've been enjoying the coffee each morning since.  A good price, free shipping, and great coffee.
Receiving coffee in the mail is such a blessing!  It's great coffee and saves me a trip to the store...in addition to saving money.  :-)

My perspective: I usually prefer light roasts, because I hate bitterness. I always add cream and sugar -- usually flavored creamers and Torani syrups. Mostly, I like coffee that is very very easy to drink. But, light roasts were getting a little weak and boring.

This coffee: Much more flavorful and rich than most light roasts, but just as drinkable. It's hearty but smooth. One of my favorite coffees, and you really can't beat 4 packages for $10. Definitely glad I tried this!

Everyone has different tastes, but Eight O'Clock is my favorite coffee. It's a smooth, medium-mild blend. Drinkers of dark blend coffees will probably prefer 8 O'Clock 100% Columbian. It is stronger and bolder. Both are excellent coffees, and moderately priced.

Summary: Beware of the best by date
Text:
I purchased this product on 09/03/2011. Received the item today (09/07/2011). However, the best by date is 11/16/2011.

This is unacceptable! Nobody can finish off such a quantity of coffee within such a short time (some people like us already have coffee stocked up).

Edit: Since I submitted the review, Amazon offered to refund the cost. Thanks guys, you restored my faith on Amazon.

Summary: Great price for unpicky coffee drinkers
Text: I noticed there were some very negative reviews for this coffee, but we were looking for something inexpensive that we could get delivered through Amazon Prime, so we gave it a shot. What I've concluded is that this is a great coffee at a great price for coffee drinkers who aren't particularly discriminating in their coffee tastes (especially if you doctor it up with plenty of cream and sugar, as we tend to do). Honestly, we thought this coffee was perfect until we traveled to Panama and tasted real fresh-roasted, mountain grown coffee. After that, coming home to Eight O'Clock wasn't so great. But if you are already drinking pre-ground coffee, and don't have a particular brand preference, I'm guessing you'll be totally happy with this product. And because we're cheap, we're still drinking it too. :)

Summary: Too close to the "Sell By" date
Text: I agree with the previous reviewer that the coffee was shipped too close to its "Sell By" date. When it arrived, the coffee was only six weeks away from expiring. In stores, usually 8 O'Clock Coffee is seven to nine months from expiration. The coffee has the typical stale smell and taste you'd expect in a product this old. Unless something changes and they can guarantee in the product description that the coffee will be much fresher, I'd pass on this if I were you. I'm slogging through all four bags because I'm trying to learn my lesson, but I bought a fresh bag at a local grocery store to give myself a break in between.

I am not a big coffee drinker. But my wife is. She has bought this in the store and really liked the coffee. I discussed with her and we thought it would be a good idea to put it on subscription. It came. She made her morning coffee and boy I heard about it. You would think someone died. And that someone could have been me! Well to make a point, it was stale. And since we opened a bag it could not be returned so now we have 4 bags of stale coffee. Do yourself a favor a pass this one by. Seriously. Thing is I am disabled. I am not crying about that, but that means a limited income. Amazon helps me to order in any items I can. Recently I have had to depend on a cane because the pain is too great. The problem in a nutshell is I think there is not enough "stock rotation" in the warehouse. I had the same problem with the Duracell batteries. Half the package was dead. Now all the other thing are fine. I love amazon. I have sold on Amazon for years. Good customers good people. (Personally, I tried the coffee and it was not the best but I have tasted worse.) That's all. Thank you.

I ordered this coffee because I had read in Consumer Reports that it was the best tasting coffee for a very low price point. Unfortunately it was less than impressive. And I had to order 4 bags to make it cost effective! I'll stick with my Peets Coffee or Seattle's Best in the future.

I am  a coffee latte drinking snob. I've tried all the name brands, and have even bought the emergency canned coffee. I drink coffee every day, twice a day. However,I have never heard of this brand and the reviews grab my attention. Disclosure, I am a big fan of anything 1940s, must have been a past life. So I was also curious about how coffee tasted back then.  I was very pleasantly surprised! It is very smooth and it has a full body. The aroma is very uplifting. Very good cup of coffee as far as drip coffee goes.

Summary: a great hot, fresh cup of coffee
Text: I love my coffee. Nothing compares to that first fresh, hot cup of coffee in the morning. The aroma of brewing coffee is almost a meal in itself. I am a morning person. I get up very early and start my day with a pot of coffee, the morning paper, and my computer. It's my favorite time of the day, my time to prepare myself for the world at large. Eight O'Clock makes real coffee, just like coffee should be. The world always looks better through the steam rising from a great cup of coffee!

I have ground a ton of this in the A&P as it is all my parents drank and it was my job to go to the store and get it. Once I ground it and paid I would walk home with my nose stuck in the bag because the aroma was absolutely delicious and that was 60 years ago and it is still a great tasting coffee today at a reasonable price.

Was raised on this brand. Good price, still a tasty coffee. I use it with more expensive,
trendy grinds for my daily brew.
it has none of those roof tar after-taste that Starbucks has and each bag cost me the same as a Grande Latte would have but makes lots of rich, smooth,  palatable pleasing cups of coffee.
For a fairly old brand, the coffee is very tasty and a very good value. It won't make you think of Kona Coffee but a much better than the general store brands

Like the lady from NJ I also remember eight o'clock coffee from the 1940's.  I was just a kid then and didn't drink coffee, but remember my parents buying this brand of coffee from the A&P super market in PA.  Recently purchased 8 bags from Amazon and now going back for more.  A very flavorful coffee with a great aroma.  Brews a good cup every time.

I have experimented with many types and brands of coffee and for the money this brand is the best. It's consistent in quality and is not oily or acidy like some of the so called gourmet brands. I original bought the 42oz.bag to test and when I found that I really liked it I ordered this four 12oz. bag package. As it turned out the four 12oz. bag package is a better deal price wise and it's the same good coffee. One more thing, if you use CO2 filters in your coffee vault like I do, the Eight O'clock brand has one in each bag. When I open a new bag to put in my coffee vault I take the CO2 filter out of the bag and replace the CO2 filter in the vault. Doing this not only keeps the coffee fresh it saves money because you don't have to keep buying replacement CO2 filters... They're not exactly cheap.  There are better coffees out there but they ARE expensive. For the price and quality this coffee tastes just fine......... Try it out, you won't be disappointed.

Am very happy that now I absolutely know I will have my good old 8 o'clock.No more wondering if store will stock the coffee and also I won't have to  wonder if I'll have to pay almost $8.00 per pound. Thank you and so does our wallet.  Kathy

8 O'Clock Coffee has been our family's go-to java for a long time.  Now we LOVE getting it regularly through Amazon!  Never run out, and it's a snap to whip up a pot anytime.  We find it stays fresh in the 12 oz bags in the freezer, so we get it already ground. No excuse for having a bad cup of coffee- 8 O'Clock gets it right every time- hot and strong!

Summary: Good Coffee for a Good Price
Text: My oldest son likes this coffee and its price and suggested I use it for guests at our rental vacation property. I do use the coffee and have never had a complaint from any of our guests. I generally buy the original ground or decaff original and am pleased with both. By using 'Subscribe and Save' this coffee is cheaper than any local store, including using a Eight O'Clock coupon at either Walmart or Target.

Purchased several of these as Christmas gifts.
Everyone who remembered 8 o'clock coffee loved them!!
I kept 2 of them for myself.

Summary: The replacement for Maxwell House Slow Roast Coffee!!!
Text:
I had bought Maxwell House Slow Roast Coffee for years. When I could no longer buy it locally, I started buying it online. Well, when the price on the few places you could find it were about >$20 for 33 oz, I gave up and started searching for a replacement.

A delightful person at a store that had previously carried it took it upon herself to do some research on my behalf, and found that Eight O'Clock regular ground was well-reviewed, and suggested it to me.

YES! Perfect replacement for MH Slow Roast, readily available and doesn't cost a fortune, especially when you buy it online. With subscription, it's cheaper to have shipped to the house than it is in local grocery stores. YEA!!!!!

GREAT smooooth coffee, can make it strong and it still doesn't tear your stomach up if you prefer a "thick" cup of coffee. :)

We go through Quite a bit of coffee and it's difficult to find this coffee, especially for affordable amounts and i will not go with a different coffee. This service and provides me with my favorite coffee for an affordable price and I never have to hunt it down at the stores.

I don't smoke and I don't drink...but give me my Eight O'Clock Coffee.
Coffee is a main staple in our house. We order through Amazon.com because we
can get a package of 4-12oz. bags of coffee for less than we pay in a grocery
store and the delivery is very prompt.

Summary: Really great coffee at a really great price!
Text: I started buying this coffee when I was looking for one that was less expensive.  I tried a variety of lower priced coffees, different roasts, flavors, etc.  I prefer a milder, less acidic taste, and surprisingly I thought it was the best.  My favorite up to that point was Dunkin Donuts whole bean medium roast, but the price was going higher everytime I purchased it. I was on a quest to brew a great cup that tastes similar to what we find in a diner, at a lower price and this fit the bill perfectly.  Eight O'Clock is a mild but full bodied flavor, with less acidity and no bitterness.  Very drinkable with or without cream.  Since higher acid in coffee sometimes upsets my stomach, I thought I might have to stop drinking it altogether.  For the best cup, I always grind my own beans, and recently switched from a drip maker to a percolator.  Since this is an old fashioned favorite, I think the percolator is appropriate. I still grind the beans, and prepare the percolator the night before (just like I did with my automatic timer Mr. Coffee) and plugged the percolator into a light timer set for my early morning time.  That way, my coffee is still ready for me when I'm still half asleep.  My husband, who always used half-and -half in his coffee, now drinks Eight O'Clock black.  We both highly recommend Eight O'Clock coffee for a flavorful cup every day that tastes like our favorite diner!

I was very pleasantly surprised with the full bodied smooth flavor. Rich without being too strong. Good value for cost. I previously drank the Dunkin Donuts brand, but found the flavor weak after awhile.
This product was exactly what I ordered and came very quickly. very satisfied!! I definitely would order this again. If you are looking for coffee you should buy this

I buy this coffee at home and it is great.  So when we needed coffee at work and they where tired of the old coffee I suggested Eight O'Clock coffee and everyone loves it.  Can't go wrong with Eight O'clock coffee in my opinion.

Smell great, tastes great, good price, quick shipping. Nothing wrong with this coffee if you are a regular old coffee drinker. I'm 2-3 cups a day and this is delicious to me. Someone with a more elaborate coffee palette may say otherwise. Or not.

PS: I use this in a Keurig with a reusable plastic K-Cup ... as good or better than any K-Cup coffee I've tried.
This is my favorite "every day" coffee. I usually wait for a "buy 1, get 1 free" sale at Publix. Combined with the coupons I cut from each bag, it's an excellent value.

I had not tasted Eight O'clock coffee in a number of years so I decided to give it a try again. The first thing I noticed when I opened the bag was the slightly 'burnt' smell...which to me indicates the beans are roasted too hot or too fast.  I have made 3 pots of coffee from this bag ( I keep it in the fridge ). The taste is very average, sort of like coffee you get at Denny's or Shari's.  It's okay, but nothing special. I may try the Eight O'clock Columbian to see if I like it better.
Loved this, my coffee right now, i have different names of coffee to brew but i settle for this one and i don't get tired of its flavor.  Great for a gift.

I saw Eight O'Clock coffee, whole-bean unground, 11 ounce bag for $4 at the local grocery store chain, aka HEB(it's a big one, here in Texas). I was blown away! I recognized the name as something of a throwback from decades past, probably my grandmother would remember this coffee brand, and at this price, it was worth a gamble. I bought four of them.

My motto is, how bad can you screw up the coffee, if you can grind the whole beans yourself, and the beans haven't been sitting there for a couple of years? Even the cheapest coffee, if roasted minimally and ground fresh by me, tastes better then the most expensive coffee, that is pre-ground, sitting on a shelf for a few months. There is no comparison, fresh ground always crushes, pun not intended, pre-ground.

So back to this Eight O'Clock whole-bean coffee I got on sale. I use my electric grinder, which is the typical handheld electric grinder, and I top it off with the Eight O'Clock beans, which is the normal amount, grind it, and throw it in my french coffee press, add the nearly boiling water, press it, and pour myself a cup. Oh yea, I add heavy whipping cream, instead of half and half, because I'm watching my carbs.

What can I say? Coffee is great. It's different from the Starbucks burnt flavor, cause I have Starbucks wholebean as well. Eight O'Clock has a hint of sweetness, I'm pretty sure that several local restaurants must use Tata for coffee, because it has a similar flavor. It's obvious that it's not as heavily roasted as Starbucks, but what is?

Anyway, after reading the negative reviews here, I'm not sure if there's a quality control issue, a bad batch, or if there is some counterfeit coffee being sold ....whatever the problem is, I know I won't be buying this Eight O'Clock coffee online. I trust my local grocer if run into a bad batch to take it back.

I'm going back tonight to buy out the rest of their Eight O'Clock.

Summary: The best coffee I've ever tasted!
Text:
Eight O'Clock Coffee, Original Ground, 12-Ounce Bag (Pack of 4)

My family has been using Eight O'Clock coffee for at least 70 years.
I grew up with it. When I was 9 years old my mother allowed me to start drinking it.
She would make a cup of 3/4 hot milk and 1/4 Eight O'Clock. When I was in my teens
she made a 50-50 mix of milk and coffee. At 18 I started drinking it full-strength
with just a couple teaspoons of milk and a bit of sugar.
I've never been a black coffee drinker because of the way my mother started me out
with milk - however, there have been times in my life when we forgot to buy milk and
I drank it black.
Eight O'Clock is the ONLY coffee I can drink black.

I have just purchased my 4th Farberware Stainless Steel Stove-top Coffee Pot from Amazon.
I've used these for the past 40 years and will still continue purchasing Eight O'Clock coffee
to use in them.

I never knew you could get Eight O'Clock through Amazon! I just took a chance and typed it in.
It's so much easier. You get it at your door in 2 days! No running long distances to buy it or having family members elsewhere purchase it for me and mail it to me.

The Original Ground Eight O'Clock has a gentle, non-bitter flavor that starts your day
with contentment rather than a jolt!

Over the past 40 years I've had to switch to other coffees when the original supplier (A&P Supermarkets) went out of business in my area and I couldn't find it elsewhere.
But other coffees STILL can't stand up to Eight O'Clock for my taste.

Summary: great tasting coffee at a great price
Text: Great coffee at a great price, i have no complaints, its a great tasting coffee that keeps fresh. Not too many scoops needed to brew a great cup of coffee.

Eight O' Clock original ground coffee is mild and has a great flavor.  Also, the price on amazon.com is very good.  I have ordered this coffee on amazon.com 5 or 6 times, both the original and Colombian roast, and they are both great.
I am very happy with this proiduct.  It comes in a convenient size package that is easy to store and use.
We use this in the percolator at church and it works fine. These price a very good and the taste is as good as some coffee shop. Perfect for churches.

My sis moved to California and had a hard time finding this coffee, which is our preferred cup o' joe.  At Christmas I sent her a shipment and she still receives one every month. She calls it the gift that keeps on giving!!! And now I don't have to X-mas shop for her anymore...she continues to get a gift that she enjoys year round. Works for us...plus...the coffee is the best!!
This is one of the best coffees you can get in the store. They also have a rewards program you can take part in!!!

Summary: Convenience, Great Price and the Greatest Coffee Ever!!
Text: I purchase Eight O'Clock Coffee all the time and the convenience, price and the ease of ordering in bulk allow me to never be without my favorite cup of Java...I am going to be 65 years old and try to purchase as many bulk items as possible so that I don't have to worry about running out or having to get all my groceries upstairs to my apartment..makes my life easier for sure...

Summary: It's always Eight O Clock at my house
Text: Absolutely the best Coffee of all brands. I am a Pro Coffee drinker. And I have tried them all but always come back to Eight O Clock. None better for aroma and taste, and value. Usually half or more in price.
We always wanted to try Eight O'Clock Coffee and the offer was good enough to go ahead and order some. It's OK is the best I can offer, We won't bother ordering again.

I have been an 8 o'clock  coffee drinker for years and I don't think you can beat this brand for any price. If you want real coffee and not some flavored trendy drink, try this or maybe the Columbian blend.The price is very good, better than any B&M in my area and so convenient with home delivery..

Summary: Liking this coffee will depend on whether or not you ...
Text: ... like Arabica coffee. Many people love Arabica, many don't. Personally, I think Eight O'Clock Coffee is pretty good. It's not the best, but it's up there with the best. I would definitely put it in my top 5. It's a tad bit bitter, but not so much that it's jarring. 4 stars out of 5. Pretty great coffee!
Eight O'Clock coffee is a throw back to my childhood. Ann Page or A&P as it was known sold this coffee. What a treat..  A MUST HAVE if you are a coffee lover!!!!

Good quality coffee at a good price. I have been buying Eight O'Clock Coffee from my local grocery store for years - 100% Arabica beans (depending on the variety you select) - you cant go wrong. I like the original and Columbian.

Summary: Love this coffee, this is a must for me!
Text: Love this coffee! It is what a drink each day at home. Formerly, I used Dunkin Donuts coffee at home. Was looking for a tasty replacement for DD Coffee at a more affordable price and a good friend suggested this coffee. I am very happy that my friend has such great taste in coffee :)

My household is filled with avid coffee drinkers. We prefer Dunkin Donuts mild/medium roast and arabica beans. With the hard economic times, it's been more and more expensive to buy by the pound. My husband insists that our coffee be 100% Arabica and we have found this coffee/roast to be comparable to Dunkin's for everyday consumption. It wasn't identical, but comparable -- not too strong/weak and not bitter. Enjoyed the coffee and the price on Amazon can't be beat, way cheaper than buying from the local grocery store.
This coffee is good and has decent flavor. I don't think that it is anything special. if I find it on sale I would get it again.

I remember my mother taking me to the A&P and having the lady put this coffee into the coffee grinder and the smell was enticing, even though I did not drink coffee then.
When I got older I bought 8 o'clock coffee for me and my husband, I loved it. Now when I buy this coffee I don't have them grind it, instead I grind it myself at home to have fresh ground coffee ever time. Nice full bodied flavor and a smoothness not in all coffee.
Love this coffee and the price is right. Have it on autoship. Nice and rich, smooth and just the perfect cup in the morning.

Summary: best coffee....but price not so much
Text: This is the best coffee ever (french roast,original and columbian) but you can get it cheaper in a grocery store (about 16$ w/tax for 36 oz bag).

Summary: Coffee that tastes like coffee should taste
Text: I love this coffee because it tastes just like coffee should. It's not all about the "roast", it's about robust, earthy flavor. It is smooth but has a nice deep taste. Hard to explain...But it's really good!

Summary: Finally! A coffee that doesn't irritate my digestive system!
Text: I always had to limit my coffee drinking to 2 cups because of the irritation to my digestive system. My sons had the same problem until one of them tried 8 O'clock brand and turned us all on to it. I use a regular drip coffeemaker and the 8 O'clock coffee comes out smooth and tasty like good restaurant coffee! With absolutely no stomach upset. I'm thrilled and now get it using Amazon's Subscribe & Save because it's hard to find in my local grocery stores.
i love this coffee but can't find it in california (im an east coast baby)  having it delivered for free makes it affordable,.  the auto delivery makes it convenient.

I love this coffee! My parents used this coffee in the 1940's. So did all our friends and neighbors.
It was good then.....today, when I drink a cup, it takes me back to a calmer and more peaceful time. Happy memories!
The flavor is great and has a richness we can all appreciate. It is also reasonably priced, with free shipping and a discount if you subscribe. Try it!

I enjoy all types of coffee and like to have variety in my coffee and one of them on my list is Eight O'Clock Coffee it is a staple in my house I would reccomend this coffee and stock up with it on your pantry shelves it was a very good deal a pack of 4 for about $24.00, the shipping was on time, good delivery!

Eight O'Clock Ground Coffee, Original, 12-Ounce Bag (Pack of 4)
Eight o'clock coffee was top-rated by Consumer Reports, and lives up to its rating. In a pack of four, with a subscription for further shipments, it is about $5 a bag, delivered, thus making it very affordable.

It does not take a coffee expert to notice this. Before this, I had Dunkin Donuts' ground coffee. For the same amount of coffee, this 8'clock one generates much less aroma and coffee-taste. I had to put in so much more to feel some taste of coffee. In this regard, this is not worth the money. I am even wondering if they blend non-coffee things in it. I really do not understand where the good reviews comes from.

I'm not a coffee snob, I usually drink starbucks coffee beans or i buy the 5 pound bags from coffee bean direct which are pretty good off of amazon.  I decided to try this due to consumer reports good reviews and the overall good reviews here on amazon.  The coffee tastes stale, and has a horrible aftertaste.  I mix these with starbucks french roast now which are a little too strong for my taste just so i dont have to have the aftertaste from these beans.  Don't buy them, even if they are on sale, like i did.

I have been used to Dunkin and Starbucks. I decided to try something new and picked this one up at local store after reading rave reviews.

I was thoroughly disappointed in this one. I whole heartedly agree with another comment posted here. This is worse than office coffee!!!

I found the coffee to be too light compared to Medium Roast of Dunkin and Star Bucks. The flavour and aroma was akin to hot water run through an already filtered coffee grind.

If you are used to stronger blends and richer flavours then you will not miss this one.

If you are trying to move off coffee or want to go for a light coffee then you might prefer buying this.

I am putting this to compost. This ain't my cup of coffee :(

I got hint of the coffee while it was being brewed. The aroma was not very nice. When you wake up in the morning and the coffee does not smell good to you, you know it is not right.
I tried to convince myself that it may be adequately drinkable so that I can at least finish the 4 pack from subscribe and save. Unfortunately, it did not make it pass the second sip.
I make quick and delicious chili with this product--I add ground meat but one does not need to. I also add carrots and shallots. Lots of possibilities! This chili tastes homemade to me.

I sent these to my son at college along with soup. He said they were great. They were very fresh and the packages were small enough where the unopened ones could stay fresh.

He said they were a perfect compliment to the soup I sent -also from Amazon. Amazon makes it easy to send things all I have to do is click a button and my son can get a care package!

I love ritz but the regular ones are so darn salty, I feel like I am eating a salt slab everytime I put one in my mouth.  So my mom suggested that I try their low soduim crackers, I had no idea they made low sodium crackers but am so happy that they do.  You still get that wondeful butter like flavor of a regular ritz but no where as salty as the regular ones.  They pack a nice flavor and crispy crunch that I love so much.  You can still taste a little bit of salt, but its such a wonderful balance that works wonders. This is my go to snack cracker whether its just to snack on or to make PB crackers with.

Summary: NABISCO Ritz Crackers,Low Salt, 16-Ounce Unit (Pack of 12) RIP-OFF SCAM
Text:
NABISCO Ritz Crackers RIP-OFF SCAM ~ Every One - Every One of These NABISCO Ritz Crackers Bags Were ONLY 3/4's Full

What A NABISCO Ritz Crackers SCAM RIP-OFF

We Will NEVER Purchase Any Products By NABISCO Ever Again ~N~ If U Were A Smart Comsumer ~ U Too Would BoyCott ALL Products Products By NABISCO ~ Until They STOP This Kind of RIP-OFF SCAN

Summary: Great alternative that holds up when frothed
Text: I had to give up dairy last month, and I was most bummed about my daily latte habit. I've never liked soy lattes... until now. This is an excellent alternative that I found out about when I ordered a soy latte at my favorite coffee shop. Now, we keep it stocked at home for me and for our non-dairy friends. I love that it is shelf-stable as well as tasty.

Summary: specially made for hot beverages - doesn't curdle!
Text: this soy milk tastes exactly like most soy milks in thickness and consistency, although it seems to have less of the "beany" taste that some others have. the only difference is that it does not curdle in hot beverages like normal soy milk (thats why it marketed as specifically for baristas). It does an amazing job of that and tastes great. One of my favorite brands!

Summary: Barista Series - Froths Beautifully & Great Taste
Text:
I have long loved making lattes at home. However, I have always had one problem.

I prefer to drink lattes with soy milk. Not only do I prefer not to have so much dairy, but I find they taste better, when it is a quality, appropriate soy milk.
