Cute packaging, great company website and rewards program. They make their mixes in an allergen free environment, and test every batch so you KNOW it's safe. Would work for vegans, too.
They make another version for persons with Celiac.

This sauce is very well balanced between fire and taste. I was afraid it would be overpowering in heat, but was very pleasantly surprised to find that its flavor is more prominent than anticipated. It has a very good blend of peppers and spices so that it is an everyday sauce (not one of those mutant novelty sauces that people try just to suffer from a drop). This sauce is great and will purchase again because the bottle I bought is being depleted very quickly.

Mad Anthony's Hot Sauce - Van Halen

This stuff is the bomb. Great deep flavor not just Hot. It is hot but not so much you can't enjoy it. I put it on everything. Pizza, chips, crackers, taco's, soups, cheese dip, spaghetti, hot wings....you get the point. Be careful it is addictive, in a way that good hot sauce is. One jar won't last. Wish they made a family size 1/2 gallon.

I agree with the other reviewers. It has a kick but more than that it has a great flavor. So many hot sauces are just hot to be hot...no flavor or fake flavor. This has a great blend of spices. Perfect consistency for tacos, pizza, nachos, popcorn. YUM!!

Lottie's is a reasonably close version of Inner Beauty Hot Sauce, what many hot sauce fans regard as the best hot sauce ever sold.  Unhappily, Inner Beauty is no longer available--although home-made recipes are available on the Web--but Lottie's is excellent in its own right.  I would judge it as very hot, but not quite as hot as IB, with IB complexity of flavor--a dimension that so many extremely hot sauces lack.  After all, anybody can buy some habaneras or ghost peppers, throw them in the blender with some dried chiles, vinegar, salt, and a little fruit, and call it a hot sauce.

This sauce is excellent, and indeed spicy.  The brand also makes a mild version, in addition to other wonderful products like Rib Rub.  Made in North Carolina.  My husband doesn't like the sweeter type BBQ sauces - this brand he loves.

We know the whole pink salt story. If you don't, just google it. We are using it mainly because it's supposed to be better for you health-wise. We both like salt and this seemed like a reasonable deal. There isn't much difference in the taste... cleaner and you have to use less I'd say. The salt isn't quite as fine as we expected... a bit many grained size, but they all come out of the salt shaker well. We found out that our local upscale grocery store carries it in bulk, but it's "rock salt" size. We've bought a Bodum grinder that grinds both pepper and salt for when the salt we have now runs out. The Bodum is great and they sell it on Amazon...
P.S. Fairie's Finest had the best prices for both the pink salt and Red Hawaiian sea salt...
man I love on some iguana gold sauce dogg especially on poached eggs makes me cry when the bottle runs dry.

Summary: My favorite variety pack of Tully's coffee
Text: I love Tully's coffee and this is the best variety pack!! It has a nice variety.  They're exactly what I need to get going in the morning or as a pick me up in the afternoon.

Summary: I tried them myself and they aren't bad!
Text: These treats smell good. I actually bought them for my rabbits because I didn't know dogs eat pumpkin, and like it. When the rabbits hear me open the package they run to the cage door and climb over each other to be the first one to get a treat. And, the dog loves them too, although he is jealous of the rabbits so I don't know if he eats them because he likes them or because he doesn't want the rabbits to get any. I actually ate one myself to see what the fuss was about only to find out they are rather bland, but the crunchiness was nice. As long as my pets are happy, then I am happy. Thanks for the speedy delivery and the discount prices.

I purchased these fruit treats for my dogs for the first time and they just love them.  They are all natual and healthy too.  They are small in size which I like because of the size of my dogs.  I brought 2 flavors just to try and they loved both of them.  I would recommend these for any size dog.

Summary: Awesome good snack for the dogs
Text: My dogs LOVE LOVE LOVE these, they love all varieties of the Fruitables. I feel comfortable giving these as treats. They are still in the category of 'goodies' or 'junk food' but as a very minor part of their diet, I am quite pleased with the ingredients and quality.

My dogs love these Fruitables.  Great tasting to the dogs and a great training aid.  I like that they are small enough to fit into a training treat bag and they aren't smelly like some of the dog training treats are.
We have tried all the flavors for our dog and he enjoys them. I like the size,for calorie control, and the ingredients, no junk!

Summary: Great Product for taste and health
Text: I bought this because my dog loves to eat sweet potatoes. Since don't have them all the time I figure he would love these. He's eaten a few and seems to enjoy them. He's not overly crazy about them, but I guess he's gotten use to the real thing for so long. However, the list of all natural ingredients is really amazing and good for any dog's health. I even ate one myself and found it to be pretty good. Remember if your dog doesn't like it, then  it's because everyone has different tastes. It's still a very solid product. I'm very happy with it.

I love these treats and my dog loves them even more. The only thing I have to say is watch out for allergies your dog may have. I have a mini schnauzer and they are known for allergies. My dog cannot have the cranberry or blueberry ones as they make her vomit. She is just fine with the banana and apple ones so we continue to buy them. She loves them and I love being able to identify what ingredients I am feeding my dog.
My dogs love these, I will purchase them again in the future I'm sure they would eat the whole bag if I let them.

Both of my dogs LOVE raw nuts, the more you pay the better they like them. So I thought that they would like this treat. The 8 year old wont even take them from your hand like she will other veterinarian treats. They are not in the favorite list of the younger dog either although she will eat them with no fuss but given the choice she will take a different vegan treat. It was worth a try. Comes down to it doesn't matter how good they are for your dog if they don't want them they are not a treat.
I thought these sounded great (sounded delicious to me anyway) but I have tried giving the treats to my pup and to my parents' 2 dogs and they won't touch them.  They won't even bite into them.

Summary: Flavor is there, but you'll have to cut it apart to get any.
Text: I read a review prior to purchasing this that said it came to them in shambles.  My review is no different.  When I received it, it was basically one giant block of Zagnut.  I've spent the past 2 months cutting pieces off from time to time.  It still tastes great, but I have to treat it like a giant block of cheese.

When I received this product it was poorly packed in a thin plastic package and included in a box with a couple of other products. As a result I got a bag of peanut butter and coconut crumbs that were smashed together and inedible. I ended up throwing the entire $10.00 package away. This is the first bad product I have received from Amazon, normally everything is packed and sent with much consideration. Why this was not packaged in a cardboard container when I receive other items double (and sometimes triple) packed I will never know.

I am definately hooked on this fudge and now that I am about to make my 3rd order, I am so grateful that you all ship to APO.  This is the highlight of my day when this package arrives here in Afghanistan.  Thanks again!

it would have been good only the expiration date was over due by about 10 months
but the dog loved them anyway they should really keep an eye on those dates for sure
Marielle

Summary: Dried chicken strips made in China
Text: Due to all the publicity surrounding the questionable quality of dried chicken strips from China, I have thrown out this order (it is not worth the money to return it).  I will not be reordering them.  I will only be ordering dog treats made in the USA.

This product arrived on time and it was in perfect condition. My dog loves these, she has a really sensitive tummy and these don't bother her at all.  I would buy this product again and I would order from this seller as well.

The reason I buy on Amazon is the price. I can't find this product anywhere else cheaper. BIC does a good job in shipping, and I am
pleased with the service, product and life in general.

I have 2 dogs, and they love these. One of my dogs is choicy and he barks when he wants a treat. If I give him the wrong one, he ups the barking. When I give him this, he gets down to chewing. He chews the coating off first and eats that.

My three dogs love these. I usually give each of them one when our puppy displays the need to chew. He is teething and these have been great!! It also occupies the three of them for a long while as well as calming them down. They love all of the flavors!
My 4 year old Cocker has one a day at about 5:30Pm. He will not take any other treat, he loves them and that's good enough for me.

My kids LOOOOOVE these!! Especially my 3 year old who is pretty severely autistic. It gives him great oral sensory input since they are so chewy! We don't have them in our stores anymore so I'm glad we can get them here! They aree made mostly from fruit, not corn syrup like most of the other types of fruit sticks. They are a little sticky but that's why they come in the wrapper, you just move it down enough to take a bite. I highly recommend!
I love these snacks. They're delicious and hit the spot when I'm craving something sweet without all of the fat!!!

These taste great compared to other fruit snacks, are good for you and easily portable (for lunch on the go.) Plus with Super Saver Shipping, they currently cost even less here than at our local 99-cent store.

The 2009 review mentioning that they are hard to open and a sticky mess is not accurate in my 2011 experience. In fact, they are a little stiff and best when warmed in your hand or pocket a couple minutes.

Why not 5 stars? A little small for an adult (maybe eat two at a time). Made in China. A lot of plastic in this box -- 12 bags containing 6 wrapped sticks each.

I used to buy Fruit by the Foot or Fruit Roll-Ups, but being both high in sugar and expensive I wanted to find an alternative. After trying several fruit snacks out there we settled on Florida's Natural Au'some Fruit Juice Stiks, 68% Fruit Content. The sugar content is still not the best, but definitely better than what we had been buying. Also the price per piece went from as much as .36¢ each to just .13¢ each when purchased through Subscribe & Save. My kids really enjoy them and I do too.
these fruit sticks have fantastic unbeatable flavor! soft chewy,not to sweet,not to tart.my kids asked for more! plus these have vitamin c! these are healthy for anyone who eats them,also delious!!

These are a pretty good price per treat, and they taste decent. However they are nearly impossible to get out of their individual packaging and by the time you do, you're covered in sticky mess. Even if you eat them in just two bites, they melt in your hand causing even more of a nasty sticky mess.  I persevered through the first bag, but threw away the rest after the second bag revealed the same results.

Summary: My wife and kids HATE them
Text:
In BIG LETTERS on the front of the box it proudly claims,"Made from AMERICAN grown fruits".
On the back of the box and on the individual "stiks"(where it's almost illegible) it states,"Made responsibly in China"*.

I'm not sure what the process is. Is the fruit grown in the U.S. and shipped to China for processing and then shipped back to the U.S. ? [Doesn't sound very responsible to me.]

Maybe it's all the miles those fruit stiks log but whatever the reason, they taste awful.

We're going look for similar products with fruit grown here and processed here even if we have to pay a bit more for the product.

*Is that according to U.S. or Chinese standards ?

I read the other reviews and really looked forward to trying this tea. It was every bit as good as the other reviewers said. The smell is strong in the tin, but mild when brewed. The mint is still pronounced, but the chocolate is subtle. Really love this tea and will continue to stock it as long as Amazon and Republic of Tea does.

I wasn't sure if I would like this tea because I was prepared for the overwhelming taste of chocolate. This tea has the right mix of chocolate and mint. It leaves you with a very refreshing taste in you mouth. Very very nice. I am glad I tried this one.
I got this at Jungle Jim's last month and I love it. It tastes like hot cocoa mixed with mint. Wish I could find this more local.

Summary: Great Mellow Chocolate Mint Flavor, Beats All The Rest!
Text:
I picked up a tin of Republic of Tea's Peppermint Chocolate today at a local store, not knowing what to expect. I've been in the market for a new favorite tea lately and had been trying countless varieties without much luck... everything just tasted too bland, or too strong, or just kind of "off" in general. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised with the balanced taste of this peppermint chocolate tea.

The mint flavor is definitely present, but quite mild in comparison to many teas (think Celestial Seasoning's Peppermint Tea). Surprisingly, you can also taste the chocolate in this blend as well which is a problem I've had with other things I've tried recently like Guayaki's Mate Chocolatte. That's one of the things I really enjoy about this particular brand... no one flavor buries the other.

Don't expect to take a sip of this tea and be reminded of hot chocolate though! It's nowhere near that rich of a chocolate flavor, and I'm glad for it. It makes for a nice cup of tea after a meal, and reminds me just enough of my favorite mint chocolate chip desserts to make an impact... and better yet, no fat or calories! If it's not sweet enough for you after brewing, it tastes pretty good with a little bit of Stevia added in my opinion and it'd probably be good with a little bit of cream added as well, although I don't think this particular blend needs it.

Best of all, many of Republic of Tea's blends are Rooibos based which is a fantastic caffeine free tea chock full of antioxidants that are good for your body and help ward off illness.

If you're bothered by the price it's possible to find this tea in stores a little cheaper, although the availability in your location may vary. I found mine at a World Market store for $10.99, which I first thought was still a bit steep... but upon tasting the tea and realizing that (unlike Zhena's Gypsy teas) this tin is sufficiently air tight which will allow me to reuse the tin for my loose leaf tea purchases in the future, I find the price to be quite reasonable.

I'd definitely recommend this tea to anyone who enjoys chocolate mint, and for long time tea enthusiasts like myself who are looking for something new!

This has become part of my night time ritual before I go to bed.  I love this tea.  I add one packet of Sweet n' Low and it's perfect.  The mint isn't overpowering and the chocolate flavor isn't too sweet or too bitter.  I will definitely be ordering more of this tea in the future.

I picked this up at my local health food store where they have loads of tea. While I normally don't like tea from bags, I LOVE this and have been drinking it more than my other teas lately. Without milk and the slightest bit of sugar, it ends up tasting like a healthier, more natural version of when one puts a candy cane in hot cocoa (come on, you know you've done that! :P)

Also I've found I can get 2 uses per teabag! Yes, the second cup is a little weaker but not unbearably so. Woo, 72 cups! :)

Summary: You'll either like it or dislike it
Text: This tea stands out to me as a tea you'll either like or dislike. The aroma and taste is enticing. For me I first tasted the chocolate - a good-tasting chocolate! Next I tasted the mint - not too strong, that's good too! Then, to my surprise after I drank a few more sips I tasted vanilla. Vanilla, to my knowledge is not in this tea - but I DO taste it, and like it!! So....it must be that the blend of this tea can cause a possible interaction on ones palette that resembles a tastes of vanilla (At least in my case). I like the tea, but not love it!  It's unusual and might take a glass or two, or a cup or two. of getting use to. On the other hand my son did not like it at all. So...........that's why I say "you'll either like it or dislike it". Only your taste-buds can let you know for sure.

This tea is so yummy! I was a little bit disappointed in the taste when I had the tea without milk, but with milk and some splenda, this tea tastes really good! The tea is chocolatey with a hint of peppermint that is just right. It is like a dessert without the calories. My only disappointment is that I wish it had caffeine, which I personally like in all my teas. Will purchase again!!!
This wasn't very chocolately tasting, but it is still pretty yummy. The mint definitely makes it for me. I would probably buy this one again.
Very enjoyable tea and I am a coffee drinker but may switch teams after tasting this tea. Satisfies my sweet tooth after dinner with a little splenda and milk.

Summary: Great Tea - Buy on Amazon as it can be difficult to find being a "seasonal" tea in retailers
Text: This tea is a great treat - even for those who don't normally drink tea I would recommend giving this one a try.  Great flavor, doesn't taste a bit like one would think of when they think "tea".  Great smell, reminds you of winter holidays.  This is difficult to find in many stores unless it's October-December timing so Amazon may be the best and easiest place to purchase this tea.  I've tried many Republic of Tea flavors and this one is a continuing favorite.

I have been on a hot chocolate kick since the holidays, a calorie-rich and caffeinated habit I didn't particularly want to continue. I saw this tea in the store and was skeptical. How could tea taste like chocolate? But it does!! Of course, it is not as rich as hot chocolate, but with a bit of 2% milk added, it's a darn good substitute. And caffeine-free!

Summary: Hill Science Diet Dry Puppy Food
Text: Have fed our Siberian Husky this food since she was old enough to eat solid food and she still eats it just fine and is in beautiful condition.

We have a 8 month old LabraDoodle and he loves this food. Prior to trying this food we tried several other brands, a few times Raja ate the food but threw up a little later. Even on the Science Diet brands we tried other variations like "Lamb Rice" formula and he did not like that at all. He would rather stay hungry than eat other food. There is something about this "original" formula.

One note: make sure you keep the food in a sealed box, in cool dry place, as per instructions.

Might be the best waffles ever!  Good apple flavor.  I made a topping to go on them using canned spiced apples.  Put the canned apples in a sauce pan with some spiced rum, brown sugar, butter, and apple pie spices to make the topping, then topped with whipped cream.  Was a great Christmas breakfast with some patty sausage.  I will be buying these again.

I don't know if I would eat this for breakfast because the sugar high would probably leave me twitching until lunch, but good stuff as desert or a snack. They taste much better than I thought they would, and are more than just "reminiscent" of a sugar cookie like many poptart flavors.

Not much of a poptart fan overall, but I do dig these. I have never attempted to eat both tarts in the package though so take caution if you plan to scarf them both at the same time. I can totally see a sugar crash if somebody ate these with no "real" food in their system. I don't even want to imagine what a toddler or adolescent would be like on a sleeve of these suckers for breakfast.

Well I was excited to order this product because I can't find sugar cookie pop-tarts anywhere but I was extremely disappointed when they came because I had ordered two sugar cookie poptart boxes  but I only received one box of sugar cookie and one box of gingerbread of which I don't care for. Will never order this product again.

The Sobieski is "the Best of the Best".
The 1 compared to to the 14th, Grey Goose that is all hype and BS marketing made for those with money and no taste!

Summary: Raisins great Seller not so much
Text: I first tried Champion raisins on a breakfast buffet while on vacation, they are softer, and more juicy than the brands our local store sells, so I have bought them at Amazon before. This purchase arrived in a padded mailing envelope, and one of the sealed packs,(each containing six small boxes)had been torn open, presumably to fit everything into the envelope. I would not trust eating food when the wrappers have been removed, no matter what the reason. It just got worse, the raisins had set someplace on the shelf,and were not as plump,and juicy as I remembered. Got to find another source !

Last week we bought this product to replace "PediaSure" powder for our 2 year old. Out of three times our baby had this he threw up thrice and yeseterday's was the worst as we had to run to urgent care and spend 4 hours there. Finally as his system has cleaned up, he has stopped throwing up. Initially we thought the root cause of something else and now we are pretty sure it is because of PediaSmart powder. We are done with this product as we are not going to give this to our baby anymore.

I just found this stuff and have been giving it to my 2 year old who isn't the best eater. We had no problem switching from the regular pediasure to this. I read the last review and have had no issue at all like he explained with his child. My son has never thrown up on it or been sick. I'm just glad to give him something more natural that doesn't contain all those unnecessary ingredients.
If you are trying to do a Paleo type diet and are having trouble finding grass fed beef locally this could be a great option for you.  I had no problems with my order and the steak was great.

Do not buy grass fed beef from Australia or other countries where we only add to the carbon footprint by importing foreign grass fed beef. America has some of the best beef in the world, and Rocky Mountain beef sells for the same price as upscale grain-fed beef, with a better flavor and a healthier content. I recommend ordering over $200. of beef- try the ground beef as well- as you save on shipping. It arrives frozen and stays fresh in your freezer until use. Excellent customer service.

Pop.Secret is excellent popcorn; I had purchased a case of it; popcorn is actually healthy for you; I had purchased the homestyle brand / these are the large bags not the small individal or I guess they call them family size...Great Price / Great Product.

I give this to my 5.5 month old chihuahua puppy. He really loves this and eats all his food. He seems very happy with his food. In fact one of my cats also enjoy trying it. My dog seems to be thriving on it.

I won't comment on the price because that can change. We all do our best to find deals and bargains.

This food is wonderful. I used to buy cheap, grocery store stuff and tried this on a whim. I'm so glad I did.

My dog is a little older and is missing some teeth. Since he is a shih tzu he also throws up from time to time after eating. (Do all shih tzus do this, mine has since birth) Anyway, this food seems to cut down on the incidents. The pieces are very small and easy for him to chew.

It's good for him, a great size for my little dog, and I will continue to buy it.

My dogs have been using this food for many years.  My 14-year-old and 7-year-old chihuahuas are very healthy and they like the food.  My 7-year-old dog has been on the mature adult diet since he was a puppy, since my older chihuahua needed a senior diet to keep her from having trouble  with her liver.  Science Diet is the best!

Summary: A few tricks necessary to get my dog to eat it, but worth it!
Text: I cook chicken livers in the oven, use a thumb-sized morsel with hot water to coat the whole doggie dish and put a dollop of tuna fish on top of a big handfull of Science Diet.  Superb!  He loves it!  He's 11 and feisty as a pup.  Feed him small meals four times a day.

My puppy is a Boxador (Boxer/Lab) and she loves this food. In fact, the first time I brought it home she was jumping on the bag trying to get it open. I have read many reviews on Science Diet in general and they have not received the best reviews for some odd reason... but, my dog has not had any gastrointestinal complications and loves this brand of dog food. It's a keeper for me... not to mention it is reasonably priced.

Summary: My Puppy Loves It and Thrives On It!
Text: My puppy has had much better success tolerating and thriving on Science Diet compared with pricier "all natural" brands...you know...ingredients that people would also be happy to eat.  But she is a dog, not a human and so if ground up chicken beaks are one of the fillers, but she is healthy and happy, I don't worry about it period.  At the shelter where I got her they sell Science diet for half the price of what it is available elsewhere...gotta go get some more.  Why, because my dog loves it and is healthy and happy and seeing is believing.  Cheers!
The product is fine - we buy this dog food anyway, but we found it's cheaper for us to buy it right in our home town.

I had been using this food mixed with the canned science diet for my lab puppy (because that is what the shelter had used), and didn't have any issues.  However, after reading the other review, I asked the manager at a local pet food store what he thought of this brand, and he said it was NOT good - all fillers (corn) and animal by-products.  He suggested I gradually shift the dog to Blue, which has a similar protein/carbohydrate mix, and then when the puppy is a bit older (around a year), move to a food with a higher protein content.  (To ease the puppy into a new diet, he suggested I start by mixing 1/4 cup new food with 3/4 old food for a few days, then half and half, etc).  He also recommended that I mix in a couple of tablespoons of canned food with some water, just to make the dry food moist.  (He said the nutritional content of the canned food isn't as important, since the dry food will provide most of the substance, and that I can vary the canned food.)  Finally, he also said that bully sticks are far better for dogs than rawhide (which are basically like eating leather).

Please do your research on pet foods and what is actually good for your dogs.  Hills science diet is a horrible food filled with horrible ingredients.  They charge an outrageous price because it's the #1 vet recommended food.  This is a joke and the only reason why it's rated #1 buy vets is because Hills gives money to soon to be vets to help them go through school.  Then they sell the dog food to them cheap so they can jack up the price and make a nice profit off of your marketing foolishness.  Read the back of the labels of Hills brand and you will see that most of the top ingredients are grains or cheap meat by products which are the feathers, bones, unwanted organs from animals, basically all of the stuff we wouldn't eat.  i would recommend going to [...] and compare brands and see what is right for you budget wise. try something like orijen or evo.

These are the only treats my Yorkie will eat.  First introduced by her vet at a ridiculous price.  They keep her teeth super white and she never has doggy breath. I only rated 4 stars because they're not made in the USA.  I get 5 packages through Amazon for the price of one at the vet.

Toy Poodle loves the chews. She stands in front of the kitchen cabinet until we give it to her every evening. The vets at the practice we take her to always comment on how clean her teeth are and for the Toy Podle breed that is unusual. We credit it that to her chew habit.

These Scottie Dogs were a gift for my daughter who is "gluten free" and was craving licorice.  This is the second time I've ordered them for her.  She "loves" them and ordering was easy and delivery quick.  Highly recommended.

Scottie dogs. SCOTTIE DOGS. These are truly delicious treat, putting Red Vines into shame. My six year withdrawals from these things was well worth the relapse, as these are truly hard to find. Thank you amazon.
Since being diagnosed with Celiac disease the one candy I missed the most was Licorice.  Both the black and red scottie dogs are very good.  My whole family loves them.

I think these taste just like I remember!!! I am addicted!!! LOVE THEM!!! I have been gluten free for 6 years now and I have totally missed the licorice that I use to have. I am sooo thankful to have these cute Scottie dogs as a delicious treat!!! I first found these at Rehobeth beach!!;)

I love the Gimbals Red Licorice Scottie dogs I purchased from Candy Crate.  The price per pound was less than I paid from another source and the purchase qualified for free shipping.  I'll be back...........for more when my supply is gone!

Summary: These don't even taste like licorice these were awful
Text:
I KNOW EVERYONE HAS DIFFERENT TASTES BUT THIS DIDN'T EVEN TASTE LIKE LICORICE !!!

I love licorice and I am always up to trying something new but this was an expensive mistake. I read the reviews and thought these would taste pretty good. But if you like red vines,twizzlers and Aussie brand than chances are you will not like these. Don't waste your money!!!!

I have even tried to give these away and as soon as people try one they are not interested.

I don't like leaving negative reviews but if I can save someone time and money this would be the perfect item to do so with.

Summary: Nice flavor but a bit pricey
Text: I bought this on a Lightening Deal. The flavor is good but I wouldn't pay regular price for it. The flavor is similar to Celestial Seasonings Vanilla Chamomile, which is what I normally drink.

Summary: Simply put - the best dark roast I've had
Text:
I received this as a gift. I love dark roasted strong bodied coffee. That's the only kind of coffee I drink. My first cup was brewed in a small french press. The aroma was succulent. It didn't have the acidic aroma some compare to cat urine (my wife, a non-coffee drinker). The smell was potent, in a good way. It filled the whole downstairs with the small 2 cup press.
The taste was something delightful. Very bold in flavor with zero acidic flavor that I have grown accustom to with other dark roasts. There is a great nutty or woody background flavor with this coffee. Add a touch of cream to really bring out the nutty overtones. I have always been a Colmbian fanatic until I tried Café Altura's Peruvian Dark. Though this is beyond my regular budget. I will get it occasionally for a treat.

This coffee is fantastic. Great, bold flavor with very oily beans. This is the first Altura coffee I have tried, but I will definitely be going back and trying the different types of beans they offer. Can't go wrong with the Peruvian dark.

This coffee is one of my favorites especially when the bag is freshly opened; however, it takes a while to go through two pounds of coffee. It looses some of the flavor over time, but regardless it remains pretty darn good. I just wish I could find a way to keep it really fresh. I have tried freezing it in an airtight zip-lock bag, refrigerating in an airtight zip-lock bag, and storing at room temp in an ceramic airtight jar. Regardless, this coffee is a amazing (especially when brewed with a french press), and I highly recommend it.

This was a shot in the dark but I liked the description and the price so thought I would try it.This coffee is full and rich. It gives me a little acid stomach if I drink too much, but I will buy from this company again and try a milder one. The flavor is so good.
Love this coffee. Great flavor, not bitter. These beans are the prettiest beans I have ever seen.
my husband and I have been drinking this coffee for about a year. It's full bodied and rich. And amazon's subscribe and save program makes it very affordable. Plus, we never run out of coffee!

Summary: Wake up, Wake up, Wake up
Text: Ok if you like very mild coffee, please dont bother.  But if you like a cup that is going to jump start your braincells in the morning, try it.  Next week Amazon is going to send me the 5th batch of this (I subscribe) and just in time too.  I use my Rancilio to make 2 double's before I go to the office in the morning and it is very good. Not as burned as Starbucks but has a kick to it.

This is a good, well rounded java that has a nice smoothness. The flavor is okay, but not really distinctive. I would buy it again, especially to mix with a medium roast, which is what I am doing now.

Summary: Great coffee & easy on my stomach
Text: We've tried many of the other Cafe Altura coffees, but this one is our favorite. It's a darker coffee with a very smooth flavor. It's also very easy on my stomach and doesn't seem to be as acidic as other dark coffees. I've added this one to my Subscribe & Save list to be delivered every month!

This is a very good cup of coffee for those seeking a French Roast.  It is full-bodied, slightly dark but not bitter or burnt.  I have been searching for a good french roast and tried several Cafe Altura varieties and found this one to be my favorite. Very satisfying coffee, even better than the Cafe Altura's Sumatran.

I really like this coffee.  I live in a rural location, so, finding less popular kinds of coffee has been more challenging, until now.  This is so easy.  2 days later, and it is here.  This is good Peruvian coffee that seems low in acidity, and has a nice flavor.  Thank you!
When I first opened the bag it was almost too rich/dark... After a few days it mellowed out slightly and is one of the best beans I've used with my Brevelle Espresso machine.

Let me start by saying that I used to live in Seattle and traveled the worlds to acquire a taste for both good and bad coffee. After some experimentation, my favorite use for these beans is iced coffee - a simple espresso shot with ice loaded, then cold water poured in to fill the cup. The dark flavor comes alive this way in my opinion. The espresso shot is good, but I have tasted better. Drip coffee is okay, but Americano works better. For some reason, I can't pull full flavored latte - doesn't seem to pair too well with milk (ref. Starbucks or Gaggia Intenso works great).

Note to self: buy these on sale, but not at regular price.

I read the review on this and decided to try it instead of the French roast that I have been buying, but found the flavor not as robust as I would like.  That said, I have cancelled my subscribe and save on this Peruvian Dark and moved back to Cafe Altura Organic French Roast.

I am somewhat of a coffee snob.  I tried many different kinds, flavors, strengths, brands etc.  This coffee is just strong enough to really give you that jolt in the morning without being too bitter.  Perfect balance.  When you open the bag up, the coffee beans are still wet from their natural oils.  The aroma is strong.  I keep it in a pyrex container which is inside of a ziplock bag to keep the beans fresh.  Every weekend we grind enough coffee to last us throughout the week.  I tried the french roast but didn't like it b/c it was too bitter.

Simply put we are picky coffee drinkers who enjoy a nice dark roast coffee in the morning to get us going. We take our coffee black, without any sweetness, so we know when the coffee is good & when it isn't worth drinking. While this coffee is pleasantly balanced, without unwanted bitterness or acidity, it does lack some depth. Cafe Altura's Peruvian Dark Whole Bean coffee is not THE BEST coffee we have ever had, but it is a DARN GOOD cup!
We are happy to support, "Organically Grown Under Shade Trees & Family Farm & Fair Trade Grown." We like it very much, indeed, enough to enjoy Amazon's subscribe & save feature. Cheers!
Has a deep flavorful taste w/ bright overtones. You get a heady aromatic smell as you grind the beans and it transports the earthy dark roast without the bitterness. It's a great morning coffee

Summary: Smooth, dark, complex organic whole bean coffee from a great company
Text: As a regular drinker of Altura's Cafe Altura Organic Coffee, Biodynamic French Roast, Whole Bean, 32-Ounce Bag for two years, I was looking to try something different. I found the Cafe Altura Organic Coffee, San Francisco Blend, Whole Bean, 32-Ounce Bag to be too light and found the earthiness of the Café Altura Organic Coffee, Colombian Dark, Whole Bean, 32-Ounce Bag a bit off-balance. Then I tried the Peruvian Dark: strong but smooth, rich chocolate tones, and bright aromas. The beans are slightly less oily than the French Roast, and the acidity of this coffee is very low. If you love dark roasts, you will look forward to waking up each morning to this brew. This is also a wonderful deal on Amazon for high quality organic.

This coffee is the best I've found so far and I LOVE that it's organic. I was using Major Dickason from Peet's Coffee, but this is less expensive AND organic and just as good or maybe even better. I got it to use with the Aerobie 80R08 AeroPress Coffee and Espresso Maker and it's perfect. I was going to give my boyfriend a sample to convince him to switch from Peet's but I was afraid of running out. 2 pounds is a lot of coffee but apparently I go through more than two pounds of coffee in a month!

I should mention that I ONLY make coffee with the AeroPress, and they say that coffee made that way is smoother, so while I have compared this coffee to other coffees made the same way I don't know how it'd be in, say, a drip coffee maker.

We get a shipment of this regularly, because we MUST be well-stocked at all times.

It has a deep, rich flavor with complex notes. The acidity is low, and while the beans are oily, it's in just the right way.

I have yet to find a burnt bean, as well! You can tell there is some love and care that goes into the roasting of these beans.

We will buy these beans for as long as they continue roasting them!

Good for the environment (dio-dynamic shade-grown)
Good for the farmer (fair trade)
Good for you (delicious, fresh, strong, flavorful)

What's not to like?!

I decided to try this coffee despite some of the bad reviews.  I LOVE Cafe Altura's French Roast. It is wonderfully rich and smooth and so good that I crave it.  This Peruvian Dark smells wonderful but tasted like it had been sitting on the warmer for an hour or two. To me it tasted burnt. It was bad enough it made me feel sick to my stomach and couldn't drink more than 1/2 cup.  Maybe if you use a flavored creamer it would be ok, but I don't like cream in my coffee. Altura makes wonderful coffee as long as you pick the right flavor.  This wasn't the flavor for me.

Summary: Coffee was really good until the batches got bitter-tasting
Text: My wife and I ordered this coffee several times until July 2011 when the batches started tasting bitter.  We really enjoy dark roasts with strong, robust flavors in the morning, so when I saw this coffee, we decided to try it out.  Some initial bags were quite good but got somewhat bitter as new bags were delivered monthly.  We stopped delivery after a really bitter batch.  We now drink an expresso roast from Costco/Kirkland/Starbucks.  Three stars for good initial bags, but got inconsistant roasts down the line later.
This coffee is an excellent buy. It is as good as starbucks coffees. It tastes great. I enjoyed it.

A very good flavor and no bitterness at all.  This is the first organic grown coffee I have tried.  I usually buy Starbucks Sumatran or expresso beans, but thought I would try something new.  I was not disappointed!  I have bought the Sumatran version of this organic coffee and was even more pleased with it.  Nice earthy flavor without bitterness.

Cafe Altura's Peruvian Dark is a wonderful coffee for those who love rich, flavorful coffee.  The beans always grind evenly and have a consistent flavor pot after pot.  I'd recommend this to anyone.  Love it!

Cafe Altura Organic Peruvian Dark Coffee Beans;
My only question about this coffee is: Why does anyone buy any other coffee?
Well, no I do have another: If it is coffee, what should we call the other so called coffees?
The coffee is smooth. Not very acidic. Great Taste. I drink my coffee black with about 1:3 ratio of coffee to water. Worth $20-25.

This is some of the best coffee I've ever had. It is rich yet balanced, full-flavored but has numerous subtle hints of "je ne sais quoi".

I highly reccomend this to coffee affectionados.

Great product.

Bought a French Press coffee maker for my husband which requires trying the hundreds of different coffee beans available to find just the right blend.  He tried several, which were okay, and then I found this great deal of Cafe Altura Organic Peruvian Dark coffee on Amazon.  Figured I would try it to see if he liked it - which he did.  Think he might just stick with this brand for awhile. He likes strong coffee with a robust flavor, and this blend makes him happy in the morning.

I'm generally a little leery of single beans for espresso, but this makes a really good shot with a nice crema and excellent flavor. Amzon had a sale on it a couple of months ago and I tried it and was pleasantly surprised, tastes similar to southern italian espresso. I use a pretty good machine and grinder but the shots are uniformly good and low acid. there are some chocolate overtones to the flavor. One of the nicer coffee's I have tried

Coffe was delivered very fresh. That's good.

The taste? Meh: Not too bad, not too good.

You can do a lot better for the price.

Summary: Flavorful coffee, not for automatic espresso machine though
Text: The beans are extremely oily, so you should not be using it with an automatic espresso machine as it clogs it. The coffee is very rich and flavorful. I used Keurig coffee maker, it took some time for the water to drip through the oily coffee, but it was worth waiting. Recommended for regular coffee makers.
This coffee has a good taste.  It is strong, but that is what dark coffee is!  Large size bag. Purchased through deal of the day and am satisfied with the product.
For a dark roast, the Peruvian Dark coffee is very smooth - no bitterness or excess acidity.  Excellent flavor and aroma.

I've bought this coffee for year. It's great! At time ist has been difficult to find and I am so glad to see it here on your website. Well worth the time and money.Cafe Altura Organic Coffee, Peruvian Dark, Whole Bean, 32-Ounce Bag

I got this coffee for the first time when Amazon had a lightening deal, offering it for $13. When I opened the bag, it smelled so freshly roasted! After brewing, I was amazed how this coffee is seriously dark and strong as it stated! I didn't need to grind as much as I use for other coffee to achieve strong taste, yet this coffee is never acidic or bitter. Simply wonderful coffee for strong coffee lovers like me!

Summary: Ground and brewed this morning for the first time
Text:
Let me start by saying it was very good but... I wouldn't exactly call this dark roast. I have been drinking Italian Espresso roast and this didn't have the body that I expected. I will certainly drink it up and enjoy it, maybe even mix it in with the espresso beans.

And darn it, why can't these manufacturers make these bags reclosable??

Summary: Affordable, deep rich flavor, and organic
Text: I've ordered dozens of dark coffees and tried them all in both a Cuisinart 12-cup machine and a glass vacuum pot. The flavors, the oil content, and the bitterness differ dramatically based on how dark coffees are brewed. In the Cuisinart, you get a darn good cup of coffee for a autobrew system... but it will never taste the same as the same coffee brewed in a vacuum pot. This Peruvian Dark, done in the Cuisinart, has some light bitterness (as others have complained about...), a moderate oil content on the top of each cup, and the flavor is good-to-great. In the glass vacuum pot with water run through a Brita, it's the greatest coffee I've ordered and our favorite for winter mornings! No bitterness, a complexity that makes you savor the flavor, and a smell that fills the house. Use a coffee mug with a thin lip - Starbucks sells several. Like wine, you want it to spread across your tongue and open up all the flavor you can get out of it. I recommend this coffee, especially if you're going to brew it in a way that optimizes it's flavors!

Summary: It's good (but hoping the price stays low)
Text: I have been drinking this coffee for at least a couple of years.  It's a strong-tasting coffee, which is just what I like.  It's not the BEST coffee I've ever tasted (I'm a major coffee snob), but it's good, everyday coffee, and the price is right for an organic coffee (especially with Subscribe & Save).

Summary: If you thought Machu Pichu was amazing...
Text: ...wait until you taste this coffee.  I used it in my espresso machine and was truly wowed by my first cup.  Special thanks to all those importers in Ojai who figured out how to import a great and responsible coffee bean.

I wanted an organic coffee to try so I thought, based on the reviews, I would try this!  To my surprise, the reviews were right!  It has to be the best coffee I have ever tried.  My husband has been buying roasted coffee from someone locally that everyone raves about.  He tried this coffee and he says it is way better than the locally fresh roasted coffee he has been getting.  Every time he has a cup, he says "this is excellent coffee".  We've been buying it for a year now and I'm getting pretty tired of him saying that, but, he is right!  We can't use the 2 lbs up very fast so we freeze most of it in glass jars and just take it out and grind it each time we make it.  It stays tasting great to the last bean!

Summary: Just right for your everyday bean
Text: Sense memories evocative of one's childhood are just too strong to fight against. Such is the strength of the delicious aroma that greeted me when I ground my first sample of this bean. It took me back to my six-year-old self waiting in line with mother at the A & P, smelling the grind of the eight o'clock beans that were being pulverized in that giant red machine.  Have I had better coffee in my life? yes. Did I pay much more for it? also yes.  However, this is the best I can find for this price point. For me I like a dark aromatic roast, a healthy long shelf life, and a coffee that will stand lingering in the pot for over an hour, in case I forget about it, and not turn into bitter motor oil sludge. For these my three critical desires in a coffee; this coffee is the perfect "everyday" bean.

Summary: Excellent organic coffee at a great price.
Text: I have have been getting this coffee for the last couple of months and love it.  I have also gotten a family member hooked on it as well!

I use a percolator and this is very good coffee! Our nanny agrees. She makes it just right for me each morning (I can't seem to make my coffee perfect each time, but she can).

It tastes best with sweetened condensed milk. I highly suggest you try it with sweetened condensed milk!

Cafe Altura is yet to disappoint me.  Another excellent bean & roast from this coffee roaster.  As always quick/consistent arrival from amazon, its available under subscribe & save, which reduces the price.
great coffee and at a great price, as an added bonus you can feel good about buying it.

I absolutely love Cafe Altura Columbian Dark.  I buy about 8 pounds a month.  I saw the Peruvian and decided to try it.  I thought that it was awful.  I made one pot and will probably throw the rest of it away.

Summary: Peru Dark beans are Good tasting, but High acidity "Really" upsets my stomach!
Text:
I like the rich flavor of these beans, but I can't stay out of the bathroom with their High acidity!

Their Sumatra beans are my 2nd favorite, but their Low acidity agrees with me!
Cafe Altura Organic Coffee, Sumatran Dark Roast, Whole Bean, 32-Ounce Bag

Summary: Good coffee at a fair price but not impressive enough to reorder it.
Text: My title pretty much says it all. I feel that this is good coffee at a fair price but I wasn't impressed enough to reorder it. I will try something else in my next order.

Was hoping for a darker, richer roast.  Ground it fine, coarse, brewed it with 3 kinds of water and still couldn't get it strong enough.  Very smooth and drinkable (hence the 3 stars); just not the dark coffee I'm looking for.  My bag did weigh in at a full 32 oz (32.5 with the package.)

Summary: I see all the rave reviews, but I have to bash it...
Text: Dark roast is its own league...the amino profiles of the beans change considerably.  But with that said, I've had high altitude dark roasts that were much better.  In fact, this coffee STINKS when you open the bag and sniff the beans.  I ground it coarsely and used a french press...poured in about 20 seconds...and guess what...it still doesn't smell good.  Drinking it black, it's smooth, not bitter, but flat on the palette.  I don't understand all the rave reviews...this coffee sucks.  I'd rather drink pre-ground maxwell house that's been sitting around for 30 minutes (yuck).  Maybe you can cook with it (in caramel since its not bitter, maybe) but I wouldn't bother drinking it...it sucks.  There is considerable crema and oil...but the taste is flat.  I also ordered Lavazza (Tierra) for moka "espresso" but it brews up better than almost every other bean I've tried.  Also Cameron's Organic "toasted southern pecan" coffee really surprised me (I don't like flavored coffees)...I love it.  Save your $$ and avoid these beans...get a brazilian dark roast instead...

I am not too sure why it is the case, but the coffee seemed not fresh and having been roasted quite awhile ago. I am not sure if it is adistribution issue or the roaster's fault, but I was not really satisfied. It is the first time I try ordering coffee from Amazon.

Summary: Exactly What I Was Looking For
Text:
These ity bity kernels of crisped rice are exactly what I was looking for. And thank goodness they were because they are the only thing I found that looked like it might be what I needed on the whole interweb.
I would have liked more product shots. Something to show the scale, so I could be sure what I was getting before I ordered. But, it worked out.

Summary: The Smell Alone is A Treat!
Text: I can't get enough of these roasted coffee beans. They're probably one of the best that I've ever had. They taste so smooth and delicious. But I can predict that they would be a delight just by looking at the beans. And when I started to brew myself a cup, the aroma was priceless! It's such a good smell, the one that makes you feel cozy inside and out. If you love coffee, then you really shouldn't be missing out on these beans!
The most tasty medium roast coffee that I have tasted so far! The perfect blend and the best part is, it's organic. Definitely a must-try!

So I had tried the ground coffee Nicaragua Gourmet Medium Roast, Ground Coffee; Organic, Mountain Shade Grown, by Kilambe Coffee (Private Reserve) and it was pretty good so I decide to give the beans a try... This stuff is amazing! The beans are definitively the way to go to preserve freshness and make sure every cup is great. I highly recommend. :)

Summary: The Original Acetum Balsami Glaze - BLAZE
Text: This is a superbly delicious, sweet and tangy glaze.  I use it on all kinds of salads in conjunction with Caroli's Basil Infused Olive Oil (Amazon, please stock the latter!).  It can also be drizzled over all manner of savory appetizers served on a white platter for a stunning visual effect.  Blaze offers other flavors such as fig, chocolate and strawberry for dessert lovers, but this, the Original BLAZE is, in my opinion, their best and most versatile product. Enjoy, I promise you won't be disappointed.~~~  Trish O. in Phoenix, AZ.
Great balsamic glaze.  It does contain sugar, but that gives it the delicious flavor.  It also has a nice thick consistency, so it kind of oozes over everything.  Great on tomatoes and mozzarella!

I picked up a large bottle of this stuf at Costco for a killer deal a couple of months ago. It is FANTASTIC! Layer sliced tomatos with basil and mozzarella and drizzle this on top...utterly amazing. I looked on Amazon and found several types of Balsamic reduction/galze, and unfortunately the Blaze is only in small bottles. I ordered 2 small bottles and I also ordered a different brand from Italy. Blaze is much much better. The other one doesn't taste bad, its just not as good.
I think this stuff tastes just like a very good bottle of aged balsamic, with a touch more sweetness and a gooey consistency (not honey gooey, more like watered down syrup gooey)...just enough to stick where you drizzle it.

FANTASTIC flavor...cant' say this enough.

The other brand (although highly spouted on Amazon reviews) tasted a bit yeasty for balsamic, and also contained other things like red wine vinegar in the listed ingredients...Blaze does not.
Wow, worst tasting balsamic ever. So disappointed in it. Tastes like pure sugar. Will probably end up throwing it away.
This glaze is the best, we use it on everything. So convenient to use and adds a whole new dimension to cooking.

After 60-some years, I qualify myself to attest to the nature of peanut butter. I love peanut butter. Smooth or crunchy? ... either is fine. I've made my own peanut butter in the blender. I've sampled peanut butters from Africa, Europe, Australia and Asia. They are all interesting and every country seems to have its national favorite. I picked up a hankering for peanut butter sauced spaghetti in China. The g-kids love it, the wife and kids ... not so much ... it's the concept of peanut butter that I appreciate.

In the US we have the giants of peanut butter ... Jif, Skippy and Peter Pan (JSPP). Some stores carry a designer peanut butter brand at a premium price. In the end, the consistently barely discernible difference among JSPP is marginally irrelevant. Does anyone say `I hate Jif but love Skippy?' No. JSPP at the lowest price delivers the commodity equivalently. I would doubt that a blind taste test could discriminate among JSPP.

In the US market dominated by JSPP, Planters just seems to appear as a butter out of peanut land. I don't think I have ever seen Mr. Peanut on a peanut butter jar before (or, I could just not remember). Was this new? Was it `different? Well, here's what the Planters web site says:

"Peanut butter had some growing up to do. And as the reigning peanut experts, who better to make it happen than Planters? After all, isn't it about time for a more sophisticated peanut butter?"

Taste test result:
1. Planters is smoother. It rolls of the butter knife without tearing a hole in the bread.
2. I taste and smell more concentrated peanut flavor.
3. Planters doesn't tend to clump and hang off the uvula requiring milk to resolve (although milk is certainly my recommended choice for beverage pairing).
4. In my 'blind taste test', Planters wins. It is a noticeably better taste and less mouth desiccating.

Decision:
Planters has something different to add to the grocery landscape of JSPP. 5-star good peanut butter and my new first choice (if the price is right).

p.s. My wife, out of the blue, said "Hey, that peanut butter you got is the best peanut butter I've ever tasted!" ... that's a "wow!" vote.

I tend to gravitate towards "natural" or "homestyle" peanut butter, free of sugars and other additives, but I could not pass up the opportunity to try Planters Creamy Peanut Butter. I was shocked to discover a bold, super smooth, fresh roasted peanut taste, more robust and subtle than sweet. I had to exercise some self-control, in an effort to avoid eating an entire jar in one sitting.

Here is a complete breakdown of nutritional value and ingredients:

Serving Size: (32g) 2 tbsps
Calories: 180
Fat Calories: 140
Total Fat: 15g (23%)
Saturated Fat: 2.5g (13%)
Trans Fat: 0g
Polyunsat Fat: 4.5g
Monounsat Fat: 7g
Cholesterol: 0mg (0%)
Sodium: 150mg (6%)
Total Carb: 8g (3%)
Dietary Fiber: 2g (8%)
Sugars: 3g
Protein: 8g

INGREDIENTS:

Roasted peanuts, sugar, *hydrogenated vegetable oils (rapeseed, cottonseed, and soybean oils), salt

*One note: the label does not indicate whether the oils are "fully-" or "parially-" hydrogenated, which does make a difference -- "partially-" being the dreaded trans fats.

Overall, a super tasty peanut butter that will compete with any other brand out there. My only deduction is for the added hydrogenated oils and sugar, which, although a nominal amount, is still unnecessary. As I mentioned above, I prefer the unadulterated peanut butters out there. But Planters Creamy will definitely satisfy even the most finicky of eaters, and make the perfect compliment to any jelly.

Summary: Now that's some TASTY peanut butter!
Text:
Since peanut butter preference is in the mouth of the beholder, I'll sum up what I liked about this Planters brand:

(1) There was no oily aftertaste. In some variations, the oil separates from the peanut butter and makes it taste strange or look "sweaty" but I didn't notice that here.

(2) Planters has a very smooth consistency. Some peanut butters rip up the bread you're using or require a dental pick to remove it from your teeth because they stick like glue...Planters didn't do this.

(3) While trying other peanut butter brands, there were some that added ingredients such as molasses...I was glad to see Planters had no additional flavorings.

All in all, I enjoyed this peanut butter very much. It made several delicious PB&J sandwiches, and it's the perfect companion for a lonely Hershey bar.

Recommended!

We eat a lot of peanut butter in this house, between kidlets, people with "sugar" issues, and just plain loving peanut butter.

I also love peanuts, and will not eat any peanut but Planets if given the option.

I was excited to see that Planters had decided to market a peanut butter.

Unfotunately.... their expertise in peanuts did not quite translate to the butter form.

Pro - Smoother than any I have ever had or used. Nothing is easier to spread.

Con - It just didn't taste "right." I am not sure what was "off" to me, but it just wasn't right.

That said, peanut butter is a very personal experience, and I would recommend that anybody who enjoys peanut butter give this version a try. Perhaps your tastes will vary from mine - and that spreadability really cannot be beat!

I caught a whiff of real peanutty flavor as soon as I pulled the protective seal off of the jar the first time. Ah!!!

This peanut butter is smooth, very smooth. That is, it's not at all likely to tear up a piece of bread you are trying to spread it onto, even lightweight white bread. And it tastes great! This product may have made me a Planters Peanut butter fan! I liked the flavor so much that I found myself dipping a table knife into the jar, spreading it the peanut butter onto some bread, and then sticking the knife back into the jar for an extra dollop that I plopped into my mouth.

Oh, mentioned something about the smooth consistency of this peanut butter earlier, but what I really like is that there is no oil seeping out of the mix like I have seen in some other brands. It looks, spreads, and tastes like Planters really got the recipe right!

Here's to Mr. Peanut!

5 stars for this tasty, spreadable peanut butter!

Pleased, but surprised to received 6 jars of peanut butter.  This is a good product, I like the taste and creamy texture, which for me is the most important.  I've been a fan of another brand for many years, but after trying Planters, I may switch.

I've tried a bunch of different peanut butter brands like Skippy and Jif, as well as own-store brands. Planters is certainly tasty, and comparable to the other name brands out there, and perhaps has a bit more of that 'roasted' taste, however the difference is quite subtle.

If it's available for a similar price to your favorite brand, it's probably worth a shot, but if it's comparatively more expensive, it's probably not worth making a beeline for. It's certainly a good, tasty peanut butter brand, I was just hoping for something a little different from everything else out there.

I'd still give it 3.5 out of 5 if half-stars were permitted.

This peanut butter is good, but I would expect it to be really good, it being Planters, with a unique taste, but it tastes almost exactly if not exactly like the Wal-Mart brand peanut butter and at Wal-Mart is the same price. Perhaps they are the ones that make the Wal-Mart Peanut butter and are only now coming out with their own brand; who knows.

But if you are not shopping at Wal-Mart, then this will probably be a low priced peanut butter that tastes good, and you cannot beat that.

PLANTERS PEANUT BUTTER -- CREAMY

Peanut butter rocks no matter how you enjoy it. There is nothing in the world like a peanut butter and grape jelly sandwich on soft bread, washed down with a tall cold glass of milk. Another favorite is celery sticks loaded with peanut butter. How about an apple cut into crisp slices and dipped into peanut butter? Or homemade peanut butter cookies? And the best ever -- a toasted English muffin, slathered in peanut butter and topped with honey? The list goes on and on -

Planters Peanut Butter is simply the best I have ever had -- and I mean the best and creamiest peanut butter. JIF is good, Peter Pan is good, Skippy is good, but Planters is THE BEST. Undeniably the best peanut butter I have ever had. The consistency of the peanut butter is so smooth and creamy. Your bread will not tear while you are spreading it on thickly. The taste is so full of peanut goodness and flavor. The smell? Divine!

The packaging is bright and eye-catching, with good old Mr. Peanut tipping his hat to you. By the way, Mr. Peanut was created by a grade school boy, Antonio Gentile, in 1916. He has been changed and updated over the years, but is still the same and easy to recognize peanut he has been for all these years. Planters was established in the early 1900's by an Italian immigrant, Amedeo Obici, in Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania. The company and their products have been around all this time due to their excellent and quality products.

I had my 30 year old daughter blind taste test for me today. I put a dab of Planters on a cracker, a dab of my former peanut butter on another cracker. Hands down, Planters won. She loved it. She wanted to take my jar home, but no way, honey, no way. Mommy isn't sharing this stuff!!!! Wellll -- maybe I will share since VINE was kind enough to send six 16.3 ounce jars instead of the one promised. Wow, what a great surprise!

This peanut butter is excellent and should be in your pantry as a staple. If you are a peanut butter lover - and who isn't? -- this is the stuff for you!

Thank you.

Pam

Summary: Everyone has a favorite peanut butter, and this one might be a contender for yours.
Text:
Like most of the people selecting this product for review, I have a long history with peanut butter and a definite preference in brands. But in recent years I've been stepping out on Jif because it is so processed and sweet, so I was delighted to review Planters creamy.

My mom was the real peanut butter lover in the family. She believed that it was its own food group, one that needed eating each and every day. She also believed that peanut butter toast was a viable choice for breakfast, lunch OR dinner. In fact, as a kid I saw and heard so much peanut butter consumed that for most of my childhood years, I refused to touch the stuff. But a high school boyfriend wooing me with impromptu pb&j picnics got me to eat it, and I have it probably once a week, now.

I think the taste quality of this is very high; very peanutty and not as sugary as most standard creamy brands. It tastes great with jam on toast, but isn't quite as strong in a sandwich, probably because of that lack of sugar to amp up the flavor. It's a more grown-up taste than Skippy or Jif, but still much more processed than the naturals that require stirring and tear up your bread (I like those too, don't get me wrong).

As I said, I've been buying all kinds of brands for at least five years, so I am no longer a brand loyalist who is going to make a big switch. Price will probably be a big factor my buying decision. But this is a quality product that is very delicious to eat.

Almost without noticing, I'd stopped eating peanut butter in recent years. Perhaps because I'd often combined it with some delicious but rather unhealthy jelly.

I tried this product and it's won me back. The Planters peanut butter truly is creamy--not pasty and dry--and tastes great even by itself. Great for a quick, healthy pick-me-up, easy to have just a spoonful... or two....

Altogether: excellent. Highly recommended.

The taste of Planters Peanut Butter reminds me of the taste of "Peter Pan" from 20 years ago. The Creamy is simply that, creamy. There is a good, but not overpowering peanut taste, also it is not too sweet tasing either.  Its interesting the copy said that Vine members would be sent one 16.3oz. jar to try, I was sent a case of 6(six) jars which will be enough to last me quite a while. Kraft has done a good job with this product and it will be interesting to see if it can compete with the other brands on the market.

I bought Planter's creamy PB since I'm a big fan of their packaged roasted nuts. I was hoping to find a tasty peanut butter from Planter's as well, but this product just tastes bad. First, it looks really shiny in the package. It does spread well, but it's so oily--and I'm not talking about the natural variety either--that it slides off the sides of the bread. I suppose this might be related to the fact that hydrogenated vegetable oil is the third ingredient on the list.

Second, this peanut butter leaves a bitter aftertaste. It doesn't really taste right. I had to take a drink of water after every single bite to get the piece of cinnamon raisin toast I experimented with down. It wasn't the cinnamon raisin bread I used either because I have bought the same brand--Sunmaid--for years.

I do believe I will be sticking with my usual brand of peanut butter from here out. I've never had an issue with Jif, the brand I typically buy, tasting bad. It's too bad because the price was really good on the Planter's brand.

I've been a Skippy Creamy peanut butter consumer for many decades, and I decided to give Planters Creamy Peanut Butter a try to see whether it might be preferable. Here are my observations:
1. I was unable to differentiate the taste of the two products in admittedly unscientific taste comparisions. Both are a pinch too sweet.

2. Ingredients: Exactly the same (though the proportions are not specified).

3. Health: I'm not a nutritionist, so I'll just quote a comparison per serving (2 Tablespoons) from the two products in the following categories: Total Fat: Skippy: 16 grams, Planters: 15 grams. Sodium: Both 150mg. Saturated Fat: Skippy 3 grams, Planters: 2.5 grams.

4. Price: I was unable to make a reliable comparison on amazon.com. Had hoped there would be two competing offers for six 16.3 oz jars, but no such luck. I'm going to check at my local (NYC) supermarket and see if there's a difference.

Bottom line, I'll probably be guided by price, since in the other categories the differences were too minimal to be much of a consideration.

After Planters released this peanut butter, I wanted to try it. As a fan of Jif peanut butter for years I was eager to try this. Peanut butter doesn't last long in our house.
Planters peanut butter delivers taste and consistency. The smooth and creamy spread is full of roasted peanut taste. It is not too sweet and not too salty, just right. As a cheap source of protein and a go to lunch staple, Planters will be in our pantry from now on.

I'm an active guy and I have a ridiculous requirement for calories and protein. The Planters Creamy peanut butter provides just this in bulk. Of course, like most other modern peanut butters, the Planters variety is an unnaturally ultra smooth spread with unnaturally ingredients (partially hydrogenated oils). If it was natural, there would be some texture and I'd have to mix up the oils and peanut goodness every time I wanted to make a PB&J. As is, I can just plop a clump of this beige yumminess right down on my homemade bread, add some unnaturally sweet jam, and voila! I have a quick meal, and most importantly, calories. If you're on a budget and can't afford the real stuff, this will do, but don't expect ideal health after consistent consumption.

Summary: PB is PB, so let's talk about something else
Text:
For me, peanut butter is peanut butter. I put it on wheat toast every morning and that keeps me from being hungry until lunchtime.

So... let's talk about the packaging. I hate the packaging! I'm so tired of trying to hack my way into products like mayonnaise, cereal, cream cheese and now, peanut butter. I speared the protective foil cover with a knife and then tried to tear it off. The adhesive is so strong that I just can't get that last rim of it off the jar. So, the PB makes a mess every time I draw the knife out of the jar.

Sounds petty, I know, but I don't need another morning hassle. My house brand is just fine with me, thank you very much.

Lovely smooth texture, not too sweet, and yummy aroma!  This is all-star peanut butter!  It makes great cookies, fabulous sandwiches, and is excellent on apple slices and carrot sticks.  I find it complements warm and cold foods equally, and the packaging is easy to open.

This is REALLY good peanut butter.  I've been buying a different name brand forever.  I like this one at least as well and will happily buy it in the future.  It has a great peanut taste.  I've now tried both the creamy and chunky varieties and really like them both.

I like Planters Creamy Peanut Butter! Also thought I would only like crunchy since I love peanuts. I never had even tried creamy. Love the taste and how smooth it spread on my toast. Very glad I tried it.

Since I was only supposed to get one jar (Vine Program Reviewer) and ended up getting six jars, I made my monster cookie recipe. The cookies contain peanut butter, chocolate chips, oatmeal and M&M's. Planters peanut butter flavor came through. Better than the previous brand I used. Will buy Planters from now on.

This peanut butter has a good, peanut taste. But too much sugar has been added. It's too sweet for me. Looking at other peanut butters, most of the popular ones do seem to have a lot of sugar. But this one tastes sweeter than the others I have tried recently in comparison. And that, to me, is not a good thing.

My household has now eaten a jar of Planters creamy peanut butter and deemed it to be slightly lighter/smoother (i.e. a less-dense paste) and slightly more peanut-y than our current favorite, Jif. When it came time to open a new jar, we chose another jar of Planters.

The ingredients (including hydrogenated oils) and Nutrition Facts for Planters are similar to Jif. The Planters package is a bit smaller (16.3-oz vs. Jif's 18-oz) so watch the price. Also watch the expiration date -- mine arrived in September with a best-by date of November. The bottom line is it's a "me too" product alongside numerous others on the grocery-store shelf.

For many years I've been buying Skippy peanut butter, and found it better than pretty much anything else I tried. Even the natural and organic bands I found lacking in comparison. So when this came up on Vine I was skeptical, but gave it a shot. And I'm glad I did. Both my wife and I like Planters Creamy more than Skippy, and my wife was raised on it. Planters has a deeper peanut flavor, with notes of a somewhat darker roast than either Skppy or Peter Pan (which we don't really like but got for the sake of comparison). The planters isn't quite as smooth as Skippy, but that's not really a detriment to enjoying it. I prefer the somewhat more robust texture of Planters. The flavor, whether on its own or in a sandwich with butter and strawberry jam, is excellent, intensely peanuty, with very good mouthfeel. We haven;t tried it in any recipes yet, but we're looking forward to doing that too. Altogether, Planters is a surprising improvement in a category we thought was a settled matter. It's our new go-to peanut butter, and highly recommended.

Summary: Spreadable and aromatic, but lacking vitamins
Text:
Compared to popular brandd Peter Pan, Jiff, and Skippy regular creamy, the Planters creamy seems to have very comparable fat content as well as sugar and sodium contents. However, it only shows 4% iron, while the others had other vitamins listed, so compared to the others, this one has the least vitamin value.

It is by Kraft foods. I haven't noticed any amount of flowing oil in the container... just very spreadable peanut butter. It has very pleasant aroma, although I enjoy all the others as well.

Here is what it says on the label for those more meticulous about nutrition facts:
serving size 2 tbsp, servings about 14
Calories 180, Fat Cal 140
Per serving DV:
Total fat 23%
Cholest 0%
Sodium 5%
Total carb 3%
Protein 8g
Iron 4%

Ingredients: roasted peanuts, sugar, hydrogenated vegetable oil (rapeseed, cottonseed, and soybean oils), salt

Enjoy this whole pound (per canister) of peanut butter. :)

This Planters Creamy Peanut Butter is great.  Very smooth texture and good flavor.  It does seem a little sweet to me but then I usually buy the crunchy kind of peanut butter.  My family also enjoys this, including the granddaughter.  Good buy.

This is one of the better peanut butters out there, particularly if you aim is to have a nice, consistent spreadable peanut butter. It is smoother in this regard than Jif.

However, Planters is a bit saltier. Since I use little salt on food, it my be my own preference, but compared to my favorite (again, Jif) Planters is a bit more salty. I think this may have something to do with the "robustness" that people report with this particular peanut butter - think salted peanuts. Jif, on the other hand, tends to be sweeter, and thicker. Simply Jif has even less salt, and uses Molasses as one of the sweeteners - which I really like. But these two peanut butters are otherwise worlds apart.

It does have a nice, fresh taste that separates it from some other brands on the market. It is definitely a 4-star peanut butter - I would give it a try.

Summary: A real winner -- with true roasted peanut flavor
Text: I grew up with peanut butter being either Skippy or Jif, and truly had no idea it could be this good. Not too sweet, nice roasted peanut flavor, and no added sugars to worry about. My family has really taken to this peanut butter in a good way, and ordering it in bulk like this through Amazon truly makes it even more affordable. Two thumbs up for Planter's Peanut Butter!
That's some excellent peanut butter. Smooth and creamy texture, spreads easily, good roasted peanut flavor. Not too sweet or too dry. Just right!

So I hated peanut butter as a kid. Even the smell used to bother me. Somewhere along the way though I started liking nuts in general and then peanuts. Even now I won't chow down on a PB sandwich or anything. But I do like it in homemade cold sesame noodles. I use it other dishes as well. If this seems like a narrow catergory to base a review on, it probably is. That said, since I'm pretty particular about PB and the taste in general, I think this is one of the better ones I've tried. There are some I just can't abide at all.  My kids seem to be far less judgmental in regards to PB and have accepted this without comment either way. When prompted, they said it was fine but didn't really seem to notice the difference. One did say it was saltier than the usual ones, maybe that's why it seems good for cooking for me.

Summary: Very good - I've my new peanut butter
Text:
I am a big peanut fan, and a big peanut butter fan as well. So I was excited to see my favorite brand of peanuts try their hand at peanut butter.

To my delight I was not disappointed at all.

Unlike a lot of bigger name peanut butter this doesn't come across as really sweet. Rather it's a much more smooth, almost refined peanut butter. It's perfect on toast and even more perfect on that PB&J.

If you are a peanut butter fan then you really need to try this. It has the Planters name and Planters quality.

How wrong can peanut butter go, really? I'd think a major company would have to work at peanut butter to make it terrible, so you know with the name Planters attached, the hope is that this peanut butter will actually taste like their famous dry roasted peanuts and not "just" peanut butter. And that's the weird surprise: when you first taste it, that "dry roasted" flavor isn't so strong, but it comes on a little stronger the more you chew your sandwich. And sure enough, it really, really does taste like those great peanuts we all love.

Also of note is how soft and creamy the peanut butter is. It's supremely spreadable even on the softest bread. Consider me and my family very impressed after a week with the Planters peanut butter.

Summary: A solid contender against my family's favorite brand. Good peanut butter.
Text:
We are big peanut butter fans in our household, dedicated to our favorite brand Skippy Peanut Butter, Creamy, 16.3-Ounce Jars (Pack of 6)|Skippy Creamy, which we've been eating for years. As a fan of Planters Peanuts, Salted, 1-Ounce Bags (Pack of 144)|Planters Peanuts, though, I was eager to give this a shot. It's quite good.

I ran a taste test in my family, having them blind sample peanut butter of each brand. Interesting, my husband and son came up with different answers as to which tasted "more like peanuts", and my son (who is 14) misidentified which sample was from the brand he has been eating for years. Both found both peanut butters quite good and could not pick a favorite.

I agree with my husband that Planters has a stronger "peanut" flavor, though I think that Skippy has a stronger flavor overall. I think Skippy has a far more powerful scent. In terms of texture, both were beautifully creamy. There may be a little bit more oil in the Planter's peanut butter, but it did not impact the flavor. The Skippy is higher in fat (and calories).

This is definitely a product that I would buy, and my family (who have rejected other brands) have demonstrated that they will consume it happily.

***
Edited on November 1 to add that it is a major annoyance that the design of the bottom makes it all but impossible to extract all of the product. The texture around the base defies knives. Downgraded from 5 to 4 stars accordingly.

Summary: I wish I could give it 8 stars
Text:
I was delighted to have the opportunity to review this peanut butter, because I happen to be a bit of a PB addict. I consume a lot of it. Planter's has entered this market with a bang, in my opinion. This is some of the best-tasting PB I have ever had. It has the peanut taste without the bitterness and without the sweetness that some other PBs include.
