It does not have an overwhelming aftertaste, which I think is a good thing. The texture is extra-creamy, which makes it very spreadable (and spoonable) and easily swallowed. You don't feel like you need to wash it down. This is yummy stuff!

I did a label comparison with the PB I have been buying for years, which is a low-fat creamy style. Interestingly, Planters has fewer calories, fewer carbs, and more dietary fiber - more fat, of course, but not a huge amount.

Guess what - I have a new peanut butter. Nice job, Planter's!

said my daughter at breakfast this morning. Normally, we are Skippy fans, but this definitely has that traditional Planters taste, and it's so smooth it spreads very easily. This means little ones can make their own sandwiches---hurrah!

A side-by-side comparison with Skippy shows that Planters has all of the same ingredients in the same order: roasted peanuts, sugar, oils, salt. Skippy is slightly higher in total and saturated fats: 25% and 15%, vs. Planters 23% and 13%. Everything else is pretty much equal, although Planters does have an extra gram of protein (8g).

Having said all that, I am shopping based on my wallet more than my tastebuds these days. Right now, Amazon has Planters listed at nearly an extra buck a jar (for a six-pack), so I've knocked off a star. It's good, but probably not *that* good. If you see it on sale or have coupons, grab it; otherwise, you're probably just fine with a cheaper brand.

Summary: Planters enters the peanut butter fray
Text:
To me, Planters creamy peanut butter is not that different from brands like Jif and Peter Pan. It's creamy (as advertised), thick, probably loaded with too much sugar for its own good, and delicious if you like this All-American food. Planters peanut butter may have a slightly more nutty taste than its competitors, but not by much. Also, at 16.3 ounces, this jar of peanut butter is not too big or too small; it's just the right amount in my opinion.

As a testament to how good Planters peanut butter is, I purchased it at the grocery store after receiving it via Amazon's Vine program. I suppose Planters didn't necessarily need to flood the peanut butter market even further, but another good brand to choose from doesn't hurt anybody.

This peanut butter tastes good & has a very creamy texture. I like that my peanut-butter loving child loves it. I love that it has 1 gram more of protein per 2 Tablespoons of peanut butter than the Jif creamy peanut butter that we currently buy. It really is creamy stuff-yum!

We are pretty particular about our peanut butter brand. We are willing to use store brands for many things, but peanut butter has to be one of the top brands, and we're leery of trying new brands. But, we have always chosen Planters when it comes to snack peanuts. So, there was no hesitation for us when the opportunity arose to try Planters peanut butter.

- Quality - I would definitely equate the Planters quality to the other top brands of peanut butter.
- Texture - Planters Creamy is very creamy and smooth.
- Taste - I was surprised to taste this and find that, apart from texture, I might as well have been biting into a spoonful of Planters peanuts, probably with a leaning toward the honey roasted flavor (one of my favorites). The "purity" and cleanness of that flavor definitely causes this peanut butter to rank very high in my book.

My husband and I actually liked the Planters better than our typical brand. When tasting it by itself, all of my kids preferred our typical brand, but when eating the Planters on sandwiches and crackers, they said it was great and that they couldn't really discern major differences that would cause them to prefer one over the other.

I also use peanut butter a great deal for cooking purposes. I made granola bars with the Planters, just to see if there was a difference. The butter, honey, and peanut butter mixture was somewhat creamier during boiling, but there was no real quality or taste difference in the final product.

I'm not sure that taste alone would entice us to switch to Planters simply because there is not a significant enough difference. But, if in price comparison we found Planters to be less expensive, even from one shopping trip to the next, we would readily purchase the Planters instead of our current brand.

Summary: If you like creamy peanut butter, this is the real deal.
Text:
So when it comes to peanut butter, there really isn't much to review. The taste of this product is great, the creaminess is also there. So far, it has spread very easy on the different types of bread we use.

All in all, I will probably purchase when I run out.

I don't know what the old Planters was like but this is delicious.  It has a good peanutty taste without a lot of extra sugar and salt.  The nutritional value is pretty much what you'd expect from peanut butter - with most of the calories coming from fat (140 of 180 caloires per 2 Tbsp.  But one tablespoon goes a long way!

Summary: Tastes Good, Wish It Wasn't Hydrogenated
Text:
This peanut butter had a great aroma and very pleasing taste. It has minimal sugar, salt and oil and the creamy texture was perfect.

My only disappointment was that the oil used was hydrogenated soybean oil; that means I have to be careful not to share it with my soy-intolerant friends and it mars my otherwise excellent record of staying away from unhealthy hydrogenated oils.

I'll start off by admitting that I'm not incredibly picky when it comes to peanut butter. Tastewise, Planters is very comparable to the major name-brand peanut butters (Skippy, Jif, Peter Pan), and tends toward the less-sweet end of that spectrum (Jif, for example, I find to be somewhat sweeter than the Planters).

From a consistency standpoint, I'd say Planters is a bit smoother than most of the major brands, and significantly smoother than store brands (Aldi, Kroger, Walmart, etc....I find the big difference between name brand and store brand peanut butter is the consistency/texture, rather than the flavor). So it spreads more easily and is easier to eat off a spoon, for example, than the store brands.

I don't think the difference is life changing, so I'd probably make my judgment mostly on price, but I do think this is very good peanut butter, so if you are picky with respect to taste, and especially texture, this is good stuff.

Finally, my wife made a batch of peanut butter cookies with the Planters, and we could tell absolutely no difference between cookies made with Planters and cookies made with the Aldi store brand. So for baking, I'd go with whatever is cheapest.

Summary: Good taste and texture but don't care for the hydrogenated oils
Text: This peanut butter is what one would expect for the brand: good peanut flavor and nice creamy texture. However, upon reading the ingredients list I noticed it had hydrogenated oils so I don't think in this day and age one should consume that. There are plenty of other peanut butter options out there just as good but without funny ingredients.

Summary: "Kraft Food With Planters Peanut Butter Will Give The Others A Run For Their Money"
Text:
Distributed by Kraft Foods Global Inc we have "PLANTERS CREAMY PEANUT BUTTER" (16.3oz), packed with six jars, which Amazon sent my way through the Vine Program.

* 1st -- This is a very creamy and smooth product, which is on the plus side.
* 2nd -- The quality is certainly up there with other brands, maybe a little higher. Just unscrew the lid and take a whiff and smell fresh peanuts.
* 3rd -- Most importantly is the taste, with a flavor that will satisfy your taste buds, nuff said.

Reminds me of my days growing up with all the good natural foods that Grandma use to serve.

My Grandchildren Tommy and Ava live with me and my wife (Judy), we gave it the taste test
with our regular brand and Planters passed with flying colors.

Each member of my family use this with snacks, on celery, apples and of course Peanut Butter and Jelly Sandwiches,
so we gave it the works and Planters came up a Winner!

In closing - My Entire Family - Highly recommends.

I found this peanut butter very disappointing.  It's *okay*, but I much prefer Jif.  We did a taste comparison.  Jif is significantly sweeter and gives you that yummy sweet and salty peanut butter taste.  This is not sweet like that at all, not even a little.  The planters does have a much stronger taste of peanuts and it is much smoother.  I think it's the molasses in Jif that makes a difference.  This peanut butter does not have any.  This tastes more like Skippy to me.  In the end, it's a question of taste.  Do you like your peanut butter sweet or do you like it to have a stronger peanut taste?  My husband and I did not care for this, and we will be buying Jif instead.  One good thing I did notice is that Planters has 10 less calories than Jif, 1 less gram of fat, and 1 more gram of protein.

Summary: little bit on the sweet side
Text: Nice spreadable consistency, good flavor -- though a bit on the sweet side for my taste -- nice basic peanut butter.  I compared the nutrition label to that of a jar of Adams No-Stir creamy that I had and was surprised to find that the Planters peanut butter was lower in calories and sodium than the Adams.  The carbs were a couple of grams higher per serving but this has sugar added to it while the Adams does not.  The added sugar makes this peanut butter sweeter than what I am used to but overall a good-tasting product.

I wasn't a huge Peanut butter fan but I usually force myself to eat it when I work out and dont have time to cook. I saw Planters on sale so I tried it. I don't know why but it's so much better! I only buy this brand now...I'm eating it as I type, nom nom.

This peanut butter is indeed very delicious and creamy. I use it in cookies, eat it on sandwiches and with apples. It tastes as close to shelled peanuts as you can get from a jar. I'm not sure if it is the oils but there is a slight aftertaste though.

i would think one of the larger companies that specializes in a variety of nuts would have exceptionally good peanut butter.  the problem i have is one that other reviewers address and that is added sugar, oil and salt.  personally i don't believe peanut butter should have sugar and/or salt in it at all.  with all the variety of peanut butters out there, certainly some taste better than others, but basically peanut butter is peanut butter.  i'll stick to the brands that just have peanuts for ingredients.  but everyone's taste is different and by these reviews, many like this brand.

I was in the grocery store today and was going to buy JIF, but after
seeing the price, and ALSO seeing that the Planter's Peanut Butter
was on sale, I decided to give it a try. All I can say is....
mmmmmm!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Very good and not as sweet as JIF, but a
very tasty peanut butter at a very reasonable price. It was
on sale 2 Jars for $3.00, I am going to have to go back to the
store to stock up!!!!

ProfileName: Leah M. Brown "Leah Marie Brown, Author"
Text: I thought this peanut butter was smooth, creamy, and had just the right balance of nutty flavor and sweetness.  It spread easily and mixed and melted well when I made peanut butter cookies.  I would put this as one of my new favorite peanut butters and would buy it over Peter Pan.

Summary: So Creamy and Smooth, Great for Baking as Well as Sandwiches!
Text:
I haven't had Planters for a while but I've always loved their roasted peanuts. I like how subtle the taste of Planters is, not overly sweet and strong the way Jif and Skippy are. I haven't had creamy peanut butter like this in a long time. Even the smooth version of Jif tends to clump, but not the Planters one - it's amazing easy to spread on bread. I also used half a cup of it for a chicken with peanut sauce recipe, and it was ideal. Because it's so smooth, it creates the perfect batter.

Thanks to Amazon Vine's generosity, I received 6 whole jars. However, my joy turned to disappointment when I saw that the expiration date on all six jars is November 11, 2011. My guess is that Amazon was trying to get rid of back inventory and decided to give it to Vine reviewers. I know peanut butter doesn't spoil easily, but most jars are dated at least two years ahead. So I'm tempted now to use up the butter as fast as possible. Oh well...

Well, this is nothing to write home about, if you are used eating Skippy of Jif or something like that then this is just fine, that's why I gave it a 3 out of 5 stars instead of less, the reason for possibly having gone lower than a 3 is as follows.  There was no nutritional information or ingredients listed on the Amazon page so I had no idea when I ordered this that it contained hydrogenated oil and added sugar, making this a peanut butter that we will not get again as we try to avoid both of those things, there is no reason why peanut butter needs to have anything other than peanuts and salt in it.  I guess I would have hoped the first name in peanuts would have been smarter about making a peanut butter and gone with a natural one instead a sugar laden, transfat containing (less than 1 gram so they don't have to list it) spread.

Summary: Very good taste, but the heath concious beware
Text:
I taste tested Planters creamy peanut butter against two other brands of PB I have on my shelf. Skippy, Natural-SuperChunk and Smuckers's Natural Chunky. I separated out the peanut chunks from the chunky versions. The Planters was much smoother-almost buttery and slightly sweet. The others were grainy and thick. The Planters seemed to melt in my mouth.

On the down side, the Planters contains "hydrogenated vegetable oil". The label does not indicate "fully" or "partially" hydrogenated vegetable oil. This is an important distinction, as partially hydrogenated vegetable oil will contain trans-fat, but fully will not. Trans-fat has been implicated in heart disease (New York City has banned its use in restaurants). The Planters label says 0 trans- fat, but legally, the manufacturer is allowed to list 0 grams of trans-fat if the total amount in a serving is less than .5 grams. Therefore, until the manufacturer clearly labels the oil as 'fully' hydrogenated oil, eating this peanut butter every day might not be a great thing for your heart.

Incidentally, the natural peanut butters I mentioned above do not have hydrogenated vegetable oil listed on their labels (but the Skippy, due to having palm oil in it, has 5 percent more saturated fat then the Planters-not good either!).

There are so many brands to choose from when it comes to peanut butter, but when I see the name Planters, I know it's a brand I can count on. I mean who doesn't associate peanuts and Planters?

Overall, Planters Creamy peanut butter is very creamy and I was very impressed at how easily it spreads onto bread. There was no clumping or oil separation and this tastes great on sandwiches or as a spoonful right out of the jar. It's not as sweet as other peanut butters, which many may prefer.

I do have to agree with another reviewer who was disappointed that the oil used was hydrogenated soybean oil. This means the oil was treated with hydrogen gas to increase shelf life and change texture, which also elevates your "bad" cholesterol and lowers your "good" cholesterol. Be sure to watch your intake of trans-fats as the American Heart Association recommends consuming less than 2 grams a day.

Let me just say that this tea is about average. I feel like the tea wasn't made to high standards, but then you have the fact that they're whole leaves. I think this creates a weird situation where you have a bad product of high quality. I'm a supertaster, so I will describe the product as best as I can. It has your typical oolong bass notes, but the higher notes are very grassy (sometimes oolong is sweet, bitter...etc etc etc, this is grassy). It has a fair balance between bitterness and boldness. Incase you aren't gathering what I'm trying to say... it's a very neutral flavor and doesn't really 'wow' me at all. The grassy flavor taste exactly like wheaties cereal (no frosted).... and that sounds stupid but when you try it you'll instantly make the connection.

So, in conclusion it's a plain tea that I won't really hold up high on my tea shrines, but it does have one last unique quality. It taste odd, but I can't stop drinking it. It's like raman noodles... you never say "man I can sure go for some raman", but when you are actually eating raman you make sure you eat every last noodle. It's like that.

12/10/11 EDIT: After drinking a few of these, I can say that it's a great tea to drink without anything added. I normally add sugar to most of my teas in some way or another (honey, sugar, guava), but I find that this tea is actually really good without anything added. I'm not going to officially change my 3 star rating, but I am tempted to bump it up to 4 stars.
Sent this gift to mom for mother's day and she loved it!! I was very happy it arrived on time and she really was happy that she was surprised.

This is a fine maker, in the top five, if you see it in the store. BUT you must make sure they will take it back if the mustard is badly stored or dated and tastes dead.

Go for Fallot if you need to buy on Amazon.

This coffee is absolutely disgusting....just buy generic instant coffee and it will taste the same.  It even sounds like instant coffee in the pod when you shake it ( like big dry chunks.}  If you like dunkin' donuts coffee or donut shop coffee....this is NOTHING like it!!

Summary: Bought 4 boxes, what a mess, total garbage - no stars
Text: I reviewed the single box, as well as this two pack. My wife thought something was wrong with our machine, as it spurted, burped and coughed on these pods. There is so LITTLE coffee inside that the coffee comes out in the first 10 seconds and then it fills the cup with hot water. Hello? Grove Stand? You can pull these from the market now. My wife's quote - "...the worst coffee I ever tasted".

DON'T BUY THIS! If you want instant coffee, get a bunch of Starbucks Via packets, at least that stuff tastes good for instant coffee. This tastes like that horrid stuff in a jar that you mix with hot water. It's a waste of time and a waste of money. I did call Amazon about it, and they refunded my purchase price. (Thank you Amazon, you always stand behind your products!) Save yourself the trouble, and just pay the higher price for real K-Cups. You'll be glad you skipped this awful stuff.

Summary: A terrible thing to do to a Keurig
Text: I was shocked to find out that this is just "instant coffee" in a K-cup. The flavor is bad and does not do a Keurig justice. Additionally, it fails to work properly in my Keurig. It always delivers only a small amount of coffee after initiating the brew cycle and then a second brew cycle has to be initiated to get the remaining coffee from the K-cup. I should have investigated this coffee more carefully!

Summary: worst instant coffee masquerading as a K-cup
Text: I picked up a box of this coffee at Wal-Mart.  Thought the K-cups felt rather light when I put one in my machine.  The second it started brewing I knew by the smell it was instant.  I felt extremely ripped off!  The Keurig coffeemaker brews coffee "instantly" so why would anyone put instant coffee in a K-cup?? I called the company and they said Grove Square was not authorized to make coffee for them.  I returned the box to Wal Mart for a full refund.  I noticed the last time I was at Wal Mart, that they are only selling this brand and the new "iced coffee" K-cups.  I wouldn't buy another K-cup from Wal Mart.  They don't carry any of the popular coffee brands and why wouold they continue to carry this inferior coffee?

DO NOT BUY THIS K CUP - IT IS INSTANT COFFEE CRYSTALS IN THE CUP.
TASTES AWFUL.
VERY MISLEADING.

These cups are simply little plastic container with coffee grounds...no filtration AT ALL.  Grounds leak out into coffee cup.  Terrible!  It almost seems like these are defective they are so bad.  One customer posted the picture of a practically empty cup after brewing next to an actual K-cup full of coffee grounds...yeah, because when you use thse all the coffee grounds end up in your cup. DO NOT BUY!

This coffee was undrinkable. In fact, it could hardly be described as coffee.

However, I contacted Amazon to complain and to see if I could return my unopened packages (I had ordered two). They responded by saying that I couldn't return food items, but that they would credit my account anyway. What fantastic customer service. It's that kind of response that keeps me coming back to Amazon for the best deals and the best service!

I expected a lot more and was completely disappointed.  I thought that there was a bitter aftertaste.  I tried several cups and continued to feel the same way.  My wife provided similar, unsolicited feedback.  I will not be ordering again.
Ordered this coffee on a whim, and really regretted it. Unlike normal k-cups, that have real coffee and a built-in filter, this appears to be nothing more than instant coffee.

As soon as I picked up the box I could tell I was in trouble, it was so light it could not be real ground coffee. It is just bad INSTANT COFFEE! (in Amazon's defense it is listed as INSTANT COFFEE in the heading, but no were on the box does it say it is instant.) I was in a hurry when I ordered... I will not do that again.

The big questions are:
1. Why would anyone put cheap instant coffee in a Keurig K-Cup?
2. Why isn't there a warning in advertising that the product is cheap instant coffee?
3. What are Amazon.com buyers thinking selling this crap?
I did not give this coffee a good review...out of all k-cups coffees I have drank (which is quite considerable), this one is my least favorite...it is like freezed dried coffee...very disappointing

I bought this because it was on sale. Half price: nice! Let's give it a shot.

It's awful. It's the old instant coffee for Keurig. Just taking the cups out of the box, you can tell the difference immediately. I'm not a coffee snob, but this is ridiculous.

Therefore, unless you simply cannot afford ANYTHING else, do not waste your $ on these.

Grove Square Coffee, Dark Roast, 24-Count Single Cup Coffee for Keurig Brewers says nothing about being an instant coffee....which is exactly what it is.  I was very dissapointed that that was not in the description.

Summary: WARNING: BUYER BEWARE! NOTHING BUT INSTANT COFFEE
Text: This product is a complete JOKE.  The K-Cups are filled with INSTANT COFFEE.  There is NO FILTER.  NO COFFEE GRINDS.  If I wanted to use a Keurig to brew INSTANT COFFEE, I would spend a few CENTS and put coffee in the bottom of a mug and use the brewer to add hot water.  I CERTAINLY would NOT spend 31 cents per cup to buy instant coffee in a K-Cup.  This was a COMPLETE WASTE OF MONEY.  I wish I could request a full refund.

Of all the coffee's I've bought, this was the most dissappointing. It's just instant coffee in a K-cup. In my opinion it was a total rip-off. Do not by these unless you are a big fan of instant coffee.

This was hands down the worst coffee I've ever had.  I bought it because Amazon had it on sale for a fantastic price...little did I know that it was going to be so bad that no one in my office could drink it.  This coffee is a waste of money and I would not recommend it to anyone.
Don't waste your money on this product unless you like the coffee grounds in the bottom of your cup.  This brand is the only one with this problem of the many brands of K-cups I have tried.

this is the worse coffee i have ever drank, i would not buy this coffee ever again,
in fact i could not even give it away, so i had to throw it in the trash,everyone in my family uses k-cups but they did not like this coffee,
I purchased this product thinking it was ground coffee.  Not so.  If you are looking for ground...look elsewhere.  This is instant coffee and not great at that.

It is instant coffee in a K-Cup, once the instant is done melting (or whatever instant does) clear water comes thru.  I opened the one I tried and it was an empty cup, not one single grain/ground of coffee.  I have such a hard time finding decent dark roast and was thrilled at this price, I didn't (shame on me) read the customers reviews.  If I had I would not have wasted my money. I am touching 60 and that had to be the worst cup of coffee I have ever had.

Summary: I'm surpise Amazon would even sell such garbage
Text: If I could have it would have had no stars. This should never have been called coffee and Amazon should never had listed it as a k-cup I will stick with the keurig site or green mountain from now on for my k-cups.
this is not a k cup at all- just shake it up- it is instant coffee in a k cup package.  more than half comes out as water!!! beware- not k cups at all - theyre horrible

Summary: instant coffee in a k cup!
Text:
This is the cheapest k cup coffee in Amazon. It taste & is an instant coffee. Dark Roast does come out dark in color & nothing else in taste, no scent of coffee in the air. Opened the used k cup & has no coffee ground in it.
40+ k cups left yet. Using the smallest Keurig cup size & brew 2 k cups for each mug.

This coffee is the worst tasting coffee I have ever had in a kcup. It really is instant coffee in a kcup. Don't buy this coffee!! We thought it was a good deal and now we know why, it is really awful. I do not even give it one star!!!
Do not buy this product!  Absolutely DISGUSTING COFFEE!!!!  Yes, it is INSTANT COFFEE!~!!!!!!!  Why would I make instant coffee w/ my $150 Keurig!  Insane!

It is bad enough that it tastes bad, but it seriously affected the Keurig coffee maker. Mine stopped working until I did all kinds of cleaning to try to get it to work again. Tried it a second time and the same thing happened - that was how I KNOW it is this coffee, not the coffee maker.

Don't buy this unless you want to risk having your expensive coffee maker break.
I wish I could return this product.  It tastes like instant coffee, and it doesn't work too well with my Keurig machine. I get half a cup and it quits mid-brew.

I thought I would purchase this product to try as it was economical.Well, I purchased 2 boxes.The K-Cups in the 2 boxes were empty. No coffee in them at all.I tried 2 cups and both just hot water,no coffee. Do not buy this product it is a rip-off.

Grove Square Coffee is not a great product.  I was very unhappy with this coffee.  It did not work well in my Keurig coffee maker.  It often got clogged, and had a poor consistency.  This product, although priced well, is not up to Amazon standards.

This is instant coffee.. After receiving 4x 24 packs and trying it i realized that the k-cup was empty after the brew.

Marketing people at grove Square pulled a good one, they call it "soluble" coffee... clever
anyone wants 95 k-cups before i toss them? (no returns on grocery items)

Amazon please add "instant coffee" to your description

I found Grovers Square at my supermarket this week and decided to try it strictly based on cost. It's not bad at all if all you have is a keurig machine and 8 bucks (for the 18 cup box)!  Plus, my kids and I love, love, love the cappaccino!  By the way, yes, it is instant coffee.... the box even says so! Read before you buy.

You get what you pay for.  I couldn't resist the price of this coffee.  It was much less expensive, but how bad can coffee be?  Try this and you will know just how bad it can get.  Just after it started to brew I noticed the "brew" coming from the Keurig was nearly clear water.  Not a good sign.  It tasted terrible, just like the old instant coffee I drank 30 years ago.  I cut open the cup, there was nothing left inside.  It was instant coffee.  Then I cut open an unused cup and, sure enough, it looked just like the instant coffee I drank 30 years ago - coffee crystals not coffee grounds.  I read the packaging more carefully, and, in fact, it does say it is instant coffee.  Well, aren't all k-cups instant?  Don't waste your money.  Horrible stuff.
Instant Coffee. I am appalled Kuereg allows this stuff to be sold! It is disgusting. Amazon should remove this from their site.

Seriously the WORST coffee I have ever tasted.  I am a huge Amazon fan but I learned my lesson with this one... READ the REVIEWS and the product description carefully!  I never would have thought that a k cup could be instant coffee so I didn't really take note of the parenthetical description but I wish I had.  Now we're stuck with 36 of these nasty things.  I even took a box to work because med students will mooch anything but even those world class scavengers won't drink this swill.  DO NOT buy this unless you are a closet Nescafe fan.
The coffee has a bold without bitterness taste.  It is very delicious. I enjoy drinking Grove Square Coffee, Dark Roast every morning.
I found this product and price the best. I know this is an instant coffee, but it has great taste. You can't beat Amazon price or service any where.

I have used this product for over a year, however I can no longer purchase at my local grocery store, therefore I order it from amazon.. I love this coffee as do all my family & friends.
Grove square coffee dark roast.,

Grove Square Coffee, Dark Roast, K-Cups for Keurig Brewers 24-Count (Instant Coffee) (Pack of 2)

Arrived Early

The site says it all. Good Price. I would do this again anytime.

Thank you

I just recently tried this brand and found it to be very good and flavorful.  I didn't find it to taste like an instant coffee at all and the Dark Roast was my favorite.  I'd definitely recommend trying it.

Summary: RIP-OFF!  NOT K-CUPS AT ALL!  INSTANT COFFEE
Text:
The company who owns the K-Cup patent is suing the company behind this item. While Amazon and many other merchants have listed as "K-Cups" they in fact are instant coffee without a filter. Yep, shake it, you'll hear that instant coffee sound.

According to a CNBC report "Treehouse does not refer to its coffee cartridges, which use a different technology, as a "K-cup," a term used by Green Mountain." A different technology? It's instant coffee - and terrible at that.

This is by large the WORST coffee ever.  It is definitely like an instant cup of water flavored with a little scent of coffee.  YUCK.  Save your money!  Now, what to do with the 2 boxes I have????BLECH!
Do Not Buy this unless you love the wonderful flavor and aroma of instant coffee crystals. It is instant coffee, not real ground coffee beans.

I have not been this incensed in a long time about a product's misrepresentation.  The primary advantage of a Keurig is not that it heats water, which can be used to make tea, hot chocolate, etc., it is that it can make real, BREWED coffee by the cup.  This product advertises itself as dark brew coffee, at an attractive price.  It is instant coffee and should be labeled as such!

If you love the old "Sanka" instant coffee from years ago than this product is for you.  However, if you are like the rest of us who like a good cup of "joe" in morning get us going then STAY AWAY FROM THIS!!  Good coffee usually urges you for more.....this is crying "no more please...I can't bear the pain much longer".  Absolutely disgusting!!

I am so upset that I didn't read the reviews first before buying this coffee.  I "assumed" all k-cups had coffee grounds inside.  I wondered why the k-cup was so light when I removed it, so I opened it ....and no grounds. This is nothing but instant coffee in disguise.  So much for a good deal on what I thought would be good coffee.  Never again.

Summary: Grove Square Coffee - Do Not Buy!  Horrible!
Text: This is actually instant coffe in a k-cup.  I was so irritated that I was sold instant coffee under deceptive practices that I informed Amazon how unhappy I was.  They immediately refunded my money and I threw the coffee out!  Maybe if enough people let Amazon know how unhappy they are they will stop selling this brand.

I don't believe that the "Instant Coffee" was designated when I first ordered this. I found this to be deceiving and a rip off. Why would I need a K Cup to make instant coffee at inflated prices?Grove Square Coffee, Medium Roast, 24-Count Single Cup Coffee for Keurig Brewers (Instant Coffee) (Pack of 2)

Instant coffee.  Make sure you stir.  first four ounces have all the coffee, any additional amount is just hot water.  bought it for the price and got what i paid for.  deceptive description avoids that it is instant coffee.

Summary: Worst coffee I have ever had
Text: After reading the fake 5 star review, I decided just to reiterate on what everyone else has said.  This is the worst coffee I have ever tasted in my life, I would give 0 stars if I could, unfortunately I was stuck with a 48 count package.  Considering I wouldn't wish this coffee on my worst enemy, I promptly threw the dehydrogenated s**t water away in the trash.  Can I have my money back amazon?

They have no filter in them, it's like instant coffee grounds every time thick mess in the bottom of my cup! Not a good deal at all! I will stick with brand name kcups from now on!  Big waste of money I would rather pay $10 more and get great coffee! I will be throwing these away, for sure!  Do not buy from this company.

dont buy this stuff, the price might seem attractive but I was so pissed when I opened the box and heard the rattling inside the k-cup, its not even packaged correctly, not filled to the top of the kcup and no coffee filter, no coffee grounds, and when using it in the Keurig machine you just get a yellowish colored watery instant coffee, not even the real thing. shame on them! I would give a negative rating if I could, they dont deserve a 1 rating.

When I saw this product on the shelf at Wal-Mart, I instantly tossed it into my cart (both medium and light roast).  I like to have a supply of different coffees on hand.  I immediately made a cup when I got home from the store.  Actually, I love the flavor.  It is easy on the tongue, and leaves the mouth refreshed.  I thought there was something odd about the K-Cup itself, different sound when shaken, and appeared to be empty after use!  I did some quick surgery on the Cup and realized that I have been duped.  While I would still drink this had it been advertised honestly, because it has great flavor, I do not care to reward dishonesty and deceptive advertising.  It seems that rather than conducting any research to find the best combination of flavors, they chose to use word-tricks and lies.  Shame on them!
I guess that I did not read the description.  It's cheap and I now know the reason.  It's instant coffee.
You should stop selling this coffee, it will ruin your reputation. I would rate it no stars, but that was not an option.

Summary: Don't waste your time or your water !!!
Text:
Bad, Bad, Bad INSTANT coffee.
Why waste the plastic.
Just run water in straight through the system into your cup.
Then dip month old cigarette butts into the water.
Stir gently.
Throw away.
The page representing this coffee has now been changed to tell you it is INSTANT coffee.
When I bought it there was no such description.
IT IS A NON_RETURNABLE PRODUCT !!
Amazon would only give me half my money back for some reason.

This coffe wasn't good at all. And it is partly my falt for not reading carefully that it was an instant type coffee. It really wasn't good at all and what a waste, I could of had a cup of instant coffee from the jar I had in my pantry. Another thing that was bad about it was that the plastic k-cup got caught in the maker every time you lifted the arm to replace the k-cup. I would never buy this again.

This was horrible coffee! It tasted worse than instant coffee! I couldn't even get through one cup!
Worse coffee ever!! If I could rate this item a zero I would!

This coffee has good flavor but it is INSTANT not ground. On the packaging they call it "soluable and microground" coffee but this is instant. There are no grounds left after brewing. I will not purchase it again just because of its deceptive packageing and description.
Save yourself some money and go to your local store and buy some instant coffee...  That is all this coffee is!

As another person noted, this is basically instant coffee.  When finishing your brew, you will note that the kcup is completely empty....much like one of the hot chocolates.  The box states: soluble & microground coffee.  I gave it 2 stars because the taste is not terrible.  It is stronger than most American instant coffees and resembles the instant coffee I have tasted while in Italy....however, it is still instant and should be better referenced in the product description.

Should have known better, if it seems too good to be true....  Then, well you know.  Bought the coffee at a reduced price and was hoping to have stumbled onto a great product.  Not the case, this coffee taste like instant.  For being a dark roast, the flavor or the lack of is extremely poor.  Better luck next time......

This K-cup is nothing but crappy instant coffee! What an insult that I even threw this money in the garbage on it! And thats EXACTLY where it went. I purchase my K-cups on autosubscribe for the extra 15% discount.....as such .....it is NON RETURNABLE. So in the garbage this crap went!
I am really disappointed for Keurig for even licensing that product for their brewers.

Buyer Beware!
This is instant coffee.  It tastes terrible.  If you don't use it shortly after you get it, the cups get hard and stuck together and doesn't work properly.  I won't buy again!

So like a lot of other reviews have said, this product is awful. I bought it due to it's price point, and after trying San Francisco bay (which is pretty decent for the price), I figured why not give another cheap brand of kcup a try? Big mistake! As soon as I opened the box and gave the cup a shake, I could tell something was strange. I brewed it on large setting, and even my keurig didn't like it as it only pushed the smallest settings worth of water through the cup. I took the cup out to see if my keurig was possibly malfunctioning, and realized the cup was empty. I peeled back the foil cover, and saw that there were no grinds, heck, there wasn't even a filter. Instant coffee in a kcup??? It completely defeats the purpose of even having it in a kcup! I have learned my lesson that for the most part you pay for what you get, and I should have spent the extra $4 to get some real kcups (Starbucks, green mountain, caribou etc.).
With all that being said, the only reason this product even remotely earns 1 star is that for an instant coffee, the flavors not the worst I've tried, but it's still instant and has that nasty instant taste.

This product is merely instant coffee in a less than sturdy cup that happens to fit Keurig coffee makers.  The product itself tastes as bad as I remember Sanka tasting in the 80's.  There is no filter in the cup and no grounds left after you run water through it.  The dark roast is bitter, not well-roasted beans bitter, but a little more like tar on a summer day bitter.  If you enjoy coffee enough to use a Keurig, spend a little more and give yourself a real cup of coffee.

because I never saw the (Instant Coffee) tag in the description. Was it there when I bought it? Not sure. All I know is that anyone who would go through the trouble to get a Keurig coffee machine wouldn't want to drink instant. Yes, the flavor is good for instant coffee, but if I wanted instant, I wouldn't have the machine. There are tiny instant granules in each pod pack, and the hot water runs through and dissolves the granules. Pull out the pod the wrong way and you get a drippy, coffee goo mess on your hands. Yuck!
It taste OK, but it is really nothing more than instant coffee.  After brewing there is nothing left but an empty plastic container.  I myself would prefer real coffee.

Summary: Grove City Medium roast Kcups, BAD to the last drop!
Text: This is the WORST Kcup coffee.  It is nothing but BAD instant. It is a real rip-off as it costs the same as the best Kcup coffee. NEVER again!

I bought a box from local grocery store, and was so disappointed! It's just regular instant coffee in a k-cup! No coffee ground in it at all! The coffee tasted even worse than instant in a jar. You could so easily put a table of instant coffee in hot water and get the same thing. I probably should read the box more carefully, but on the box it said "instant & microground coffee". There's no ground coffee whatsoever. Avoid this, and if you love instant coffee flavor, get a jar, it will be cheaper. I felt cheated.

Summary: This is a total rip off...customer beware!
Text: I was shocked when I received my shipment of this rip off instant coffee.  It doesn't even completely dissolve in my Keurig as it brews....a waste of time for a true coffee lover.  Just buy a jar of instant coffee.  They should not be allowed to sell this for use with Keurigs unless it clearly states...THIS IS INSTANT COFFEE!  It is unfair marketing and I will never again be duped by this company.

I should've listened to the reviews. This coffee is terrible. I am not sure why Amazon still has this producat available. I ordered 4 boxes and cannot even give those away as people in the office also say it's terrible.

Who would have thought you need to read the fine (and parenthetical) print for a K-cup product that you naturally assume would contain GROUND COFFEE? My somewhat paraphrased recommendation is DON'T FRACKIN' BOTHER. The resulting brew, if you can call it that, is closely akin to something you would scrape from the bottom of a 100-thousand-mile Chevy oil pan. GROSS!

Summary: Seems to jam up the machine
Text: Like many other reviewers said, it's instant coffee in a little plastic cup.  If I wanted instant coffee I'd save a ton of $$ and buy a jar, run a cup of hot water through the Keurig and plop in a spoonful.  And get better coffee.  But all that aside, something is weird about these, the second one I tried seemed to block up the machine and it quit brewing halfway through.  I won't try it again.

Summary: Don't Buy = Get what you pay for
Text: These are not true cups made for Keurig machines.  There is no filter technology, it simply is instant coffee granules which flow through a hole into the cup.  This company is being sued for patent infringement, but be aware these cups are not gourmet coffees which should be used in the machines.  Inferior product, and the cider cup tore in my machine.  I am requesting refund, and would urge Amazon to not sell this product, or at least change the description.  This was the most disappointing product I have ever received from Amazon.
This was beyond disappointing. Just proved you get what you pay for. It doesn't even taste like coffee!!! Don't bother!

I've used a lot of different K-Cups, and these are different than all the rest.  WORSE.  They brew weird....really dark at the beginning, then clear water, and oftentimes stop in the middle when it's only half-brewed.  They were cheaper than all the rest, and I purchased them because I've had good luck with all the other K-Cups I've ever used.  I'll never buy these again.

Summary: Doesn't work right in the machine
Text: I purchased these without reading the reviews. As soon as I started using them I noticed something was different. The machine would not cycle properly when making a cup of coffee. It would spurt out really dark liquid and a very small amount at that. I had to run a second cycle to get the coffee to a point where it was drinkable. I also noticed the foil top is more flat than the other brands I have which are more "puffed up". I came here to cancel the auto subscribe on these and that's when I started reading all of the other reviews and now it all makes sense. I still have an unopened box, don't know if Amazon will take them back or not.
Terrible. It has that tried and true aftertaste of instant coffee and way too much caffeine for a dark roast. Total waste.

Summary: Like a nice warm cup of stale beef jerky.
Text: Im not gonna get all agro about this stuff like everyone else is here, but this is not good coffee. Like i said in the title, it smells like a nice warm cup of stale beef jerky. Seriously, it does. I bought this because it was cheaper than all the other coffees on the shelf and as it turns out, i got what i paid for. If you are an instant coffee person stick with Starbucks Via or something like that as this is not really worth your time. Im gonna finish out the box though, since caffeine is my crack. Wish me luck.

This has to be the worst coffee I've ever bought.  Amazon should offer a full refund to anyone purchasing it.  You might as well put a little dirt in a filter and run the hot water through it.  That's what it is...colored water.
This coffee K-cup was the worst ever. It leaks when you lift it out of the k-cup holder..(extra thin plastic)..and the grounds run into the cup with the coffee. I guess you get what you pay for.

If I could rate this ZERO stars, I would...but it won't allow me to.
Absolute GARBAGE!! Buy Taster's Choice for half the price and mix w/ boiling water instead, if you want INSTANT COFFEE!!!
My Best Friend accidently ordered these not realizing they were instant, and thinking she was getting a good deal. To be honest, after drinking one and gagging, I've been opening them and pouring them into the canister of my bagless vacuum, b/c coffee is so good at eliminating odors. It's about all they're good for.

My rating is: ICK!!! 100% GROSS!!!!!!

These are not what I expected...they are INSTANT coffee, not really K-Cups.  Also, they clogged both Keurig machines I have tried them on and clog every time, requiring 2 brewing cycles.  Very frustrating.  They don't taste bad, but overall, would not recommend.

1) The coffee is inferior to any other Keurig coffee I have ever had
2) The K-Cups LEAK like crazy and are a huge mess - a problem I have had with no other Keurig K-Cups
3) AMAZON WILL NOT REFUND THIS PRODUCT! So, they sell you junk, then they refuse to take it back.

DO NOT BUY THIS!
even with the Keurig brewer, it is just instant coffee... since this was one of the only K-cups products on the subscribe and save, I tried it, but I will not get it again.

I bought this coffee given it's cost and that it is a bold brew.  I openend the box and thought the whole batch of coffee was made incorrectly as the pods are very light and not full, not even close.  I emailed the company and a rep called me back and explained that the pods are light as this is a new brew process.  I decided to try them and they are actually pretty good.  My daughter really likes them to make iced coffee.  They are strong and richly flavored.  I prefer other bold pods to these, though.  Buy them if you like espresso, really strong coffee, or want to brew over ice.

Summary: They make nice rattles for a 2 year old
Text: This is the worse coffee I have ever had. I admit I drank it many times because I had nothing else to drink and I wanted caffeine. It kind of taste like hickory or something. If you like instant coffee then get this item. But if you like instant coffee you probably don't have a fancy coffee maker to use them in. My 2 year old daughter loves playing with then though. shake shake shake
These are instant coffee cups, not traditional K-cups. When I originally purchased these it did NOT say instant coffee. This was added after the many complaints on here.

Stay away from the Grove Square products. I ordered this because I'd been so happy with the Amazon Subscribe and Save service in the past and these were the only K-cups available at the time I placed the order.

Shame on Amazon for making this the only brand available! These are not "true" K-cups with the filter inside, etc. They are basically instant coffee sealed in the K-cup packaging.

Many times when you put them in the machine, the cup doesn't fill all the way. I estimate I didn't get a full cup out of 15-20 of the K-cups and had to start the process over with a new K-cup, wasting a lot of time and money.

The flavor of the coffee is also bad, and has the exact taste you'd expect from instant coffee. Ick.

To sum up, save yourself some time and money. If you want instant coffee flavor and lots of hassle, these are for you. If not, get another brand of "real" K-cups.
The flavor was OK but I didn't like the way the cups leaked after taking them out of Keurig. I have never had this problem with other Keurig cups. Dripping on the counter and on the floor.

Summary: It tastes like what it is: instant coffee
Text: Like many of you, I'm tired of paying big bucks for K-cups and when I saw this product on my grocer's shelf, I just had to give it a try. How bad could it be? Well, it tastes just like what it is: a spoonful of instant coffee in a plastic cup that kinda-sorta works in a Keurig coffee machine. It's not the most vile thing I've ever tasted, and I'm going to finish the box I purchased, but I won't be buying it again. Besides, even if I liked the flavor of this product, it would be more economical to buy a jar of instant and use the Keurig to dispense hot water.

I got lured in by the subscribe and save, but it's nothing but freeze dried crystals of coffee. To top it off, the coffee "grounds" end up at the bottom of your cup so you get a thick swill of a finish. I would not purchase this again.
It is instant coffee... I did not realize this when I bought it so the price is a huge ripoff and I cannot understand why a kcup with instant coffee in it would even be made

Summary: Don't bother, unless you actually like instant coffee
Text: What would have been a 1 Star review, is now a 3 Star review only because Amazon and/or the manufacturer have corrected several information listing problems. When I purchased these K-cups at the beginning of January 2011 there were no reviews and in the Product Name or Product Features it did NOT say Instant Coffee. Because we do have an abundance of K-cups in our pantry it took over a month before I tried these out. I didn't even need to drink it to know that something wasn't right. The weight and sound of the K-cup was the first tip off, then watching the brewing of it and finally the taste - Yuck! Now if you like instant coffee then you will probably like these, BUT you could save money by buying Nescafe Clasico Instant Coffee, adding a spoonful to your cup and then brewing just hot water through your Keurig. Either way I won't be purchasing any more, but it wasn't a total waste as my daughter did like them and has used them up.

I was very disappointed with this purchase, it is not fresh coffee, like I expected. It looks, smells, and tastes just like Folgers instant freeze dried crystals!!
If you like freeze-dried instant coffee, then this is for you, but I got my Keurig machine because I like real, fresh coffee and this just doesn't do it for me.

Summary: "Instant Coffee" is Instant Coffee is Instant Coffee........
Text:
So I ordered this stuff fairly quickly and I thought that the "Instant Coffee" on the label was just a marketing thing as all K-cups brew instantly right... BIG MISTAKE!
This is actual freeze-dried, Instant coffee there is no filter no coffee smell and the taste is pitiful.
The packaging is exactly like the other Keurig K-cup "real" coffees, but what a huge disappointment...
It wasn't even significantly cheaper than any a good Timothy coffee..
In my opinion Instant coffee should not be allowed into a K-cup, I got my Keurig to replace my Auto-Drip coffee maker not my tea-kettle!
I also strongly believe this Grove Square nonsense is just a trick to dump cheap instant coffee on the unsuspecting Keurig owner, What a rip off!

I don't drink coffee, but I bought this for my husband who was very disappointed with it. Like me, he thought it was "the ususl" K-Cup and was very surprised when he brewed a cup and discovered it was not. Now he's stuck with 47 "imposter" K-Cups that he doesn't like. We both really wish this product had been advertised in such a fashion that would have made it obvious that it was instant coffee. I would never have purchased it had I realized what it was.

Summary: A Sad Excuse For Instant Coffee
Text: I am sorry, but this was not ground coffee.  Amazon should clearly identify that this is mostly instant coffee.  Knowing that, when you compare it to other instant coffee products that are available this stuff is at or near the bottom of the flavor quality you expect from instant. So... that means it is cheaper to get yourself a cup of hot water from you coffee brewer, then add your favorite instant coffee.  There are two additional benefits of using your own favorite instant coffee - your cup of Joe will taste better and you will not have to clean your coffee brewer as this stuff leaves a residue in the brewer.

I didn't look at the reviews before I bought this terrible product.  I wish I had.  It's hard to believe that someone would put instant coffee in a k-cup.  Even harder to believe that Amazon would sell it.  I have requested a refund.  Amazon should not dupe their loyal customers with products like this.  I would rate it a -1 if it was possible.

Summary: Not at good as I would expect
Text: I do regret this purchase because I could have gotten a better value with generic brand and still get the same thing.  This product is truly awful.

It is beyond me why anyone owning a keurig coffee brewer would want instant coffee.
I usually read all reviews (unfortunately I did not have time that day and did not want to
miss this "friday special.)" This is the way it was marketed to buyers on Amazon-
"Grove Square (TM) Single Cup Coffee - Dark Roast - 24 ct Box". I find this deceptive and unfair
to unsuspecting customers. This is instant coffee. If you go onto Amazon, it now 2/22 it states on some
of the grove square products that it is instant coffee. I use my keurig for making
tea and hot chocolate and have even bought the chai cups. Don't buy it is worse than
any instant coffee I have ever tasted and amazon will not let you return! It does not
deserve the 1 rating I had to give it to get this to post! Thank you and I hope this is helpful.
Absolutely the worse coffee ever. Instant coffee in a K-Cup.  And it doesn't even flow through correctly in the machine.

If you want instant coffee go out and by Sanka. This is nothing more than instant coffee. The week after I purchased it I noticed it was on sale for only $10 for a pack 0f 2 24count boxes. I would not even pay that for it. Don't waste your money on aweful coffee!!!

What a rip off ... Kuerig should ban this stuff.  It is basically instant coffee in a plastic shell.  There is no filter, it's just hot water pouring through chunks of busted up freeze dried crystals.  Don't waste your money.  The cheap price got me hooked.  If I wanted instant coffee I would have bought Sanka.  Stick with COFFEE PEOPLE brand ... now that some good stuff!

Not what we were expecting in a k-cup.  This is weak coffee that tastes like instant coffee.  There is a reason it is cheap - buyer beware!  I would have given it a negtaive rating if it was possible to do so.
Don't be fooled. This is not brewed coffee but instant coffee. Although it does not taste too bad, it still has that instant coffee taste. Don't waste your money.
I am extremely disappointed by this coffee.  It has a terrible taste and it seems like instant coffee is inside that pod.  I will never buy this again.
Did not like flavor.  Left significant residue in cup and flow was limited into cup.  Tried 2 and plan to return.  Very disappointing

When I received Grove Square coffee, I was, at first, very happy about the price. However, it was before I tasted the coffee; this is garbage. For those of you who appreciate a cup of aroma and flavorful cup of coffee in the morning it would deliver you NEITHER AROMA NOR FLAVOR. It is colored water to say the least; exact flavor of diluted, bitterly aftertaste, instant coffee. I would not recommend this product even to my worst enemy.

I bought this to try out when it went on sale for $15/box here at Amazon.  The flavor is decent, but it really is just instant coffee with a few grounds packaged into a K cup.  For way less money and packaging, you can get instant coffee and just use the Keurig to heat the water.

They say this is "Micro Brewed"....in other words-instant cooffee in a thin flimsy k-cup.  You would be better off buying a jar of instant and using the hot water out of the Keurig.  I feel this is a deceptive product.  I would give it Zero stars if I could.  Don't waste your money.
Anyone can go to the store and buy instant coffee for a lot less than this, it SUCKs. You need to stop ripping off the people.I would not even give it 1 star but I can't send this if I don't.

Summary: "Soluble and microground coffee with natural flavors"
Text:
This is basically the same technology as Starbucks VIA (whether it tastes better or worse is your call - I don't like VIA; this stuff is OK but not great.) It's essentially freeze-dried instant coffee (that's the "soluble" part) mixed with ultrafine coffee powder to give it more body... and to leave that little extra dust in the bottom of your cup and grit between your teeth.

The actual box does tell you - but you won't figure it out from the listing here on Amazon unless you read the reviews, so I'm pretty irritated. It's a decent price for real coffee, but it's actually pretty damn expensive for instant.

Now, as for what really matters: flavor. It's actually not terrible; it reminds me of Douwe Egberts toddy coffee - full body and a fairly rich, mild flavor.

The medium roast Grove Square is better than the Dark, IMO, and the Dark is a lot grittier in your mouth.

Would not have bought this stuff if the listing had been up-front; will not buy again.

Do not buy this "coffee!"  I bought some at Walmart because of the price only to find that it's literally instant coffee in a K-Cup package.  Tastes awful.  Why buy an expensive single-cup dispenser only to use instant coffee???  This company should be shut down or sued for false advertising.
Bought this at a store because of the price. It is an Awful tasting instant coffee. Don't waste your time or risk your tastebuds.

Just had my first cup of this coffee. It is strong, just how I like it, and has a nice aroma. Because this is micro-ground it comes through the brewer much faster than the regular K-Cups. I am not a coffee snob but do enjoy a good strong cup in the morning to get my motor running, this fits the bill just fine. The price makes it a deal breaker, I just ordered more to add to my collection of different varieties of coffee. I am well satisfied and hope you will be too.
____UPDATE from my original review. After using this for several weeks, I will have to agree that this is not up to snuff with regular K-Cups---I don't think it's as bad as some think but is not as good as the regular ground coffee. Some people drink instant coffee and have no problem with it and others just don't like it. This will wake you up in the morning, but does lack the flavor of the regular ground varieties.

Summary: READ CLOSELY!!! This is instant coffee.  If you like instant coffee than you will like this.  If not, DO NOT BUY!!
Text: I bought this because of the great value.  I didnt read this very closely.  This is INSTANT COFFEE. If you like the taste of instant coffee than this is for you.  If you are like me and you like the real deal, Do NOT buy.

Summary: Poor quality control and it's instant coffee
Text:
I have two complaints about this product.

First, for some reason, every one of the 24 cups brewed in my Keurig came out at four ounces instead of 12 ounces. I have no idea why. I pressed the large cup of coffee button on my machine, and four ounces of coffee came out. I pressed the small cup of coffee button on the machine and four ounces of coffee came out. After two years of using the Keurig, the Grove Square is the only product line this happens for.

Second, it's instant coffee. For being instant coffee, it has a decent flavor.

Very, very disappointed with this product. I wouldn't recommend this for anyone.

I do realize I missed the part where it said instant coffee, well I saw it but I thought it meant instant in the kuerig, not actually Folgers type instant coffee. However the so-called k-cups aren't kcups at all. They caused my Kuerig to malfunction and clog. And as if that weren't bad enough the actual coffe tasted burnt.

Don't be like me, read and heed the reviews!!!! It's not worth a nickel let alone $20.

I can only get a little comfort in the fact that I wasn't the only one that missed the fact this is INSTANT coffee!  (Who would buy instant coffee in a K-Cup?  Not me - at least not knowingly!)  Having said that, I can't really rate the flavor, since I never (until this morning) drink instant coffee - but the double-sized cup I brewed this morning paled in comparison with my normal real K-Cup coffee.  The other 22 K-Cups of this *stuff* went right into the garbage can!
I hope you are reading these reviews.  I did not.  This is instant coffee inside a K-cup container.  The description is deceptive.
Avoid!!!  This is a bait and switch.  This is INSTANT coffee, about 1 tablespoons worth, in a K-cup.  Not even air sealed.  Folgers in a can is better than this.  Please, don't waste your money!

Anyone who owns a Keurig Coffeemaker obviously enjoys good, rich coffee. Why anyone would market and sell this stuff is beyond me. The first thing I noticed upon receiving my order was that the k-cups were extremely light; and when you shake them, you can hear the granular substance inside. This is clearly, without a doubt, INSTANT COFFEE.
The amount charged per box for these is ridiculous. Two boxes down the drain, which in any case is still way better than in my cup.
This coffee smells and tastes like the old fashion instant coffee in a glass jar my parents used to drink when we were litte! Sanka comes to mind. Don't buy this unless you like instant coffee!

Summary: OK coffee, but clogs the Keurig
Text:
This Grove Square coffee tastes fine, when it brews. The problem is that the coffee is ground too coarse. Other brands are typically ground finer, allowing it to work with the Keurig machine.

I cancelled my subscription to Grove Square, and went back to Coffee People.

This particular coffee had little flavor and generally only worked on the middle setting of the Keurig machine. Sometimes I had to run it a 2nd time using the first button[smallest amount.] It was not worth the aggravation and i would not recommend purchasing it.
This was a disappointing order. The coffee taste like instant coffee which is stated on the product. It dose have a good instant coffee taste if you want an instant coffee.

Saw a box of this coffee at the grocery store next to the Green Mountain K-cups and noticed it was a lot cheaper so I figured I'd give it a shot. Well the old sang 'you get what you pay for' doesn't even do justice here because this coffee is not worth $1 a box, never mind the $8 or so I spent on it.

The taste of this coffee is what I imagine it would be like if you used a Green Mountain Coffee K-Cup, discarded of the used K-Cup in the trash, let it sit in the trash for a few weeks, and then took it out and tried to use it again.

Summary: Terrible coffee, and clogged my coffee maker
Text: Not only does this "coffee" (instant crystals" taste terrible, but it clogged up my machine so badly that it took me about 2 hours to get it clean.  Avoid at ALL cost.
love this formula, its the best and when you buy in bulk, the price cannot be beat and really, your child will go through formula pretty quickly.

Summary: Perfect cup of tea every time
Text: YUM, YUM, YUMMMY!!! I have a cup before I goto bed every night. I LOVE the k-cup system. Waaaay more affordable on Amazon too. I do the auto ship for the extra discount...believe me you will go through it.
I would recommend this tea for anyone who enjoys a good tasting cup of chamomile. Good value with the 2 pack.

I am so sorry I purchased a 24-pack of this tea for my new Keurig. It is absolutely tasteless. Celestial Seasoning's Sleepytime Tea is far superior in every way. Before I switched to Keurig, I used STASH Camomile, and it was great. This one is tepid and tasteless. I am never going to order any Bigelow product for my Keurig. It's too expensive to waste. Right now I use the Sleepytime and put an "Espresso" shot of the Bigelow Camomile in to use up the 24-pack. If you love Camomile, don't buy this one.

Summary: Buy it here all the time!
Text: I love this tea for the Keurig and I always get the best value on Amazon!  I think this is the 3rd or 4th time I've purchased it here.
I drink this tea everynight before I go to bed and it helps to relax me and get the troubles of the day off of my mind.  The flavor and aroma are awesome as well.

This is a little strong for me on "setting 1" but perfect on the more diluted "setting 2." The price is right, a little more or less than $0.50/cup based on what I paid... wish k cups were a little more affordable but I'm beginning to consider Chamomile one of my "necessities" in life.

Number two is Timothy's. Number three by far is Twinnings, which was a disappointing cup of chamomile. I also tried I Love Lemon and Mint Medley and love both. All three flavors don't taste watered down like some others.

Summary: Bigelow Tea Cozy Chamomile K-Cup For Keurig Brewers, 24-Count, Boxes (Pack of 2)
Text: Mmmm Yummy! Nice if you own a Keurig.  I only wish K-Cups were less expensive.  Less expensive would have given this product 5 stars.  Since I can only find the Chamomile Tea K-Cups online, I'll likely buy this product again.
This is fairly good, but the Timothy's version is better and costs a bit less.
I have always liked Campbell's Green Pea Soup.  It is smooth and doe not have those annoying split peas that other pea soups have.
The product tasted good.  I enjoyed them.  I would order again.  I love red velvet cake so I knew I would like red velvet petits fours.

This is my first time trying petit fours, and I must say they lived up to what I expected. If you like or want to try petits fours, I don't think you can go wrong with the Swiss colony brand. The whole cake was fresh and had a good taste to it.

Summary: Strange name, but I enjoy Ashwagandha matcha every day
Text: A very nice tea. Strange name, great benefits. Must like Matcha tea in general to enjoy this one. Recommended for everyday use.

Summary: Acai Matcha by RedLeafTea carries more protein than eggs!
Text: I hate eggs. I developed this aversion to them because my mother used to make me drink them raw when I was a kid. I felt more punished than healed and nothing in the world can make me eat an egg, no matter how well it is cooked. One problem, though, their protein source is excellent. I need the protein but not the egg. My online search finally bore fruit the other day when I came upon Acai matcha tea. This fine tasting tea has more protein than eggs. Hurray! What a relief...

Summary: SKIMPY for the price charged!!  Shocked!
Text:
Was shocked at the skinny size of this item!! They are five inches long as I expected, because that's the size I wanted and ordered, but can't be any bigger around than even a pencil and that's a BIG stretch!! WOW, I'm sure disappointed considering the cost ~~ $7 and shipping. Won't be ordering these again.
Of course my dog likes them ok, but wouldn't call them her fav by any means. :( Will I send them back? Don't know if it's worth the hassle at this point. But I will NOT recommend them either. Because of the size quality and high price compared to so many other products to choose from! Keep looking is my advice. :)
The other Beefeaters' products I ordered well met my standards. This one was a DUD!! What's the old saying? Buyer beware? I fell into that trap big time!
Here's the product link at this time:

Beefeaters Great Fillin Porkhide Rolls with Meaty Chicken Filling, 5-Inch

Wish you luck if you try this product...but again "Buyer Beware!!"

UPDATE 2.15.2012: My little dog got VERY SICK not too long after I wrote this review...I contacted Cust. Service with even more reason to not like this item and they refunded my money!! How's that for Customer Care?? :) Great!! Thank you Amazon.com ~~ you are TERRIFIC!!

My Scottish Terrier inhaled hers in about 2 hours, but my finicky Pomeranian, who usually turns his nose up at chew toys, loved it! It kept my Pom busy for a few weeks, but he really enjoyed it!

Affordable price, fast shopping, great product!

It not like fresh- but how much time and energy do you have to find real buttermilk and have it on hand for spontaneous baking frenzies?

This is great to have around, just keep it in an airtight canister in a cool place. No, it's not for drinking. But powdered milk has never been for drinking, it's for preople who need to drive 30 miles to a grocery and need to cook a dinner party at the last minute. I love this stuff, better biscuits and life easier.

Keeping kitchen inventory up can be tough with perishables. This is a great idea.

i have tried other dry milk powdered  bobs non fat and buttermilk are the best  people say its not for drinking but since moving to ohio this tastes better then the milk you buy fresh. my fussy 20 yr old even likes this better

I already own the regular milk powder and used it in a white bread dough. It worked so now I am splurging ($22.93) on the buttermilk.  I keep buttermilk on hand in the fridge but fresh milk prices are always rising and I like not worrying about inventory.

I bought this buttermilk at the same time I bought Bob's Non-Fat Dry Milk. They both came in the same box in a few days. I don't use buttermilk other than for cooking, but it seems you have to make a trip to the store if you need some, or plan ahead. It tastes reasonably close to the store-bought variety, but is not that thick oozy stuff that comes from the store. So far I have used it to marinate chicken and it seems to work great, and augment or replace regular milk in other recipes. Seem fine. The plan is it check it out as a scratch mix substitute for store bought box mixes and dressings, but first I have to use up the store box mixes and dressing. The four bags from Amazon may last quite a while, but according to Bob's shelf life specifications, it should be fine.

I am echoing what others have said, but needed to put my 2- cents' worth in. This is great to have on hand, especially around the holidays or if you do a lot of baking.  Not for drinking, as others have said, but works just fine for your baking needs, or, as one baker put it, during a "baking frenzy"....
Great stuff. I always have it on hand for cooking anything that calls for buttermilk.

Summary: Buttermilk when you can't get fresh.
Text: Great stuff, cooks like fresh buttermilk, easy to store in freezer. Buttermilk is not readily available in Central American countries, so I cook with this.

I ordered one pkg of Bob's Red Mill Buttermilk Powder a couple of months ago to try it.  I love it.  I can make as much as I need for baking, whenever I need it.  I don't have to throw out soured milk that I purchased from the store, and didn't use in time.  Taste's great, too. So, this time I bought several packages to store.

Summary: Does this product contain Bovine Growth Hormone (BGH)!??
Text:
Where does this milk powder come from? Bob's Red Mill grinds flour in the Northwest but many of their products are "packaged" at their location but are not made there.

This buttermilk powder did nothing for me. It didn't make a better biscuit or waffle and it made my loaf bread less tasty than if I had used regular milk powder. This wasn't a successful product for me and I still have not finished the first package. I won't restock it when/if I run out of it.
I sent this to my Mother to store for emergency situations. She said it did not taste like buttermilk at all. OK for cooking but not drinking.

Summary: Advertised as "White Coffee"... it is not
Text:
The product is advertised as "white coffee" but in fact the name comes from the owner's name "White"... Has nothing to do with the "white coffee" whatsoever.
It is as if my name would be "Kona" so the coffee that I would sell would be named "Kona coffee"...

Other than that, a decent coffee.

I have switched my dog's from the terrible treats that come from China, and am glad that I found these Salmon Sticks!  My American Bulldog goes crazy for them!  Have already ordered more!  Highly recommend to give these a try!  Your dog will love them!

My 3 month old Labradoodle loves these. (I break them in half for her, but she gobbles them down in no time at all.) The only problem is you have to hold your nose when you open the bag - it smells like dead fish.  "The smell only a dog could love."
My dogs went crazy over these. They have a very strong fish smell, but if you like to make your dog happy, it's a great treat.

I have three little dogs. They love these sticks so I break pieciecs off as rewards for good behavior. they love it and look forward to thier reward.I have purchased these for a while and like to get them via amazon so easy.

It's sooooooooooooo good.  I love it.  When I've finished a bottle, I have to remind myself to stop at the bottom of the bottle, because the plastic does not taste good.  It tastes like plastic.  And after you eat the plastic, you usually get down to the countertop.  We have a cheap formica countertop and it tastes horrible.  And beneath that is a particle board-type substance that is very dry.  And it swells too.  So when you get to the bottom of the bottle, where the sauce stops, stop and open a new bottle, then begin eating again.  I'm currently working on a helmet that would hold 2 bottles (minimum) and dispense the crimson yumminess at my mere thought that some Sriracha might be nice.  But it's ruined several T.V. remotes so far in testing.  I know what you're thinking, but it takes weeks to get the smell out of your truck.  So, for now, I'll continue my work, and most folks should just stick to normal containers.

Summary: The last reviewer was right on the money! Excruciatingly good! Ha!
Text:
This is the best Sriracha sauce EVER! The heat is addictive because there is also sweet, salty and notes of garlic and tanginess of vinegar in this sauce that just makes you want to tip the bottle and pour it in your mouth.

I'm seriously considering trying this as a topping on vanilla ice cream just to see what it would be like to have the heat with the cool-down of dairy. What? What? You think I'm crazy now? *innocent look*

Obviously, anyone who forks out the dough for a 12 pack of 28-ouncers is a hard-core sriracha sauce addict and this was super fresh and bright red like I expect it to be and this tall order was shipped in perfect packaging.

Anyone want to lick some sriracha sauce off my finger? *pulls finger away* Oh no you can't! You have to buy it for yourself! *wink*

What is sriracha sauce good for?

Stir fries
Egg dishes
Rice dishes
Meat dishes
Barbecues
Fish dishes
Veggies
Soups
Stews
Pasta
Salads
Salad dressings
Spicy mayo
Spring rolls
Etc. ad infinitum

The possibilities are limited only to your imagination.

If you already know you love this stuff, this is an excellent deal!

As of this review: 3.80 for each 28 0z bottle at the $45.60 w/free shipping via amazon.com.

Viva the hot stuff and may you all sweat a little, burn a little and love a little.

;)

I love this stuff! I put it on just about every thing I eat. It's the perfect amount of heat, but not over-powering. My only complaint is the packaging. Of the 12 bottle in my order, 2 had been busted open and went everywhere (this stuff turns in to concrete when it dries so it was quite a task to clean the remaining 10 bottles).

I realize that this may be more of a complaint better directed to the shipper (i.e. UPS), but as the customer, I feel this is Amazon's battle to wage. On that topic; I submitted this information to Amazon, along with a couple photos of the mess, but they never even responded with a confirmation, let alone offered a partial refund. I'm not sure why Amazon even bothers to offer a way to submit satisfaction issues if they just ignore it.

Regardless, still a great product...I might suggest you just buy it at your local grocery store instead of purchasing it here since there's no guarantee you'll get every thing you paid for from Amazon.

Summary: I would eat this off of a dead hobo's finger.
Text:
Perfect combination of hot, tangy, and a zest of garlic.

Rice, Eggs, Pizza, Stir Fry, Burgers, anything you normally put Tobasco or what you've used to put on your food this can do better.

Anything else....is just weak sauce.

Summary: Part of our Dubai Survival Kit
Text:
We can buy almost anything in Dubai except Sriracha sauce, so when I convinced my mom to visit us here for the holidays, I had my sauce delivered to her house, and she "smuggled" it here.

My wife even plans on "smuggling" a couple of bottles to Vietnam when she goes home for Tet. Now isn't that an example of how good the sauce is?

Seriously, you don't want to live without it. This sauce is not that hot - well, it is hot, but it is also full of flavor, it goes on just about everything. I keep a bottle at work as well, it makes even so-so lunch taste better. I say even if you don't like hot food, give this a try - it will grow on you. Maybe you should not start with 12 28-oz bottles, but give it a try, really.

Summary: I cannot live with out this stuff
Text: Best sauce on the planet and I believe this is the best price you'll find it at.  My favorite food enhancement, it goes into everything I make - including popcorn.

My whole family is looking to shed a few pounds and current diet plans called for soy nuts sold by diet plan vendors at a much higher cost.

These soynuts are less expensive and taste great. The whole family is now fighting over them.
Great snack even if health foods aren't your thing.  They are only a little bit spicy.  I would love to order again but they are out of stock.

These are good....really really good.  I wanted to find a snack that was higher in protein and lower in carbs than the average snack, and this fit the bill nicely.  These are flavorful with a decent amount of heat.  I found that I was satisfied when eating only a small amount.

If you are interested in healthy snacks, beware that this product lists cottonseed oil as a "possible" oil used in its prepartion on the back of the package, and once you receive your package you cannot return grocery items.

My girls love this Strawberry applesauce.  I spoon it into smaller containers for them to take to school for snack or a healthier dessert.  Buying the entire case without having tried it first I was nervous but my girls' delight means I made the right choice.
Received product timely.  Upon opening product found weevil infestation. Put product in freezer to kill weevils.  Returning product would have been a nuisance.

Summary: Bow wow review of Dog Biscuts
Text: I have 2 sixty pound American Staffordshire Terriers, aka Pitt Bulls. Mugsy and Spookey seem to realy enjoy the Biscuts. I ordered 2 boxes of Biscuts, which in the future, I'll only order one box at a time. As I did not relize how much twenty pounds of dog biscuts are.Wells SPORTMiX Golden Dog Biscuit Treats, Extra Large - 20 lb. Bag A lot to say the least.

I ordered two boxes of these bones for my commercial kennel.  I chose the Sportmix products because I was assured by their customer service rep (who responded to my inquiry within the hour) that the ingredients and manufacturing are US-based.
