I do not purchase foreign pet food ingredients - particularly China-made pet products.  I am thoroughly happy with the apparent palatability of the bones.  The dogs fall over each other to get one.  I am a little dissatisfied with the condition of many of the bones - about 20% of them are broken due to packaging.  They are not stacked - just loosely placed in the box to be knocked around during delivery.  This is the only thing I can fault, though.  Otherwise, a fair priced, quality, USA MADE product.

Generally the dog biscuits are great if not such a high percentage would be broken. The point in buying extra large biscuits is the "extra large", small pieces miss the reason for buying theme in the first place. There has to be a better way to pack the biscuits better than this.

Wow! Elephant seasoning is an instant classic. I use Elephant on my burgers, dogs, fires, veggies, steaks, fish.... on and on. My lovely girlfriend can't live without it. Favorite

Baked brussel sprouts with olive oil and Elephant are exceptional. Healthy treat that is to die for.

YOU MUST TRY THIS SEASONING!!!!!!!

This is a great savory seasoning to use on everything. I really like it for fish but it's also great for red meat and all kinds of veggies. It's a new label design from what they used to sell at Joe Patti's Seafood but it's the same stuff.

Summary: Elephant Seasoning by Chef Carlos is the best
Text: I'm so happy to find the Elephant Seasoning online. I moved to Nashville and couldn't buy it here.  I love this stuff! It is wonderful on everything.  I'm lucky enough to have eaten food prepared by Chef Carolos and his daughter.  They always used this seasoning and everybody raved about the meal.  You will not be disappointed in this product.  This seasoning is a must-have for serious cooks.

Summary: medium-grade tea with no distinctive apricot taste
Text:
[Edit to add: A friend stayed at my house for a week recently and said "This is the most delicious tea I've ever had in my life." She's a huge tea fan, so that is definitely saying something. So, I've upped my star rating to a 4 (that's the average of my opinion (3) and her opinion (5)). In light of her reaction, this tea may well be worth a try.]

Original review:
I live in Japan where we drink oolong tea daily. I usually buy my flavored teas in the US, because here in Japan they emphasize the aroma of the tea as it is brews rather than the taste, whereas in the US they emphasize the quality of the taste over the quality of the aroma. This offers nothing outstanding in either area. The aroma is present but nothing fantastic, and I can't taste the apricot in this at all.

This is an upper medium-grade oolong tea, not the delicate high-grade Chinese oolong I was expecting at this price. This is important because oolong tea is stunning when high-grade, perfectly nasty when low-grade, and merely OK when medium-grade. It's upper medium-grade, so still very good, but not the stunning flavor I was expecting at this price. (On reflection, perhaps the high price comes from the fact that it is organic, rather than from using only the highest-grade tea leaves.)

Visually all the teas from this series are very appealing and they are ready to give "as is" if you need a housewarming gift, gift for your child's teacher, etc. The package closes securely so you don't need to worry about the tea leaves not keeping well.

We purchased this from Amazon as our local store was only carrying this occasionally. It is the exact same product. It is a fast dinner that you can throw in a crock pot and do the rest when you get home. My family loves this. We have a problem, half the family cannot have dairy products, so we make the first part which is dairy free. Then we split it in two and add the sour cream to the one half. Both ways are very good. I chop the mushrooms finely and our picky eaters never know they are in there. I put the entire thing over egg noodles to complete the meal. We usually use two packets to make a double recipe because it gets eaten so fast. We never have any left overs. I highly recommend this product. McCormick has a real winner here.

The bags leave tiny shreds of cotton from the bag lining and string attachments in the tea while brewing. I guess the cotton they use is too fluffy.  Also the tea is too light and not as full bodied/full flavored as I would prefer.

This green tea has a nice robust but complex flavor that can be enjoyed hot or cold. Some green teas have a good flavor, like Stash green tea, but the flavor is very subtle and simple so you don't get the full green tea experience. This tea is very refreshing, and calming even. Green tea has one of the most potent antioxidants known to man, EGCG, it also has L-Theanine which is a unique, calming amino acid found almost exclusively in green tea. As is mentioned in the detailed info, the teabags are entirely compostable.
Delicate, fragrant, delightful. The tea leaves are contained in delicate, upscale silky tea bags. The taste is not too thick or heavy, but it's not tasteless either. Perfect - just too pricey.
I fell in love with this green tea, has a unique flavor.  It's light like a green tea should be, and has a slight fruity flavor.  Best Green Tea i've had yet.

Summary: Great tee 25% cheaper than in retail store
Text: This is by far my preferred tea. It is great at any time of the day and it preserves it flavor even when it is cold. This brand is available only in a few stores where it goes for $9.99 the box.

Table is big and heavy, don't know how some reviewers are claiming to be just over 5 feet and pick this up with no problem. I am 5'4 and have trouble with this. However, it is very good quality, nice massage table, I love using it.
Hard to find a tapenade without capers or other common GI irritants.  Tasty and works well on sandwiches.  So, this is great..

This is  delicious, aromatic maple syrup like I remember in my childhood.  It is not super thick like the grocery store sells, but a thinner, tastier syrup.  We especially like the two jugs - one the use now and one to save, for a little while!  We definitely will buy more later.

Summary: Excellent black tea for brewing Kombucha
Text:
My Kombucha scoby babies seem to go crazy for this very basic black tea. They also like Tetley but the Lipton seems to be their food of choice. Go figure that one out?!

BTW, I bought my first scoby off of ebay (super cheap) and my scoby chirrens have made a ton of babies already! lol

YUMMERS!

In closing, if you are big into brewing your own Kombucha tea...your Symbiotic Colony of Bacteria and Yeast will love this brand of black tea (and for cheap even)!

Happy brewin'. :D ;)
I wanted tea, I got tea.  The only complaint I have is the sometimes the tag breaks of and the string falls into the tea.
Why does Lipton tea taste so bad recently? I have been drinking it for years and now it's disgusting. I will be throwing out this box. I noticed others have made the same comments recently. [...]
Lipton makes 3 teas I can drink. I have enjoyed this one very much. I will Reccomend this to anyone. Thank you Amazon and Lipton.

Summary: Black Tea is Beautiful!  The Jewel in Lipton's Crown
Text:
I love tea and have been a tea drinker since childhood. When I had my first sip of tea, I knew tea was for me!

Lipton was the tea I was introduced to many years ago. As one of the few tea drinkers in a family of coffee drinkers, Lipton and I go back a long ways. Over the years, I have gotten to know and love many other brands and flavors of tea. If you want a good, healthy staple, then you want to drink this tea.

I love oolang; white, black, green, and herbal tea. I found that this tea is quite good, iced or piping hot and fresh in your tea pot. I love it! Black tea also has many health properties and I highly recommend black tea. It is very soothing and if you are drinking your black tea while listening to some soothing George Harrison, it doesn't get any better than that! It is an ideal stress buster and a nice part of your day.

Excellent tea. I highly recommend it!

Summary: Not the best black tea, but the best value.
Text: I think my title sums it up. This is far from the best tea, and I routinely drink better tea. Deference is that tea cost more, were as this tea taste just fine and is cheap. Ever day when I show up to work I make a glass of this tea. Fancy teas are nice, but this one gets me through my daily grind.

ordinary black tea.
not very brilliant
smells good but the taste is fair.
312 bags could last a year for meDDDDD

I am a big drinker of tea but even for a quick brew, Lipton is made from substandard parts of the Tea plant also including the leaves. As a red rose tea the richness of color and flavor can be compared by buying other loose Tea brands and brewing the exact weight vs. Lipton. Cut the bag open and compare it with a bag of Tetley or Brooke Bond or Taj Mahal for that matter to confirm. No offense to Lipton lovers; I prefer Quality over Quantity. Enjoy your Tea otherwise :)
Excellent value for the dollar when on sale - makes a wonderful cup of tea. Product arrived promptly and of the same quality as in supermarkets.

This is a very good item.
I will my friends about this great buy.
A lifetime favorite that never disappoints.  The package arrived as expected and cost was a great deal.  I would definitely order the Lipton tea again.
My favorite tea of all time I totally enjoy drinking Lipton tea before and after I wake in the morning

The taste and the packaging is great. It came in three boxes so you can store the rest. The tea bags are a bit smaller, that makes it less strong for average drinker and you don't waste as much when you serve individual cups.
Ready for the Summer. Put 8 bags in a large pitcher of water, put it in the fridge over night and remove the Tea bags in the morning. Perfect, flavorful clear tea all day long.

Summary: Ice tea quenches thirst like nothing else
Text:
I must admit I love my Jasmine Tea (Ito En Jasmine Japanese Green Tea, 16.9-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 12) but I can't down more than a bottle of it a day, it gets a bit cloying if I do.
So I switch over to this old standby and I can drink a gallon of it a day. One tea bag will honestly make an entire gallon if you have a jar that big and let it steep for a few minutes.

I live in a very hot humid subtropical environment and we all love our iced tea here. I don't use sugar but I mix in so much lemon juice it's almost half lemonaid. And it must be ice cold. This can be watered down or made very strong depending on your taste. I like mine on the watery side. This can be a bit acidic if you make it strong. It is a very strong tea with a strong flavor so making it weak works well with this.

I probably have a dozen types of teas on my shelf but along with my daily bottle of jasmine tea I drink this the most.
It has a distinctive flavor I never get tired of. It's almost like a comfort food to me, as I grew up drinking
Lipton Tea. It's been around forever. Constant Comment Bigelow Constant Comment Tea, 20-Count Boxes (Pack of 6)is another old standby tea worth trying.

I found the quality of tea inconsistent. I think it is a Lipton issue rather than anything to do with Amazon.

I have had one experience like this with store-bought Lipton tea bags before. I wish I had remembered that before I ordered this.

I would recommend going in for some other tea like Tazo Awake or some other English Breakfast tea.
This is a premeium product at a great price.Hot or cold, it will perk you up!  Brew this tea everyday!

Over the years I have started drinking more tea and have found that there is a HUGE difference in taste from manufacturer to manufacturer.  I have found that Lipton has almost no flavor (it used to, some years ago).  I currently have about 20 different teas on hand, most from English or Asian manufacturers, which have a noticeable flavor.  If you love tea, try one of the imports.  You'll be surprised how bland Lipton really tastes.

Lipton has been my tea of choice for many years.  I drink it English style, with milk & sugar.  In my experience, Lipton's is the only brand that holds it fabulous flavor after adding the accoutrements.  Great price and nice to have a subscription so I never run out.
Fantastic for making good old southern style sweet tea. Consistent quality and a good price from subscribe and save. This black tea is the one I always reach for.
My purchase of Lipton Tea 312-Count Bags was a great value. The same product at a North Jersey supermarket would cost much more. Amazon.com prices are very reasonable.

Summary: Lipton Tea  and Amazon are the best!
Text: I have been drinking tea for over 60 years.  Lipton Tea was the only tea we had at our house.  I use it for hot tea and for ice tea.  It always tastes great! Getting the 312 count, three boxed set of Lipton black tea sent at regular intervals saves me time and money.  Thanks Amazon my most trusted online store for offering me this service

Good value to buy in bulk like this when the price is right. I buy black tea for making sweet iced tea. I'm not sure if it's just my batch or what, but I've made two batches now (16 tea bags) and the tea bags "leak" tea leaf bits. As soon as I opened the first package there were bits of black tea leaves all over. After I brewed the first batch there were bits of tea leaves in the pitcher. Quite a bit actually. Guess I have to buy one of those metal diffusers?

generally speaking, a pleasant experience for both the tea and Amazon.com.  But too bad that only after 2 weeks the Amazon.com has another 15% off of the product which means I paid 15% more...  wish I can have them adjust the price....

The price per packet is a huge savings. The package and cost is similar to warehouse club stores without the additional cost of that membership. Excellent price, quick ship, and will be buying again. When you drink as much tea as I do...I never have to worry about running out again. Thanks Amazon!

Delicious black tea.  I like the packaging; comes in three boxes so the tea will stay fresh longer.  It may not beat the much more expensive teas in flavor, but for the price, it tastes very, very nice and the price is unbeatable. I will buy this again!
This is truly a great product and at a great price. Great product! I drink alot of this tea. Highly recommended.

Summary: Middle of the road black tes
Text: I don't know why anyone would buy the American version of Lipton tea when there are so many good black teas available. If you want to experience a good tea that creates a good strong flavor and aroma without any bitterness try PG Tips. In only 2 minutes a single bag of PG Tips in 8 to 10 oz of water will create a brew that will make you forget about any American tea brand.

This was not the item I wanted. This item is just an everyday tea that can readily be purchased in an everyday food store.

I wanted black tea 100% and that is not what I received

I always have a pitcher of Lipton iced tea in the fridge. There is nothing fancy here, just great old fashioned black tea. I got the 312 count tea bags on subscribe and save and love it. The shipping was very prompt as usual.

Great Product.  I ordered these tea bags as I brew a lot of tea.  Everyday there is someone in my family who either wants a cup of hot tea or a glass of iced tea.  It is so handy having this item at our reach.  I received this order in perfect condition and on time.

I am a coffee drinker but there are times when a nice hot cup of tea is needed. This tea is the go to tea for me, I always use Lipton, sure I tried others but I always come back to Lipton.
It has a nice crisp clean smooth taste. Weather you like it hot or iced this is a good old brand to make.

Summary: Awesome buy for your buck! A++++
Text: I ordered this on auto-ship for a reduced price of $7.66 per month. I could not be more pleased. It is a great deal. Thank you, Amazon!

Though I like various types of tea, Lipton fills a niche at certain times. The case of tea bags will last me forever and the price was so good that I had to take advantage of it.

For breakfast, I usually drink my Lipton hot with a touch of lemon. I enjoy ice tea and Lipton has always been my favorite. Other times, I drink Earl Grey, Chinese black tea, or Japanese green when the moment arises.

At best, I will have a long time to drink Lipton black tea thanks to this deal,

I was vastly disappointed with this product. I live for tea bags. Ask anyone and they will tell you, "Yep, that guy loves a good tea bag." So, I thought I would expand my horizons. I decided to go for some black tea bags this time. It was now what I had hoped and dreamed about at all. These tea bag were weak. They were small and didn't satisfy my longing for a moist, sensational, musty, and delicious tea bag.

These Macaroons taste fantastic; but they are not raw. Hail Merry is advertising this product as raw and it isn't, that is false advertising. Out of six ingredients only two are raw. The Coconut oil and sea salt are the only raw ingredients in this product. See back of package for

Not just for Christmas, this is a heavenly treat that combines the best of both worlds. Chocolate and coconut macaroons are satisfying and present the time honored dilemma of how you can possibly only eat one. The answer is easy. You don't. I do turn eating these into a quasi religious experience by eating these is tiny, deliberate bites and chewing slowly as I experience the harmonious effects of sight, smell and taste that these macaroons elicit.
If you like macaroons and you like chocolate, these macaroons will be sure to satisfy a sweet tooth,

They taste excellent and are a really great source of healthy fat! They are delicious!!! They have excellent texture, nice dark chocolate flavor and are satisfying! I could eat the whole bag in one setting!

If you like any of the 3 ingredients (chocolate, sugar, excellent brandy), you should like these. I love them. The combination of the three simply drives me crazy until I can have one (or two)! Normally not a selfish person, I hide these so I don't have to share them with friends and family. I feel ashamed, but after several years still not enough to share. I'm sorry - get your own.

The last order, I mistakenly ordered the cherries rather than the bottles, but the Mostly Chocolate people went out of their way to resolve after contacting Amazon. Great chocolates - great service.

Very good, Very spicy treat. It's a crunchy blend, salty spicy with nuts, peas and these weird noodles that give it a nice crunch. It's very spicy tho' so I eat a little at a time. with 6 grams of fat for 129 cal's it's not a diet food and it is easy to eat a 1/2 a bag at one sitting.

I can't remember which werehouse store but it was either Sam's Club or Costco where I purchased this for around seven bucks. Anyways I'm Indian and for my taste buds this was not spicy at all but it was still very good taste wise. It's not greasy which I loved. I would recommend this product but if you eat a lot of spicy food and your looking for that extra spicy kick then try elsewhere now if you just want an all around good tasting bhuja this one does the trick.

Summary: BHUJA  !!  Good to the last bite
Text: The Original Mix is very good and like the "BHUJA Peas" it is very hard to stop munching once you get started on them.  The Original Mix is spicy, so for those who have a low tolorence for "hot" this may not be your best choice.

Summary: Crunchy. Tasty. Good Nutrients. Nice Snack.
Text:
I'm always looking for snacks that might be tasty and nutritionally good at the same time. A month or so ago I found "Majans Bhuja Cracker Mix" and liked it very much. As such I continued looking and found "Majans Buja Original Mix. It's a rather similar assortment of rice crackers, crisp noodles, green peas, peanuts, and sultanas. Plus, there's an assortment of flavors and other minor ingredients. It's crunchy and chewy and tastes good. The calories are not particularly high and the snack has a good protein and fiber content. It's low fat with no cholesterol. The sodium content is fairly low. Nice mixture of characteristics. One thing I might add that this snack is fairly filling. I've had little tendency to eat the whole bag at one sitting such as I can often do with potato chips and things of that sort. It's a product of Australia. I discovered it in a nearby Fresh and Easy Store, which happens to be and English company. It's good to find a few snacks like this and Bhuja come in several varieties, juist in case you like to switch around a bit. I find these a bit spicy and prefer the other variety I had.

Gary Peterson

Summary: Its pretty good. Tasty and delicious
Text: Nice snack for tea or coffee time in afternoon. right amount of spicy. its not oily as other spicy gram noodles you get in Indian stores across US

Summary: I love this Ghirardelli Mint Chocolate. Perfect for after dinner or dessert. It tastes just right.
Text:
This Ghirardelli Mint Chocolate tastes really good. The chocolate isn't too sweet nor too bitter. It is also not too creamy or milky. As far as the mint filling, it adds some more sweetness to the Chocolate, but at the same time the mint is very refreshing. Perfect to have after dinner or as dessert.

If you like Mint Chocolate, you might also want to try the After Eight Mint Chocolate. they are very good too. Also try the Ghirardelli Peppermint Bark Chocolate which is kind of interesting taste (a combination of chocolate/dark chocolate with white chocolate and peppermint crust).
I received this item today and it came in great condition..with ice ice packs. Nice chocolate! I plan on using this with Mint flavored brownies.
I made a mistake and thought this was shampoo and it was conditioner. It works good as such. It smells good and makes fur soft.
This conditioner works well with the companion shampoo. It really makes my Maltese soft AND white!  Love it! Smells good too!

This conditioner is light and works great.
Its not heavy and wont weight down my dogs coat- leaves it nice and fluffy and soft.
Smells terrific!

I recommend it!

This is a great product. I have 2 male Maltese and using this product makes them very white. I like it and will continue to use it. If you have a white dog or cat, this is the stuff to buy. I think it would work well with white haired people too. I highly recommend it.

The conditioner smells good.  I know because when I opened the box, the product was all over the contents.  Even though the bottle was in a plastic bag, it had leaked through the bag.  It took a while before I discovered why it leaked.  The bottle had a large crack in it.  About 1/8 of the contents of the bottle filled the bag and leaked into the box.  It appears the bottle had the crack before it was shipped because the box did not show any signs of having been crushed or anything.  I haven't used it yet, since it just arrived.  I would send it back but with the damaged bottle, there would just be more leaking and it might damage something else.  Fortunately, I was able to rinse the rest of the contents off and there was no damage.  The crack is not very noticeable with the bottle being in the bag. I can see why it was missed. I am just glad I did not have anything that would have been ruined.  I hate returning products.

Summary: 13 flavors, nice sampler, long use by dates, great for K-cup starter
Text:
I received this as a gift for xmas 2011. I also posted a picture of the sampler. There are 13 flavors included in this 20 tea sampler:

2 - Celestial Seasonings lemon zinger
2 - Celestial Seasonings Green tea with white tea for smooth taste
2 - Gloria Jean's Peppermint Herbal*
2 - Twinings Pure Peppermint
2 - Timothy's English Breakfast*
2 - Bigelow Mint Medley*
2 - Green Mountain Naturals Hot Apple Cider
1 - Twinings English Breakfast
1 - Twinings African Rooibos Red
1 - Twinings Pure Camomile
1 - Twinings Earl Grey
1 - Bigelow Orange & Spice Herb*
1 - Timothy's Lemon Blueberry Passion*

* does not specifically indicate decaf on the package -- this is a little concerning to me. The others indicate that they are caffeine free or decaf. So, I am not sure that I'd safely claim that those 5 are truly decaf.

Overall, I think this is a decent sampler. The packaging was nice for a gift...with 4 recipes printed inside the box (although they didn't correlate with the teas in the box). I would have preferred a little less duplication...how about 20 different teas!? We are just starting out with a Keurig, so wanted to try samplers first. I bet that almost every box that goes out is different. So, I'd likely buy again (and hope that there is less peppermint options if it's not holiday time, but that's just personal preference!). Not sure if Tazo or Traditional Medicinals makes K-cups, but would love to see some of those in the box! Was also happy to see apple cider in the box.

Also important to note, the use by dates on the teas range from 4/12 to 2/13!

4 stars for nice packaging, decent variety, and long use by dates. Would give 5 stars for 20 different teas!!

I bought this item for my in-laws for Christmas as they don't drink caffinated beverages. It arrived and at least half were not decaf. One actually said on the label "Contains Caffeine". So, I contacted Amazon and they sent another, free of charge, over night. It arrived and 4 of them were not decaf. Be careful to check that you get what you ordered.

This product is great for me because I wanted to try a lot of different types of tea.  Also, it can be hard to find decaf sometimes and every one of these k cups was decaf.  I'll be buying another one soon!  Just a side note, this product comes in a regular cardboard box and probably shouldn't be labeled as a 'gift pack'.  Be aware if you are purchasing as a gift.

Summary: Great if you prefer decaf tea.
Text: Decaf is our first choice which is why we purchased this product.  Nice variety for when you want to sip a cup!

Got this product for a gift. It was received with GREAT THANKS. She LOVED the variety and looked forward to enjoying all of the flavors included. If there is a tea lover in your family or friend list, you won't go wrong in giving this to them. Go for it if YOU LOVE TEA. Since I use Amazon Prime, this came in in the two day FREE delivery time frame. I LOVE AMAZON PRIME.

This Decaf sampler gave me a wonderful opportunity to taste some teas I may not have ordered otherwise.  The sampler itself came in a really nice box in which each K-Cup was inserted into its own slot.  It would make an excellent gift box.  The sampler also led me to a couple of teas that I liked so much I purchased.  I don't think you'd go wrong trying this for yourself.

I received my 2 tea Samplers sets today and they were nicely packaged, in a flip top box in individual spots. This would be suitable for gift giving. There's a nice variety in there with no more than 2 of any given flavor. All were labeled as decaf. I'll be ordering them again, if they come up at the price I paid.

I hoped to be different, but like other reviewers I did not recieve a very good mix of "samples". I recieved 6 mints, 8 earl grays, etc leaving me with just a few to try instead of 10 different kinds like i hoped. Luckily, i really did like the mint so it sorta kinda worked out in the end.

Since it's extremely difficult to buy caffeine free teas, except Sleepytime, at stores, I decided to purchase the variety pack on Amazon.  What a great variety of teas and every one was wonderful.  I also bought a box of decaf green tea on Amazon and was happy with that one too.

Ordered the item on December 12th as a Christmas gift.  It did not arrive until late the 24th.  I made the mistake of just wrapping the box and putting it under the tree.  I was quite embarrassed when my wife opened the box and the K-cups were just thrown in the cardboard box.  An earlier reviwer's comments regarding the deceptive wording about the packaging apply here.  At least our adult children that were over for the holidays got quite a laugh out of it.  Upon inspection, it was noticed that not all of the K-cups contained decaf tea.  I will not be purchasing from this vendor again.  The reader of this review would be better served going elsewhere.
I like teas and my husband and I wanted an assortment for out K-cup maker.  It included Earl Grey, English breakfast, red rooibos, orange spice, mint, camomile, and others. Very tasty.

Received this in the mail today. This is exactly what I was looking for, a variety of teas with no rhyme or reason. Understand that these were put together because customers did not like them and they returned the full box they purchased; therefore you will not always get the same amounts.
Funny, the limited edition print was inside the cardboard tube; not anything I was expecting...but fun. Thanks!

Variety received but distribution among the varieties included is not consistent; lots of some and few of others.
Good idea to try out teas with a sampler as you don't want to get stuck with a whole box of something you decide you don't care for.
Limited Edition print was same for the coffee and I cant' figure out how to get the full set even though the company says they'll send it to you if you want the prior releases. bought through Amazon via prime, so maybe you can only get the other prints "gratis" if you buy from the company directly. Not that big a deal though, really.
This would be a good "coffee mess" purchase for a work environment.
Same applies to coffee sampler which I also purchased.
Had planned to give this as a gift until it arrived with all the K-cups just throw in a brown cardboard box.  Calling it a "gift pack" is very deceptive.
Was pleased with the variety of tea flavors, a little disappointed that they were just thrown in a brown box, the picture is misleading.

I've read only raving reviews about this matcha and the order couldn't come any sooner! The second you open the bag, the cheesecake-y goodness fills your nose. I decided to make it into a latte with soy milk and opted to not add sugar so I could get the full taste of the matcha. After less than a minute of whisking, the matcha created a nice blanket of foam. The first sip was heavenly and after adding some agave, the cheesecake flavor popped even more. This has become one of my favorite matchas and I'm excited to mix it with other flavors and make signature flavored cheesecakes.

I've heard great, great things about this matcha and I couldn't wait to try it. But real life stepped in and I didn't have the time to give it the attention it deserved, so, well, I had to wait to try. But I wait no more! Today I got to mix up my first frothy cup of cheesecake matcha goodness. I was stuck at the location I hate at work, so I desperately needed a thermos of matcha comfort and boy oh boy was I not let down! This is amazing stuff. Creamy and just that touch of tang found in a good cheesecake....yum. One of my specialities around this time of year is a pumpkin cheesecake....nom. I can't wait to mix this with a touch of Pumpkin Pie matcha and see how they go together.

Oh cheesecake, I have missed you desperately. Cream cheese is one of those things I absolutely cannot have or I'll be ill for days, so cheesecake is, unfortunately permanently off my menu. But with a little beauty like this in my tea cupboard, I find I don't mind nearly as much! I want to try mixing this with all of the flavors in the Red Leaf Tea catalogue, and I'm sure every one of them would be delicious!

Cheesecake matcha basically sounds like a dream come true. I'm not sure why I didn't order this with my first order. If I can get matcha that will satisfy my cheesecake craving without all the calories, I am definitely going to try it!

I received this with my order of tiramisu and caramel, and although it had the least distinctive smell and flavour, it definitely still had an authentic cheesecakey-ness that was so worth it. I think the best part of this was that it wasn't just matcha that tasted like cheesecake - it tastes like what I imagine matcha-flavoured cheesecake would taste like (I haven't ventured into the world of baking with matcha because I am the only one who would eat it and I really don't need to eat an entire batch of cookies, cheesecake, etc. By myself!).

Sweet, but not too sweet, with that little hint of tanginess that you get from cream cheese, this is a perfect after-dinner tea. I am going to make it again and do a better job - I had it iced the first time, and I think that is how I will prefer it, but it wasn't quite cold enough. I took it to work in my timolino and forgot to put ice cubes in! That will be a necessity next time. I can't wait to mix this with a few other flavours!

Okay so let's break this down to if you like cheesecake but don't want the extra pounds then this is perfect for you! I wasn't quite sure about ordering this one as I wasn't sure if I would like the cheesecake flavour... well I'm glad I did add this one to my cart as it was worth every cent. I make this one half matcha half milk and I've been adding marshmallows it makes it a bit more fun (and fancy!) The cost is reasonable the company's customer service is fantastic. There is no reason you can't order this tasty treat right now :D Just writing about it makes me want another cup :D

I love this matcha every bit as much as I thought I would. I have tried three flavoured matchas from Red Leaf, and they are quickly becoming my favourite beverages.

This particular matcha has a full, creamy flavour and texture. You can almost even taste the cream cheese tang. There's also a bit of cookie-crust going on here, which I love!

When I first opened the packet I was delighted with the aroma. It smells sweet and decadent, almost reminded me of matcha ice cream! Must be the sweet creaminess of the cheesecake flavour combined with that familiar, distinctive matcha scent I know and love.

This one has become a staple for me, and although there are lots of different flavours I'd love to try, I know I'll always make sure to have some of this on hand. It is so delicious and versatile.

It has been far too long since I've had some matcha so I decided that tonight would be as good as any to remedy that situation. This cheesecake matcha is seriously smooth and has a very strong aroma that makes me want to double check and make sure there isn't any actual cheesecake somewhere in my kitchen. I've had this matcha several times now and each time this flavor is spot on to a real, creamy cheesecake. You can find out more about this matcha here (and pick up some for yourself!):[...]
Initially, I tried this matcha traditionally in my chawan and it was creamy and rich. I was pleasantly surprised that the color was a vibrant green instead of being muddled by the flavoring. Even though the cheesecake flavor is front and center, it is tempered nicely with a smooth, fresh matcha aftertaste that prevents the flavor from being cloying. The matcha also whisked up quite well with no noticeable clumps and I didn't even sift it!

After the initial success with this matcha, I couldn't wait to try it as a hot cheesecake latte. Although the thought of hot liquid cheesecake is not necessarily my idea of a great treat, I was confident that the quality of Red Leaf Tea's product would not let me down. With a bit of sugar and the addition of warm milk, this latte was so great! I downed it in no time flat and had to make another immediately.

Tonight, I'm having this as a cold iced matcha with a teensy bit of sugar and enough milk to complete the cup. The flavor seems to really pop when prepared this way and I'm certainly wondering how I made it for so many days without drinking this or any other of the great flavors from Red Leaf Tea. A couple of weeks ago I made a delicious matcha cake and I think it would be amazing with this cheesecake flavor as the base! Now to figure out what the next flavor I'll try will be...

There is nothing bad that I can say about this Matcha from Redleaf.  They have hit the flavour right on the money.  If you love cheesecake, or are even on the fence about it, try this matcha.  It's like biting into the best cheesecake slice you can imagine without the guilt of calories and sugar!

Okay, I was wracking my brain to think of which matcha I had left to review. I actually had to go into my cupboard and sort my Recently Added to figure it out... it was CHEESECAKE! How could I forget?! I've been drinking this glorious Matcha almost every day, not even kidding. I know it'll be the first I run out of and the first I run back to order more of! I might get a tin just for this one, because I know it will be in my cupboard forever. Dear Red Leaf Tea, never stop making matcha!!!! Love, your adoring fans!

I have had 2 amazing cheesecakes in my life. One was purchased on a trip to Vancouver from the market on Granville Island. It was tiny. It was expensive. It was amazing! The second was this week from a place called Broadway Cheesecake (something like that) here in Halifax. They have so freaking many kinds of cheesecake, it is crazy! 8 bucks a piece, but the pieces are HUGE. Why am I telling you this? Because this matcha trumps them. It puts the power of cheesecake into my little hands, adds green tea powder to make it amazing, and tastes like heaven on earth!

That may seem a little dramatic, but it's the only way I know how to truly show how much I appreciate this matcha in my cupboard. The taste is tangy, thick and a bit sweet. If you add sugar it has the decadence of a perfect cream cheese icing. If you add milk (I tried 2%, almond and vanilla soy) it's a slice from a fine bakery (or cheesecake from home, arguably the best kind!). If you drink it hot - it's fresh from the oven! Iced? It's a perfectly chilled and dense New York piece from the fridge. I could go on, but I guess what I'm trying to say is: Any way you slice it, this Cheesecake Matcha is the best of the best - it has the power to turn my crappy tired morning into an awesome day. Just sayin'.

One of the best features of this flavour (and many of the other dessert matchas) is that you get the delicious taste of a rich cheesecake without the tummy-ache and super full and heavy feeling. I won't say without the "guilt" because I am highly against self shaming, especially in the food department. With that in mind - this tea doesn't completely replace a cheesecake. I'll still eat my fair share of cheesecake! What this tea DOES do is let you have cheesecake every day - even if your tummy is full or your wallet is empty! THAT my friends, is the magic of matcha :D

Thanks for reading this ramble. I'm kind of passionate, can you tell? ;)

I love that I am able to find such dessert flavors in a tea. No calories!
This tea is creamy and tangy and makes quite a comforting cup!
I think that it would be delicious with a splash of milk or some sugar, but it is enjoyable by itself.

WOW is this stuff good! The cheesecake flavor really comes through, adding a creamy decadence to the cup along with cheesecake's signature tang and even a little bit of crusty goodness. It doesn't overwhelm the matcha flavor but balances with it, making this sweet treat not overly dessert-y but great for drinking any time of day. It's great straight or as an iced latte, perfect for a mid-afternoon pick me up! All the taste, none of the calories--what more could you want?

Another winner from Red Leaf Tea!

The smell of the this particular matcha is tangy and slightly sweet, even though there's no sugar added to the flavoring. I prepared this my usual way - cold latte style. Two ounces of warmed water with a teaspoon of matcha and a half teaspoon of super-fine sugar - wisk until blended. I didn't try sifting the matcha this time, and it frothed up very nicely without any clumping. Six ounces of cold, creamy whole milk and the taste was so smooth and creamy with a bit of tang - just how I like my cheesecake to be!

After my first cup as a cold latte, I went for a second cup - this time as a warmed, straight matcha. The tang and creaminess are much less noticable the second time around, but the matcha base is much more prevalent. As the cup cools, the tangy taste comes to the forefront with the matcha and the creaminess lags behind. It's kind of like having two very different teas, which is pretty awesome for just buying the one! A creamy, dessert-like cup of tangy cheesecake with milk/dairy alternative or a green tea with a little tang - it's up to whatever kind of mood you're in!

I've tried this prepared a couple of different ways now. The first time I prepared it, I prepared it the way I would most Matcha - in the traditional way in my chawan (tea bowl) and whisking it until smooth and frothy. It is good that way. It has a delicious, creamy taste. Sweet. Really good, and tasting very much like cheesecake.

However, if you really want the FULL cheesecake experience, I recommend drinking this one as a latte, using warmed milk instead of water and whisking with a frothing tool instead of the bamboo whisk. YUM! The creamier texture and flavor that comes from using milk instead of water is really beneficial to this cheesecake flavored Matcha. All the flavor remains intact - it is not masked by the milk - and it tastes creamier and richer ... and let's face it, when you want cheesecake, you want that rich, creamy flavor and texture.

This cheesecake flavored Matcha is rich, smooth, and sweet, with the distinctive tangy taste of cream cheese and even a hint of buttery pastry. It makes a delightful pick-me-up for the afternoon, especially if you're craving something a little sweet. This will help curb those cravings for a fraction of the calories and fat!

This particular matcha tastes EXACTLY like cheesecake and not that fake cheesecake made with inferior "cheesecake" stuffing stuff you can buy pre made in the store but real cheesecake made at home from scratch or from a fine restaurant or bakery!

It is not overly sweet either which I was surprised at because I honestly was expecting something more fake tasting and overly sugary.

I was both surprised and pleased when I took my first sip and realized this was the real deal! I still am amazed that Red Leaf Tea can get such excellent flavor from all natural sources into a matcha!

This flavor melded perfectly with the green tea base giving it a beautiful slightly sweet and creamy earthy flavor! I imagine it would be insanely good in a white base as well!

You can almost taste the crumbly cheesecake crust in this as well as the taste of the filling so you do get that whole cheesecake experience.

ProfileName: Jolly Green Giant "You can try Birchbox too! ...
Text:
I try to drink 1-3 cups of green tea everyday and this was a great way to try out so many different Stash green teas at once.

The varieties included were (ordered May 2010):

Chai Green - Very good chai, one of my favorites. Better than Celestial
Fusion Breakfast - Too much going on- mix of Indian Assam, Indonesian Black, Chinese Green, Japanese Green, African Black, and Japanese Matcha
Fusion Green & White - Good if you can't decide to have white tea or green tea, which happens every so often to me
Ginger Peach - not my cuppa, too much ginger and difficult to find the peach flavor
Organic Premium Green - very good
Moroccan Mint - Excellent, not quite as minty as peppermint herbal tea, but a nice balance of mint and green flavors
Pomegranate Raspberry - meh, okay when you're craving fruity but I wouldn't invest in a case of this
Premium Green - very good
Decaf Premium Green - Excellent, my kids drink this often

After drinking tea for years with or without sweetener (no milk) I made a mistake one morning and put Torani Sugar-Free Vanilla Syrup into my tea with some cream (thinking it was coffee!) and I was blown away with the smooth, mellow taste. I now drink my tea with a little vanilla syrup and cream (less than I would use in coffee) and it's such an amazing flavor - like dessert. My daughter thinks it tastes like Yoplait vanilla yogurt. I highly recommend this!!!
